In other words, the lower the cost of the infrastructure to host validator nodes, the more decentralized these chains become.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1664986414-screen-shot-2022-10-05-at-12-13-28-pm.png)\\n\\n## Developer Traction in Web3\\n\\nOutside of cost and security, the third biggest factor preventing Web3 applications from going mainstream is the availability of talented dApp developers. Here is a [chart from Electric Capital](https://medium.com/electric-capital/electric-capital-developer-report-2021-f37874efea6d) that tracks the number of Monthly Active Developers in Web3 over time:\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1664986484-electric-capital-dev-report.png)\\n\\nCompare that with a similar chart from Statista showing the growth in total (Web2 plus Web3) developers over time:\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1664986652-screen-shot-2022-10-05-at-12-17-29-pm.png)\\n\\nWhile the \u201chockey-stick\u201d growth in Web3 developers is impressive in relative terms, the absolute number of developers (~18,500) pales in comparison to the total number of developers (~28M). Web3 developers only represent a tiny fraction (0.06%).\\n\\nWhile there are many reasons developers choose not to move to Web3 (including the fact that some scams and bad actors tend to make more news than legitimate value-generating projects), I believe that a key factor is the availability of a healthy \u201cdeveloper product ecosystem.\u201d\\n\\nOur friends at [Coinbase recently attempted to define a \u201cWeb3 Developer Stack.\u201d](https://www.coinbase.com/blog/a-simple-guide-to-the-web3-developer-stack) Here is what they came up with:\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1664986688-coinbase-web3-dev-stack.png)\\n\\nI love this representation, not only because it is well researched but because it shows a burgeoning ecosystem of products in the Web3 developer world. While this is great to see, it is still a far cry from the developer product ecosystem that exists in Web2. To drive the point home with an equivalent image, here is a product ecosystem image from the [Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF)\u2019s website](https://landscape.cncf.io/):\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1664986751-screen-shot-2022-10-05-at-12-19-07-pm.png)\\n\\nKeep in mind that while the CNCF, part of the Linux Foundation, is arguably one of the largest open source communities, there are a plethora of (non-open-source) commercial solutions that are not represented in the image above.\\n\\nI present this data to say that anything we can do to foster growth in the ecosystem of tools for Web3 developers helps attract more talent to the space. These developers will not only build dApps but will also build even more tools. So, the space expands exponentially\u2014like a flywheel.\\n\\n## Summary\\n\\nThe state of Web3 infrastructure can be summarized in three points:\\n\\n1.  The heavy reliance on public clouds for core Layer 1 infrastructure is an existential risk to chains, nodes, and the DApps that run on those chains.\\n2.  The cost of public clouds is a significant barrier to entry for new validators. Therefore, finding a cheaper alternative that is also easy to use (if not better) is key to ensuring chain security across the space.\\n3.  The third-largest barrier to Web3 adoption is the availability of developer talent. One way to drive developer traction is to foster the growth of a healthy \u201cdeveloper product ecosystem,\u201d similar to the one that exists in the Web2 world.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1664987718-screen-shot-2022-10-05-at-12-35-15-pm.png)\\n\\nIf this topic has piqued your interest, stay tuned for the next article in this series. We will delve into how Akash Network addresses the above challenges and more.\\n\\nIf you are interested in Akash Network, [get started today with our documentation](https://akash.network/docs/).\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Building the Open Cloud, Part 1: The State of Web3 Infrastructure&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;By Anil Murty, Head of Product at Overclock Labs&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2022-10-05T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Insights&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Insights&quot;],[0,&quot;Product&quot;],[0,&quot;Developers&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Anil Murty&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.CzQZ9WzL.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1500],&quot;height&quot;:[0,844],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/building-the-open-cloud-part-one/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-weekly-adam-bozanich-and-anil-murty-of-overclock-labs/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-weekly-adam-bozanich-and-anil-murty-of-overclock-labs&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\nOur guests on this week\u2019s Akash Weekly With Greg Osuri:\\n\\n- Greg Osuri, CEO &amp; Co-Founder of Overclock Labs (creators of Akash Network).\\n- Adam Bozanich, CTO &amp; Co-Founder of Overclock Labs.\\n- Anil Murty, Head of Product at Overclock Labs.\\n\\nEcosystem news from this week:\\n\\n- Greg Osuri appeared on Coinage with Zack Guzm\u00e1\u00f1.\\n- Overclock Labs launched its latest deployment promotion.\\n- Mainnet 4 is coming soon.\\n- Overclock Console will be launched to the public in a few weeks. The date will be announced soon.\\n\\n## Ecosystem Updates from Greg Osuri\\n\\nGreg Osuri appeared on Coinage with Zack Guzm\u00e1\u00f1. As Akash expands and grows, it is beginning to attract the attention of the large, centralized cloud providers.\\n\\n> \u201cThe goal of Akash is to bring people to the table and create a multi-cloud standard\u2026you\u2019re going to have big clouds and small clouds at the same table\u2014leveling the playing field. [This will] give the consumer the ultimate benefit. Optimizing the true cost of the cloud, while operating in a sovereign and open way.\u201d \u2014Greg Osuri\\n\\n**Overclock Labs launched its latest deployment promotion.** Follow the link in the tweet below to sign up to receive free credits to deploy an RPC node on Akash for up to three months. As everyone heads home from Cosmoverse and begins to shift back to building\u2014we want to make it easy for people to get up and running on the open cloud.\\n\\n## Adam Bozanich and Anil Murty on the Vision of Overclock Console and Building Akash Network\\n\\n**Adam Bozanich, CTO &amp; Co-Founder of Overclock Labs (Creators of Akash Network)**. Led software development at Symantec, One King\u2019s Lane, and Marketron. Before that, he worked as an engineer and developer for the music monetization platform Topspin\u2014acquired by Apple in 2014 after an initial acquisition by Beats. Adam holds a U.S. patent for Network Protocol Fuzzing, a security analysis methodology.\\n\\n**Anil Murty, Head of Product at Overclock Labs.** Anil is an Engineer turned Product Manager. He has a passion for building products that serve deeply technical users. He has worked on products ranging from consumer and enterprise hardware, software, and SaaS\u2014and most recently, cloud-native developer and observability tooling. Anil is based in the beautiful city of Portland, OR.\\n\\n### What\u2019s exciting about Overclock Console, and who are its intended users?\\n\\nOverclock Console fulfills much of the original vision for deploying on Akash Network. Akash network is already performant and cost-optimized. Console provides the last piece of the puzzle, making the deployment process on Akash easy and intuitive.\\n\\nOver time, Console will give users of Akash access to one-click deployments to launch validators, RPC nodes, and more.\\n\\nThere are many ways to deploy on Akash today, with each deployment tool taking an opinionated approach to deployment. Because Akash is such an extensive network, it represents a wide-ranging marketplace for potential deployments. There is plenty of room in the layer above Akash for many different tools to help users deploy, each tailored to a unique deployment style or user workflow.\\n\\nOverclock Labs\u2019 approach to Console has been to focus on making sure that we provide the best tools for Validators within the Cosmos ecosystem to be able to spin up nodes\u2014whether that is a full validator node, an RPC node, a sentry node, or anything else a Validator might want to deploy.\\n\\nPast Cosmos, we will widen our focus to other chains, whether that is Solana, Ethereum, or any others.\\n\\n### Mainnet 4 is coming soon.\\n\\nOverclock is gearing up to launch Mainnet 4 for Akash Network. Thankfully, the major upgrades are easy to remember\u2014as there are four.\\n\\nHere are the four major upgrades of Mainnet 4:\\n\\n1. IP Leases. This will allow tenants on Akash to request a publicly routable IP address for the services they deploy. Today, you get an HTTP endpoint connected to your service, and Kubernetes assign the actual port. With IP Leases, a tenant on Akash can request a dedicated IPV4 address, allowing users to assign a specific port instead of a randomly assigned port. This will unlock Solana node hosting on Akash Network.\\n\\n2. Provider Services Split. This upgrade will separate parts of the behind-the-scenes development process for Overclock Labs and make it easy to iterate quickly as we build and grow Akash.\\n\\n3. Cosmos IBC v3. IBC v3 and Interchain Accounts allow one chain to send transactions to another chain.\\n\\n4. Interchain Accounts. By enabling Interchain Accounts on Akash, we will open up an entirely new world of interchain composability and significantly improve the user experience on Akash Network.\\n\\nOur Akash Insiders were the first to gain access to IP Leases.\\n\\n### The Internet Lost Its Way\\n\\nIn its way, the core vision for Akash Network is to bring the internet back to its roots.\\n\\n\u201c[The Internet] had turned into this thing, where if US-West-1 goes down on AWS\u2014no apps work anymore. Clearly, there is a huge amount of centralization happening on the internet. That\u2019s one of the things we wanted to address.\u201d \u2014Adam Bozanich\\n\\nAkash is one step towards an internet that is more sovereign, independent, and open. An internet that works better for everyone.\\n\\n## Q&amp;A\\n\\nQ: What is unique about Akash, and how will that impact AKT?\\nA: Akash is the first attempt at an open and decentralized cloud. This will reduce the premium we all end up paying the centralized cloud\u2014which hosts most applications today.\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly: Adam Bozanich and Anil Murty of Overclock Labs&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Our guests on this week\u2019s Akash Weekly With Greg Osuri - Greg Osuri, CEO &amp; Co-Founder of Overclock Labs (creators of Akash Network). - Adam Bozanich, CTO &amp; Co-Founder of Overclock Labs.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2022-09-30T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Zach Horn&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.CWMgf8Ck.jpeg&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1920],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1080],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;jpg&quot;],&quot;orientation&quot;:[0,1],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-weekly-adam-bozanich-and-anil-murty-of-overclock-labs/banner-image.jpeg&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-weekly-the-web3-regulatory-landscape/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-weekly-the-web3-regulatory-landscape&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;Welcome back to another issue of The Akash Weekly Newsletter from the team at Overclock Labs.\\n\\nTune into our weekly live Twitter Spaces event held every Wednesday at 8am PT. Featuring Overclock Labs\u2019 CEO &amp; Co-Founder, Greg Osuri, and special guests from around the web3 space.\\n\\nOur guests this week\\n- Lourdes C. Miranda \u2014 Chief Compliance Officer at Send Crypto\\n- Alani Bankhead \u2014 Lieutenant Colonel &amp; Agent in the Air Force Reserves and Professional Coach &amp; Consultant\\n\\n## Ecosystem Updates\\nHear the ecosystem updates directly from Greg Osuri.\\n\\n### Akash\u2019s Mainnet 4\\nIn case you missed it \u2014 Mainnet 4 is coming in a few weeks. This upgrade will include four main features: IP Leases, Provider Services Split, IBC3, and Interchain Accounts.\\n\\n### Interchain Accounts\\nInterchain Accounts (ICA) are coming to Akash Network with the Mainnet 4 upgrade, which is tentatively expected to happen in the first week of November.\\n\\nICAs bring a new phase of interoperability to IBC-compatible chains. With Interchain accounts, any IBC chain can call a method on Akash Network from its native account. For example, a Juno account could own a deployment on Akash. This will allows for a widespread cross-pollination of communities within Cosmos and eventually beyond.\\n\\n### Dimokus Deploys Hypersign via Spheron\\nAkash Insider, Dimokus, won a bug bounty contest from our ecosystem partner Spheron for building a Hypersign Validator Script for Akash Network.\\n\\n### A Thread on Akash From Elemental Crypto\\nCheck out this thread from Elemental Crypto on the fundamentals of Akash Network. We always appreciate the efforts of our community and their work in helping to explain our work in building an open and sovereign cloud.\\n\\n### Google Announces It Will Accept Crypto Payments\\nOn Tuesday, Google announced that it would begin to accept crypto payments for cloud services.\\n\\nCrypto payments will initially be rolled out to a handful of customers involved in the Web3 industry. Google will also user Coinbase's custody service, Coinbase Prime.\\n\\n\\&quot;We want to make building in Web3 faster and easier, and this partnership with Coinbase helps developers get one step closer to that goal,\\&quot; said Thomas Kurian, CEO of Google Cloud.\\n\\n## Regulation &amp; Compliance In Web3\\nWe are excited to host this conversation on regulation and compliance in Web3 with our special guests this week. Given the wide-ranging experience and deep expertise of both guests, please find their full bios below:\\n\\n**Lourdes C. Miranda** \u2014 Chief Compliance Officer at Send Crypto. Lourdes Miranda is a former CIA Officer and a former FBI Analyst with over 20 years of government and corporate experience specializing in financial crime investigations and intelligence collection and analysis globally. She has extensive field experience targeting money launderers and terrorist financiers. Since 2017, she has been working with Fintechs as a senior crypto investigator, senior compliance officer, and as a risk manager building compliance, investigations, crypto, and intelligence teams and training programs. Lourdes is also an author and has contributed to ManchesterCF\u2019s Cryptoassets and Open-Source Intelligence online courses as a subject matter expert. Lourdes is also a Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialist; Certified Crypto Forensic Investigator; Certified Fraud Examiner; Certified Chainalysis KYT; CipherTrace Certified Examiner; and ManchesterCF Financial Intelligence Specialist.\\n\\n**Alani Bankhead** \u2014 Lieutenant Colonel &amp; Agent in the Air Force Reserves and Professional Coach &amp; Consultant. Alani Bankhead is a career special agent and professional coach, consultant, and public speaker. With a career spanning almost two decades in federal and state government, Alani has hunted terrorists and spies both in and out of the Middle East on behalf of special operations, was a senior bodyguard to a top Pentagon official, and ultimately found her passion in protecting the most vulnerable \u2014 our children \u2014 from sexual exploitation. Alani started the Air Force\u2019s Internet Crimes Against Children (ICAC) Task Force mission almost 15 years ago in Japan. And since leaving active duty, she has overseen law enforcement investigations, operations, and hosted national law enforcement training in Latin America for the US\u2019s largest anti-slavery non-profit focusing on the commercial sexual exploitation of children (CSEC) also known as child sexual trafficking. Alani eventually transitioned to Hawaii where she created and led the largest anti-child exploitation cyber operations in the Pacific comprised of federal, state, local, and military law enforcement agencies resulting in the arrest of almost 100 child sex abusers, the identification and recovery of 35+ live child victims, and a 96% conviction or plea rate. Still serving as a Lieutenant Colonel and Agent in the Air Force reserves, Alani currently works as a coach and consultant to enable larger groups of law enforcement and prosecutors to be equipped to handle the growing issue of child exploitation online. Alani has given dozens of conference presentations and talks including a TEDx talk.\\n\\nThis conversation is wide-ranging and touches on essential and difficult topics around how Web3 companies, protocols, and tools preserve privacy and enable freedom\u2014but also potentially enables new attack vectors for bad actors.\\n\\nThis conversation covers far too much ground to transcribe fully in this newsletter. We recommend listening to the entire discussion between Greg Osuri, Lourdes C. Miranda, and Alani Bankhead.\\n\\n[Watch the full recording on YouTube](https://youtu.be/6r_OON8CNPs)\\n\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly: The web3 regulatory landscape&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Welcome back to another issue of The Akash Weekly Newsletter from the team at Overclock Labs.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2022-09-30T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Zach Horn&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.CWMgf8Ck.jpeg&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1920],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1080],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;jpg&quot;],&quot;orientation&quot;:[0,1],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-weekly-the-web3-regulatory-landscape/banner-image.jpeg&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-insiders-spotlight-rodrigo-rochin/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-insiders-spotlight-rodrigo-rochin&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\n_Today, we are featuring a profile of one of our Akash Insider community members\u2014Rodrigo Rochin, known on the_ [_Akash Discord_](https://discord.com/invite/akash) _as \\&quot;Rodri.\\&quot; Rodrigo will introduce himself in his own words, share his background, how he came to find Akash Network, and his experience with the Akash Insiders._\\n\\n_Enter, Rodrigo:_\\n\\n---\\n\\nAs a crypto enthusiast since around 2016, I have seen Bitcoin, Ethereum, as well as many other crypto assets and projects, grow and prosper over the years.\\n\\nI have had the opportunity to mine some cryptocurrencies with my own CPUs and GPUs, as well as with rented ones. I got to use some of the earliest faucets, sportsbooks and \u201clottery\u201d games\u2014but I have also seen many \u201crugpulls\u201d, censorship cases and other problems too.\\n\\nI have believed in the utility and transparency of blockchain technology since I first found out about it. Today, I still believe in its capacity to solve different types of problems around the world, such as a store of value, almost instant payments and very low fees.\\n\\nBack then, we did not have as many communities, projects, companies, institutions or governments involved as we do today, which is why I see more potential in this industry every day.\\n\\nI can no longer recall how many times I have read or seen that a government or authority is going to end Bitcoin and crypto once and for all, but in the end, blockchain technology and Web3 keep improving.\\n\\n## My Venture Into the Cosmos\\n\\nIn 2019/2020, while learning about DeFi, NFTs and trying to find alternatives to extremely high gas fees on the Ethereum network, I found the Cosmos Ecosystem.\\n\\nWhen I read about Atom, Tendermint and the Cosmos SDK, I realised the incredible work that many people are doing here, how visionary they are and the amazing open source technology that they have developed.\\n\\nFrom the opportunity to build your own unique blockchain, to the opportunity of completing blockchain transactions in a few seconds and using DEXs at almost no gas fees, to projects that offer real solutions like Sentinel DVPN, Regen Network and one of my favourite ones\u2014Akash Network.\\n\\nI used my free time to work on my own [**NFT project**](https://www.moonbys.com/) and education. I read more about the Cosmos SDK and Starport (now rebranded to Ignite). I learned how to build my own blockchain, how to run nodes and become a validator for different Cosmos SDK-based chains, how to use smart contracts for NFTs and thanks to Akash, I have learned about Docker, Kubernetes and decentralization.\\n\\n## Building On The Decentralized Cloud\\n\\nAfter understanding what Akash\u2019s mission is and how anyone can use this cloud computing marketplace to become decentralized and censorship-resistant (while also saving on costs, when compared to traditional cloud providers), I got more involved in Akash\u2019s Discord and forum\u2014and I began to learn how to deploy my own apps and infra on Akash Network\u2019s decentralized cloud.\\n\\nAt first, it did take me a few days to understand how to use Akash, but after the small learning curve, I realised how convenient it is and how it makes it possible for anyone with an Internet connection to host a website, and to run applications and blockchain nodes.\\n\\nAnyone with a little over five AKT can start using Akash Network. At first, I used the Akash binary and command line, but now we have tools like Cloudmos, which makes it extremely simple to deploy your projects onto the Akash Network.\\n\\nThanks to [Akash Provider Console](https://provider-console.akash.network/) it is also now very easy to become a provider, allowing anyone to take advantage of their idle compute resources and earn some AKT.\\n\\nThese are all things that help to decentralize the cloud industry, give more opportunities to people around the world and that help to promote freedom of speech.\\n\\n## Becoming an Insider\\n\\nWhile learning about Akash, I participated in multiple hackathons and contributed to some of its blog content.\\n\\nI was invited to become an [Akash Insider](https://akash.network/community#insiders) and I did not think about it twice. I knew it was a great opportunity to grow, to learn and to promote something that I believe in.\\n\\nIn the last 15 months or so, I have virtually met some of the people behind Akash. I have witnessed how hard the team works every day, how they keep improving this cloud computing marketplace and how they have made it a reality.\\n\\nI have had the opportunity to test out new features before they are made public. I got the chance to participate in different tasks, which helped me to learn more about blockchain tech, Web3, Docker and Kubernetes.\\n\\n## Decentralization Is Now a Requirement\\n\\nAfter reading news about governments trying to ban crypto assets, about innocent developers being jailed and about companies like Hetzner Cloud, Steam and WeChat banning everything related to blockchain technology, Web3 and NFTs, I am now sure that we need decentralized cloud computing more than ever.\\n\\nI think that having people provide their unused computer resources opens up new opportunities for Web3, blockchain tech, gaming and freedom of speech, while also helping to reduce worldwide energy consumption.\\n\\nWhile we have been accustomed to not self-hosting or opening up our internet connections to the world, I think that it is now time to change paradigms and decentralize the cloud industry.\\n\\nWhile the space does need regulation, completely banning these technologies is not the right path forward. These technologies offer many more benefits than most people realise, which is why more of us are using them daily.\\n\\nThese are only some of the reasons why I believe in the benefits of blockchain tech, in the simple user experience that Web3 provides, the utility of NFTs and a decentralized cloud.\\n\\nThese are also some of the reasons why I will keep providing my idle compute resources to the decentralized cloud, why as an Akash Insider I will keep helping others to learn about these technologies and why I will keep building my own project, [Moonbys.com](https://moonbys.com/), which has several parts hosted on Akash Network.\\n\\n---\\n\\n## Interested in Becoming an Akash Insider?\\n\\nPlease&nbsp;[head over to our Akash Insiders page](https://akash.network/community#insiders)&nbsp;to get a feel for the community. When you're ready, follow the link to apply!\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Insiders Spotlight: Rodrigo Rochin&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Today, we are featuring a profile of one of our Akash Insider community members\u2014Rodrigo Rochin, known on the Akash Discord as \\&quot;Rodri.\\&quot; Rodrigo will introduce himself in his own words, share his background, how he came to find Akash Network, and his experience with the Akash Insiders.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2022-09-26T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Community&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Community&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Akash Insiders&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.pqOuSv0V.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1830],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1330],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-insiders-spotlight-rodrigo-rochin/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-messari-mainnet-spheron-token-unlocks-and-more/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-messari-mainnet-spheron-token-unlocks-and-more&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly with Greg Osuri is our weekly community call hosted on Twitter Spaces. Each week, we cover the latest news and updates from Akash Network with our CEO, Greg Osuri.\\n\\nFollow Akash Network ([@akashnet\\\\_](https://twitter.com/akashnet_)) on Twitter to get notifications for all future Akash Weekly events. We\u2019re live every Wednesday at 8 AM PT.\\n\\n**On this Akash Weekly:**\\n\\n*   [Greg Osuri](https://twitter.com/gregosuri), CEO &amp; Co-Founder of&nbsp;[Overclock Labs](https://ovrclk.com/)&nbsp;(creator of Akash Network).\\n    \\n*   [Prashant Maurya](https://twitter.com/prashant_xyz), CEO of&nbsp;[Spheron](https://spheron.network/).\\n    \\n*   [Cheng Wang](https://twitter.com/LeChenghiskhan), CFO of&nbsp;[Overclock Labs](https://ovrclk.com/).\\n    \\n\\n**Ecosystem news from this week:**\\n\\n*   The launch of&nbsp;**Overclock Console**&nbsp;at Messari Mainnet.\\n    \\n*   Mainnet 4 is coming in a few weeks.\\n    \\n*   GPU support on Akash Network is coming soon.\\n    \\n\\n**Links**\\n\\n*   [Our latest Telegram AMA with Prashant Maurya](https://forum.akash.network/t/ama-session-akash-network-with-spheron-network/4658).\\n    \\n*   [Join Spheron on their Discord here](https://discord.com/invite/ahxuCtm).\\n    \\n\\n* * *\\n\\nOverclock Labs At Messari Mainnet 2022\\n--------------------------------------\\n\\nThe Overclock Labs team headed to Messari Mainnet for three days of events, talks, presentations, and networking\u2014to spread the word about Akash Network, debut Overclock Console, and to see our friends from around the Web3 space.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1663983797-img_0797.jpg)\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1663983810-img_0839.jpg)\\n\\nOverclock Labs\u2019 CEO, Greg Osuri, spoke on a panel alongside Mary Gooneratne (Bridgesplit), Rachel Saunders (Apex Crypto), and Paul Brody (EY).\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1663983821-img_0870.jpg)\\n\\n* * *\\n\\nAnil Murty Presents Overclock Console at Messari Mainnet\\n--------------------------------------------------------\\n\\nOverclock Labs\u2019 Head of Product, Anil Murty ([@climbriderunner](https://twitter.com/ClimbRideRunner)), revealed Overclock Console during his workshop at Mainnet yesterday.\\n\\nOverclock Console makes is easy and intuitive to create new deployments, and manage active deployments on Akash Network.\\n\\nOver the next few days, we will be releasing the full recording of Anil\u2019s talk, which includes the full Console demo\u2014along with lots of content around Console, how it works, and its use-cases.\\n\\n**We will be releasing Console to the public in the next few weeks.**&nbsp;Keep an eye on our social channels and this newsletter for the official launch date.\\n\\nAnil Murty, Head of Product at Overclock Labs, demonstrating&nbsp;**Overclock Console**&nbsp;live at Messari Mainnet.\\n\\n* * *\\n\\nEcosystem Updates from Greg Osuri\\n---------------------------------\\n\\n**Akash Mainnet 4 is coming soon.**&nbsp;With the launch of Mainnet 4,&nbsp;**IP leases**&nbsp;will be coming to Akash Network.\\n\\n**GPU support.**&nbsp;Once IP leases are live on the network\u2014we will shift our focus to launching GPU support on Akash.\\n\\n**Overclock Labs at Cosmoverse.**&nbsp;Several members of the Overclock Labs team are heading to Medell\u00edn, Columbia for Cosmoverse.&nbsp;[Adam Bozanich](https://twitter.com/abozanich), CTO and Co-Founder of Overclock Labs, and&nbsp;[Adam Wozney](https://twitter.com/AdamDeanWozney), Head of Community at Overclock Labs, will both be speaking.\\n\\n* * *\\n\\nSpheron, and the Need for Decentralized Infrastructure\\n------------------------------------------------------\\n\\n[Prashant Maurya](https://twitter.com/prashant_xyz), CEO &amp; Co-Founder of&nbsp;[Spheron](https://spheron.network/), comes to Web3 with a background in healthcare, ERP, and HRMS. He was a solutions architect and led large teams across his career\u2014spanning eight years. He believes that for Web3 to succeed, we will need scalable infrastructure that is native to Web3 and the ethos of decentralization.\\n\\nThe challenge in building web3 is finding decentralized infrastructure. The purpose of Spheron is to make the decentralized ecosystem accessible for developers and builders.\\n\\nSpheron is launching its marketplace in the coming weeks. This will address the growing problem of developers wanting to move to Web3, and onto decentralized networks, but lacking a solution that is easy and intuitive.\\n\\nSpheron will be launching on Optimism, Arbitrum, and eventually onto most EVM-compatible chains within the next 2-3 months. Behind the scenes, Akash Network will be facilitating access to decentralized compute\u2014regardless of the chain.\\n\\n* * *\\n\\nCheng Wang, CFO of Overclock Labs on Token Unlocks\\n--------------------------------------------------\\n\\n[Overclock Labs](https://ovrclk.com/)\u2019 CFO,&nbsp;[Cheng Wang](https://twitter.com/LeChenghiskhan), joins us today to talk about AKT and token unlocks. Cheng leads financial operations and strategy at Overclock Labs.\\n\\nPrior to Overclock Labs, Cheng served as the CFO for Workshop, a premier blockchain startup. He spent over eight years at premier financial institutions, before founding and managing his own retail businesses in NYC. His experience includes extended tenures with Merrill Lynch, Morgan Stanley, Goldman Sachs, and RBS\u2014where he served as a Vice President, focusing on debt and valuations. His financial expertise includes equity, debt valuations, derivatives instruments, and portfolio management.\\n\\n_Given the financial nature of this section\u2014_[_please listen to Cheng directly in the full audio recording_](https://youtu.be/1SjcSAQKY7g?t=1194)_._\\n\\n_Nothing mentioned here, or in the audio recording, should be construed as financial advice._\\n\\n* * *\\n\\nQ&amp;A\\n---\\n\\n### Q: Is there any chance the team is planning to improve the volume and liquidity of AKT on centralized exchanges?\\n\\nA: AKT is listed on Kraken, Ascendex, and Kucoin\u2014among others. We are always seeking additional exchange venues that would be a good fit for listing AKT.\\n\\nFor background, the process to be listed on a centralized exchange is arduous. Each exchange has its own economic considerations, its own pipelines, and things to weigh. Simply listing on an exchange will not necessarily drive volume. Product and user adoption is more likely to drive volume over the long term.\\n\\n### Q: How will the last token unlock affect the price of AKT?\\n\\nA:&nbsp;_(_[_As before, please listen to Cheng speak directly to this question in the audio recording_](https://youtu.be/1SjcSAQKY7g?t=2311)_)._\\n\\n* * *\\n\\n[Listen to the full recording of this Akash Weekly.](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1SjcSAQKY7g)&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly With Greg Osuri: Messari Mainnet, Spheron, Token Unlocks, and More&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly with Greg Osuri is our weekly community call hosted on Twitter Spaces. Each week, we cover the latest news and updates from Akash Network with our CEO, Greg Osuri.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2022-09-23T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Zach Horn&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.1g-mvG8P.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1920],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1080],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-messari-mainnet-spheron-token-unlocks-and-more/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-masq-network/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-masq-network&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly with Greg Osuri is our weekly community call hosted on Twitter Spaces. Each week, we cover the latest news and updates from Akash Network with our CEO, Greg Osuri.\\n\\nFollow Akash Network ([@akashnet\\\\_](https://twitter.com/akashnet_)) on Twitter to get notifications for all future Akash Weekly events. We\u2019re live every Wednesday at 8 AM PT. Tune in next week for the latest from Akash and conversations with special guests!\\n\\nSign up for our newsletter to stay up to date with everything happening across Akash Network.\\n\\n**On this Akash Weekly:**\\n\\n*   [Greg Osuri](https://twitter.com/gregosuri), CEO &amp; Co-Founder of Overclock Labs (creator of Akash Network)\\n    \\n*   [KauriHero](https://twitter.com/KauriHero), Co-Founder of [MASQ Network](https://masq.ai/)\\n    \\n\\n**Highlights from this week:**\\n\\n*   Updates from the ecosystem, including Akash Network\u2019s integration in a U.S. Department of Defense hackathon.\\n    \\n*   KauriHero: Building a Web3-native browser with privacy at its core.\\n    \\n*   Q&amp;A with the Akash Network community.\\n    \\n\\n* * *\\n\\nGreg Osuri\u2019s Weekly Ecosystem Updates\\n-------------------------------------\\n\\n**Akash Network and Secret Network Used in Hackathon-Winning U.S. Department of Defense Project.** Both Akash Network and Secret Network were used in [a prize-winning application from the DoD\u2019s Bravo 1 Hackathon](https://www.marines.mil/News/News-Display/Article/3156537/marine-officer-leads-joint-service-team-of-hackers-in-an-it-competition/). According to Moultrie Audits, \u201cthe application won first place for \u2018Most Tactically Relevant for Maintenance Data,\u2019 and second place for \u2018Most Tactically Relevant for Cyber Operations.\u2019\\&quot;\\n\\n([Read the announcement tweet from @AuditsMoultrie here](https://twitter.com/AuditsMoultrie/status/1569811136819916802?s=20&amp;t=_k_kfDMzvZuxXKKKCVpv8Q))&nbsp;\\n\\n**Mainnet 4 is coming soon.** Akash will announce the dates in the next few weeks. Mainnet 4 will have Interchain accounts, and this will allows users to deploy directly on Akash from a Secret account.\\n\\n[**Bi23**](https://bi23.com/#/) **joins Akash Network as an Ecosystem Partner.** They have moved their website onto Akash, and we love to see more and more projects deploy on the network. If you deploy on Akash, make sure to share on Twitter and tag @akashnet\\\\_ so we can spotlight your project for the Akash community.\\n\\n[**Chia publishes an article**](https://www.chia.net/2022/09/12/chia-akash-network-equals-plotting-as-a-service.en.html) **featuring Akash Network for plotting and farming.**\\n\\n* * *\\n\\nMASQ Is Building a Decentralized, Privacy-Focused Browser for Web3\\n------------------------------------------------------------------\\n\\n[**MASQ**](https://masq.ai/) **is creating a user-first Web3 browser experience that integrates privacy by design.** Their browser combines the best of Web2 and Web3 into a seamless experience that will appeal to users from both groups. It is also powered by native peer-to-peer payments using crypto, without the need for user accounts or subscriptions.\\n\\nKauri references a well-known diagram, created by [a16z](https://a16zcrypto.com/), that lays out the progression from Web2 to Web3:\\n\\n_Web1: Read_\\n\\n_Web2: Read + Write_\\n\\n_Web3: Read + Write + Own_\\n\\nAkash and MASQ take this concept a step further, by giving users the ability to participate in and own a piece of the underlying infrastructure that will support the transition from Web2 to Web3.\\n\\nWeb3 has a chance to redefine how developers look at open-source systems. The difference between open systems on Web3 and the closed systems of Web2, are the increases in functionality that come with Web3 networks. The open systems that characterize Web3 come with massive increases in functionality and composability\u2014a large portion of the Web3 learning curve is understanding the full scope of these decentralized, open source networks.\\n\\nImproving the developer experience has the potential to take Web3 to places that Web2 couldn\u2019t reach.\\n\\n* * *\\n\\nQ&amp;A\\n---\\n\\n### Q: How is MASQ similar to what Sentinel is doing with their dVPN?\\n\\nA: Sentinel uses a single-point VPN to route users\u2019 traffic. MASQ hops traffic across three other users (like Tor). There is no central point of failure for MASQ, as it is a \u2018mesh network\u2019\u2014although both are decentralized tools.\\n\\n### Q: How is the Brave browser similar or different from MASQ?\\n\\nA: MASQ is focused on creating Web3-native features. An average user won\u2019t be able to tell that MASQ\u2019s entire stack is decentralized, which makes for a seamless user experience.\\n\\n### Q: Akash has another token unlock upcoming. How is this expected to impact AKT?\\n\\nA: We remain confident that our investors are focused on Akash over the long term. Listen to Greg Osuri\u2019s thoughts in [the audio recording of this Akash Weekly](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ckp4eQ94ojM).\\n\\n* * *\\n\\nListen to the full audio recording\\n----------------------------------\\n\\n[Click here to listen to the full audio recording on our YouTube channel.](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ckp4eQ94ojM)&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly With Greg Osuri: MASQ Network&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly with Greg Osuri is our weekly community call hosted on Twitter Spaces. Each week, we cover the latest news and updates from Akash Network with our CEO, Greg Osuri.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2022-09-16T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Zach Horn&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.Bdx_91Ua.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1920],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1080],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-masq-network/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-insiders-spotlight-del-rey/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-insiders-spotlight-del-rey&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\n_Today, we are featuring a profile of one of our Akash Insider community members\u2014Del Rey, AKA \\&quot;Instafinanzas.\\&quot; Del Rey will introduce himself in his own words, share his background, how he came to find Akash Network, and his experience with the Akash Insiders._\\n\\n_Enter, Del Rey:_\\n\\n---\\n\\n## How I Found Crypto\\n\\nI\u2019m known as [Del Rey](https://twitter.com/instafinanzas), insta, instafinanzas or just Robert. I have over five years of experience in the banking sector, going through different departments like social media, sales, quality assurance, and compliance. I've always been drawn to content creation and social media, and I've been involved in projects like a car wash, taking pictures, food, and personal finance.\\n\\nInstafinanzas was born from the idea that it's possible to turn your finances around. However, the steps are not clear for many people. Through instafinanzas, I am able to help a wide array of individuals that are looking to change their approach to finances. I\u2019ve helped people work on budgeting, paying off loans, and how to get started with investing.\\n\\nI learned about Bitcoin around November 2020 through a platform called eToro. I was impressed with how expensive 1 BTC was, and since I had demo money in the account, I bought some BTC. Then, I forgot about eToro and when checked the account again in February 2021\u2014the profits I made were huge! I was happy but didn't know exactly what Bitcoin could be used for. So, I read the Bitcoin whitepaper, watched some YouTube videos, and fell down the rabbit hole.\\n\\nI spent a decent amount of time reading and understanding Bitcoin. This reading helped me see the flaws in our current financial system, and it just made sense to me, got orange pilled by myself!! I think bitcoin is freedom and all the technology that came after BTC will empower us to do incredible things, same as the internet helps us communicate and work in ways never thought before. The same will happen with cryptocurrencies.\\n\\nI still run instafinanzas' Instagram, and now I use it to spread awareness about cryptocurrencies and to showcase my Cosmos Journey. In the future, I\u2019d like instafinanzas to become The Hub, which will be filled with news, info, and entertainment content around cryptocurrencies.\\n\\n## Making The Jump Into Web3\\n\\nIn my early days in crypto, I learned lots about DeFI, NFTs, the concept of \u201crugpulls,\u201d and the communities behind various projects. During this time, I joined all the groups I could. My phone battery wouldn't last more than two hours due to all the messages, but I loved it. The vibe, the \u201cWAGMI\u201d culture, and, of course, the technology. I got deeply involved in a few projects, mostly as a mod answering users\u2019 questions and chitchatting. However, most of the time I was reading about new projects and how they worked.\\n\\nIn July 2021, an old friend shared a podcast episode with Cryptocito, and he was talking about Cosmos, interoperability, and how the future was cross-chain. I started researching ATOM, Cosmos, IBC, and their future possibilities.\\n\\nThe Cosmos rabbit hole is something else. There are so many apps, projects, developers, and governance\u2014there's not a boring day in the Cosmos ecosystem. I applied the same formula from my previous experience, learning as much as I could while connecting with people and helping others. I still had a regular job at this point, and crypto was taking up so much of my time that I thought, what if I could get a job in crypto?\\n\\nI consider myself to be bold and intrepid, so I went job hunting and found pages full of web3 jobs. On a side note, I still share any open jobs I find in my telegram channel _Crypto Jobs Latam_ so I can help more Latin Americans make the switch to web3.\\n\\nDuring my search, I saw that Stakin had an open position, and the description was similar to what I was already doing. So, I applied and was hired.\\n\\n## My Experience Working at Stakin\\n\\nI\u2019ve been working for Stakin since January 2022, and what I do is strengthen Stakin\u2019s relationship with its networks while helping our delegators in their crypto journey. I use many different strategies to achieve these goals. Content creation is one of the main ways we contribute to our networks, and I try to make it special in every iteration. I take my time to deliver greatness, although, the crypto market is so fast-paced that I had to learn how to deliver more quickly.\\n\\nI've learned many things while working at Stakin, engaged in governance conversation, and decentralization initiatives, while getting an overview of many Cosmos apps, their updates, the communities, and where they are heading. Practice makes perfect, and going back to my first articles and Twitter spaces, my rookie mistakes were apparent. But you just learn from those and move on, there's room for improvement but you have to do the job! Also, I\u2019ve learned a lot from others. I'm thankful for all the quality people I have met in the space. Being able to work in crypto has been a blessing. I proudly represent Stakin and I'm happy to join hands with people that want the best for the ecosystem.\\n\\n## How I Found the Akash Insiders and My Experience So Far\\n\\nI initially got into Cosmos and from there, discovered other networks. I remember listening to a discussion about Akash Network, and I got interested and started doing more research. Akash is one of the networks where Stakin is a validator, and I got the chance to study Akash closely, its community, and the team behind it. I saw myself spending more and more time on Discord, reading, and sometimes trying to be of assistance.\\n\\nNetworks in the Cosmos ecosystem often have ambassador programs, that recruit enthusiastic, talented, and dedicated individuals to spread the word. Akash has its own ambassador program called the [Akash Insiders](https://akash.network/community#insiders). These are people who have skills, know the tech, and get direct support from the Akash team. The goal? To speed up the decentralized cloud revolution.\\n\\nI\u2019ve applied for the Insiders two times. The first time, I got rejected, but it didn't matter. I deepened my knowledge, improved my skills, and developed relations within the community. The second time I applied, I got in! You have to know what you want to do and never give up! Find something bigger than you. Find a purpose, and attach yourself to it. I\u2019m honored to contribute to Akash\u2019s mission, and I\u2019m looking forward to the experiences and learnings that will come my way.\\n\\nI\u2019m eager to see all the things that The Insiders will be able to achieve in this new phase of Akash Network. The tech is being refined, the marketing team has been assembled, and the Insiders are ready!\\n\\nCrypto gives us an alternative. It gives us ways to make things different. The decentralized economy needs a decentralized infrastructure\u2014one that users can use and trust for its reliability. However, there's not much info out there, and some use cases are too complex for the average person at the moment. Let\u2019s change that!\\n\\n---\\n\\n## Interested in Becoming an Akash Insider?\\n\\nPlease [head over to our Akash Insiders page](https://akash.network/community#insiders) to get a feel for the community and the link to apply!\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Insiders Spotlight: Del Rey&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Today, we are featuring a profile of one of our Akash Insider community members\u2014Del Rey, AKA \\&quot;Instafinanzas.\\&quot; Del Rey will introduce himself in his own words, share his background, how he came to find Akash Network, and his experience with the Akash Insiders.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2022-09-15T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;General&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Insights&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Akash Insiders&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.gMnDKE8R.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1828],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1326],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-insiders-spotlight-del-rey/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;how-to-deploy-on-akash-network-using-authz/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;how-to-deploy-on-akash-network-using-authz&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\nAuthZ is a feature that allows one wallet to spend the funds in another wallet, up to a specified limit.\\n\\n## Deploying with AuthZ on Akash\\n\\nLet\u2019s walk through a simple \u201cHello World\u201d deployment with Cloudmos' deploy tool, using AuthZ to pay for the deployment.\\n\\nAfter following the on-screen instructions to set up your Cloudmos wallet and create a certificate, you should see the screen below:\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1663102509-screen-shot-2022-09-13-at-4-45-50-pm.png)\\n\\n## Create the Deployment\\n\\nClick **\u201cHello Akash World\u201d**\\n\\nThen **\u201cCreate Deployment\u201d**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1663102593-screen-shot-2022-09-13-at-4-46-52-pm.png)\\n\\n## Specify the Funding Wallet\\n\\nIn the box below, set the initial deposit amount. Then select **\u201cUse Depositor\u201d** and input the funding wallet address.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1663102612-screen-shot-2022-09-13-at-4-47-06-pm.png)\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1663102628-screen-shot-2022-09-13-at-4-50-30-pm.png)\\n\\n_Note: You should replace \\&quot;akash123...\\&quot; with the funding wallet address._\\n\\nThen click **\u201cDeposit\u201d**\\n\\n## Finish the Deployment\\n\\nFrom there, follow the on-screen instructions to select your bid and finish the deployment process. Please refer to [Akash Network\u2019s documentation](https://akash.network/docs/) for more information, and feel free to join [Akash\u2019s Discord](https://discord.com/invite/akash) if you have any further questions.\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;How to Deploy on Akash Network Using AuthZ&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;AuthZ is a feature that allows one wallet to spend the funds in another wallet, up to a specified limit.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2022-09-13T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Developers&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Developers&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Zach Horn&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.C3Di3Ch4.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1828],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1328],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/how-to-deploy-on-akash-network-using-authz/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-comdex-and-cloudmos-are-building-the-future-of-cosmo/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-comdex-and-cloudmos-are-building-the-future-of-cosmo&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly with Greg Osuri is our weekly community call hosted on Twitter Spaces. Each week, we cover the latest news and updates from Akash Network with our CEO, Greg Osuri.\\n\\nFollow Akash Network ([@akashnet\\\\_](https://twitter.com/akashnet_)) on Twitter to get notifications for all future Akash Weekly events. We\u2019re live every Wednesday at 8 AM PT. Tune in next week for the latest from Akash and conversations with special guests!\\n\\n**On this Akash Weekly:**\\n\\n*   [Greg Osuri](https://twitter.com/gregosuri), CEO &amp; Co-Founder of Overclock Labs (creator of Akash Network)&nbsp;\\n    \\n*   [Abhishek Singh](https://twitter.com/empAbhishek), CEO of [Comdex](https://comdex.one/)\\n    \\n*   [Siddarth Patil](https://twitter.com/SidP95), COO of [Comdex](https://comdex.one/)\\n    \\n*   [Max Beauchamp](https://twitter.com/thereisnomax), Co-Founder of [Cloudmos](https://cloudmos.io)\\n    \\n\\n**Highlights from this week:**\\n\\n*   Coinbase features Akash Network as a leading solution for decentralized compute.\\n    \\n*   Comdex is building a suite of DeFi solutions for the cosmos ecosystem.\\n    \\n*   Cloudmos has launched its custom SDL builder and continues to build new tools for the Akash ecosystem.\\n    \\n\\n* * *\\n\\nAkash Ecosystem Updates from Greg Osuri\\n---------------------------------------\\n\\nIt\u2019s been a busy week for Akash Network. Here are a few highlights from across the ecosystem:\\n\\n[**Coinbase features Akash as one of the top solutions for decentralized compute.**](https://twitter.com/gregosuri/status/1565367900415729664?s=20&amp;t=663NidiSuMYth4JJxwyrew) This week, Coinbase published a guide for Web3 developers highlighting projects from all parts of the Web3 ecosystem. The projects included make up all the protocols and tools needed to develop a fully decentralized Web3 application. In the section for decentralized cloud compute\u2014Akash Network was featured as the leading network in the category. This further highlights that Akash Network is top-of-mind for developers looking to create truly decentralized applications.\\n\\n[**Spheron**](https://spheron.network/) **and Akash Network are official integration partners.** Spheron has been working closely with Akash Network over the past few weeks, and we are excited to announce that Spheron will feature Akash Network as its featured integration. We look forward to seeing even more growth from Spheron on Akash.\\n\\n[**Cloudmos**](https://cloudmos.io/) **officially announces its custom SDL builder.** Cloudmos has launched a tool that allows a user to easily define the parameters for their deployments, and the tool will do the work of automatically creating the SDL (Stack Definition Language) needed to create the deployment. This will make it even easier for more users to define many different types of applications and remove another potential barrier to deployment.&nbsp;\\n\\n**Greg Osuri gives a preview of on-chain deployments on Akash Network.** Check out the YouTube recording of this Akash Weekly to hear Greg explain how this feature could potentially work in his own words.\\n\\n* * *\\n\\nComdex Is Building the DeFi Infrastructure Layer for the Cosmos Ecosystem\\n-------------------------------------------------------------------------\\n\\n[Comdex](https://comdex.one/), a suite of DeFi solutions for the Cosmos ecosystem, started as a solution for digitizing the commodities trade industry\u2014one of the largest industries in the world and the \u201clifeblood of the supply chain globally,\u201d according to Siddarth Patil, COO of Comdex, \u201c...as the crypto ecosystem legitimizes itself, we want to build the infrastructure rails for facilitating that interaction of capital between DeFi and CeFi.\u201d\\n\\nComdex intends to build out a full-fledged ecosystem to bring real-world assets on-chain. They have started building a stablecoin protocol called CMST, which is live on testnet, along with a decentralized exchange called cSwap. [Explore the rest of Comdex\u2019s ecosystem here](https://docs.comdex.one/comdex-ecosystem).\\n\\nMany parts of Comdex\u2019s apps are hosted on Akash Network, and they are working to bring even more of their ecosystem onto Akash. They mention that it is critical for DeFi to move to decentralized infrastructure.\\n\\nSiddarth notes that Comdex discovered Akash Network through its visibility in the Cosmos ecosystem, and also through meetings with Greg Osuri, CEO of Overclock Labs, and [Boz Menzalji, COO of Overclock Labs](https://twitter.com/boz_menzalji).\\n\\n* * *\\n\\nCloudmos Is Building Tools for Akash and the Cosmos Ecosystem\\n-------------------------------------------------------------\\n\\n[Cloudmos](https://cloudmos.io/) is a set of tools, and a deployment platform, made for Akash Network and its ecosystem. These tools include: A fully functional block explorer with built-in analytics, a deploy tool GUI for easily creating deployments, as well as being a validator for Akash Network.\\n\\nMax found Akash Network through its visibility in the Cosmos ecosystem, much like Comdex.&nbsp;\\n\\nCloudmos is an alum of [Akash Accelerator](https://akash.network/akash-accelerator) and remains a participant in the program. Max notes that his discussions and meetings with Alani Kuye, Technical Program Manager at Overclock Labs, have helped Cloudmos to better align its roadmap and vision. Akash Accelerator is a great way to get guidance and actionable advice straight from the Overclock Labs teams.\\n\\nMax is also a founding member of the [Akash Insiders](https://akash.network/community#insiders). The Akash Insiders program is a great way to get deeply involved with the core of the Akash Network community and to get access to new features before they are fully released to the network. The Insiders are managed day-to-day by [Adam Wozney](https://twitter.com/AdamDeanWozney), Head of Community at Overclock Labs.\\n\\n* * *\\n\\nQ&amp;A\\n---\\n\\n### Q: What are the personal uses of a proxy server?\\n\\nA: A proxy server could be used to cache certain parts of a web application for different regions. It could also be used to reduce bandwidth costs by caching a webpage.&nbsp;\\n\\n### Q: How can a beginner use the SDL builder?\\n\\nA: Greg notes that the SDL builder will greatly simplify the creation process, and make it easier to deploy seamlessly to Akash.\\n\\n### Q: How will fiat payments on Akash affect AKT (Akash\u2019s Utility Token)?&nbsp;\\n\\nA: Fiat payments will make it easier for more people to access Akash Network. Most of the world is not Web3-fluent and is more familiar with fiat payments systems. As Akash\u2019s adoption increases, projects like Vix\u0113llo will allow enterprises and others to access the network with seamless fiat payments.\\n\\nCrucially, fiat payments will not hinder the usage of AKT. Projects that offer fiat payments will still have to acquire AKT in order to facilitate those deployments on Akash Network. The only way to deploy on Akash at the base level is with AKT.&nbsp;\\n\\nMore payment types will increase the usage of AKT by bringing ultimately bringing more users to the network.\\n\\n### Q: What does Kava Proposal 97 mean for Akash Network?&nbsp;\\n\\nA: Kava Foundation recently announced their Ecosystem Fund. They will finance companies that are going to build on Kava, and they also want to ensure that these companies are aligned with the ethos of decentralization and Akash Network. Kava will be providing rewards to those selected companies building on Akash.&nbsp;\\n\\nAkash Network is proud to collaborate with Kava Network, and we look forward to working together to support and enable builders in the Cosmos ecosystem to create a more robust, decentralized future.\\n\\n* * *\\n\\nClosing Thoughts from Greg Osuri\\n--------------------------------\\n\\nCloudmos began as Akashlytics, which was built by Max as a separate application\u2014and not affiliated with the core team at Overclock Labs. Over time, the application evolved into a fully-fledged deployment platform with many tools that provide value to the ecosystem. Many other developers have followed suit in building apps for Akash.\\n\\nWe are proud to see the organic growth the Akash ecosystem has achieved over time. This is what will take Akash to the next level, and bring more and more adoption to the network.\\n\\nOrganic growth is a long road. It takes time, and a strong product-market fit to achieve real growth\u2014growth that is not purely the result of incentives.&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly With Greg Osuri: Comdex and Cloudmos Are Building the Future of Cosmos&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly with Greg Osuri is our weekly community call hosted on Twitter Spaces. Each week, we cover the latest news and updates from Akash Network with our CEO, Greg Osuri.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2022-09-09T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Zach Horn&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.CtSNd4vH.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1920],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1080],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-comdex-and-cloudmos-are-building-the-future-of-cosmo/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;how-to-access-chia-s-bladebit-disk-on-akash-network/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;how-to-access-chia-s-bladebit-disk-on-akash-network&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;Chia has launched the beta of their Bladebit Disk plotting software, which takes the high performance of the original Bladebit and adds flexibility to support plotting across a wide range of systems. With Bladebit Disk, a Chia user has greater flexibility to create plots according to their time and cost preference.\\n\\nChia currently has three software options for plotting: MadMax, Bladebit, and Bladebit Disk. MadMax optimizes the original Chia reference plotting software while maintaining similar performance. Bladebit has very high system requirements (416GB of DRAM), making it suited to high-performance systems or those with access to virtual compute environments. With the addition of Bladebit Disk, users can create plots with more flexible system requirements.&nbsp;\\n\\nBladebit Disk is compatible with most home computing setups but also scales exceptionally well in virtualized Kubernetes environments. This makes Bladebit Disk the best choice for those looking to create Chia plots from their home system\u2014and especially those creating plots via Akash Network.\\n\\nHow much can Akash providers earn from Bladebit Disk?\\n-----------------------------------------------------\\n\\nChia plotting on Akash Network is a very profitable workload for Akash providers. This is due to the high demand for Chia plots and the flexibility of using Akash for Plotting-as-a-Service.&nbsp;\\n\\nCurrently, providers can earn between $200-350/month with a $0.15/plot cost on modern hardware (defined as hardware produced within the last three years).\\n\\nAs a reference for Bladebit and MadMax pricing, the chart below is from our Summer Sale\u2014which offered Chia plots for $0.10/plot.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1662672470-screen-shot-2022-09-08-at-5-27-30-pm.png)\\n\\nHow do Akash providers upgrade to support Bladebit Disk?\\n--------------------------------------------------------\\n\\nAs a provider, becoming compatible with Bladebit Disk is as simple as upgrading your hardware. Below are the ideal requirements for running Bladebit Disk:\\n\\n*   24 CPUs\\n    \\n*   128 GB DRAM&nbsp;\\n    \\n*   1TB Ephemeral Storage (NVMe or RAID SSDs)\\n    \\n\\nIf any providers have questions about upgrading their hardware, or about Bladebit Disk in general\u2014please reach out through the [Akash Network Community Discord](https://discord.gg/RAJSe4a7JG).\\n\\nHow to run Bladebit Disk on Akash\\n---------------------------------\\n\\nAnyone who would like to run Bladebit Disk today can do so using the steps below:\\n\\n1.  Launch [**Cloudmos**](http://cloudmos.io/) (formerly Akashlytics)\\n    \\n2.  Navigate to **Templates**\\n    \\n3.  Then **Mining**\\n    \\n4.  Run **Bladebit Disk**\\n    \\n\\nAkash is a fast and flexible way to run any application\\n-------------------------------------------------------\\n\\nBladebit Disk was live on Akash Network only eight hours after its launch. There are only a few simple steps to bring any application to the network. Create a Docker file, publish it to our Awesome Akash repository, and create a pull request. If the pull request is accepted into the main branch, it will be available for providers and through [Cloudmos](http://cloudmos.io/) (formerly Akashlytics). The speed and efficiency of this process are how Akash was able to be the first to run Bladebit Disk.\\n\\nThis entire process is seamless and is available to anyone who would like to make a pull request to our [Awesome Akash](https://github.com/ovrclk/awesome-akash) repository.&nbsp;\\n\\nThis simple process showcases how seamless it is to make new software available to everyone on Akash Network. Anyone can publish any application. Akash is fast and flexible but also robust and distributed\u2014a powerful combination for a distributed network.&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;How To Access Chia\u2019s Bladebit Disk on Akash Network&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Chia has launched the beta of their Bladebit Disk plotting software, which takes the high performance of the original Bladebit and adds flexibility to support plotting across a wide range of systems. With Bladebit Disk, a Chia user has greater flexibility to create plots according to their time and cost preference.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2022-09-08T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Developers&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Developers&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Zach Horn&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.Le5K1uot.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1920],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1080],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/how-to-access-chia-s-bladebit-disk-on-akash-network/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-august-updates-and-ali-merchant-on-the-akash-s-devel/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-august-updates-and-ali-merchant-on-the-akash-s-devel&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\nAkash Weekly with Greg Osuri is our weekly community call hosted on Twitter Spaces. Each week, we cover the latest news and updates from Akash Network with our CEO, Greg Osuri.\\n\\nFollow Akash Network ([@akashnet\\\\_](https://twitter.com/akashnet_)) on Twitter to get notifications for all future Akash Weekly events. We\u2019re live every Wednesday at 8 AM PT. Tune in next week for the latest from Akash and conversations with special guests!\\n\\n[Sign up for our newsletter to stay up to date with everything happening across Akash Network.](https://akash.network/?newsletter=true)\\n\\n**On this Akash Weekly:**\\n\\n- Greg Osuri, CEO &amp; Co-Founder of Overclock Labs (creator of Akash Network) [@gregosuri](https://twitter.com/gregosuri)\\n- Ali Merchant, Developer Relations Lead at Overclock Labs\\n\\n**Our topics this week:**\\n\\n- Updates from August.\\n- Enterprises begin to repatriate their data centers.\\n- [Ali Merchant](https://twitter.com/Ali_the_Curios) gives an overview of how we will work to make Akash intuitive for developers.\\n- Q&amp;A with our community.\\n\\n---\\n\\n## August Updates from Greg Osuri\\n\\n### Akash Network Trends on Twitter\\n\\nAkash was top-of-mind in the wake of a large centralized cloud provider banning Web3 from their platform. Many on Twitter suggested Akash as a decentralized Web3 solution for developers looking to build on an open cloud without fearing arbitrary censorship and banning.\\n\\n**Akash Network generated more than 7,000 tweets per hour at the peak trending volume.**\\n\\nThis publicity is a testament to the work being done by Overclock Labs in building and supporting the Akash Ecosystem. This also reflects the continued efforts of Akash\u2019s incredible community, who help the network grow and evolve. Keep up the great work, keep sharing your projects, and keep engaging with us on social media\u2014we love seeing your efforts!\\n\\n### Chia Partners with Akash Network for Bladebit Disk Launch\\n\\n[Chia Network](https://www.chia.net/) has partnered with Akash Network for the launch of their new plotting software, Bladebit Disk. This new version of the popular Bladebit plotting software makes it easier for users to create plots across a broader range of system requirements. Bladebit Disk also scales exceptionally well in virtualized Kubernetes environments\u2014making Akash a perfect launch partner to help users experience everything Bladebit Disk has to offer.\\n\\nWe are proud to work with Chia to bring Bladebit Disk to people around the world, and we look forward to continued collaboration on future projects.\\n\\n### Akash Network Officially Welcomes Spheron\\n\\nWe would like to welcome [Spheron](https://spheron.network/) to Akash Network as a protocol client. Spheron is a developer-friendly platform that makes it simple to deploy Javascript-based applications to the cloud. We are excited to welcome them to the ecosystem and look forward to seeing them grow on Akash Network.\\n\\n### The Akash Community Continues to Grow\\n\\nWe are excited to see our community continue to expand and evolve as more projects choose Akash as the decentralized Web3 network of choice.\\n\\nWe would like to highlight&nbsp;[Cloudmos](https://cloudmos.io/)&nbsp;and&nbsp;[Akash Console](https://provider-console.akash.network/)&nbsp;for their continued work building great products that make it easy for anyone to access Akash Network.\\n\\n[Our Ecosystem page on akash.network](https://akash.network/ecosystem/showcase/latest/) showcases all the projects currently on Akash Network.\\n\\n---\\n\\n## Enterprises Begin to Repatriate Their Data Centers\\n\\nThe $500 billion cloud infrastructure industry is undergoing a massive shift. Enterprises are beginning to realize that over time, the centralized cloud is an expensive proposition.\\n\\nThe co-founders of Overclock Labs wrote about the concept in the whitepaper that launched Akash Network. It has been an amazing journey watching this early vision of the cloud industry\u2019s progression become a reality.\\n\\nIt will be likely that these repatriated data centers will have underutilized compute\u2014which creates an incredible adoption opportunity for Akash Network.\\n\\n---\\n\\n## An Overview of the Developer Experience on Akash with Ali Merchant\\n\\nAli views the development of blockchain technology as similar to the early internet. It\u2019s important for developers to begin to learn about blockchain, and the potential impacts it will have on many industries.\\n\\nWeb3 and blockchain technology are not necessarily perfect solutions for every problem. Understanding where to apply Web3 tech to solve specific problems requires more than a passing understanding of the technology. Developers have the opportunity to begin learning and experimenting with the technology before it reaches the mainstream. This will give adventurous developers a head start on the adoption of blockchain technology more broadly.\\n\\nAli first learned about Akash in 2017. He notes that one of the things that drew him to Akash was the platform being live and operational in a space where many other projects are not. Akash Network was providing value immediately to its users, is still building on that functionality today, and has a strong roadmap planned for the future.\\n\\nAli believes that Akash Network will shine as Web3 reaches mainstream adoption.\\n\\n---\\n\\n## Q&amp;A\\n\\n### Q: How decentralized are Akash\u2019s validator nodes?\\n\\nA: Akash validators can run on any provider platform, including colocation data centers and on bare metal. We are working on reporting to gain more information about the state of Akash\u2019s validators.\\n\\n### Q: Is there a team within Overclock Labs working on enterprise adoption?\\n\\nA: We are always working towards increasing adoption, especially for enterprise providers and tenants. We have a business development team that is always open to conversations around moving onto Akash Network.\\n\\n### Q: Is there a plan to support something like Firecracker in the future?\\n\\nA: Firecracker support is coming soon to Akash Network.\\n\\n### Q: Is there an attribute filtering mechanism on Akash Network?\\n\\nA: Yes, there is a way to filter for certain provider attributes. Providers will also advertise when they make new features available to the network.\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly with Greg Osuri: August Updates, and Ali Merchant on Akash\u2019s Developer Experience&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly with Greg Osuri is our weekly community call hosted on Twitter Spaces. Each week, we cover the latest news and updates from Akash Network with our CEO, Greg Osuri.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2022-09-02T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Zach Horn&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.JoUFduTI.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1314],&quot;height&quot;:[0,956],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-august-updates-and-ali-merchant-on-the-akash-s-devel/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;web3-is-welcome-on-akash-network/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;web3-is-welcome-on-akash-network&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\n**It\u2019s time to move to the open cloud.**\\n\\nOn the centralized cloud, you can be kicked off at any time, for any reason. One simple change to a centralized provider\u2019s Terms and Conditions can send you scrambling for an alternative. You might find yourself locked out of your account, unable to do anything, while frantically reaching out to customer support for answers.\\n\\nOn the open cloud, deployments are fast and low-cost. Best of all, there are no arbitrary rules and restrictions. You set the specifications for your deployment and choose the provider that works best for you. If you need to make a change, a new provider is only a few clicks away.\\n\\n## A Simple Deployment to Try Today (Total Time: ~10 Minutes)\\n\\nWant to experience what Akash has to offer? Try this simple \u201cHello World\u201d deployment, and experience the lightbulb moment that everyone mentions when they first experience Akash Network.\\n\\n### Step 1: Download Cloudmos and Keplr Wallet\\n\\nDownload Cloudmos using the links below.\\n\\n- [Windows](https://github.com/maxmaxlabs/cloudmos-deploy/releases/download/v0.15.0/Cloudmos-Deploy-0.15.0.exe)\\n- [Mac](https://github.com/maxmaxlabs/cloudmos-deploy/releases/download/v0.15.0/Cloudmos-Deploy-0.15.0.dmg)\\n- [Linux](https://github.com/maxmaxlabs/cloudmos-deploy/releases/download/v0.15.0/Cloudmos-Deploy-0.15.0.AppImage)\\n\\n[Download Keplr Wallet](https://www.keplr.app/download), and follow the in-app instructions to create a new wallet.\\n\\n[_Issues with downloading? See our docs for more information._](https://akash.network/docs/guides/deploy/cloudmos-deploy-installation?q=cloudmos)\\n\\n### Step 2: Get Some AKT (Akash\u2019s Utility Token)\\n\\nYou\u2019ll need at least 5 AKT (~$1.65 at the moment) to escrow for your deployment on Cloudmos. We recommend getting at least 10 AKT, so you have a little extra if needed.\\n\\n[See instructions and a list of exchanges here.](https://akash.network/docs/tokens-and-wallets/buy)\\n\\nOnce you have AKT in your Keplr wallet, head to the next step.\\n\\n### Step 3: Launch Cloudmos and Click \u2018Deploy\u2019\\n\\nFollow the in-app instructions to create a certificate.\\n\\n### Step 4: Choose your Deployment\\n\\nSelect the **\u201cHello Akash World\u201d** deployment.\\n\\nThen click **\u201cCreate Deployment\u201d** in the top right corner of the app.\\n\\nSelect **\u201cDeposit\u201d** to add your AKT to escrow. You\u2019ll only need to deposit 5 AKT for this deployment.\\n\\n### Step 5: Choose Your Provider Bid\\n\\nNext, you\u2019ll see a list of bids from providers. We recommend a provider with a ~$2/month cost\\\\* for this deployment.\\n\\n**Click \u201cDeploy.\u201d**\\n\\n---\\n\\n## Welcome to the Open Cloud\\n\\nYou should now see the active deployment in the \u201cDeployments\u201d tab on the left side of the screen.
