Go ahead and click the URI towards the bottom of the active deployment dashboard, and check out your live app.\\n\\nDeploying on Akash Network is that simple, and this process works with any dockerized application.\\n\\nThe possibilities are limitless.\\n\\nBe sure to share your new deployment on Twitter, tag [@akashnet\\\\_](https://twitter.com/akashnet_), and include the hashtag **#PoweredByAkash** to connect with our community.\\n\\n_\\\\*prices as of August 2022._\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Web3 Is Welcome on Akash Network&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;It\u2019s time to move to the open cloud.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2022-08-30T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Insights&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Insights&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Zach Horn&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.BKdxleIg.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1920],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1080],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/web3-is-welcome-on-akash-network/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-julian-morales-from-vixello/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-julian-morales-from-vixello&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly with Greg Osuri is our weekly community call hosted on Twitter Spaces. Each week, we cover the latest news and updates from Akash Network with our CEO, Greg Osuri.  \\n  \\nFollow Akash Network ([@akashnet\\\\_](https://twitter.com/akashnet_)) on Twitter to get notifications for all future Akash Weekly events. We\u2019re live every Wednesday at 8 AM PT. Tune in next week for the latest from Akash and conversations with special guests!  \\n  \\n**On this Akash Weekly:**\\n\\n*   Greg Osuri, CEO &amp; Co-Founder of Overclock Labs (creator of Akash Network) [@gregosuri](https://twitter.com/gregosuri)&nbsp;\\n    \\n*   Julian Morales, Head of Technology at [Vix\u0113llo](https://vixello.com/)\\n    \\n\\n**Our topics this week:**\\n\\n*   Updates from around the ecosystem\\n    \\n*   Vix\u0113llo: Making the open cloud easier to use and more compatible for enterprise use-cases\\n    \\n*   Dispelling misguided Akash FUD\\n    \\n\\n**News:**\\n\\n*   **Overclock Labs welcomes Ali Merchant as our Developer Relations Lead.** Ali comes to Akash from Ignite (formerly Tendermint). [Follow him on Twitter @Ali\\\\_the\\\\_Curios.](https://twitter.com/Ali_the_Curios)\\n    \\n*   A reminder that the Overclock Labs team will be attending Messari Mainnet in NYC from September 21-23. Use code AKASH300 at checkout for $300 off of your ticket purchase.&nbsp;\\n    \\n*   Also, Adam Bozanich (Co-Founder of Overclock Labs) and Adam Wozney (Head of Community at Overclock Labs) will be speaking at Cosmoverse in Medell\u00edn, Columbia between September 26-28.\\n    \\n\\n* * *\\n\\n**Greg Osuri\u2019s Akash Ecosystem Updates**  \\n  \\n**Two new projects deploy on Akash Network**  \\nEvery week we see more projects join the Akash ecosystem. We would like to highlight two new projects that have recently been deployed on Akash:&nbsp;  \\n  \\n[**Stakewolle**](https://stakewolle.com/) is a staking service provider for multiple chains across the space.  \\n  \\n[**Money.space**](https://money.space/) enables deep interblockchain liquidity for stable assets.  \\n  \\nIf you deploy a project on Akash, be sure to include the Powered by Akash logo on the project site, and tweet us at [@akashnet\\\\_](https://twitter.com/akashnet_) with the hashtag #PoweredByAkash to be discovered by the Akash community.  \\n  \\n**Allnodes lists Akash Network**  \\n[Allnodes](https://www.allnodes.com/), a non-custodial platform for node hosting and staking, has listed Akash Network. This gives Akash even more exposure to the wider staking ecosystem.  \\n  \\n**Cloudmos\u2019 On-Chain Funding**  \\nCongratulations to [Cloudmos](https://cloudmos.io/) for the approval of their on-chain fundraise. This is a testament to the strength of the community in supporting its favorite projects on Akash and across the Cosmos ecosystem.  \\n  \\n**DeFund Airdrop to AKT Holders**  \\n[Check out DeFund's article for more information.](https://medium.com/defund-finance/airdrop-d-c2685d282858)  \\n  \\n[**Dimokus**](https://twitter.com/Dimokus_vrn) **(Akash Insider) is Working to Enable VPN Deployments on Akash**  \\nOnce finished, it will be easy for anyone to deploy a VPN on Akash. Although there will be a slight tradeoff in performance, a VPN on Akash\u2019s decentralized cloud gives users complete control over access to the VPN itself, and also to the VPN\u2019s log files\u2014which is key to maintaining true privacy online.\\n\\n* * *\\n\\n**Greg Osuri Addresses Misguided Akash FUD**  \\n  \\nThere has been some FUD (Fear, Uncertainty, and Doubt) on Twitter recently, stemming from a tweet that claimed to show&nbsp;data that many nodes on Akash were running on a very well-known centralized cloud provider.  \\n  \\nThis is simply false.  \\n  \\nThe data in the tweet appears to show testing data and does not reflect the actual active providers currently on Akash Network. It is unknown whether this misleading data was posted maliciously, or if the poster simply did&nbsp;not know how to compile accurate provider data from the network. We have reached out to them, but have received no response.  \\n  \\nWe will publish our own analysis on this topic in the coming weeks. In the meantime, our preliminary data suggests that there are zero nodes running on the large centralized provider in question.\\n\\n* * *\\n\\n**Julian Morales Gives an Overview of Vix\u0113llo**  \\n  \\nVix\u0113llo is a validator on Akash network and a platform for staking, delegating, and governance. They started with validator nodes across several projects, and are working to expand their offerings over time.  \\n  \\nTheir roadmap includes building a seamless on-ramp to Akash Network by offering credit card payment and invoicing. This will enable enterprises to access Akash that currently cannot use decentralized networks because of the inability to receive an invoice for payments made on the network.  \\n  \\nJulian's \u2018lightbulb\u2019 moment for Akash Network came from his first-hand experience with the product. He quickly realized that not only was deploying on Akash possible today\u2014it was better than many other alternatives. This is something we hear over and over again from new members of the Akash ecosystem.&nbsp;  \\n  \\nVix\u0113llo notes that the experience of being a validator on Akash has been seamless. The team at Overclock Labs is always ready and available to make onboarding as a provider and validator as easy as possible and to provide support as needed.\\n\\n* * *\\n\\n**Q&amp;A**&nbsp;  \\n  \\n**Q: A question for Julian\u2014What is the reason that it is difficult for enterprises to use Akash currently and how does Vix\u0113llo help?**  \\n  \\nA: Enterprises typically need invoices for their expense payments. If an enterprise company is going to have an expense for cloud compute, they often need to be able to pay in fiat\u2014and then to receive an invoice for that payment.&nbsp;  \\n  \\nVix\u0113llo is working to build a fiat on-ramp for Akash Network that will allow users to pay with a credit card (to be able to pay with fiat) and also to receive an invoice for their payment. They will accomplish this by working with several banks in Singapore.&nbsp;\\n\\n* * *\\n\\n**Overclock Labs is Hiring**  \\n  \\nAkash still has openings for a **Sr. Software Engineer (equivalent to an L7 at Google)**. We are focusing mainly on Kubernetes experience for this role and are willing to provide background and guidance on Blockchain as needed. This role will be integral to creating the architecture of the open cloud.  \\n  \\nWe are also actively searching for a **VP of Marketing**.  \\n  \\nIf you know someone who might be a good fit for either of these roles\u2014please reach out to us. We are willing to reward any successful referrals generously.&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly with Greg Osuri: Julian Morales from Vix\u0113llo&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly with Greg Osuri is our weekly community call hosted on Twitter Spaces. Each week, we cover the latest news and updates from Akash Network with our CEO, Greg Osuri.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2022-08-26T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Zach Horn&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.JoUFduTI.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1314],&quot;height&quot;:[0,956],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-julian-morales-from-vixello/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-chia-launches-bladebit-disk-beta-terraform-integrati/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-chia-launches-bladebit-disk-beta-terraform-integrati&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\nAkash Weekly with Greg Osuri is our weekly community call hosted on Twitter Spaces. Each week, we cover the latest news and updates from Akash Network with our CEO, Greg Osuri.\\n\\nFollow Akash Network ([@akashnet\\\\_](https://twitter.com/akashnet_)) on Twitter to get notifications for all future Akash Weekly events. We\u2019re live every Wednesday at 8 AM PT. Tune in next week for the latest from Akash and conversations with special guests!\\n\\n[Sign up for our newsletter to stay up to date with everything Akash Network.](https://akash.network/?newsletter=true)\\n\\n**On this Akash Weekly:**\\n\\n- Greg Osuri, CEO &amp; Co-Founder of Overclock Labs (creator of Akash Network) [@gregosuri](https://twitter.com/gregosuri)\\n- Andrew Mello, Head of Mining at Overclock Labs\\n- Jonmichael Hands, VP of Storage at [Chia Network](https://www.chia.net/)\\n- Joao Luna, [Akash Insider](https://akash.network/community#insiders) &amp; Creator of Akash\u2019s Terraform Integration\\n\\n**Our topics this week:**\\n\\n- An overview of the Akash Ecosystem\\n- Chia launches Bladebit Disk Beta\\n- Joao Luna walks us through Akash\u2019s Terraform integration\\n\\n---\\n\\n## Greg Osuri\u2019s Akash Ecosystem Updates\\n\\nOne of the greatest strengths of Akash Network is the ecosystem of developers working to build tools that bring value to everyone on the network.\\n\\n### Cloudmos (formerly Akashlytics)&nbsp;\\n\\nCloudmos is the defacto deployment tool on Akash Network, which is a testament to the product\u2019s ease of use and intuitiveness for both new and experienced users. Cloudmos is also releasing an explorer for Akash Network, along with a price comparison tool.\\n\\n### Praetor&nbsp;\\n\\nPraetor is building an intuitive solution for providers on Akash Network, which will enable Akash providers to rapidly get up and running on the network. [Praetor is now called Akash provider console](https://provider-console.akash.network/)\\n\\n### Spheron\\n\\nSpheron is also building a tool to make deploying on Akash easy and intuitive. They also will offer multi-coin settlements.\\n\\n### Cosmos Directory\\n\\nCosmos Directory has also joined Akash. They offer a highly curated list of RPC servers for any of the Cosmos SDK chains and are fulfilling a real need for a project directory in the web3 space.\\n\\n### Dimokus ([@dimokus_vrn](https://twitter.com/Dimokus_vrn)) is running a VPN server on Akash for $0.18 per month.\\n\\nThis highlights the low-cost and flexibility of deploying on Akash Network, and begs the question: What other deployments are possible?\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1660944280-screen-shot-2022-08-19-at-5-24-23-pm.png)\\n\\n---\\n\\n## Chia Launches Bladebit Disk Beta\\n\\nChia, a decentralized blockchain based on a consensus mechanism called Proof of Space and Time, launched its beta of Bladebit Disk\u2014which gives users even more flexibility when creating Chia plots.\\n\\nPlotting on Chia is a one-time process that requires significant computational resources to complete. Once the plot is created, it can be transferred to storage and farmed for five to seven years.\\n\\nIn initial testing, Andrew Mello (Head of Mining at Overlock Labs) discovered that Bladebit Disk scales exceptionally well on virtualized Kubernetes environments on Akash Network.\\n\\n## Bladebit Disk on Akash Network\\n\\nWithin eight hours of the beta launch, Bladebit Disk was available for the entire network via Cloudmos (formerly Akashlytics). This showcases the exceptional flexibility of Akash and the speed that new deployments can be made available to everyone on the network. In addition, Bladebit Disk is a very profitable workload for providers. It will generate $200-350 per month, per workload, at $0.15/plot cost on modern hardware (defined as CPUs, memory, and hard drives produced within the past three years).\\n\\nAny providers that want to upgrade to support this workload should feel free to reach out to us if they have questions.\\n\\n## Run Bladebit Disk Now on Akash Network\\n\\nThe fastest (and only) way to run Bladebit Disk right now is to deploy on Akash Network.\\n\\nFirst, launch Cloudmos (formerly Akashlytics) > Templates > Mining > Bladebit Disk.\\n\\n---\\n\\n## Joao Luna on Akash\u2019s Terraform Integration\\n\\nLuna was inspired to integrate Akash with Terraform to make managing multiple workloads from both Akash and web2 providers easier. Given Terraform\u2019s status in the legacy cloud market, this integration will make it much easier for developers to begin to move workloads onto Akash Network\u2014while still managing everything from the same Terraform environment they are already running.\\n\\nLuna mentions that Akash\u2019s Terraform integration works best for:\\n\\n- Developers\\n- Operations Teams\\n\\nAnyone that has any feature requests or suggestions should feel free to head over to [Joao Luna\u2019s GitHub](https://github.com/cloud-j-luna/terraform-provider-akash), as his Terraform integration is open source.\\n\\n---\\n\\n## Q&amp;A\\n\\n### Q: What problem does Akash Network solve?\\n\\nAkash Network is the first viable open cloud. The mission of the network is to decentralize the market for cloud compute. This will balance the market power of large cloud providers, as the market is currently controlled by an oligopoly of only three major providers.\\n\\nThere is also a widespread underutilization problem with cloud providers. Offering unused compute capacity on Akash helps providers maximize profitability for their resources.\\n\\n### Q: What is Akash\u2019s plan to onboard more people into the decentralized cloud?\\n\\nThe first step is improving the product so that it\u2019s easier for more people to use. Second, we will work with protocol clients to improve retention.\\n\\nWe will work to maximize market penetration within the Cosmos ecosystem (which includes RPC servers, node providers, and websites, among others). This initiative is going well.\\n\\nNext, we will move outward to the broader web3 community. We just beginning this work, and are already seeing traction.\\n\\nBeyond that, we will move into the high-performance computing market.\\n\\nOur goal for each of these phases is to offer a value proposition that cannot be found elsewhere. We aspire to offer a product that isn\u2019t offered anywhere else in Web2 or Web3.\\n\\n### Q: When will Akash be able to offer managed services?\\n\\nManaged services are something we would like to offer down the road, but for the immediate future, we are going to prioritize retention and our current roadmap.\\n\\n### Q: I know a few cloud service providers who would be interested in using Akash. Who should I have them connect with?\\n\\nWe would be happy to connect! Please reach out to [Boz Menzalji, COO of Overclock Labs](https://twitter.com/boz_menzalji), or [Greg Osuri, CEO of Overclock Labs](https://twitter.com/gregosuri).\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly with Greg Osuri: Chia Launches Bladebit Disk Beta, Terraform Integration with Akash&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly with Greg Osuri is our weekly community call hosted on Twitter Spaces. Each week, we cover the latest news and updates from Akash Network with our CEO, Greg Osuri.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2022-08-19T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Zach Horn&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.JoUFduTI.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1314],&quot;height&quot;:[0,956],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-chia-launches-bladebit-disk-beta-terraform-integrati/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;overclock-labs-july-2022-recap/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;overclock-labs-july-2022-recap&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\nOur team at Overclock Labs is hard at work building the future of the decentralized cloud, and the results are showing. Here is a look back at our major milestones for July 2022.\\n\\n## Executive Summary\\n\\n**All-time high usage.** We reached several new all-time highs for usage in July\u2014including daily AKT spend, actively leased memory, and active providers.\\n\\n**Our team is growing.** Overclock Labs welcomed three new members to our team in July: Jorge Lopez Johnson, Sr. DevOps Engineer, Milos Nikolic, Sr. Software Engineer, and Zach Horn, Content Marketing Associate. We are still looking to fill several roles, especially engineering talent.\\n\\n**Opportunities for thought leadership.** Greg Osuri (CEO of Overclock Labs) and Anil Murty (Head of Product at Overclock Labs) are announced as speakers at Messari Mainnet from September 21-23 in New York City. Adam Bozanich (CTO of Overclock Labs) and Adam Wozney (Head of Community at Overclock Labs) are scheduled to speak at Cosmoverse, from September 26-28.\\n\\n---\\n\\n## Record High Usage\\n\\nAkash reached a new record high for usage in July, peaking at over 11 terabytes of actively leased memory. We consider memory to be the most accurate measure of network usage, as it is the most valuable scarce resource on the network.\\n\\nDaily AKT spend also peaked in a similar time frame at over 1,100 AKT/day.\\n\\nAkash has more providers on the network than ever before. There are currently 57 active providers, and more providers are joining the network on a continual basis.\\n\\n## Akash Accelerator\\n\\nIn June, we refactored what was previously the Community Awards Board (CAB) into our new initiative, Akash Accelerator. Over the month of July, we have continued to build upon this foundation to bring new projects onto Akash Network, providing guidance, technical support, and grants to help these projects become operational and grow.\\n\\nAkash Accelerator also acts in an advisory capacity and ensures these projects are better prepared to raise money.\\n\\n### Our featured Akash Accelerator projects:\\n\\n[**Cloudmos (previously Akashlytics)**](https://cloudmos.io/)\\n\\nCloudmos provides network usage data for Akash Network. Cloudmos is also in the process of launching an explorer for Akash Network.\\n\\n[**Akash Provider Console**](https://provider-console.akash.network/)\\n\\nAkash Provider Console makes it easy to become a provider on Akash Network, offering an easy-to-use interface as an alternative to using the command-line interface (CLI).\\n\\n[**OpenRegistry**](https://app.openregistry.dev/)\\n\\nOpenRegistry is a decentralized registry of container images. Users can store, download, and share container images and the platform is Open Container Image (OCI) compliant.\\n\\n[**Moultrie Audits**](https://www.moultrieaudits.com/)\\n\\nMoultrie Audits is an infrastructure auditing company designed to increase technical security and uptime.\\n\\n## Greg Osuri and Anil Murty Announced as Speakers at Messari Mainnet\\n\\nAkash Network will be sponsoring Messari Mainnet from September 21-23 in New York City. Both Greg Osuri, CEO of Overclock Labs, and Anil Murty, Head of Product at Overclock Labs, will be speaking on panels alongside several other prominent companies in the web3 space.\\n\\nWe look forward to the opportunity to provide thought leadership to the industry around decentralization, peer-to-peer marketplaces, and the future of the cloud\u2014topics we believe in deeply.\\n\\n## Persistent Storage Now Available on Akash Network\\n\\nPraetor now offers persistent storage on Akash Network, offering even more flexibility to developers looking to run a wider variety of workloads. We have already heard from many developers that the availability of persistent storage was a major factor in the decision to move additional workloads onto Akash Network.\\n\\nDevelopers are using persistent storage across many different applications\u2014including running nodes and validators, databases, data warehousing, and machine learning.\\n\\n## Four-Phase Adoption Plan\\n\\nGreg Osuri reiterated our commitment to our four-phase plan for the adoption of Akash Network.\\n\\n**Phase One:** Increase adoption within the Cosmos Ecosystem &amp; web3.\\n\\n**Phase Two:** Increase adoption of compute-intensive workloads and add GPU support.\\n\\n**Phase Three:** Further increase adoption by decreasing latency and targeting the High-Performance Computing market.\\n\\n**Phase Four:** Maximize adoption around the world by onboarding web2 tenants and providers.\\n\\n---\\n\\nWe will release a similar recap for the month of August in a few weeks. In the meantime, follow us on Twitter [@akashnet\\\\_](https://twitter.com/akashnet_) along with our CEO, Greg Osuri, [@gregosuri](https://twitter.com/gregosuri).\\n\\n[Subscribe to our newsletter](https://akash.network/?newsletter=true) to keep up with the latest news and product updates from Akash.\\n\\nOur Akash Weekly community call is live every Wednesday at 8 AM PT on Twitter Spaces.\\n\\n[Check out our YouTube channel](https://www.youtube.com/c/AkashNetwork) to get up and running with Akash Network, and catch up on recordings of our Akash Weekly calls.\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Overclock Labs: July 2022 Recap&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Our team at Overclock Labs is hard at work building the future of the decentralized cloud, and the results are showing. Here is a look back at our major milestones for July 2022.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2022-08-15T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Zach Horn&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.Bl-saeWI.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1830],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1326],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/overclock-labs-july-2022-recap/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-blockpane-com-alter-and-the-process-of-developing-fo/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-blockpane-com-alter-and-the-process-of-developing-fo&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly with Greg Osuri is our weekly community call hosted on Twitter Spaces. Each week, we cover the latest news and updates from Akash Network with our CEO, Greg Osuri.\\n\\nFollow Akash Network ([@akashnet\\\\_](https://twitter.com/akashnet_)) on Twitter to get notifications for all future Akash Weekly events. We\u2019re live every Wednesday at 8 AM PT. Tune in next week for the latest from Akash and conversations with special guests!\\n\\nSign up for our newsletter to stay up to date with everything Akash Network.\\n\\n**On this Akash Weekly:**\\n\\n*   Greg Osuri, CEO &amp; Co-Founder of Overclock Labs (creators of Akash Network) \\\\[[@gregosuri](https://twitter.com/gregosuri)\\\\]\\n    \\n*   Todd Garrison, Founder of [Block Pane](https://blockpane.com/)\\n    \\n*   Oskar Jepsis, CEO of [Alter](https://altermail.live/)\\n    \\n\\n**Our topics this week:**\\n\\n*   Developing decentralized applications with Block Pane&nbsp;and Alter.\\n    \\n*   The reason that many developers default to web2 hyperscale cloud providers, and how to make the jump to web3.\\n    \\n*   The tools&nbsp;that web3&nbsp;needs now.\\n    \\n\\nNews &amp; Events\\n-------------\\n\\nUpcoming Events\\n\\n*   Come meet the team behind Akash Network in person at [Messari Mainnet](https://mainnet.events/) in NYC from September 21-23. Use code **AKASH300** at checkout for $300 off of your ticket purchase.\\n    \\n*   Adam Bozanich (Co-Founder of Overclock Labs) and Adam Wozney (Head of Community at Overclock Labs) will be speaking at [Cosmoverse](https://cosmoverse.org/) in Medell\u00edn, Columbia between September 26-28.\\n    \\n\\nThe Ethos of a Validator\\n------------------------\\n\\nTodd provides his background as a validator and his journey to Cosmos. From both his and the community\u2019s perspectives, a validator is responsible for more than just making blocks. There is a responsibility to make the ecosystem better. One way to do that is by building tools that seek to answer a question.\\n\\nFor Todd, the genesis of his [Cosmissed](https://blockpane.com/projects.html) tool came from the question: \u201cWhy are people missing blocks?\u201d&nbsp;\\n\\nFrom this question, many more arose as the tool evolved. He notes that asking these seeking questions brings forward valuable information that makes it easier to build for the right audience. Greg agrees, having built many apps that started as a desire to fulfill a personal need. He says that even years later, he finds many of those apps very useful, and nostalgic in a way. Sometimes, those apps end up finding a wider audience.&nbsp;\\n\\nWhy Do Some Developers Continue to Choose web2 Cloud Providers?\\n---------------------------------------------------------------\\n\\nThis is an interesting and complex topic that has been brought up by guests on previous Akash Weekly segments.\\n\\nThe answer, according to Todd (and echoed by previous guests), is that hyperscale cloud providers are familiar to many developers\u2014who often have deep experience with these platforms. Even though these legacy services may not be the best fit for certain projects, some developers continue to return to what they know.\\n\\nBut this is changing. Many developers are beginning to run their nodes and applications on decentralized peer-to-peer marketplaces like Akash Network\u2014often achieving the same performance for a fraction of the cost.\\n\\nTodd mentions that he avoids running more than one validator in the same data center. This way, if there are outages, it reduces the impact of the problem. \u201cThis way I only have one problem, not six,\u201d he says. This is one way that developers can begin to spread out risk and achieve a semblance of decentralization. For those looking to achieve an even greater decentralization of their workloads, Akash Network makes it easy to deploy seamlessly across many different providers.&nbsp;\\n\\nIn addition, many developers have mentioned the addition of persistent storage on Akash Network as a key reason for moving more workloads over to Akash.\\n\\nA Scalable, Private Infrastructure Layer\\n----------------------------------------\\n\\nOskar gives a run-through of Alter, which is a scalable, private infrastructure layer that supports web3 communities. They have focused on maintaining the highest security and privacy standards.\\n\\nAlter is focusing on decentralizing its file storage infrastructure, and working on ways to give users the most choice in controlling the security of their data. They are also exploring options to work with Akash to offer users more control and sovereignty over their data and communications.\\n\\n**Managing to GDPR.** Oskar notes that Alter is not subject to GDPR regulations because they do not process user data\u2014as all the data that Alter works with uses E2EE (End to End Encryption). This not only reduces Alter\u2019s regulatory burden but is also a function of the ways that Alter protects and preserves user privacy.\\n\\nAs Oskar notes, \u201cweb3 can only happen if we collaborate with each other. Otherwise, it is not possible to reach our common goal\u2014which is a decentralized web space.\\&quot;\\n\\nWhich Tools Does web3 Need Now?\\n-------------------------------\\n\\nweb3 is currently highly dependent on Github, which is owned by Microsoft. This centralized service becomes a single point of failure if there are outages, or if takedown notices are issued. Cloudflare also has a significant concentration of websites and applications.\\n\\nA major risk to the entire decentralization movement is the reliance on centralized cloud providers. Chainstack estimates that the top ten cloud providers of Ethereum nodes amount to nearly 60% of all nodes on the network. AWS alone hosts nearly 25% of all nodes on the network.\\n\\nReliance on centralized infrastructure poses significant risks to the stability and sovereignty of all systems and networks that aim to be decentralized. Based on this data from the Ethereum network\u2014an AWS outage would take down nearly a quarter of the entire network.&nbsp;\\n\\nAkash provides the foundational layer that provides decentralization at the base layer. This opens the opportunity for developers to build applications on truly decentralized infrastructure, without having to sacrifice sovereignty by defaulting to hyperscale providers.\\n\\nQ&amp;A\\n---\\n\\n### Q: Are there plans to launch incentive programs with AKT?\\n\\nWe will have future plans to launch incentives, but there are no current plans. We are focusing on revamping our AKT tokenomics.\\n\\n* * *\\n\\nCheck out the full recording of this Akash Weekly on our YouTube channel.&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly with Greg Osuri: Block Pane, Alter, and Developing for Decentralization&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly with Greg Osuri is our weekly community call hosted on Twitter Spaces. Each week, we cover the latest news and updates from Akash Network with our CEO, Greg Osuri.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2022-08-12T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Zach Horn&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.Db6LVDAW.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1830],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1330],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-blockpane-com-alter-and-the-process-of-developing-fo/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-the-importance-of-open-source-yieldmos-overview-and/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-the-importance-of-open-source-yieldmos-overview-and&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly is our weekly community call hosted on Twitter Spaces. Each week, we cover the latest news and updates from Akash Network with our CEO, Greg Osuri.\\n\\n[Follow Akash Network (@akashnet\\\\_) on Twitter](https://twitter.com/akashnet_) to get notifications for all future Akash Weekly events. We\u2019re live every Wednesday at 8 AM PT. Tune in next week for the latest from Akash and conversations with special guests!\\n\\n[Sign up for our newsletter](https://akash.network/?newsletter=true) to stay up to date with everything Akash Network.\\n\\n**On this Akash Weekly:**&nbsp;\\n\\n*   Greg Osuri - CEO &amp; Co-Founder of Overclock Labs (creators of Akash Network) \\\\[[Twitter](https://twitter.com/gregosuri)\\\\]\\n    \\n*   George Jekner, CEO of [Yieldmos](https://www.yieldmos.com/)\\n    \\n*   Scott \u201cHewi\u201d Hewitson, Finance Associate at Overclock Labs\\n    \\n\\n**Our topics this week:**\\n\\n*   Updates on upcoming Akash events and news.\\n    \\n*   The recent exploits of Slope Finance.\\n    \\n*   Akash Network's continued growth and adoption, along with Akash's Terraform integrations.\\n    \\n*   George Jekner gives an overview of Yieldmos, and offers his perspective on web3 adoption and the goal of decentralization.\\n    \\n*   Our panel discussed DeFi vs CeFi, security vulnerabilities, and more.\\n    \\n\\nEvents &amp; News\\n-------------\\n\\n**Upcoming Events**\\n\\n*   Discord Quiz - Every Tuesday. This upcoming Tuesday\u2019s quiz will have a 200 AKT prize pool for five winners.\\n    \\n\\n**News**\\n\\n*   Akash welcomes our newest Insider, Dimokus! If you are interested in becoming an Akash Insider to get access to the leading edge of the Akash Ecosystem, get more information at [akash.network/community](https://akash.network/community).\\n    \\n*   Check out our Akash Accelerator program if you have an idea for a project on Akash Network.\\n    \\n*   [Check out our recent AMA with Citadel.one](https://forum.akash.network/t/citadel-one-ama-recap/4636)\\n    \\n\\nUpdates from Greg Osuri\\n-----------------------\\n\\n### Recent Exploit of Slope Finance and The Importance of Open Source\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1659711571-screen-shot-2022-08-04-at-10-05-39-am.png)\\n\\nThe recent attack on Slope Finance highlights the importance of building open source software. [According to reporting from The Block](https://www.theblock.co/post/161325/solana-team-traces-exploit-back-to-slope-mobile-wallets), a group of, \u201cdevelopers, ecosystem teams and security auditors\u201d called @SolanaStatus completed an independent investigation of the attack, tweeting:\\n\\n\u201cThis exploit was isolated to one wallet on Solana, and hardware wallets used by Slope \\\\[Finance\\\\] remain secure. While the details of exactly how this occurred are still under investigation, but private key information was inadvertently transmitted to an application monitoring service.\u201d \\\\[@SolanaStatus\\\\]\\n\\nAkash Network is open source, and we believe strongly in open source development\u2014which creates trust and confidence for Akash users.\\n\\nAnyone using a hot wallet should verify that the underlying code is open source. Closed source wallets present significant risks to users, and are especially vulnerable to hacks and exploits\u2014as we have seen in the case of Slope Finance.\\n\\n### Decentralized Cloud Adoption and Akash\u2019s Organic Growth\\n\\nAkash Network was recently featured in an article from [Rachel Wolfson at CoinTelegraph on the adoption of decentralized web services for web3](https://cointelegraph.com/news/decentralized-storage-providers-power-the-web3-economy-but-adoption-still-underway). The piece focuses on the current state of the centralized internet, specifically on the dominance of the three largest cloud providers. Wolfson points to decentralized storage protocols like Filecoin and Storj, and of course, decentralized compute marketplaces like Akash Network as leading examples of web3 infrastructure.\\n\\nIn addition, Colin Pape, the CEO of Presearch, a decentralized search engine, highlighted that nodes on Presearch\u2019s network could be run using Akash. In addition, Pape mentioned that Presearch encourages nodes to be run on as many different platforms as possible to encourage decentralization, which is in line with Akash\u2019s ethos and functionality. Presearch currently has 70,000 nodes supporting its network.\\n\\nWe believe that bear markets are an excellent time to educate the market on the importance of decentralized infrastructure. Our message stands out as signal when the noise of token prices and NFT floors calms down. This is the time to speak clearly to long-term market participants\u2014the folks who are building in web3 for a decentralized future. We look forward to more features in the press and the healthy, organic adoption that it will bring.\\n\\n### Terraform Integration\\n\\nTerraform is the number one orchestrator for multi-cloud applications. Terraform makes it simple to deploy applications across different cloud providers. A new community-created Akash integration with Terraform makes it easy for developers to write a small script to move some of their resources over to Akash Network, which allows them to test Akash without the need to make an all-or-nothing decision. This is important for our business development efforts when we reach out to web2 developers.\\n\\nWe want to thank our incredible community for their continued development efforts and commitment to Akash Network.\\n\\n### Cosmos IBC Relayers\\n\\nInter-Blockchain Communication (IBC) protocol on Cosmos works by relaying packets of information between blockchains, without taking custody of user assets. In this way, the security of the transfer is based on the security of the underlying blockchains. Relayers are not vulnerable to the same kinds of attacks and exploits that can happen with bridges.\\n\\nOur Guest this Week: George Jekner, CEO of Yieldmos\\n---------------------------------------------------\\n\\nGeorge Jekner is the CEO of Yieldmos, primarily responsible for strategy and back-end development. George has been a crypto enthusiast and a full-stack developer in the traditional finance sector for almost a decade. George was previously an IT consultant in the Chicagoland area for seven years.\\n\\nYieldmos provides a way for users to earn yield while maintaining custody of their funds. This is achieved by using AuthZ to delegate specific permissions so that Yieldmos can act on a user\u2019s behalf, but critically, Yieldmos does not take custody of user funds.\\n\\nGeorge offers an analogy to the way that a check works in the traditional finance system. A check grants a person permission to draw an exact amount of money from an account. In the same way, Yieldmos operates with specific permissions which are granted via AuthZ by the user\u2014this way, users can earn yield while maintaining custody of their funds.\\n\\nOur Panel this Week: Greg Osuri, George Jekner, and Scott \u201cHewi\u201d Hewitson\\n-------------------------------------------------------------------------\\n\\n**What is DeFi?**\\n\\nHewi offers a definition of Decentralized Finance (DeFi): \u201cAccess to financial products without a trusted third-party.\u201d&nbsp;\\n\\nContrasting DeFi against Centralized Finance (CeFi), the panel notes that DeFi products have continued functioning well despite the recent collapses of multiple centralized entities adjacent to the DeFi space\u2014notably Voyager, Celsius, and 3AC.&nbsp;\\n\\nGreg notes that this is a classic example of closed source failing to open source. DeFi protocols offer transparency that CeFi cannot. In DeFi, a user can see how their funds are being transferred. On-chain transactions allow the users and the wider industry to examine how a protocol is functioning. In this way, openness and transparency can put a check on bad actors and help to mitigate the risks of overleverage.\\n\\nThe panel agrees that DeFi is doing very well in terms of protecting users.\\n\\n**What is the importance of web3 protocols running on decentralized services?**\\n\\nGeorge Jekner offers his perspective on the current state of decentralization in web3. He notes that Yieldmos is striving to move fully into web3 but currently must use some web2 services to access the full tech stack they need. At the moment, web2 is a stepping stone to web3.\\n\\nGreg\u2019s perspective is that the primary issue is the overreliance on a single host. Relying on the largest cloud providers causes too much concentration of power. web3 companies and protocols should avoid running their applications on these massive cloud providers.\\n\\nAkash offers high security and high flexibility for developers - all within a decentralized environment.\\n\\nQ&amp;A from the Community\\n----------------------\\n\\n### Is there an ETA on Take Fees?\\n\\nWe are waiting for more regulatory clarity.\\n\\n### Does the protocol have a treasury?\\n\\nOverclock Labs (the creators of Akash Network) does have a treasury.&nbsp;\\n\\n### Will AKT tokenomics change?\\n\\nOne of our goals is to add stable settlement, as AKT is volatile. This applies especially to people looking for long-term hosting.\\n\\nWe are working to add a stable settlement mechanism using dynamic pricing. We are also working on early provider incentives to grow Akash Network. Stay tuned.\\n\\n### Is Keplr secure?\\n\\nKeplr is closed source, so Greg recommends the same best practices for security that a person would use with any wallet. Always move funds to a cold wallet for greater security.\\n\\n### Where kind we find a list of Akash Accelerator projects?\\n\\n[This page on our website lists our current accelerator projects.](https://akash.network/akash-accelerator)\\n\\n### Is there a plan for an APR boost?\\n\\nThere is no plan for an APR boost.\\n\\nConnect with Akash\\n------------------\\n\\n[_**Follow Akash Network (@akashnet\\\\_) on Twitter**_](https://twitter.com/akashnet_) _to stay up to date with Akash Network, AKT, and the Akash Community._\\n\\n[_**Join our Discord**_](https://discord.com/invite/DxftX67) _to get involved with our community._\\n\\n_**Are you an Akash super user?**_ _Consider joining our_ [_Akash Insiders community_](https://akash.network/community?form=true#insiders) _to get access to the leading edge of the Akash ecosystem, and be among the first to see and test new features before anyone else._\\n\\n### Join our team\\n\\nWe currently have an opening for a VP of Marketing, and we are always looking for engineers. If you or someone you know is interested, [check out our careers page to see current openings.](https://akash.network/careers)&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly with Greg Osuri: The Importance of Open Source, Yieldmos Overview, and DeFi vs CeFi&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly is our weekly community call hosted on Twitter Spaces. Each week, we cover the latest news and updates from Akash Network with our CEO, Greg Osuri.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2022-08-05T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Zach Horn&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.JoUFduTI.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1314],&quot;height&quot;:[0,956],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-the-importance-of-open-source-yieldmos-overview-and/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-july-27-2022/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-july-27-2022&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly is our weekly community call hosted on Twitter Spaces. Each week, we cover the latest news and updates from Akash Network with our CEO, Greg Osuri.\\n\\n[Follow Akash Network (@akashnet\\\\_) on Twitter](https://twitter.com/akashnet_) to get notifications for all future Akash Weekly events. We\u2019re live every Wednesday morning, and everyone is welcome. We hope to see you next week!\\n\\nOn this Akash Weekly:&nbsp;\\n\\n*   Greg Osuri - Co-Founder &amp; CEO of Overclock Labs &amp; Host of Akash Weekly\\n    \\n*   Anil Murty - Head of Product, Overclock Labs\\n    \\n\\nThis week, we looked back on the progress Akash has made in July, took a look into our progress with IP Leases, and much more.\\n\\nAkash Ecosystem Updates\\n-----------------------\\n\\n### Akash Excels for Incentivized Testnet Participation\\n\\nSaving money is one of the core utilities of AKT. We have seen users of Akash Network apply our infrastructure to participate in incentivized testnets, which lowers their costs and results in higher earnings.\\n\\nAkash user Pavlo Dereniuk (@PDereniuk) participated in an incentivized testnet and was able to deploy a node for only $4 using Akash.&nbsp;\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1659123850-screen-shot-2022-07-29-at-3-43-18-pm.png)\\n\\n### Akash is Recording Strong Growth Metrics\\n\\nAkash recorded its highest-ever resource usage in July, **peaking at 11 terabytes of actively leased memory**. Providers on Akash Network maintain a 29% utilization rate, which strongly indicates that Akash has a healthy product-market fit without any external incentives.\\n\\nAkash registered the highest Inter-Blockchain Communication (IBC) volume of any non-financial Web3 application.\\n\\n### Interchain Accounts Are Coming Soon\\n\\nInterchain accounts on Akash are code-ready on our GitHub and currently in review. The addition of interchain accounts will allow for interoperability between other chains like Juno and Akash Network. Once interchain accounts are live, Juno users will be able to deploy onto Akash using a Juno account \u2013 instead of an Akash account. This opens up the ecosystem and fundamentally changes the way that users interact with networks. Interchain accounts will also open composability use-cases between different application chains within the IBC ecosystem.\\n\\nIf you use Akash Network for your project or protocol, please consider displaying the Akash logo and sharing on social using #PoweredByAkash.\\n\\n### Work with Akash\\n\\nWe are continuing to expand the Akash team. In July, we welcomed eight new hires with two roles remaining to be filled \u2013 continuing toward the goal of expanding our team by 20%.\\n\\nAkash is still searching for two priority roles. If you, or someone you know, are interested in making the jump into web3 \u2013 please feel free to take a look at the open roles below:\\n\\n*   [Sr. Software Engineer](https://jobs.lever.co/AkashNetwork/ffb7576e-b9c4-450b-993e-226565dc236d)\\n    \\n*   [VP of Marketing](https://jobs.lever.co/AkashNetwork/02a876a8-8732-4e8c-a638-f696aeac027c)\\n    \\n\\nLooking Forward\\n---------------\\n\\n### GPU Marketplace\\n\\n[Messari\u2019s research article](https://messari.io/article/akash-solving-web3-s-centralization-problems) highlights Akash as a viable option for Ethereum miners to rent their GPUs in the future, post-merge. Akash aims to have that functionality ready by the time The Merge happens.\\n\\nOnce unlocked, GPU support on Akash will not only open the door for the next generation of Web3 games but will unlock unprecedented Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) capabilities. This means that everyone will be able to run even more complex workloads without the fear of being de-platformed or censored.\\n\\nAs the world becomes digitized, we will see GPUs integrated into more aspects of our lives. Not just in computers but phones, gaming consoles, and yes, even Teslas. As Ethereum prepares to complete The Merge \u2013 more GPUs will hit the market as demand decreases post-merge.\\n\\n### IP Leases Functionality &amp; Release Progress\\n\\nIP leases allow Akash tenants to request static and publicly recognizable IP addresses for the applications and services they deploy.\\n\\nProviders typically control a pool of IP addresses, of which many are unused. Akash\u2019s IP Lease service allows providers to lease these unused IP addresses to users, which benefits the user\u2019s application and allows the provider to monetize their unused IP addresses.\\n\\nThe addition of IP leases gives users on Akash Network access to a service typically reserved for users of large cloud providers.\\n\\nIP Leases on Akash are currently live and deployed on a testnet, and we are working to get this service live as soon as possible.\\n\\nQ&amp;A Highlights\\n--------------\\n\\n### Q: Do you plan to implement a system where people can buy AKT with their credit card for deployments so that there is no need to go to an exchange?\\n\\n> \\&quot;Yes, we plan to offer credit card payments at some point in the future. We are investigating options and defining the work that would allow for the leasing of resources directly via credit cards, instead of having to purchase AKT.\\&quot;\\n> \\n> Anil Murty, Head of Product, Overclock Labs (Creator of Akash Network)\\n\\n### Q: What is the difference between Akash Network, Filecoin, and Arweave?\\n\\nThese are very different services, although the offerings may sound similar.\\n\\nFilecoin and Arweave offer data storage, which means that a user can store and retrieve static data without the expectation of running an application.\\n\\nAkash Network is a cloud computing service. This means that Akash allows developers to run applications in the cloud. As with any cloud computing service, the expectation is that once a user is finished running the application \u2013 the storage goes away. Even with persistent storage, data is maintained across different restarts but not permanently stored.\\n\\nCloud computing services like Akash Network and storage solutions like Filecoin and Arweave are complimentary. A developer would need to use both service types to create a fully decentralized web application.\\n\\n### Q: Will we see Greg and Lex on an Elden Ring livestream?\\n\\nPotentially! Stay tuned.\\n\\nConnect with Akash\\n------------------\\n\\nWe invite you to dive deeper into the original audio on our YouTube Channel.\\n\\n[_**Follow Akash Network (@akashnet\\\\_) on Twitter**_](https://twitter.com/akashnet_) _to stay up to date with Akash Network, AKT, and the Akash Community._\\n\\n[_**Join our Discord**_](https://discord.com/invite/DxftX67) _to get involved with our community._\\n\\n_**Are you an Akash super user?**_ _Consider joining our_ [_Akash Insiders community_](https://akash.network/community?form=true#insiders) _to get access to the leading edge of the Akash ecosystem, and be among the first to see and test new features before anyone else._&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly with Greg Osuri: July 27, 2022&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly is our weekly community call hosted on Twitter Spaces. Each week, we cover the latest news and updates from Akash Network with our CEO, Greg Osuri.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2022-07-29T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;],[0,&quot;News&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Zach Horn&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.CbHpIwUE.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,660],&quot;height&quot;:[0,480],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-july-27-2022/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-july-20-2022/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-july-20-2022&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\nAkash Weekly is a regular effort hosted via Twitter Spaces to update our community about the ins and outs of Akash Network\u2019s developments. [Follow us on Twitter](https://twitter.com/akashnet_) to be notified when Akash Weekly's are live.\\n\\nOn this Spaces: CEO of Overclock Labs, Greg Osuri, and Alani Kuye, Program Manager of Overclock Labs speak with Akash Providers to discuss general ecosystem updates, and share some of our providers\u2019 experiences using Akash Network.\\n\\n### **Akash Ecosystem Updates**\\n\\n#### **Recent Ecosystem Additions**\\n\\n- **AlterDapp recently joined as a contributor and cloud provider on Akash.** AlterDapp also runs Altermail, a privacy-optimized messaging service that is now powered by Akash.&nbsp;Learn more about them, [here](https://altermail.live/).\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1658528315-unnamed-1.png)\\n\\n- **Thirdweb is considered to be one of the best dApp development frameworks.** Akash is happy to see them enjoying deploying on Akash.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1658528360-unnamed-2.png)\\n\\n- **Blockless Protoco**l is a protocol that was started up by a former developer of Akash. He embraced Akash\u2019s vision from day one and made a native integration to stay decentralized.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1658528393-unnamed-3.png)\\n\\n- **Praetor App launched its Akash Providers' map.** Praetor launched a new feature that allows users of the Praetor app to check the provider dashboard, and discover providers on a map of the entire world that uses Akash. Praetor App is now called Akash Provider Console. Currently, Akash has 50 providers across the globe. Click [here](https://console.akash.network/providers) to see for yourself.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1658528480-unnamed-4.png)\\n\\n- **Cosmo club** conducted a great thorough dive into Akash. They discuss Akash, the market, and the issue they are trying to solve. They are doing excellent work in educating people about Cosmos.\\n\\nBelow is a quick outline of topics discussed, we invite you to dive deeper into the original recap here on our YouTube Channel.\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly with Greg Osuri: July 20, 2022&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly is a regular effort hosted via Twitter Spaces to update our community about the ins and outs of Akash Network\u2019s developments. Follow us on Twitter to be notified when Akash Weekly's are live.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2022-07-22T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;],[0,&quot;News&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Joe Deng&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.q2uWXQkH.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,660],&quot;height&quot;:[0,480],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-july-20-2022/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-july-13-2022/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-july-13-2022&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\nAkash Weekly is a regular effort hosted via Twitter Spaces to update our community about the ins and outs of Akash Network\u2019s developments. [Follow us on Twitter](https://twitter.com/akashnet_) to be notified when Akash Weekly's are live.\\n\\nOn this Spaces: CEO of Overclock Labs, Greg Osuri and Rebecca Liao, the Co-founder and CEO of Saga get together to go over the partnership between Saga and Akash, Ecosystem and AKT updates.\\n\\n#### **Saga Introduction**\\n\\nSaga is a protocol that allows developers to take a single-tenant VM and automatically launch it on a dedicated blockchain, complete with fully provisioned validators and an optimally incentivized security structure.\\n\\n#### **Akash Ecosystem Updates**&nbsp;\\n\\nAnother week, another all-time high of usage on Akash \ud83d\udd25.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1657930634-unnamed-2.png)\\n\\n- The increased demand is attributed to our ongoing partnership with Chia. Read more about the Akash X Chia partnership, [here](https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/akash-network-adds-support-for-chia-network-301462805.html).\\n- Greater demand signals increasing utility being discovered.\\n\\n### Provider Updates\\n\\n- Praetor App's success with onboarding new providers results in Akash's highest active provider counts to date.\\n- There are now _**44 active providers**_ on Akash with a high fill rate, which means they are profitable and encouraging more providers to join our network.\\n\\n### Inter-chain Accounts are Ready\\n\\n- ICA opens up new interoperability options within the Cosmos ecosystem. Read more about that, [here](https://blog.cosmos.network/interchain-accounts-take-cosmos-interoperability-to-the-next-level-39c9a8aad4ad).\\n- Usecase Example: Juno DAO can spin up Akash services and pay for them using native JUNO tokens.\\n- Usecase Example: Secret Network can offer ownerless deployments where you won\u2019t necessarily need to disclose who the owner is when Akash is being used with Secret.\\n\\n### Powered By Akash is on the Rise\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1657908793-unnamed-1.png)\\n\\n#### **Guest Highlight: Saga**\\n\\nSaga is a Cosmos SDK-based chain that is deploying application blockchains as a service. Using interchain security, Saga gives developers all the benefits of having their own block space without having to set up their own network of validators themselves. The whole process can be done as easily as deploying a smart contract.\\n\\n- Option to automatically set up their own dedicated chains.\\n- Gas fees can be set by the developers and are predictable because the users are not sharing block space with a bunch of other applications that they have no control over.\\n\\n### **Synergies for Akash and Saga**\\n\\nSaga is a shared state chain that enables rapid startup of new chains. In terms of being able to supply the processing capacity to power the chain. Greg believes Akash really helps in terms of being able to provide the computation to power the chain. Users will no longer be required to have a separate account and will not need to go out of their existing community in order to buy AKT to use computing on the Akash Network.\\n\\nSaga wants its validators to have automatic access to the computing power that Akash can provide. The composability and inter-chain accounts also open a big opportunity for future collaborations.\\n\\nBelow is a quick outline of topics discussed, we invite you to dive deeper into the original recap here on our YouTube Channel.\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly with Greg Osuri: July 13, 2022&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly is a regular effort hosted via Twitter Spaces to update our community about the ins and outs of Akash Network\u2019s developments. Follow us on Twitter to be notified when Akash Weekly's are live.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2022-07-15T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;],[0,&quot;News&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Joe Deng&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.CGVVr27_.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,660],&quot;height&quot;:[0,480],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-july-13-2022/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-july-6-2022/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-july-6-2022&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\nAkash Weekly Spaces is a regular effort hosted via Twitter Spaces to update our community about the ins and outs of Akash Network\u2019s developments. [Follow us on Twitter](https://twitter.com/akashnet_) to be notified when Akash Weekly\u2019s are live.\\n\\nOn this Spaces: CEO of Overclock Labs, Greg Osuri, and Anil Murty, the Head of Product at Overclock Labs go over ecosystem updates, product updates, and the Akash adoption plan, phase by phase.\\n\\n### **Introduction**&nbsp;\\n\\n[Anil Murty](https://www.linkedin.com/in/anilmurty/) is our new Head of Product at Overclock Labs. He is an Engineer turned Product Manager who has a passion for building products that serve deeply-technical users. He's worked on products, ranging from consumer hardware, enterprise hardware, software, SaaS, and most recently cloud-native developer and observability tooling.\\n\\nPrior to Akash, Anil worked on cloud-native products at Hashicorp where he was involved with building products for people that are monitoring their services running on the cloud; relevant experience that will help bring Akash forward.\\n\\n### **Ecosystem Updates**\\n\\nAkash hits a new record with adoption, seeing an all-time high in resource utilization and AKT expenditure \ud83d\ude80\ud83d\ude80\ud83d\ude80.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1657299165-unnamed-1.png)\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1657299233-unnamed-2.png)\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1657299286-unnamed-3.png)\\n\\nWe attribute this uptick to our partnership with the Chia Project, a new blockchain and smart transaction platform, as well as the $0.10 plots on Akash, currently offered as a part of our Summer Sale. This is a steal compared to the $0.40 plots often found using traditional cloud services.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1657299368-unnamed-4.png)\\n\\nThe Praetor App streamlined provider deployments, and it now includes persistent storage. Persistent storage, as a newer feature on the Akash Network, is still somewhat expensive simply because there aren't enough providers who currently offer it. Praetor is continuing to come up with innovative ways that simplify persistent storage enablement on Akash and we anticipate more and more providers offering this feature in near future. To learn more about Praetor App, click [here](https://youtu.be/M6-8x4WUMjo). [Praetor is now called Akash provider console](https://provider-console.akash.network/)\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1657300118-unnamed-5.png)\\n\\n### **Proposals of Akash Community**\\n\\n- Proposal 22 seeks to fund Moultrie Audits, an infrastructure auditing development group focused on decentralized Cosmos SDK protocols. View the full proposal, [here](https://www.mintscan.io/akash/proposals/22).\\n- Proposal 23 will officially transition the Community Awards Board to the Akash Accelerator. View the full proposal, [here](https://www.mintscan.io/akash/proposals/23).\\n- Proposal 24 is a vote on funding for Akash Accelerator. View the full proposal, [here](https://www.mintscan.io/akash/proposals/24).\\n\\n### **Akash Product Updates**\\n\\n- IP Leases will go live later this month, allowing providers to provide static IPs that you can tie to your services, expanding the use cases of Akash Network.\\n- Akash is currently undergoing a major restructuring of the code that takes care of onboarding for new providers, ultimately making it easier to troubleshoot provider issues.\\n- Akash Network is looking into a sandbox environment for developers. This would be something that you can integrate and test with Akash without having to deploy or spend any AKT.\\n- We\u2019ve begun work on the final product plan on how to support GPUs on Akash Network over the next few months.\\n- Akash Console (in the works) is a user interface that will be completely web-based and low-friction, making it possible for both technical and non-technical users to use Akash, thus lowering the barrier to entering the world of Web3.\\n\\n### **Adoption Plans**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1657300163-unnamed-6.png)\\n\\nAs outlined above, phase one focuses on attracting our immediate community, Cosmos users, and then Web3 communities at large. We chose to target Cosmos users initially because they already understand and are engrained in the ecosystem. This allows us to provide value to them immediately while validating our model for adoption. If you look at the [ecosystem page](http://44ft4f31u1dipf9g689u3hm7lg.ingress.provider-0.prod.ams1.akash.pub/) made by our community (thanks, Akashians!), you see top Cosmos projects within DEX, NFT, and gaming vertices like Osmosis, Strangeclan, and more, that are choosing Akash Network over Amazon.\\n\\nPhase 2 will be focused on data-intensive applications because, in general, it's extremely expensive to run GPUs on the cloud. Sourcing the underutilized GPUs, once the Ethereum merge happens, is going to be a major milestone and proof point as a unique value proposition that Akash can provide to the world.\\n\\nPhase 3, once we solve for cost, we plan to move to the performance. We plan to enhance performance by expanding our network reach from the 35 providers we have now to hundreds, and then thousands over multiple regions to cover a larger footprint than the current, centralized cloud providers can do. Akash is building something fundamentally different - we are not building data centers, people with data centers come to us and at some point, Akash will be the fastest network because of this coverage.\\n\\nPhase 4 is mass adoption. Once you have the fastest performance at the lowest cost, along with product and service layers complete, we can create a very compelling argument for Web2 to make the jump over to the decentralized cloud through Akash.\\n\\nBelow is a quick outline of topics discussed, we invite you to dive deeper into the original recap here on our YouTube Channel.\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly with Greg Osuri: July 6, 2022&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly Spaces is a regular effort hosted via Twitter Spaces to update our community about the ins and outs of Akash Network\u2019s developments. Follow us on Twitter to be notified when Akash Weekly\u2019s are live.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2022-07-08T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Insights&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Insights&quot;],[0,&quot;News&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Joe Deng&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.DkMhNeT5.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,660],&quot;height&quot;:[0,480],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-weekly-with-greg-osuri-july-6-2022/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-weekly-spaces-jun-29-2022/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-weekly-spaces-jun-29-2022&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\nAkash Weekly Spaces is a regular effort hosted via Twitter Spaces to update our community about the ins and outs of Akash Network\u2019s developments. Follow us [on Twitter](https://twitter.com/akashnet_) to be notified when Akash Weekly Spaces are live.\\n\\nOn this Spaces: CEO of Overclock Labs, Greg Osuri &amp; Jigar Patel, Founder of Praetor App get together to go over Akash Ecosystem updates and the story of Akash Accelerator alum, Praetor's success so far, and its vital role within Web3.\\n\\n### Praetor Introduction\\n\\nPraetor App is a Web3 and blockchain application development group focused on decentralized applications that further the evolution of the internet. They reduced the onboarding experience on Akash by 83%, so a person can become a provider/host in 20 minutes or less.\\n\\n### Akash Ecosystem Updates\\n\\n#### Akash Usage &amp; Adoption\\n\\n- [Paloma](https://www.palomachain.com/blog/paloma-weekly-wings-june-26-2022/), a new Cosmos SDK-based messenger chain that has 7% of its validators running on Akash.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1656696411-screen-shot-2022-07-01-at-9-28-05-am.png)\\n\\n- Validators such as [Vixelo are frequently offering FREE assistance](https://twitter.com/0xVixello/status/1541428927570186245?s=20&amp;t=_QB8k29Obfn_AltQIHZpiQ) to anyone willing to migrate to Akash. Click [here](https://vixello.com/akash-network-deployment-support/) to reach out for assistance in deploying your app on Akash Network.\\n- [Strangeclan](https://marketplace.passage.io/), an action rpg is one of the first NFT-based games to be released on Akash and [announced on July 7th at 3 PM EDT, their Town 2 collection is minting](https://twitter.com/gregosuri/status/1541892979903692800?s=20&amp;t=-8PiaDoa2mdQCnLR7LnCSQ).\\n\\n#### &nbsp;Akash GPU Marketplace is Closer Than You Think\\n\\n- Messari Crypto wrote about how Akash is a viable option for ETH miners post-merge. Click [here](https://messari.io/article/what-will-ethereum-miners-do-after-the-merge) to read the full article.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1656696464-screen-shot-2022-07-01-at-9-39-50-am.png)\\n\\n- Greg gives an update that the GPU marketplace will have a demo soon.\\n- Akash GPU prices would be 20 to 50% less than current market prices.\\n\\n#### Importance of Decentralized Infrastructure\\n\\n- [The recent Cloudflare outage](https://techcrunch.com/2022/06/20/cloudflare-outage-knocks-popular-services-offline/) demonstrated how dependent some decentralized dapps and blockchains were and that this needs to change immediately.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1656696536-screen-shot-2022-07-01-at-9-42-31-am.png)\\n\\n- Over 50% of Eth nodes are hosted on centralized servers. There means, there is a huge opportunity to migrate these to become more decentralized, especially given the amount of miner value there is to be extracted from the price differences between Akash and middleman cloud providers.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1656696555-screen-shot-2022-07-01-at-10-10-24-am.png)\\n\\n#### Solana Mobile Phone Possibilities\\n\\n- Gregs shares his thoughts and gives use-cases where Solana, an Akash partner, going into mobile phones could have great opportunities for everyone in the ecosystem.\\n- Example use-case include lightweight processing on the mobile phone and heavyweight processing on Akash\u2019s network in the cloud, running on the Helium Network.\\n\\n#### Thoughts on the Current Market\\n\\n- This time, the focus will be on user experience, growth, and people utilizing actual products.\\n- Bullish on Cosmos: we\u2019re optimistic about the sovereign model that Cosmos provides, which allows you to provide the kind of user experience that growth stage networks or organizations want. Akash is poised well to take advantage of the potential growth of Cosmos as more dapps and orgs scale to their own chains.\\n\\n#### Akash is Currently Hiring\\n\\nWe are looking to expand our team by 20% by the end of the year. With seven positions open in Engineering, Marketing, and Developer Relations, we are seeking a variety of talent to join our team.\\n\\nClick [here](https://akash.network/careers) to view all open positions and apply.\\n\\n### Guest Highlight: Praetor App\\n\\nPraetor started as a cloud provider on Akash and went on to build a Praetor App that offered a streamlined mechanism to get started as an Akash Provider.\\n\\nThey have improved the Akash provider onboarding experience by reducing onboarding time by over 83%. This means you can become an Akash provider/host in 20 minutes or less. This reduces the barrier to entry for individuals and entities looking to join the Web3 revolution.\\n\\nIn addition to the Praetor Provider build app, the team has created great tools for viewing current Akash Providers and a Provider revenue calculator.\\n\\nTo read the full case study, on \\&quot;_How to Become an Akash provider in 20 Minutes of Less_,\\&quot; click [here](https://akash.network/blog/how-to-become-an-akash-provider-in-20-minutes-or-less). To see a recap of our AMA with Praetor, click [here](https://forum.akash.network/t/ama-session-akash-network-with-praetor-app/4610).\\n\\nWe invite you to dive deeper into the recap audio on our YouTube Channel below.\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly with Greg Osuri: Jun 29, 2022&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Weekly Spaces is a regular effort hosted via Twitter Spaces to update our community about the ins and outs of Akash Network\u2019s developments. Follow us on Twitter to be notified when Akash Weekly Spaces are live.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2022-07-01T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;],[0,&quot;News&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Joe Deng&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.DRBHDAz8.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,660],&quot;height&quot;:[0,480],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-weekly-spaces-jun-29-2022/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;from-deploying-on-akash-to-auditing-the-network/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;from-deploying-on-akash-to-auditing-the-network&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\n### Introduction\\n\\nThe Moultrie Audits team is determined to continue adding value to the Akash ecosystem, and the greater Cosmos ecosystem. They have created a tiered auditing system, are the only active community auditors, and have developed one-click auditing. This means you can set up your provider via an onboarding tool like Praetor, and get your provider audited, all without ever having to come in contact with Moultrie. This reduces the barriers to entry for individuals and entities looking to increase their security in the Web3 ecosystem.\\n\\nThe Moultrie Audits team is an infrastructure auditing development group focused on decentralized Cosmos SDK protocols.\\n\\nA blockchain-based decentralized web is shattering centralized monopolies that control information, access, money, and how networks work. Furthermore, Web3 has created new interconnected economies, new asset classes and products, including new decentralized services online. As Web3 re-democratizes the web, this will define the next era of the internet. Akash plays a key role in this process.\\n\\nAkash Network is the world's first distributed peer-to-peer marketplace for cloud compute that provides a fast, efficient, and low-cost application deployment solution. Developers leveraging Akash Network can access cloud computing at a fraction of the cost compared to centralized cloud providers like Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure.\\n\\n### The Moultrie Audits Team\\n\\nMoultrie Audits is composed of former Department of Defense (DoD) software engineers, network architects, and penetration testers. Moultrie Audits team members have achieved government compliance for 17 applications and led 7 applications into production, including 3 artificial intelligence applications used in hostile environments. The project lead, Anthony Rosa, also received a DoD award for cooperative work with the NSA on cryptocurrency.\\n\\nThe Moultrie Audits team\u2019s dive into Web3 work began in 2019 with content creation in the Tezos ecosystem,&nbsp; leading to community awards from TezosCommons. Team members then built ERC20 and BEP20 tokens for pay before exploring the application possibilities of cryptocurrency in the DoD. Hedera Hashgraph was integrated into applications and the team saw potential in Akash as a way to make government infrastructure more resilient. Not only was Akash useful for short-term, anonymous test deployments, but it could also be used as a fast-flux defense tactic, utilizing the compute power of individuals to defend against attacks on prominent infrastructure.\\n\\nThe Moultrie team was responsible for multiple deployments within the first 100 active deployments on the Akash Network. At this time, Akashlytics had not launched and the CLI and Tom Beynon\u2019s Docker deploy method were the only available options. Understanding the technical limitations of some users, and the developer-focused posture of Akash, Moultrie began making tutorials for deployment. They created poweredbyakash.com as a single place for users to view public projects on Akash, find tutorials, or download free simple code paired with guides. The tutorials are currently being updated to reflect the newer deployment methods and capabilities of the Akash ecosystem.\\n\\nNaturally, some community members needed additional support for more complex deployments, so Moultrie helped members through Telegram. This caught the eye of the Akash team members who proposed Moultrie to support the onboarding of larger clients on Akash. Thus, Project Phoenix was born, which was a 3-month event resulting in 33 sites being built and 12 projects/apps/companies actively adopting Akash. Project Phoenix was also the original point of contact for Rango Exchange, a decentralized exchange utilizing Akash.\\n\\nAfter Project Phoenix\u2019s success, and given the Moultrie team\u2019s background in infrastructure auditing, the Akash team reached back out and propositioned Moultrie to design an auditing system for providers. The Moultrie team agreed and recognized the importance of such an undertaking. Without an audited, verified system, gaining regulatory, governmental and institutional adoption would be a difficult undertaking. 6 months later, Moultrie Audits has operational three-tiered auditing and is capable of dozens of concurrent audits, scaling to meet the growing provider set thanks to ecosystem partner, Praetor.\\n\\n### Tiered Audits\\n\\nMoultrie Audits has designed and launched a three-tier auditing system (bronze, silver, gold) to allow for variance in provider capabilities, security, and financial resources. Onboarding begins through our website, email, or via Praetor. For intrusive audits which require sensitive Information, a Right-to-Audit contract is drafted and signed by the provider, data custodian, and company representative. Moultrie then tailors our audit to the provider\u2019s configuration, creates a lightweight agent for the provider to deploy on their controller, and begins trial deployments. Depending on the level of audit, these deployments undergo testing.\\n\\nMoultrie has custom task lists, Security Configuration Assessments, uptime metrics from global positions, and regulatory compliance frameworks including NIST 800-53 and PCI DSS. This also includes the ability to provide MITRE ATT&amp;CK reports. The first phase of the audit lasts 2-4 weeks before a full report is generated for the provider with all issues discovered, explanations, and remediation steps.
