The Kava Platform connects the world\u2019s largest cryptocurrencies, ecosystems, and financial applications.&nbsp;\\n\\nWe are expanding our partnership with Kava to provide distributed, censorship-resistant cloud hosting for all frontend applications of protocols launching on the Kava Ecosystem. Every Kava project will have the compute power they need as a grant of AKT.&nbsp;\\n\\n> \u201cWe\u2019re proud to be able to provide a decentralized solution for cloud compute to Kava Labs and its ecosystem. Hosting the decentralized version of the Kava App along with their analytics dashboard is one step closer to a truly decentralized Internet.\u201d\\n> \\n> Greg Osuri, CEO of Akash Network\\n\\n### Tell Me More About Kava&nbsp;\\n\\nThe Kava Platform is a Layer-1 network that combines powerful scalability and institutional-grade security to connect the world\u2019s biggest crypto assets and ecosystems. Built using a robust Go Language architecture and the Cosmos SDK, the Kava Platform is built to power a DeFi ecosystem with better safety, user experience, and performance than traditional financial products and services.&nbsp;\\n\\n> \u201cThe Kava Ecosystem is all about creating the most secure and scalable decentralized platform for DeFi. \u201cAs our preferred cloud provider, Akash Network will empower developers to bring that decentralization all the way through to the frontend of their applications.\u201d&nbsp;\\n> \\n> Scott Stuart, CEO of Kava Labs\\n\\nThe Kava Ecosystem is a suite of best-in-class DeFi services powered by the Kava Platform and connected to a global network via Kava\u2019s partners. The goal of the Kava Ecosystem is to deliver secure, meaningful scale by creating a trusted environment for mainstream users to access the value of DeFi.&nbsp;\\n\\n### Hosting, Compute and AKT&nbsp;&nbsp;\\n\\nThe partnership will initially focus on bolstering the decentralization of the current Kava Ecosystem. This includes a mirrored version of the [Kava App](https://app.kava.io/balances) frontend hosted on Akash as well as a decentralized ecosystem analytics dashboard.\\n\\nAs the next recipient of Kava\u2019s Ignition funding to further decentralize the Kava Ecosystem, we will also be providing upcoming Kava Ecosystem projects with compute credits in the form of our utility token, AKT, to support the hosting of decentralized frontends. In turn, Akash users will now have access to a new blockchain with the opportunity to deploy their projects directly to the Kava Ecosystem.\\n\\nThe long-term goal of the partnership is to implement decentralized frontend applications for every piece of the Kava Ecosystem, making it the first truly decentralized ecosystem in DeFi.\\n\\n### What\u2019s Next?&nbsp;\\n\\nWith our shared goal to evolve decentralization in a secure way, this partnership with Kava is another step in the right direction. We look forward to seeing what new projects this partnership brings and are excited to continue working with Kava on other initiatives in the spirit of advancing decentralization.&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Network Partners with Kava Labs to Provide Decentralized Hosting for the Kava Ecosystem&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Network has been selected by Kava Labs as the preferred distributed cloud hosting solution for the Kava Ecosystem. Akash began integration with Kava in September 2020, and continues to work closely with the Kava Labs team to support cross-chain DeFi applications and services.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2021-10-13T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Partners&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Partners&quot;],[0,&quot;News&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Kelsey Ruiz&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.QIR7FO3h.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,2000],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1125],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-network-partners-with-kava-labs-to-provide-decentralized-hosting-for-the-ka/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;product-roadmap-2022/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;product-roadmap-2022&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;Since the launch of Akash Network, a distributed peer-to-peer marketplace for cloud compute, we\u2019ve been hyper-focused on stability while pursuing product-market fit. We\u2019re excited to have achieved both in under six months since the launch.\\n\\nAs we continue to improve the user experience on Akash Network and navigate users' needs, we see accelerated growth in network usage and revenue. New deployments have averaged about 200 per day for several weeks, with active deployments steadily increasing, and we're proud to have crossed the 25,000 milestone in total deployments.&nbsp;\\n\\nMost recently, to make the provider/tenant relationship more seamless, we released the [Akash Provider Upgrade (v0.14)](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/releases/tag/v0.14.1-rc0) that allows end-users to troubleshoot their deployments and includes other essential features that improve provider performance.\\n\\nThe possibilities of building on Akash are endless. Our approach is to identify a community where Akash\u2019s value proposition can be communicated clearly, increase awareness, and improve user experience by building onboarding tools to gain adoption within the community.\\n\\nAt the present, we have a solid platform optimized for builders and have seen the emergence of community tools like [Akashlytics](https://akashlytics.com/) and [Deploy Tool](https://akashdeploy.hns.siasky.net) that bring in a steady set of users with a simplified graphical user interface (GUI). And, with [Akash Omnibus](https://github.com/ovrclk/cosmos-omnibus), where one can launch a scalable proof of stake (PoS) node network in just a few steps, we saw impressive growth and adoption within the Cosmos ecosystem as a whole. Additionally, community-generated content such as this [Guide to Mining PKT on Akash at Scale](https://youtu.be/GBXEzDu5JYE) takes users one step further into the power of mining on Akash.&nbsp;\\n\\nScaling this approach to broader use cases such as machine learning will impact Akash\u2019s growth exponentially.\\n\\nThis [roadmap](https://akash.network/roadmap) is how we get there.&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Product Roadmap 2022&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Since the launch of Akash Network, a distributed peer-to-peer marketplace for cloud compute, we\u2019ve been hyper-focused on stability while pursuing product-market fit. We\u2019re excited to have achieved both in under six months since the launch.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2021-10-06T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Product&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Developers&quot;],[0,&quot;News&quot;],[0,&quot;Product&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Greg Osuri&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.BIi1TQcJ.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,2000],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1125],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/product-roadmap-2022/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;supermini-update/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;supermini-update&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;We have an important announcement today, but first, I want to give a brief update on how Akash Network is progressing. We are seeing strong and consistent growth since releasing Akash\u2019s distributed peer-to-peer marketplace for cloud compute in March.&nbsp;\\n\\nNew deployments have been averaging about 200 per day for several weeks, active deployments are steadily increasing, and we crossed the 25,000 deployments milestone in just six months.&nbsp;\\n\\n[The adoption](https://akashlytics.com/) continues to grow, with developer tooling, guides, and integrations rising alongside deployments. Akash is meeting a real market demand at [a fraction of the cost](https://akashlytics.com/price-compare) of centralized cloud services.\\n\\nToday, we are at a critical phase in Akash's growth\u2014one that sometimes includes pivots to our path forward to ensure the long-term success of the network, so we are postponing the Akash Supermini. While I know many of you have been eagerly anticipating the Supermini, this is a situation where a good idea came at the wrong time.\\n\\n> People think focus means saying yes to the thing you've got to focus on. But that's not what it means at all. It means saying no to the hundred other good ideas that there are. You have to pick carefully. I'm actually as proud of the things we haven't done as the things I have done. Innovation is saying no to 1,000 things.\\n> \\n> Steve Jobs\\n\\nIn October of 2019, just before the COVID-19 pandemic put the entire world on pause, we demonstrated the flexibility of our platform by running Akash's software on a low-power ARM-based Raspberry Pi. The \u201cAkash Pi\u201d was the genesis of the Akash Supermini. Engineering teams around the world use Pis for testing, running scripts, and even acting as servers on test networks. The Pi is a versatile device, but we knew the market wanted something with high performance for running machine-learning workloads and supporting production applications.&nbsp;\\n\\nWe set out to design a miniature supercomputer for the home office, a powerful machine that you could use to offload heavy workloads and rent to others looking for high-performance compute. The Supermini's design was fit for the home office, and the spec sheet of its hardware included a powerful GPU. We believed that a GPU was critical to support machine learning. Since we needed to explore the viability of the Supermini both technically and economically, we planned to make just 300 units.\\n\\nWe intended the Supermini to be a consumer-focused appliance that would enable almost anyone to enjoy the benefits of cloud computing while maintaining data sovereignty. Excess compute from Supermini could be contributed to Akash\u2019s decentralized cloud to support the network and earn passive income in AKT. This goal is still our long-term intention, but as Akash has grown over the last couple years, we found that introducing the Supermini now would be premature for four key reasons.\\n\\n#### **The Market has Spoken**\\n\\nFirst, the market is demanding a different product, and we are responding to the massive growth in deployments on our network. We have seen impressive growth, reaching the first hundred daily application deployments in 120 days, but the next hundred in less than 30. Now we are seeing roughly a doubling of deployed applications every month. A few star applications like [Osmosis DEX](https://app.osmosis.zone/) and [Skynet](https://siasky.net/) (a decentralized S3 alternative) live on Akash\u2019s open-source decentralized cloud, and ShapeShift is considering using Akash for its decentralized autonomous organization (DAO).&nbsp;\\n\\nWe are in a crucial phase of building application reliance on Akash, particularly for workloads that have no real alternatives among centralized providers, such as data services for DAOs. We are still early in our journey, but Akash is maturing quickly, both technologically and in the diverse set of applications that require a permissionless, decentralized cloud. As reliance on Akash grows, we will be better positioned to reconsider the Supermini to take full advantage of its utility and powerful use case.\\n\\n#### **Technical Support**\\n\\nThe second reason is technical. GPU support on Akash is still under development, and this feature is necessary to make the Supermini profitable for its users. Until we roll out GPU functionality, the Supermini simply would not work as intended. In order for the Supermini to be viable, Akash needs multitenant GPU infrastructure, and we are several months away from testing and deploying that functionality. Right now, Akash supports CPUs, storage, and memory. Building out bandwidth marketplaces and working around the limitations of home bandwidth also need to be deployed before the Supermini could work properly. We strongly believe it would be better not to launch a product that would leave customers waiting for the full functionality to be unleashed.\\n\\n#### **Economic Viability**&nbsp;\\n\\nThe third reason is economic. Today Akash is focused on converting data centers into Akash providers because it's more competitive than launching home-based hardware.\\n\\nOur number one risk is competition from datacenter compute. Why would anyone choose a Supermini over a compute cluster in a data center?&nbsp;\\n\\nWe can compete on cost, but we need a critical mass of users first to make contributing compute economically viable for the Supermini.\\n\\n#### **The Revolution Will Not Be Centralized**\\n\\nThe fourth reason is more philosophical. The Supermini is intended to be a managed product, a plug-and-play appliance. Our team would have directly managed firmware development and update deployment so that the Supermini owners would not need technical expertise. But as a result, releasing Supermini now would potentially introduce too much centralization to the network, which is against our ethos at Akash. Once Akash is more fully built out, the risks posed by a centrally managed appliance like the Supermini will be diminished, but we are not there yet.\\n\\n#### **What's Next?**&nbsp;\\n\\nFor those of you who preordered a Supermini, we want to make sure that you are properly compensated for your enthusiasm and trust in our vision. We recognize that your deposit came with an opportunity cost that went beyond just the hundred dollars you spent, so for each Supermini unit reserved, you will be refunded in full plus an additional 100 AKT. We hope that this refund will do more than just give you back your money. We hope that it will demonstrate our commitment to Akash\u2019s bright future. You will be receiving an email to the address that was used to place your order with reimbursement details and instructions on claiming your AKT.\\n\\n#### **Onward and Upward**\\n\\nAs I mentioned at the beginning, Akash is gaining momentum, and we will continue capitalizing on that. Later down the road, we can revisit the idea of the Supermini. It is still a good idea for the right time. But for now, we will be pouring our energy into making sure that Akash fulfills its promise of a decentralized cloud ecosystem that is permissionless and censorship-resistant\u2014delivering data sovereignty to all.&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Supermini Update&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;We have an important announcement today, but first, I want to give a brief update on how Akash Network is progressing. We are seeing strong and consistent growth since releasing Akash\u2019s distributed peer-to-peer marketplace for cloud compute in March.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2021-10-06T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Greg Osuri&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.RGeA5NVa.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,2000],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1125],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/supermini-update/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;governance-101/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;governance-101&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;Blockchain technology is one of the most important innovations of our time. Although it has been around since the early 1990s, it isn't until now that many of us are seeing its real potential.&nbsp;\\n\\nBlockchain tech has been growing exponentially year after year and thanks to new developments, such as blockchain governance, we are going to see this technology change our world as we know it.\\n\\n### **Solving Real-World Problems**\\n\\nRight now, most people believe that blockchains are only about cryptocurrencies, NFT collectibles and public ledgers, but the reality is that this technology is capable of solving real life problems, such as health record management, identification management, supply chain, HR tools and a whole lot more.\\n\\nOne of the most important benefits of blockchain tech is its use as a governance tool or system. Blockchain governance can basically give any organization, any government, any business or any community, the tools and the fundamentals to become a transparent and true democracy.\\n\\nThroughout history, there have been many problems with different types of governments, companies and groups. Ambition, avarice and corruption, are only a few of the problems that can be solved by applying a blockchain governance system to an organization.&nbsp;\\n\\nThis technology basically allows all citizens, all stockholders or all members of a group, to cast their votes, to know exactly how many votes have been cast, and to propose new ideas or plans.\\n\\n### **How Does Blockchain Governance Work?**\\n\\nAs of today, we have two different types of blockchains, Proof of Work (PoW) and Proof of Stake (PoS).&nbsp;\\n\\nIn PoW blockchains, miners or nodes, are basically competing against each other, to try and solve a cryptographic puzzle before the others do. The miner or the node that deciphers that puzzle first will be awarded a specific amount of tokens.&nbsp;\\n\\nIn these types of blockchains, there is no blockchain governance and these are mostly used for financial or for speculation purposes.&nbsp;\\n\\nIn PoS blockchains, there are no miners.&nbsp; Instead, these blockchains have validator nodes, which work towards making sure that blockchain transactions are passed correctly.&nbsp;\\n\\nThese types of blockchains, require tokens to be held or staked within their ecosystems and this is how validators are able to prove each transaction.&nbsp;\\n\\nThere are different types of rewards for PoS blockchain validators and for the members who stake or delegate their tokens with them, but the people that do have their coins or tokens held within the blockchain, get to participate in the governance aspect of the ecosystem.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\\n\\nAs it was mentioned before, any person who is part of a group, could be more involved in the decision-making process of any organization and thus, change the path that their group will take, as well as its results.&nbsp;\\n\\nBesides making the entire process extremely transparent, blockchain governance also helps to eliminate many of the problems that can come from immoral members of a group and in the end, this increases the probabilities of the group achieving their goals.&nbsp;\\n\\nInstead of using tokens or coins from a blockchain as currency or as collectibles, these can become a company stock or a share, a government ID, a membership card or something that identifies each individual of a group.&nbsp;\\n\\nJust as most of us use our government IDs to vote in our country\u2019s elections, these governance tokens give us the right to vote on any proposal or decision that needs to be made within our groups.\\n\\nNot only does this technology make the results of an election or proposal truly transparent, but it also solves other problems, like not needing to spend time and resources on counting votes, as the blockchain will take care of this almost instantly; it can also solve the problem of not enough members casting their votes, as this technology allows us to vote from our mobile devices or from our computers, without having to rely on transportation, without having to spend time waiting in lines and without having to do much effort at all.&nbsp;\\n\\nMaking it as easy as possible for all members of a group to cast their votes and allowing them to make their opinions and their values truly count, turns the process and the group into a real democracy.&nbsp;\\n\\nThis is without a doubt, one of the best methods for making each one of us, as equal and as important, as any of the other members of our groups.&nbsp;\\n\\nIn a few words, blockchain governance is the new democratic process or system, which simplifies voting and helps any group to achieve its goals.\\n\\n### **How Can I Participate in Blockchain Governance?**\\n\\nBeing part of blockchain governance is extremely easy.&nbsp; You only need to find a project or an organization that uses a PoS blockchain system, acquire some of its tokens and keep them in your wallet or delegate some of those tokens to a validator.\\n\\nEach project will have its own rules, its own rewards and its own processes, but by simply holding your tokens, you will have the right to cast your vote on proposals and to form part of the governance aspect of that project.&nbsp;\\n\\nEvery blockchain has some type of wallet or software that allows you to hold and store your tokens. Most of these wallets will have an option for you to participate in the blockchain governance and it is as easy as reading through the proposals, deciding how you want to cast your vote and finally pressing a button.&nbsp;\\n\\nAfter you have gone through the process once, you will have no problem doing it over and over again.&nbsp;  \\n\\n### **Will We See This Technology Impact Our World Soon?**\\n\\nBlockchain governance is already being used by different organizations and projects. The results that most of these are having, have exceeded expectations and they are proof that this technology is here to stay.&nbsp;&nbsp;\\n\\nIt will not be long before more governments and more organizations start using this system to bring transparency and democracy to their road maps and to their goals.&nbsp;\\n\\nIt is extremely likely that most democratic governments will start using this technology within the next decade. It is also very likely that this technology will be a requirement for many organizations and for many groups within the next five years.&nbsp;\\n\\nIf you are still not part of blockchain governance, you will most likely have to be very soon.&nbsp;\\n\\nAlthough it may seem a little scary or a little difficult to understand at first, the reality is that it is very simple and that it is one of the most important use cases for blockchains, as well as one of the most important technologies that we will ever have.&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Governance 101 &quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Blockchain technology is one of the most important innovations of our time. Although it has been around since the early 1990s, it isn't until now that many of us are seeing its real potential.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2021-09-21T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Insights&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Insights&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Rodri-R&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.8sxza7L_.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,2000],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1125],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/governance-101/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;end-of-summer-update/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;end-of-summer-update&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;Following our mainnet 2 launch in March, this past summer was the first that we had a live, working product. Having a tangible product presented a whole new set of opportunities as well as learnings.&nbsp;\\n\\nFor the first time, developers were able to use and play with our software to deploy and host applications on Akash Network\u2019s open-source, distributed peer-to-peer marketplace for cloud compute. As such, two of our main goals have been to drive growth and adoption of Akash Network, while supporting the evolution and architecture of the decentralized web (dWeb).\\n\\nThrough key partnerships, new listings, our global community, bounties, and new product features, we\u2019ve seen the number of active deployments [more than triple](https://akashlytics.com/) from 150 to 465 and a rapid increase in Akash Token (AKT) spend; positioning Akash to best support the future of the Internet.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1631052654-screen-shot-2021-09-03-at-8-21-37-am.png)\\n\\n**Partnerships**&nbsp;\\n-----------------\\n\\nIn May, just after the launch of our platform, [we were selected to support the Helium Network](https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/akash-network-provides-decentralized-cloud-to-the-largest-internet-of-things-iot-network-helium-301300571.html), the largest peer-to-peer wireless internet-of-things (IoT) network by providing decentralized cloud compute for their new blockchain validators.&nbsp;\\n\\nLast month, through an [integration with Skynet](https://akash.network/blog/akash-network-and-skynet-labs-provide-a-full-stack-for-the-unstoppable-web) and [a key partnership with Filebase](https://akash.network/blog/akash-and-filebase-replace-s3-with-multi-cloud-dweb-providers), we took major leaps forward when it comes to supporting the development of dWeb, making it easier for developers to build and host decentralized apps. By bringing together compute and storage layers, developers can now host their applications on a fully decentralized cloud.\\n\\n> \\&quot;The Filebase API is S3 compatible, which allows developers to seamlessly leverage multiple decentralized storage networks for the first time. We're excited to pair our S3 compatible access layer to decentralized storage networks, with the power and flexibility of Akash Network. We can't wait to see what our ecosystem builds through the pairing of dWeb compute and multi-cloud storage as one.\\&quot;\\n\\n> Joshua Noble, CEO, and Co-founder of Filebase\\n\\nMore recently, we began working with mining communities such as [pkt.cash](https://pkt.cash/), the world\u2019s first bandwidth-hard blockchain. Mining cryptocurrency on the cloud is much easier than building your own hardware. Cloud hosting usually comes at a higher cost and requires contracts, and service providers can charge extra fees for bandwidth usage. Making things more difficult, some cloud providers are shutting off mining operations at will. Crypto-mining projects like PKT, are looking for better cloud providers and now they can run on Akash Network.\\n\\nCheck out the video below to see this in action.&nbsp;\\n\\n**Listings**&nbsp;\\n-------------\\n\\nAKT is now on a total of 8 exchanges. This past quarter we announced listings on [BHEX](https://support.hbtc.co/hc/en-us/articles/900006734366-AKT-Akash-Network-) and [Bittrex Global](https://bittrex.com/home/markets) and are seeing an influx of decentralized exchanges (DEX) appear on the market that allows for fewer regulatory restrictions, lower transactions fees, and higher incentives.&nbsp;\\n\\n#### **Decentralized Exchanges**\\n\\nOur first DEX listing was [Osmosis](https://app.osmosis.zone/pools), an automated market maker (AMM) protocol built for liquidity providers, allowing users to earn rewards for providing liquidity. Users are now able to pair the Cosmos native coin, atom (ATOM), one of the most widely available tokens in the world, to AKT, significantly increasing access to our native token. This enables ATOM holders with the ability to swap their ATOM for AKT, increasing the incentives to buy and hold AKT by incentivizing liquidity pools with OSMO tokens for offering their AKT to the pool.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1631052881-osmosisliquidity.png)\\n\\nHosted on Akash, Osmosis was a huge success with over $100-million in Total Locked Value in its first month.\\n\\n> \u201cWe\u2019re excited to have Akash Network be one of the first launch partners of Osmosis. Akash Network enables a new generation of resilient, decentralized Internet infrastructure to be built, and Osmosis provides a gateway for anyone to take part in this decentralized economy. For Osmosis to be a truly decentralized exchange, we need to be built on a decentralized infrastructure. Osmosis will be a proud user of Akash infrastructure to host our applications and API-serving nodes.\u201d\\n\\n> Sunny Aggarwal, Co-founder of Osmosis\\n\\nAnnounced earlier this month, AKT is now supported on a second decentralized exchange, [Emeris, a portal to cross-chain DeFi](https://app.emeris.com/pools). As one of the first tokens available on Emeris, users can now swap, transfer, pool and manage AKT across multiple chains. Emeris saw four million in Total Locked Value in less than a week.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1631053001-emeris.png)\\n\\nAKT Liquidity on Cosmos cross-chain DEXs\u2019 has increased significantly in the past couple of months and, this is just the beginning.&nbsp;\\n\\n**Community**\\n-------------\\n\\nOur community is growing fast with over 80,000 members distributed all over the world. From the United States to Russia, China and Korea, we\u2019d like to thank everyone who has supported us along the way.&nbsp;\\n\\n#### **The Akash Community Forum**\\n\\nThe [Akash Community Forum](https://forum.akash.network/) is our version of Stack Overflow. It's designed to help developers receive community support and share their technical expertise. Since our relaunch of the Forum, growth in membership has been incredible. We now have topics of conversation including validators, providers, miners, hackathons, bounties, and are seeing our community members interacting with one another and answering each other\u2019s questions.&nbsp;\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1631053186-screen-shot-2021-09-03-at-9-07-07-am.png)\\n\\nIf you have been looking to find or provide community support check out the Akash Community Forum [here](https://forum.akash.network/).&nbsp;\\n\\n#### **Akash is Global**&nbsp;\\n\\nWe've launched a few new global channels where our Chinese and Russian-speaking community members can connect with each other to receive updates about Akash.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1631053221-dsc2944.png)\\n\\nTo connect with our Chinese community, check out [Bihu Coinbar](https://akt.bihu.com/), [Weibo](https://weibo.com/akashchina) and [QQ Group](https://qm.qq.com/cgi-bin/qm/qr?k=xD-wcitwEnl3LkI0yah6FXWf5t13xuVw&amp;authKey=3Vu/z8JcpblJ7UirpWEUyhyuCMn9zEiro9exgNkPDFQ30bjyEw0uVodTO6MLhW0R&amp;noverify=0). To connect with our Russian community members, check out our [Twitter](https://twitter.com/akash_ru) and [VK](https://vk.com/akash_ru).\\n\\n#### **Akash Insiders**\\n\\nWe've been busy onboarding a leadership community of 24 (and growing) developers, event organizers and creators to provide support and develop educational content for customers, developers, providers, and partners. The goal of the Insiders program is to support Akash advocates and provide opportunities for personal and professional growth. If you\u2019re interested in participating, [apply today](https://akash.network/community#insiders).\\n\\n#### **Developer Grants Program**\\n\\nTo drive the development of open-source projects and support the evolution of the dWeb, we launched the [Developer Grant Program](https://forum.akash.network/t/new-developer-grants-program-community-awards-board/541), a community-driven source of funding for promising developers and teams.&nbsp;\\n\\nOffering grants up to $100,000 in AKT, the Grant Program has already awarded over 100 developers in our first batch.\\n\\n**Hackathons, Challenges and Bounties** &nbsp;\\n-----------------------------------------\\n\\n#### **Solana Season Hackathon**&nbsp;\\n\\nTo progress our integration with Solana, we joined the [Solana Season Hackathon](https://solana.com/solanaszn), and presented a total of 4 challenges with a $15,000 AKT prize pot.&nbsp;\\n\\nIn first place, with a $10,000 prize (2,500 AKT) was the [Akash Deploy UI](https://github.com/tombeynon/akash-deploy) created by Tom Beynon and submitted by newsystem090 with a key improvement, Keplr wallet integration.&nbsp;\\n\\n> \u201cThe Akash Deploy UI makes it easier to manage multiple deployments on Akash in one place, your web browser.\u201d\\n> \\n> Tom Beynon\\n\\nClick [here](https://akash.network/blog/winners-of-the-akash-solana-hackathon) to see all of the great project submissions.&nbsp;\\n\\n#### **Sovrython, Powered by Gitcoin**&nbsp;\\n\\nThe Sovrython was a 6-week long hackathon that invited developers from all chains to collaborate on decentralization/privacy, data science, integrations, and finance with a shared goal to accelerate the future of DeFi.\\n\\nWe committed $100,000 in $AKT to the winners of our three challenges which asked developers to:\\n\\n1.  Securely deploy the Sovryn node using Akash Network&nbsp;\\n    \\n2.  Design an easy-to-use UI to help developers deploy any app on Akash\\n    \\n3.  Build an app that leverages decentralized storage such as Skynet and run it on Akash\\n    \\n\\n&nbsp;From a decentralized container registry to an app that allows influencers to easily gift NFTs to their fans, we saw a lot of great projects. Click [here](https://forum.akash.network/t/everyone-s-a-winner-in-the-sovrynthon-hackathon/734) to see all submissions.&nbsp;\\n\\n#### **Skynet**&nbsp;\\n\\nFollowing our integration with Skynet Labs to provide the first full-stack dWeb solution to handle backup, restore, and migration, we hosted a challenge, offering $10,000 to the developer or team that builds the best app that integrates Skynet and Akash.&nbsp;\\n\\nOur first-place winner was SkyChat, a decentralized version of Discord. SkyChat uses MySky to let users login in a permissionless and decentralized way. With MySky, every user fully owns their key pair, which is the root of their decentralized identity.&nbsp;\\n\\nTo read more about how SkyChat works click [here](https://forum.akash.network/t/skychat-decentralized-alternative-to-discord-powered-by-skynet-and-akash/732/6).&nbsp;\\n\\n#### **Filebase**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1631053395-filebase-hackathon-banner.png)\\n\\nLaunched just last week, we are currently running a Filebase challenge. With $10,000 in $AKT and $250 in free object storage, we\u2019re challenging our community to build the best app that integrates Filebase and Akash.&nbsp;\\n\\nClick [here](https://forum.akash.network/t/the-filebase-akash-hackathon/2332) if you\u2019d like to get involved.&nbsp;\\n\\n**Product**&nbsp;\\n------------\\n\\nOur core dev team has been hyper-focused on stabilizing the provider services and improving the deployment experience. Taking feedback from our users and working directly with the community, the core dev team made a few big feature updates, some small bug fixes, and launched developer tooling that allows non-technical users to deploy in 2 minutes or less.&nbsp;\\n\\n#### **Feature Updates**\\n\\n*   **Update #1231:** Enables Akash Network to support Apple\u2019s M1. See more, [here](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/pull/1231).&nbsp;\\n    \\n*   **Update #1232:** Provides prometheus metrics to the provider so they can get insights into how their Kubernetes cluster is running. See more, [here](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/pull/1232).&nbsp;\\n    \\n*   **Update #1251:** Allows hostname dash and SDL which allows people to use hyphens in their domains - something our community is very excited about! See more, [here](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/pull/1251).&nbsp;\\n    \\n*   **Update #1265**: Eliminates resource leaks causing out of memory. See more, [here](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/pull/1265).\\n    \\n\\n#### **Developer Tooling**\\n\\nLaunched by one of our developer partners, Maxime, the [Akashlytics Deploy tool](https://akashlytics.com/deploy) is a desktop app for Windows and Mac with an easy-to-use GUI for defining and deploying apps on Akash. Non-technical users are now deploying apps like WordPress and Minecraft on Akash in roughly 2 minutes.\\n\\n#### **Coming Soon**\\n\\nThe Faucet App -- think AWS credits. A project led by our Engineering lead, Derek Anderson, the Faucet app is designed to help distribute AKT and ease developer onboarding. The Faucet will distribute enough AKT for one free deployment so devs who are new to our ecosystem can try deploying on Akash.&nbsp;\\n\\nNext up is a brand new command-line interface (CLI). The new CLI, expected to launch at the end of mid-Fall, will be client-focused and project-based to help developers deploy, manage, and configure their applications.&nbsp;\\n\\n**What\u2019s Next?**\\n----------------\\n\\nAs we continue to improve the user experience on Akash Network and navigate the needs of our users, we are seeing accelerated growth in network usage and AKT spend.&nbsp;\\n\\nRecently, we\u2019ve even been running out of capacity due to the high demand, but don\u2019t worry, this is something our core dev team is continuously working on to bring more on, and as quickly as possible! As we start to see what can be considered just the beginning of product-market fit, our surge in growth validates what our CEO, Greg Osuri, and CTO, Adam Bozanich have been developing for more than five years.&nbsp;\\n\\nRespectively, [as pointed out by Ellio Trades](https://youtu.be/ejRC_1TgJFU), people are starting to realize the potential of the Cosmos ecosystem at large. Not only are we seeing the [Cosmos Market Cap](https://cosmos-cap.com/) continue to grow but earlier this year we saw the launch of Inter-Blockchain Communication (IBC) which enables blockchain protocols to communicate and transact with each other independently. Next up: cross-chain composability. According to Cointelegraph, \u201cthis would mean users with almost any decentralized holdings could easily use it as collateral to get involved with Decentralized Applications, or DApps, across all networks.\u201d&nbsp;\\n\\nAs Akash Network and the Cosmos ecosystem both continue to grow, we\u2019re primed to become the leading provider for decentralized cloud computing. With 100 percent month-over-month growth and a goal of 10,000 deployments by the end of the year, we\u2019re just getting started.&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;End of Summer Update&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Following our mainnet 2 launch in March, this past summer was the first that we had a live, working product. Having a tangible product presented a whole new set of opportunities as well as learnings.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2021-09-08T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;],[0,&quot;Product&quot;],[0,&quot;News&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Kelsey Ruiz&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.C35q_C7O.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,2000],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1125],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/end-of-summer-update/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-token-akt-supported-on-emeris-the-portal-to-cross-chain-defi/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-token-akt-supported-on-emeris-the-portal-to-cross-chain-defi&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;The Akash Token (AKT) is the utility token that powers Akash Network. It\u2019s the primary method of settlement that enables users to buy and sell compute. As [network usage increases](https://akashlytics.com/), so does the demand for AKT.\\n\\nLast month, we announced [our first DEX listing on Osmosis](https://akash.network/blog/akt-token-launches-on-osmosis-the-first-decentralized-exchange-for-cosmos). This allowed users to pair Cosmos native coin, ATOM, one of the most widely available tokens in the world, to AKT. By enabling ATOM holders with the ability to swap their ATOM for AKT, users worldwide can now enjoy access to AKT while benefiting from the incentives from the liquidity pool. Osmosis was a huge success with over $100-million in Total Locked Value in its first month.&nbsp;\\n\\nToday, we\u2019re excited to announce AKT is now supported on a second decentralized exchange, [Emeris](https://emeris.com/). A portal to cross-chain DeFi, Emeris is connected to [Gravity DEX](https://cosmos.network/gravity-dex/), the first cross-chain DeFi protocol on the Cosmos Hub.\\n\\n> \\&quot;Emeris delivers an amazing experience that abstracts incredible complexity with cross-chain DeFi \u2014 a true portal for DeFi \u2014 powered by the Gravity DEX,\\&quot; said&nbsp;Greg Osuri, CEO of Akash Network. \\&quot;The protocol makes it substantially easier and cheaper to discover and purchase AKT as well as other tokens from a wide variety of Cosmos projects that historically have been harder to access. We're proud to be one of the first available assets on the platform.\\&quot;\\n\\nWith Gravity DEX, blockchain developers can list their tokens and avoid regulatory restrictions and excessive listing fees from centralized exchanges. This makes it substantially easier to discover and purchase tokens from a wide variety of Cosmos projects that historically have been harder to access.&nbsp;\\n\\n> \\&quot;Just as Emeris intends to revolutionize DeFi with its cross-chain capabilities, Akash Network is a real disruptor of the cloud computing market. We\u2019re proud to have such an innovative project as one of our first supported chains, and to open its AKT token to a larger audience,\\&quot; said Sane Lebrun, VP of Growth at Tendermint.\\n\\n### **What Makes Gravity DEX Unique?**\\n\\nGravity DEX has three main characteristics that differentiate it from other decentralized exchanges.&nbsp;\\n\\n1.  It leverages both an Automated Market Maker (AMM) model and an orderbook system.\\n    \\n2.  Improves price consistency through the use of an Equivalent Swap Price Model (ESPM) instead of a Constant Product Market Maker (CPMM).&nbsp;\\n    \\n3.  To remove the possibility of front-running, making trading fairer, it handles orders in batches (per block) instead of serial order.\\n    \\n\\nWith Gravity DEX, users will have access to a cross-chain decentralized exchange with lower transaction fees ($0.01 - $.10). If you\u2019ve used Uniswap, you know what a massive difference that is.&nbsp;\\n\\nTwo issues users experience when swapping on Ethereum based DEX\u2019s, like Uniswap, are unsustainably high fees and slippage which causes inconsistencies in token prices. Gravity DEX solves this problem by using the ESPM instead. ESPM lands on the latest swap price which ensures that the price users see is the price they get.&nbsp;\\n\\nGravity DEX also uses batch execution to eliminate front-running and price manipulation. Instead of sequential order execution, orders in the same block are processed simultaneously and treated equally. This eliminates the possibility of front running by paying higher gas fees.&nbsp;\\n\\n### **What\u2019s to Come?**\\n\\nSome of Gravity DEX\u2019s most exciting features including Gravity bridge and Staking Derivatives are scheduled to launch later this year.&nbsp;\\n\\nBlockchain ecosystems have historically been siloed from each other. Gravity bridge will enable cross-chain transfers between the Cosmos Hub and Ethereum, unlocking an unprecedented transfer of value between the Ethereum and Cosmos ecosystems.&nbsp;\\n\\nTypically, when you stake tokens they\u2019re locked up and can\u2019t be used for other purposes. Now with Staking derivatives, users will be able to assume long or short positions on the unearned portion of block rewards using their staked tokens. [Read this for more on staking derivatives](https://github.com/cosmosdevs/atom2021).&nbsp;\\n\\nGravity Dex is one of Cosmos\u2019 flagship products and we're extremely excited for AKT to be one of the first tokens listed at its launch. Click [here](https://emeris.com/) to try Emeris and [here](https://cosmos.network/gravity-dex/) to learn more about the Gravity DEX protocol.&nbsp;\\n\\nDisclaimer: The current features available on the site are offered in \\&quot;beta\\&quot; form (\\&quot;Beta Services\\&quot;). The developer communities also benefit from the network effect; as more users and developers switch to a decentralized architecture, more contributions are made to these open-source projects.\\n\\nAs a part of this integration, [we offered $10,000 to the developer or team](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W2pVpefAtA8) that builds the best app that integrates Skynet and Akash.&nbsp;\\n\\nFrom submissions that make it easier to deploy on Akash to anonymous messages stored in a MySQL database to prank your friends, we had a ton of great submissions.&nbsp;\\n\\n### **The Runner-Ups**&nbsp;\\n\\n#### **AkashNS by figurestudios**\\n\\nAkashNS makes Node.js deployments easier for developers who may be new to Docker. Including environment variables, AkashNS allows changes to the deployment .yml file with a few different variables rather than rebuilding their own images. This makes it so that most users with a basic tech understanding will be able to utilize the Akashlytics Deployment Tool to get their app hosted on Akash.\\n\\nTo see the bot in action join [this Discord server](https://discord.com/invite/F95xQ2xKat).\\n\\nYou can see the full AkashNS project submission [here](https://forum.akash.network/t/akashns-making-node-js-deployments-easier/916).&nbsp;\\n\\n#### **Capsule by aldin**\\n\\nCapsule is a decentralized alternative to Pastebin with more features, utilizing real-time Skynet backups and decentralization with Akash as the backend for discovery. Leveraging properties of decentralization, Capsule has no single source of authority, making it secure and private. See the full submission, [here](https://forum.akash.network/t/challenge-decentralized-alternative-to-pastebin/).\\n\\n#### **Grafana Plugin by humanoid**\\n\\nA proposal to work on a data source plugin for the Grafana open-source dashboard and monitoring project.&nbsp;\\n\\nSee the full proposal [here](https://forum.akash.network/t/project-proposal-grafana-datasource-plugin/).&nbsp;\\n\\n#### **OpenRegistry by JasdeepSingh**\\n\\nHosted on Akash and powered by SkyNet, OpenRegistry is a decentralized container registry fully compliant with OCI Distribution Specification which means now you can use all the features of existing container registries on OpenRegistry.\\n\\nAs a part of the Skynet Challenge, OpenRegistry added 3 major features, fixed a few bugs, and provided both memory and storage optimizations. New features include:\\n\\n*   Concurrent image uploads\\n    \\n*   Authenticate with OpenRegistry using Docker CLI (or any other container tools like podman)\\n    \\n*   Push Container Images\\n    \\n*   Pull Container Images\\n    \\n\\nOpenRegistry is accepting users for a closed beta program at Parachute by OpenRegistry 21. Feel free to register for the beta program [here](https://parachute.openregistry.dev/).&nbsp;\\n\\nView the full project submission [here](https://forum.akash.network/t/openregistry-an-open-and-reliable-container-registry/515).&nbsp;\\n\\n#### **Skynet Akash Image Library by zJu**\\n\\nThis project shows you how to host a decentralized platform with static files stored on Skynet and the backend running on Akash Network. The Skynet Akash Image Library allows users to upload images while others either up or downvote them. If the number of votes falls below a certain value, it will be removed. Skynet Akash Image Library also has a server that temporarily stores the files and uploads them again, if necessary.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1629736631-akashmeme1.jpeg)\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1629736781-akashmeme2.jpeg)\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1629736796-akashmeme3.jpeg)\\n\\nSee the full Skynet Akash Image Library [here](https://akashost.hns.siasky.net/) and view the full submission [here](https://forum.akash.network/t/skynet-akash-image-library/857).\\n\\n#### **Secret Message by developerpiyush**\\n\\nSecret Message is a website that allows you to send and receive encrypted messages from your friends. Through Secret Message, anyone can create and send messages through a unique link that gets stored in a MySQL database with a foreign key that links to its owner. When the owner of the link logs in to see messages, they can see all the anonymous messages that they received. Hence the name, Secret Message. If you\u2019d like to try it out yourself, send your own secret message using [this link](http://j00j6ner7pdkb86le6mhhgm3ug.ingress.provider-0.prod.ams1.akash.pub/message.php?name=piyush_).&nbsp;\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1629506009-screen-shot-2021-08-20-at-4-08-21-pm.png)\\n\\nClick [here](https://forum.akash.network/t/challenge-get-secret-message-feedbacks-from-your-friend/) to see the full submission.&nbsp;\\n\\n### **Introducing the 1st Place Winner**\\n\\n#### **SkyChat by redsolver**\\n\\nSkyChat, a decentralized version of Discord, uses MySky to let users login in a permissionless and decentralized way. With MySky, every user fully owns their key pair, which is the root of their decentralized identity. You can learn more about MySky from Skynet Labs CEO, David Vorick [here](https://blog.sia.tech/mysky-your-home-on-the-global-operating-system-of-the-future-5a288f89825c).&nbsp;\\n\\nTo read more about how SkyChat works and its benefits click [here](https://forum.akash.network/t/skychat-decentralized-alternative-to-discord-powered-by-skynet-and-akash/732/6).&nbsp;\\n\\n### Congrats!\\n\\nCongrats to redsolver and everyone who participated!\\n\\nFor the submissions that did not win, we encourage you to apply for our [Developer Grant Program](https://forum.akash.network/t/new-developer-grants-program-community-awards-board/541), a community-driven source of funding and support for promising developers and teams. The purpose of the program is to expand the developer community, encourage collaboration between developers, and develop open-source projects.&nbsp;&nbsp;\\n\\nAll software developers and engineers with a GitHub account are eligible for grants ranging from $100 - $100,000 AKT.&nbsp;\\n\\n  \\nClick [here](https://forum.akash.network/t/how-to-apply-for-developer-grants/685) to learn more and apply.&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Announcing the Skynet Hackathon Winner&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;In June, we announced an integration with Skynet Labs to provide the first full-stack decentralized web (dWeb) solution to handle backup, restore, and migration.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2021-08-23T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Developers&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Developers&quot;],[0,&quot;Partners&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Kelsey Ruiz&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.DUD3GE54.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,2000],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1125],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/announcing-the-skynet-hackathon-winner/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;deploy-onto-akash-setting-up-your-keplr-wallet/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;deploy-onto-akash-setting-up-your-keplr-wallet&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\n_This post was originally published by Anthony Rosa on_ [_Medium_](https://anthonyrosa.medium.com/deploy-onto-akash-setting-up-your-keplr-wallet-aa01c7fd8420)_._\\n\\nInspired by an Akash challenge, this guide will show you how to create and set up a Keplr wallet. View the full challenge description [here](https://forum.akash.network/t/create-a-keplr-wallet-guide-win-akt/804) on the Akash Community Forum.\\n\\n### **Intro**:\\n\\nWhen using cryptocurrency, one of the things you need is to set up a \u201cwallet\u201d&nbsp;in order to hold your coins and use them. A wallet is simply software or hardware that enables you to take your cryptocurrency from an exchange (where you buy crypto) and transfer it to a place where it is usable. Using your own wallet instead of storing crypto on an exchange is important because it reduces your risk of losing funds from an exchange hack, and it allows you to deploy your crypto into Decentralized Finance (DeFi) applications like&nbsp;[Osmosis DEX](https://app.osmosis.zone/)&nbsp;or stake (lock up your funds to secure the network to earn rewards) at higher rates. Exchange wallets are great for buying crypto, non-exchange wallets are better for just about everything else!\\n\\nThe Cosmos Ecosystem has a few compatible wallets, but one that is extremely easy to use is&nbsp;[Keplr](https://keplr.app/). Keplr comes pre-installed with support for Cosmos, Osmosis, Secret Network, Akash Network, Crypto.org, Starname, Sifchain, Certik, Irisnet, Regen, Persistence, Sentinel, Kava, Cyber, and Straightedge. That\u2019s a lot of options! But, in fact, you can actually add any Cosmos-based token through a few extra steps.\\n\\nThis tutorial will show you how to download Keplr on a browser extension.&nbsp;[**Here**](https://youtu.be/8lwmAOaG6LE) **is a YouTube version of this guide where I show you how to download, fund, and trade Akash with a Keplr wallet.**&nbsp;[**Here**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KGu3wiwcxNc&amp;t=642s)&nbsp;**is my video about how to deploy on Akash with a Keplr wallet.**\\n\\n### How to Download and Install Keplr for Google Chrome:\\n\\n1.  Navigate to the&nbsp;[Google Chrome Extension Store](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/category/extensions?hl=en).\\n2.  Search for&nbsp;[Keplr](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/keplr/dmkamcknogkgcdfhhbddcghachkejeap?hl=en).\\n3.  Click \u201cAdd to Chrome.\u201d\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1629324635-keplr1.png)\\n\\n4\\\\. Click the puzzle piece icon in the top right corner of the browser. These are your extensions.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1629324697-keplr2.png)\\n\\n5\\\\. Pin Keplr.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1629324771-keplr3.png)\\n\\n6\\\\. Click the Keplr icon.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1629324808-keplr4.png)\\n\\n7\\\\. Click \u201cCreate new account.\u201d\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1629324846-keplr5.png)\\n\\n8\\\\. Write down your Mnemonic Seed 12-word phrase on a piece of paper. You\u2019ll need these for the next step. Give your account a name and type in a password of choice. Click Next.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1629324875-keplr8.png)\\n\\n9\\\\. Use your piece of paper to click the boxes to arrange the Mnemonic Seed in its proper order. Once complete, store your Mnemonic Seed in a safe, protected place. Click \u201cRegister.\u201d\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1629324933-keplr-9.png)\\n\\n10\\\\. Click the Keplr icon.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1629324808-keplr4.png)\\n\\n11\\\\. Click the dropdown Cosmos menu. Click \u201cAkash.\u201d\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1629325002-keplr11.png)\\n\\n12\\\\. You have now downloaded Keplr wallet and are ready to fund your wallet with Akash!\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1629325033-keplr12.png)\\n\\n13\\\\. Fund Wallet.\\n\\n14\\\\. Create a deployment on the decentralized cloud!\\n\\n15\\\\. \\\\*Optional\\\\* Use a Custom domain name and proxy service for https.\\n\\n16\\\\. DM me on Telegram (@Jethro1705) or&nbsp;[Twitter](https://twitter.com/JeromeBerkshire)&nbsp;so I can add your site to&nbsp;[poweredbyakash.com.](https://poweredbyakash.com/)\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Deploy onto Akash: Setting up Your Keplr Wallet&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;This post was originally published by Anthony Rosa on Medium.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2021-08-19T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Developers&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Developers&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Anthony Rosa&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.BgrljBa9.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,2000],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1125],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/deploy-onto-akash-setting-up-your-keplr-wallet/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;how-to-mine-pkt-faster-on-the-world-s-first-decentralized-cloud/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;how-to-mine-pkt-faster-on-the-world-s-first-decentralized-cloud&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\nMining cryptocurrency on the cloud is much easier than building your own hardware. Cloud hosting usually comes at a higher cost and requires contracts, and service providers can charge extra fees for bandwidth usage. Making things more difficult, some cloud providers are shutting off mining operations at will. Crypto-mining projects like [PKT](https://pkt.cash/), are looking for better cloud providers and now they can run on Akash Network, the world\u2019s first open-source and decentralized cloud marketplace.\\n\\nPKT is a Bitcoin fork using PacketCrypt, a \u201cbandwidth-hard,\u201d proof-of-work blockchain that requires bandwidth and CPU to mine. Miners use idle CPU time to generate small messages called announcements and broadcast them to block miners who pay for them. PKT announcement miners and block miners collaborate to connect bandwidth from their local Internet connections and build a global, decentralized edge network. The PKT Network is designed to enable high-speed, low-cost Internet access without requiring a corporate ISP.\\n\\nAkash Network helps miners find and lease cloud-hosted CPU and bandwidth from data centers at a lower cost than traditional cloud providers. PKT miners operating on Akash spend 50% less compared to centralized cloud providers. Akash customers also reduce the risk of having operations shut down by providers. While providers ultimately decide if they want to stop bidding on a deployment, the providers on Akash Network are crypto-friendly and benefit by monetizing their underutilized hardware infrastructure on Akash\u2019s marketplace.\\n\\nPerformance is critical to miners, and the team at Chandra Station found Akash was far more performant than Amazon Web Services (AWS) in a side-by-side comparison. We asked several experienced miners from the PKT community to validate the results. After further testing by the community, we found that miners on Akash produce about 2x the amount of PKT as the AWS (c4.2xlarge) EC2 instance with 8 cores. [See our performance results and share your results on the Akash Community](https://forum.akash.network/t/pkt-performance-testing-results/).\\n\\nSupporting the PKT ecosystem is mutually beneficial to PKT and Akash. Akash\u2019s community can deploy infrastructure towards PKT\u2019s mission to decentralize access to the Internet and also profit by monetizing bandwidth resources.\\n\\n### Choosing the Ideal Configuration for PKT\\n\\nWhen choosing a configuration for PKT mining in the cloud, a higher amount of vCPU cores will yield more PKT, but this performance comes at a higher cost paid in Akash Token (AKT). Akash\u2019s CTO, Adam Bozanovich, looked at the results of the performance testing with various CPU configurations to find the ideal configuration that produces the most PKT for the least AKT spent.\\n\\nThe ideal configuration for PKT miners is 10 vCPU, 1 GB RAM, 1 GB storage. Configurations with less than 10 vCPU do not yield as much PKT and consume excess RAM and storage.\\n\\nConfigurations with 1 core running on 10 miners still produce a similar amount of PKT, but the 10 core miner produced a better price to performance ratio.\\n\\n[Visit the Akash Community](https://forum.akash.network/) to find more guides, ask for help, and connect with other PKT miners. You can also join the [Akash Discord server](http://discord.akash.network/) to chat with us live.\\n\\n### Mining is as easy as 1, 2, 3\\n\\nThis article from [Chandra Station](https://www.chandrastation.com/) will walk you through how to deploy a PKT announcement miner on the Akash Network. There are three steps to a successful deployment:\\n\\n1.  Creating a PKT wallet.\\n2.  Create a configuration file, using Akash\u2019s stack definition language (SDL).\\n3.  Deploy the PKT miner on Akash.\\n\\n### Step 1: Create Your PKT Wallet\\n\\nThere are PKT wallets for Windows, macOS and command-line. Visit [pkt.cash](https://pkt.cash/wallet/) and [pkt.world](http://pkt.world/wallet) (Windows only) to try out the wallets that support mining.\\n\\n#### **Microsoft Windows**\\n\\n- Download the most recent zip archive suffixed with -windows.zip available from [pktd releases page](https://github.com/pkt-cash/pktd/releases): (e.g. pktd-v1.3.1-windows.zip).\\n- Go to the Downloads directory.\\n- Unarchive the content of the file.\\n- Open the command prompt.\\n- Type cd Downloads to change directory to the downloads folder.\\n\\n#### **MacOS and Linux**\\n\\n- Download one of the most recent packages available for Linux or macOS from [pktd releases page](https://github.com/pkt-cash/pktd/releases): (e.g. pktd-v1.3.1-macos.pkg).\\n- Install pktwallet and other utilities by clicking on the package icon in the Finder.\\n\\n#### **For Linux**\\n\\n- Download one of the following packages:\\n- pktd-v1.3.1-linux.deb (Debian or Ubuntu).\\n- pktd-v1.3.1-linux.rpm (Fedora or RedHat).\\n- pktd AUR package (Arch linux or Manjaro).\\n- Install pktwallet and other utilities by clicking on the appropriate package icon or running an installation command.\\n\\n#### Creating a wallet\\n\\nTo create a new PKT wallet, use the pktwallet \u2014 create command:\\n\\n**For Mac:** `pktwallet --create`\\n\\n**For Windows:** `./bin/pktwallet.exe --create`\\n\\nYou will be prompted to follow a few steps, make sure you write your seed words on paper so that you can recover your funds even if your computer is damaged.\\n\\n#### Run PKT wallet\\n\\nAfter creating your wallet, you can launch pktwallet with:\\n\\n**For Mac:** `pktwallet`\\n\\n**For Windows:** `./bin/pktwallet`\\n\\nWatch the output from the logs and when you see a log line like this:\\n\\n```sh\\n1608294386 [INF] headerlogger.go:64 Processed 1 block in the last 24.82s (height 702781, 2020-12-18 13:26:01 +0100 CET)\\n```\\n\\nCompare the height number in the log line (e.g. 702781) to the number in [the pkt block explorer](https://explorer.pkt.cash/) to see when your wallet is up to date.\\n\\nYou may leave pktwallet running in the background or start it only when needed.\\n\\n#### Creating a new PKT address\\n\\nWhile **pktwallet** is running in the background, open a new terminal window, change directory again if needed, and run the following command:\\n\\n**For Mac:** `pktctl --wallet getnewaddress`\\n\\n**For Windows:** `./bin/pktctl.exe --wallet getnewaddress`\\n\\nYou should see a series of numbers and letters beginning with pkt1, this is your address which you can use for receiving coins.\\n\\n**NOTE**: Every time you use getnewaddress, the address you receive must be remembered by **pktwallet** forever so only use it when you actually need an address.\\n\\nYou now have a PKT wallet address and we can move on to step two.\\n\\n### Step 2: Create Your Configuration File&nbsp;\\n\\nWhen deploying on Akash, miners define the deployment services, data centers, requirements, and pricing parameters, in a \u201cmanifest\u201d - a configuration file that may end in `.yml` or `.yaml`. This configuration file follows the YAML standard and is very similar to Docker Compose files. The file is written in a human-friendly language called [Stack Definition Language (SDL)](https://akash.network/docs/sdl). This SDL file is a form to request resources and declare deployment attributes.\\n\\nBelow is an example configuration file written in the Akash stack definition language (SDL). The file has four sections: version, services, profiles, deployment. Just change the wallet address in the **services** section and you are good to go, or modify it to your taste.\\n\\n[Download the file](https://github.com/ovrclk/pkt-miner/blob/main/deploy.yaml) or copy the contents below and save it to a new file named `**deploy.yml**`.\\n\\n```yml title=\\&quot;deploy.yml\\&quot;\\nversion: \\&quot;2.0\\&quot;\\nservices:\\n  miner:\\n    image: chandrastation/pkt_on_akash:v1.0.0\\n    env:\\n      - WALLET_ADDR=<PKT_Wallet>\\n      - POOL1=http://pool.pkteer.com\\n      - POOL2=http://pool.pktpool.io\\n      - POOL3=http://pool.pkt.world\\n      - POOL4=http://pool.srizbi.com\\n    expose:\\n      - port: 3000\\n        as: 80\\n        to:\\n          - global: true\\n\\nprofiles:\\n  compute:\\n    miner:\\n      resources:\\n        cpu:\\n          units: 10\\n        memory:\\n          size: 1Gi\\n        storage:\\n          size: 1Gi\\n  placement:\\n    miner:\\n      attributes:\\n        host: akash\\n      signedBy:\\n        anyOf:\\n          - \\&quot;akash1365yvmc4s7awdyj3n2sav7xfx76adc6dnmlx63\\&quot;\\n      pricing:\\n        miner:\\n          denom: uakt\\n          amount: 1000\\n\\ndeployment:\\n  miner:\\n    miner:\\n      profile: miner\\n      count: 1\\n```\\n\\n### Step 3: Deploy Your Miner to Akash\\n\\nIf you are new to Akash Network, you will need to install Akash and set up your wallet, and get some AKT to fund your deployments. Head over to the [Quick Start Guide](https://akash.network/docs/guides/deploy) to get started. It takes just a few minutes to install Akash, and just seconds to create a wallet and add a certificate to the Akash blockchain, enabling you to deploy to Akash.\\n\\nWe recommend using the amazing new [Akashlytics Deploy Tool](https://www.akashlytics.com/deploy) for an easy-to-use Windows or Mac OS tool to deploy. But we know you are a rockstar, and you\u2019ll probably want to use the CLI, so keep reading.\\n\\nBefore you can create a deployment, a certificate must first be created. Your certificate needs to be created only once per account and can be used across all deployments. To do this, run:\\n\\n```sh\\nakash tx cert create client --chain-id $AKASH_CHAIN_ID --keyring-backend os --from $AKASH_KEY_NAME --node $AKASH_NODE --fees 5000uakt\\n```\\n\\nIf you see an error adding your certificate to the blockchain, try again! Now to deploy on Akash, run:\\n\\n```sh\\nakash tx deployment create deploy.yml --from` `**<your_wallet_name>**` `--node https://rpc.akash.forbole.com:443 --chain-id akashnet-2 --fees 5000uakt -y\\n```\\n\\nAfter that command, a string of JSON will appear in your terminal/command prompt.\\n\\n```json\\n{\\n  \\&quot;height\\&quot;: \\&quot;1696542\\&quot;,\\n  \\&quot;txhash\\&quot;: \\&quot;\\&quot;\\n}\\n```\\n\\nFind and take note of your **DSEQ** value in bold above. This is your deployment sequence number and identifies your miner on the network, and it will be used in the commands that follow.0\\n\\n**{\\&quot;key\\&quot;:\\&quot;dseq\\&quot;,\\&quot;value\\&quot;:\\&quot;1696540\\&quot;}**\\n\\nNote, if you just followed the Quick Start Guide, you might run into an error such as \u201cdeployment exists.\u201d What happened is this **DSEQ** number was stored as an environmental variable in your shell terminal. You should clear it from memory by running this command:\\n\\n`unset AKASH_DSEQ`\\n\\nNext, run:\\n\\n```sh\\nakash query deployment get --owner <your_akash_wallet_address> --node=tcp://135.181.60.250:26657 --dseq <your_dseq>\\n```\\n\\nCreate a market order.\\n\\n```sh\\nakash query market order get --node=https://rpc.akash.forbole.com:443 --owner <your_akash_wallet> --dseq <your_dseq> --oseq 1 --gseq 1\\n```\\n\\nAcquire a list of bids.\\n\\n```sh\\nakash query market bid list --owner=<your_wallet_address> --node=https://rpc.akash.forbole.com:443 --dseq <your_dseq>\\n```\\n\\nSelect a bid from a provider.\\n\\n```sh\\nakash tx market lease create --chain-id akashnet-2 --node=tcp://135.181.60.250:26657 --owner <your_wallet_address> --dseq <your_dseq> --gseq 1 --oseq 1 --provider <select_a_provider_from_the_list> --from <your_wallet_name> --fees 5000uakt\\n```\\n\\nConfirm your lease is open.\\n\\n```sh\\nakash query market lease list --owner <your_wallet_address> --node=tcp://135.181.60.250:26657 --dseq <your_dseq>\\n```\\n\\nSend the manifest.\\n\\n```sh\\nakash provider send-manifest deploy.yml --node=tcp://135.181.60.250:26657 --dseq <your_dseq> --provider <the_provider_you_selected> --home ~/.akash --from <your_wallet_address>\\n```\\n\\nEnsure the miner is running by looking at your logs.\\n\\n```sh\\nakash provider lease-logs --node=tcp://135.181.60.250:26657&nbsp; --dseq <your_dseq> --gseq 1 --oseq 1 --provider <the_provider_you_selected> --from <your_wallet_address>\\n```\\n\\nAnother great way to see how much PKT you are mining is by visiting the [block explorer](https://explorer.pkt.cash) and inputting your PKT wallet address.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1628712507-1owxmka1g6tvyq6tnhhptta.png)\\n\\n### You Should Now be Mining PKT\\n\\nNot only is it cheaper to run a PKT miner on Akash but the PKT yield is also several times higher than what you would get running on AWS. Running the PKT miner in one of Akash\u2019s cloud containers, with a single core, demonstrated twice the yield as an eight-core server running on AWS EC2.\\n\\n**How to Get Help**\\n\\n[Visit the Akash Community](https://forum.akash.network/c/mining) to find more guides, ask for help, and connect with other PKT miners. You can also join the [Akash Discord server](http://discord.akash.network/) to chat with us live and ask for support in the #deployments channel.\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;How to Mine PKT Faster on The World\u2019s First Decentralized Cloud&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Mining cryptocurrency on the cloud is much easier than building your own hardware. Cloud hosting usually comes at a higher cost and requires contracts, and service providers can charge extra fees for bandwidth usage.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2021-08-12T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Developers&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Developers&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Colin Pollen&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.iiMR-UuR.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,2000],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1125],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/how-to-mine-pkt-faster-on-the-world-s-first-decentralized-cloud/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-offers-up-to-100-000-in-grants-through-new-developer-grant-program/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-offers-up-to-100-000-in-grants-through-new-developer-grant-program&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\n### Introducing the Akash Developer Grant Program\\n\\nWe\u2019re excited to announce the launch of the Akash Developer Grant Program, a community-driven source of funding and support for promising developers and teams. The purpose of the program is to expand the developer community, encourage collaboration between developers, and develop open-source projects to promote further adoption and usage of Akash Network\u2019s decentralized cloud.\\n\\nInspired by startup programs like AWS Activate and Y Combinator, the Developer Grant Program offers funding, guidance, support, and marketing for developers including:\\n\\n- **Grants**: Developers can apply for grants in amounts ranging from $100 to $100,000 paid in $AKT.\\n- **Office Hours**: Office hours from Akash\u2019s community and core development team to provide guidance and best practices as they build and test.\\n- **Collaboration**: Every project funded will be open source and will have its own channel on Discord to communicate with the Akash community.\\n- **Powered by Akash**: Promising projects will be featured on our forum and website to amplify attention.\\n- **Demo Days:** The top developers will present their projects to investors, advisors, and other developers in the Akash community via blogs and Akash branded livestreams.\\n\\n### Eligibility for Grants\\n\\nAll software developers and engineers with a GitHub account are eligible.\\n\\n### What can I do with $AKT tokens?\\n\\nYou can use the grants for infrastructure services provided on the Akash Network:\\n\\n- Deploy container-based apps on managed Kubernetes.\\n- Host websites on the Akash open-source cloud hosting platform.\\n- Build web apps or API backends on robust infrastructure.\\n- Apply for up to $100,000 from the Community Pool.\\n- Securely lease out your data center as a provider.\\n\\n### How do I get help with Akash?\\n\\n- **Getting Started Guides**: Our guides and tutorials are written by the community to help you get started deploying on Akash quickly. Click [here](https://forum.akash.network/c/learn/14) to get started.\\n- **Tech Support**: Technical support for all developers is free regardless of how much AKT you spend, stake, or own. Get technical support [here](https://forum.akash.network/c/support/19).\\n- **Ask us Anything**: Have a question about Akash? Join the discussion on our active community forum, [here](https://forum.akash.network/c/support/faq/24).\\n\\n### **Explore the Tiers**\\n\\nThe Developer Grant Program has a wide range of award tiers, from $100 to $100,000. The amount of funding received depends on the milestones achieved and funding tiers unlocked.\\n\\nTo start, the program has four award tiers to support all types of projects large and small.\\n\\n- **$100 Initiate Grant**: The purpose of this funding is to support a large number of developers in running their first apps on Akash. If a developer sends these tokens to an exchange, they will be ineligible for future funding, as well as the next tier of funding.\\n- **$1,000 Seed Grant**: The Seed Grant requires a developer to create a detailed proposal for their project and share this with the community for public comment and questions. Developers are expected to open source their project for the community, publish a detailed guide, and answer questions from the community.\\n- **$10,000 Incubator Grant**: The Incubator Grant is awarded only if progress is made by the developer to meet the milestones in their proposal. The developers may be asked to present their project in a recorded livestream and answer questions live from the community.\\n- **$100,000 Accelerator Grant:** The Accelerator Grant is only awarded to developers that have consistently met their milestones, demonstrated improvements, and shown a willingness to remain open source and collaborate with the Akash community.\\n\\nAll grants are paid in $AKT to the developer\u2019s Akash account address. To prevent fraudulent activity, the account is linked to the developer\u2019s accounts on Discourse, GitHub, and Discord. This award is a non-dilutive donation, and Akash\u2019s treasury and community do not gain equity in projects with the grants. The grants must be used to deploy and run applications on Akash Network.\\n\\n### **Milestones**\\n\\nMilestones for each project will be determined as part of the grant application. A milestone is a goal such as the development of a feature, the release of a working beta, and the completion of the work. A typical project should have 3-4 milestones and be completed within 2-4 months. Projects that complete their milestones will present to investors, advisors, and developers in the community on a scheduled Demo Day.\\n\\n### **What types of projects will be funded?**\\n\\nWe are committed to a transparent and clear process and we want to set expectations for the types of projects that will be considered for funding.\\n\\nProjects that apply for grants from the developer program will need to outline how their project will contribute and add value to the Akash ecosystem.\\n\\nHere are some examples of projects that we hope to see submitted:\\n\\n- Developer tooling for Akash including SDKs and APIs.\\n- Open-source developer tools (Homebrew).\\n- Creator platforms (CMS, podcasting, blogging, forums, GitLab).\\n- Decentralized web services (Handshake, DNS, OpenRegistry).\\n- Backend as a service (Hasura on Akash).\\n- Platform as a service (Heroku on Akash).\\n- Open-source communications (Chat, Email).\\n- Desktop deployment interface.\\n- Hosted deployment interface with wallet integration.\\n- App Store interface (OpenChannel on Akash).\\n- Persistent storage integrations (Sia, Skynet, Filebase, Arweave, Filecoin, Storj, Coldstack).\\n\\n### **How will the projects be chosen?**\\n\\nProposals will be reviewed by the [Community Awards Board (CAB)](https://forum.akash.network/t/proposal-developer-grants-program-community-awards-board/541).\\n\\nEach month the board will meet to review the proposals submitted by developers and craft on-chain proposals for the community to vote on. Meetings will be publicly announced and hosted online via Google Meet or Zoom. All meetings will be recorded and minutes will be shared publicly with the community.\\n\\nThe CAB is open to Akash customers, validators, providers, investors, advisors, employees, and former employees. If you\u2019d like to nominate someone, please post your nomination publicly on the community forum\u2019s Grant Applications.\\n\\nBeing a member of this board requires active participation to review developer applications and be involved in the decision-making and proposal writing process. Initially, voting requires attendance.\\n\\n### **Referral Rewards**\\n\\nOne of the main goals of the Developer Grant Program is to attract talented developers from across the globe. If you would like to invite a developer to the Akash developer program, [create an invitation](https://forum.akash.network/my/invited/) and share it with your social network. Each month, the community members with the most successful invitations will be awarded $100 or $1,000 in grants.\\n\\n### **Incubators, accelerators, and VCs, oh my!**\\n\\nAkash will be partnering with other startup funds to provide free hosting on Akash. If you are a venture capital firm, accelerator, incubator, or other startup-enabling organization interested in providing Akash developer grants to your startups, contact [partners@akash.network](mailto:partners@akash.network).\\n\\n### **How will this be funded?**\\n\\nIn order to scale the program quickly, the initial grants will be awarded by the Akash Treasury.\\n\\nWe are currently funding developers through five [coding challenges](https://forum.akash.network/c/challenge/7).
