Remember that the AKT<> ATOM pool is a 2-to-1 pool, meaning 2/3rds of the value of the pool will be in AKT and 1/3rd will be in ATOM\\n\\nAdd the amount of ATOM and AKT you would like to provide to this pool to become a Liquidity Provider and earn OSMO and AKT rewards\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1624503715-screen-shot-2021-06-23-at-3-22-01-pm.png)\\n\\n**Step 3.3: Bonding your LP Tokens**\\n\\n*This is the final step and an important one.*\\n\\n45% of daily issuance of OSMO rewards will go towards incentivizing liquidity providers to bond their LP tokens to promote long-term liquidity on Osmosis\u2019 AMM. Osmosis users can also choose to bond their LP tokens after providing liquidity. Similar to OSMO staking, LP tokens remain bonded for a certain length of time, except users are allowed to choose the length of their own unbonding period.\\n\\nYou\u2019ll see three bonding gauges below: 1 day, 7 days, and 14 days with the respective APY of each pool. You can choose to unbond your LP tokens at the end of whichever gauge you choose.\\n\\nOnce you\u2019re done selecting which gauge you prefer, click bond, and you\u2019re done!\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1624503773-screen-shot-2021-06-23-at-3-44-39-pm.png)\\n\\nCongratulations, you\u2019ve now made your first swap on Osmosis using IBC, and you\u2019ve added liquidity to the first ever AKT <> ATOM pool on a decentralized exchange!\\n\\n**Important note:** As a liquidity provider, you incur the risk of impermanent loss, which occurs when users could have earned more by just holding the assets than adding them to liquidity pools. Asset prices in pools change at different rates causing LPs to own larger amounts of whichever asset appreciates less.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1624503826-osmosis-image.png)\\n\\nWe suggest you do your own research to understand the risks involved related to impermanent loss.\\n\\nFor Osmosis updates, join the Osmosis [Discord](https://discord.gg/qwC4yfCw).\\n\\n**Join The Unstoppable Cloud Community** \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\*\*\\n\\n---\\n\\nFor the latest AKT and Akash Network news and promotions, [join our Telegram](https://t.me/AkashNW) &amp; [Twitter](https://twitter.com/akashnet_).\\n\\nFor developer support, [join our Discord](https://discord.com/invite/DxftX67).\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;How to Access AKT Token and Provide Liquidity on Osmosis&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;As we shared last week, one of our primary goals is to unlock Akash Network\u2019s acceleration and expand global access to Akash Token (AKT) without arbitrary access restrictions. That\u2019s why we were excited to announce our first decentralized exchange listing of AKT on Osmosis.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2021-06-24T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Product&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Product&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Michael Gushansky&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.CdE_uED0.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,2000],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1200],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/how-to-access-and-provide-akt-token-liquidity-on-osmosis/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akt-token-launches-on-osmosis-the-first-decentralized-exchange-for-cosmos/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akt-token-launches-on-osmosis-the-first-decentralized-exchange-for-cosmos&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\n> **\u201cWe\u2019re excited to have Akash Network be one of the first launch partners of Osmosis. Akash Network enables a new generation of resilient, decentralized Internet infrastructure to be built, and Osmosis provides a gateway for anyone to take part in this decentralized economy. For Osmosis to be a truly decentralized exchange, we need to be built on a decentralized infrastructure.**\\n>\\n> **Osmosis will be a proud user of Akash infrastructure to host our applications and API-serving nodes.\u201d**\\n>\\n> Sunny Aggarwal, Co-founder of Osmosis\\n\\nIt\u2019s been an eventful month at Akash. We announced that [we partnered with Helium Network](https://akash.network/blog/akash-network-provides-decentralized-cloud-to-the-largest-internet-of-things-iot), the largest peer-to-peer wireless internet-of-things (IoT) network, to provide a decentralized, open-source, and low-cost cloud alternative for Helium\u2019s new blockchain validators.\\n\\nWe also [welcomed the NBA\u2019s Houston Rockets owner Tilman Fertitta to Akash Network as an investor and validator](https://www.investing.com/news/cryptocurrency-news/nbas-houston-rockets-owner-to-validate-blocks-for-the-akash-network-2527433). Fertitta, an early Bitcoin supporter, has a track record of leveraging emerging technology and is working towards migrating his business empire\u2019s cloud computing needs to Akash DeCloud.\\n\\nWith deployments on Akash increasing over 20% week on week, the need to expand access to AKT for our users has never been greater. As the primary method of settlement for compute on the Akash decentralized cloud, AKT is the utility token that enables the frictionless buying and selling of compute.\\n\\nAs the demand for AKT increases with network usage, one of our primary goals is to unlock Akash Network\u2019s acceleration and expand global access to AKT without arbitrary access restrictions; the decentralized cloud requires decentralized access.\\n\\n**Wider Global Access to AKT** \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\\_**\\n\\n---\\n\\n**So it\u2019s with great excitement that we announce our very first decentralized exchange listing of AKT on Osmosis shortly after the Osmosis Mainnet launch this Saturday, June 19th.**\\n\\n**We\u2019re also thrilled to be hosting Osmosis applications and API-serving nodes on Akash\u2019s decentralized cloud.**\\n\\n**With Osmosis, any developer or AKT buyer can now access AKT in a permissionless and frictionless way, from anywhere in the world. All that\u2019s needed are a few things: your** [**Keplr wallet**](https://keplr.app/)**, a Cosmos ecosystem token starting with ATOM, a computer, and Internet access.**\\n\\n**For holders of AKT the ATOM<>AKT pool will also feature lucrative incentives for liquidity providers on Osmosis. Early liquidity providers receive a larger proportion of rewards in both OSMO and AKT.**\\n\\nFor the Cosmos superfan and humble farmers, this is the start of IBC\u2019s potential being realized. For the first time, Osmosis users will be able to&nbsp; directly swap ATOMs for AKT, and bring Cosmos\u2019s fully interoperable ecosystem to life.\\n\\nAkash Network\u2019s main goal is to increase access to lower cost, scalable, and developer friendly cloud compute in an open-source and permissionless environment. Listing AKT on a DEX aligns fundamentally with our ethos and vision for a decentralized future.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1623890938-1wkfqvrq3idonzv6tuyqttq.png)\\n\\n**What is Osmosis?** \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\\_**\\n\\n---\\n\\nOsmosis is an automated market maker (AMM) protocol built for liquidity providers. With Osmosis, users are able to&nbsp; swap cross-chain assets within the Cosmos ecosystem and provide liquidity for IBC-enabled Cosmos assets like AKT and ATOM for the first time while earning OSMO and AKT rewards.\\n\\n**Why Participate in Osmosis?** \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\\_**\\n\\n---\\n\\nUser experience is critical to the success of any trading protocol and one of the biggest obstacles in creating a consistent and reliable trading experience is short-term mercenary farming where liquidity providers quickly add and remove liquidity to pursue the best yields. With that in mind, Osmosis has leveraged two novel devices to encourage long term liquidity: Bonded liquidity Gauges and Exit fees (a fee LPs pay when withdrawing liquidity from a pool).\\n\\n45% of daily issuance of OSMO rewards will go towards incentivizing liquidity providers to bond their LP tokens to promote long-term liquidity on Osmosis\u2019 AMM. Osmosis users can also choose to bond their LP tokens after providing liquidity. Similar to OSMO staking, LP tokens remain bonded for a certain length of time, except users are allowed to choose the length of their own unbonding period. Staking requires a two-week unbonding period.\\n\\nTo further promote \u2018long-lasting incentive programs\u2019, the Osmosis team has enabled external incentives by outside parties to supplement Osmosis\u2019 own liquidity programs. This&nbsp; provides Akash Network\u2019s team the capability and flexibility to incentivize with additional rewards for bonding gauges that promote the overall health and liquidity of pools that include AKT, such as our initial AKT/ATOMs, or potential future pools within the Cosmos ecosystem, like Terra\u2019s $Luna, Binance\u2019s $BNB, or Thorchains $Rune.\\n\\nFor a deeper dive into bonded liquidity gauges and other features that make Osmosis so unique, read [Osmosis\u2019 Liquidity Mining 101.](https://medium.com/osmosis/osmosis-liquidity-mining-101-2fa58d0e9d4d)\\n\\n**Osmosis AKT Timeline**  \\n\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\n\\n---\\n\\n- Osmosis Chain Launch: June 18th 5PM UTC\\n- Osmosis Public Launch: June 19th 5PM UTC\\n- AKT LP Rewards turned on: Earliest on June 21st\\n\\n**Join The Unstoppable Cloud Community**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n---\\n\\nFor the latest AKT and Akash Network news and promotions, [join our Telegram](https://t.me/AkashNW).\\n\\nFor developer support, [join our Discord](https://discord.com/invite/DxftX67).\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Announces First AKT Token DEX Listing on Osmosis&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;We\u2019re excited to have Akash Network be one of the first launch partners of Osmosis. Akash Network enables a new generation of resilient, decentralized Internet infrastructure to be built, and Osmosis provides a gateway for anyone to take part in this decentralized economy.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2021-06-17T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Partners&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Partners&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Michael Gushansky&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.B7bB15Jg.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,2000],&quot;height&quot;:[0,900],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akt-token-launches-on-osmosis-the-first-decentralized-exchange-for-cosmos/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-network-provides-decentralized-cloud-to-the-largest-internet-of-things-iot-network-helium/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-network-provides-decentralized-cloud-to-the-largest-internet-of-things-iot-network-helium&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\n> Migrating the Helium blockchain's consensus group from hosted hotspots to validators is a major upgrade for scalability and performance. From the Foundation's perspective, we want to see Helium validators optimize for diversity of infrastructure and decentralization, which is why we're thrilled to have Akash in the Helium ecosystem. Not only is their performance and cost structure attractive to node operators, but their decentralized cloud aligns with our own ethos of creating permissionless and open systems.\\n>\\n> Scott Sigel, Director of Operations at the Decentralized Wireless Alliance, the nonprofit foundation arm of the Helium Network\\n\\nToday, we\u2019re excited to announce that we\u2019ve been selected to support the Helium Network, the largest peer-to-peer wireless internet-of-things (IoT) network, and providing a decentralized, open-source, and low-cost cloud alternative for Helium\u2019s new blockchain validators, projected to launch June 2021.\\n\\nValidators will play an integral role in the expansion, stability, and success of the Helium network, acting as the consensus group, and performing functions that include verifying transactions and adding new blocks to the blockchain.\\n\\nAkash Network is proud to be providing a faster, more efficient, and low-cost deployment and hosting solution for the Helium validator software.\\n\\nAs part of today\u2019s announcement, I\u2019ll be sharing how I learned to run a Helium validator on Akash, along with providing a detailed deployment guide.\\n\\n### **How I learned to run a Helium Validator on Akash in one day**\\n\\nSome people can dive into documentation and figure something out in an hour, but for someone like me, it can take a&nbsp;**_whole_**&nbsp;day. Fortunately, this article covers the step-by-step process of deploying a Helium Validator on the Akash decentralized cloud (DeCloud). By end of day, you\u2019ll have a Helium Validator running on&nbsp;[Akash](https://akash.network/)&nbsp;DeCloud\u200a\u2014\u200aand you don\u2019t need to be a developer.\\n\\n_**If you already know about Helium Validators, skip to the technical step-by-step section.**_\\n\\n### **Why am I so excited about Helium?**\\n\\nToday, the Helium blockchain, and its&nbsp;[30,000+ hotspots](https://explorer.helium.com/hotspots)&nbsp;provide access to the largest Long Range Wide Area Network (LoRaWAN) in the world. By deploying a simple device at your home or office, you are helping provide coverage for billions of devices and earning cryptocurrency.\\n\\nHelium was started in 2013; MIT called&nbsp;[2013: The year of the Internet of Things](https://www.technologyreview.com/2013/01/04/180666/2013-the-year-of-the-internet-of-things/). It was the early days, when people still called it \u201cThe IoT\u201d. Helium\u2019s innovative LongFi technology is based on the IEEE 802.15.4 standard with enhancements to harden security, increase bandwidth, and simplify ease of use. In 2014, I signed up for the Helium Beta Kit, and I still have my original Helium Atom to this day. Helium\u2019s VP&nbsp;[Mark Phillips](https://www.linkedin.com/in/mark-phillips-255b757/)&nbsp;even emailed me directly asking me to do some beta testing. I felt special to be part of something new.\\n\\nThe Helium blockchain and HNT launched in 2019 and sparked a massive growth in Helium\u2019s network. If you were one of the early adopters, you\u2019ve been mining HNT, and it\u2019s likely paid off much more than the cost of the hotspot. Hotspots use Proof-of-Coverage (PoC) to verify wireless coverage from peers and earn rewards for providing coverage and transferring device data. A single Helium hotspot in the right neighborhood can earn over $12,000 (USD) in monthly HNT mining rewards.\\n\\nNew partnerships and customers are coming to Helium\u2019s network including&nbsp;[FreedomFi](https://freedomfi.com/helium5g/)\u2019s Helium5G network which pays people to host a 5G hotspot and reward them with HNT.\\n\\n#### **Helium Validators are right around the corner.**\\n\\nHelium\u2019s Validators are a new entity on the Helium Blockchain that will perform the work of the consensus group including verifying transactions and adding new blocks to the blockchain. Helium Validators are projected to go live on their Mainnet by June 2021, and possibly sooner.\\n\\nTo host a Validator node requires a stake (deposit) of 10,000 HNT and running Validator node software in a suitable environment. In return for staking, users contribute to network stability and earn rewards.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1622233046-colin-1.png)\\n\\n#### **Mining with Validators vs. Hotspots**\\n\\nValidators split the Consensus Group reward,&nbsp;[which is 6% of all HNT mined](https://docs.helium.com/blockchain/mining/#mining-and-token-rewards). Approximately 300,000 HNT is split evenly amongst validators every month. Initial validator size is somewhere between 100 and 500. Early stakers will earn a larger % of the 300,000 HNT.\\n\\nCompared with Helium hotspots, the earnings are split evenly amongst routers. There are currently over 30,000 routers and many more joining the network every day\u200a, \u200areducing each routers individual earnings.\\n\\n#### **What is the APR for running Helium Validator?**\\n\\nIt depends on the number of validators and how often a validator is randomly chosen to participate in the consensus group. Helium\u2019s website depicts an estimated APR represented assuming 10k HNT per node.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1622233062-colin-2.png)\\n\\n### **Why run on Akash?**\\n\\nAkash is the first open-source and decentralized Cloud. Akash\u2019s peer-to-peer marketplace offers the most flexible and cost-effective options for a developer to deploy their app.\\n\\n- **Efficient:**&nbsp;Pay for what you need, when needed. Akash lets you set the price, length of lease, and terms of your deployment.\\n- **Flexible:**&nbsp;Compatible with all existing cloud applications. Akash Network supports generic compute\u200a\u2014\u200aany cloud native applications running on the cloud today (AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure), can run on Akash.\\n- **Price Advantage:**&nbsp;Up to 10x lower in cost for developers. Helium Validators can run on Akash without worrying about running up an expensive bill from Amazon.\\n- **Censorship-resistant**: Akash is founded on the principle of permissionless open access and does not decide who can use the marketplace.\\n- **Open-source:**&nbsp;Purpose built for \u201cbuilders\u201d by some of the top developers in the world. Akash is a community-driven open source project that allows anyone to contribute.\\n\\nWith advanced containerization technology and a unique staking model to accelerate adoption, Akash will be a faster, more efficient, and up to 10x lower cost cloud platform.\\n\\n### **How to run a Helium Validator on Akash**\\n\\nThis section is sourced from Tom Beynon\u2019s&nbsp;[**Helium-on-Akash**](https://github.com/tombeynon/helium-on-akash)&nbsp;project and&nbsp;[**Helium\u2019s Validator Deployment Guide**](https://docs.helium.com/mine-hnt/validators/validator-deployment-guide/). If you run into any issues or have feedback, feel free to join&nbsp;[**Akash\u2019s Discord Chat**](http://chat/)&nbsp;and ask me for help. My name on Discord is @colinster.\\n\\nValidators currently can only run on Helium\u2019s Testnet\u200a\u2014\u200a a network designed to deploy and test new software for beta testing\u200a\u2014\u200abefore going live on their Mainnet\u200a\u2014\u200aor production network. This means you\u2019ll be deploying to the Testnet until Mainnet is live. This guide reflects deploying to the Testnet only. This guide will be updated when Validators are ready for MainNet.\\n\\n#### **Step 1. Set Up a Helium Testnet Wallet**&nbsp;\\n\\n- Install the&nbsp;[Helium CLI Wallet](https://github.com/helium/helium-wallet-rs). The easy way to download the latest binary release. Download the latest binary for your platform here from&nbsp;[Releases](https://github.com/helium/helium-wallet-rs/releases/latest). Unpack the zip file and place the helium-wallet binary in your $PATH somewhere.\\n- Once you have your&nbsp;[Helium CLI Wallet](https://github.com/helium/helium-wallet-rs)&nbsp;installed locally, it\u2019s time to create your Testnet Wallet. Run the following command to create it.\\n\\n  helium-wallet create basic--network testnet\\n\\n- You\u2019ll be prompted to supply a new passphrase to complete it. This is used to encrypt/decrypt the wallet.key file, and is needed to sign transactions. Don't lose it.\\n- This command will produce a wallet.key file on your machine.\\n- Next, run the info command to get all the details for your wallet.\\n\\n  helium-wallet info\\n\\n#### **Step 2. Get Testnet Tokens (TNT)**\\n\\nRunning a Validator requires a stake. This stake is 10000 tokens per Validator. For the Testnet we are using TNTs.\\n\\nTo acquire them, head to&nbsp;[faucet.helium.wtf](https://faucet.helium.wtf/)&nbsp;and input your public key from the wallet you just created. Use your public wallet address. If you copy and paste, the one above the TNT will be sent to someone else.\\n\\nOnce you\u2019ve inputted your address, the Faucet will deliver just over 10000 TNT to your Testnet Wallet. This can take up to 10 minutes so please be patient. Make a cup of coffee, issue a compelling tweet, then check your wallet balance using the balance command:\\n\\n    helium-wallet balance\\n\\n#### **Step 3. Set Up an Akash Mainnet Wallet**\\n\\n- [Install the Akash CLI](https://akash.network/docs/guides/install). To installakashusing homebrew just enter:\\n\\n  brew tap ovrclk/tap\\n  brew install akash\\n  brew link akash --force\\n\\n- Set the variable AKASH_NET to the URL of the Akash MainNet.&nbsp;[You can also choose to deploy on Testnet or Edgenet.](https://akash.network/docs/guides/version)&nbsp;Enter the following command on your command prompt to set the variable.\\n\\n  AKASH_NET=\\&quot;https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ovrclk/net/master/mainnet\\&quot;\\n\\n- Set the variable AKASH_VERSION to the URL of the Akash MainNet\\n\\n  AKASH_VERSION=\\&quot;$(curl -s \\&quot;$AKASH_NET/version.txt\\&quot;)\\&quot;\\n\\n- Set the variable AKASH_CHAIN_ID environment variable:\\n\\n  AKASH_CHAIN_ID=\\&quot;$(curl -s \\&quot;$AKASH_NET/chain-id.txt\\&quot;)\\&quot;\\n\\n- Set the variable AKASH_NODE environment variable:\\n\\n  AKASH_NODE=\\&quot;$(curl -s \\&quot;$AKASH_NET/rpc-nodes.txt\\&quot; | shuf -n 1)\\&quot;\\n\\n- Set the variable AKASH_KEY_NAME to the Key name of your choosing. This documentation uses a value of \u201calice\u201d.\\n- Set the variableAKASH_KEYRING_BACKEND Keyring backend to use for local keys. This should be os (default), file, ortest.\\n- Derive a new private key and encrypt to disk using the command keys add, to generate a key with the named alice, run the below:\\n\\n  akash \\\\\\n  --keyring-backend \\&quot;$AKASH*KEYRING_BACKEND\\&quot; \\\\\\n keys add \\&quot;$AKASH_KEY_NAME\\&quot;\\n\\nYou\u2019ll see a response similar to below:\\n\\n    - name: alice\\n    type: local\\n    address: akash1cz87pqkad72gggrv3t7y2x9z56h9gqghlnx3j3\\n    pubkey: akashpub1addwnpepqtnydvj056gy64uuquldq5yx7mr8ncmn3ut59wwl9p83d8h2v4rtg5xa3vn\\n    mnemonic: \\&quot;\\&quot;\\n    threshold: 0\\n    pubkeys: []\\n    **Important** write this mnemonic phrase in a safe place. It is the only way to recover your account if you ever forget your password.\\n    town wolf margin parrot strong disease dance eyebrow inflict meadow crunch version tube elite interest movie uphold column shift fox excuse humble nest call\\n\\n**IMPORTANT:**&nbsp;It\u2019s imperative your keep the mnemonic phrase is a safe place and it is the ONLY way to recover your private key incase you change or lose your device.\\n\\n- Find your account address with this command:\\n\\n  akash \\\\\\n  --keyring-backend \\&quot;$AKASH_KEYRING_BACKEND\\&quot; \\\\\\n keys show \\&quot;$AKASH_KEY_NAME\\&quot; -a\\n\\n#### **Step 4. Get Akash Tokens**\\n\\nThe easy way to get Akash Tokens (AKT) is to purchase them on&nbsp;[exchanges listed here](https://akash.network/token/). From there you can withdraw tokens to your address.\\n\\nAnother easy way to get Akash Tokens is to join&nbsp;[Akash\u2019s Discord Chat](http://chat/)&nbsp;and ask me directly for help. My name on Discord is @colinster.\\n\\nCheck your account balance with the following CLI command:\\n\\n    akash \\\\\\n    --node \\&quot;$AKASH_NODE\\&quot; \\\\\\n query bank balances \\&quot;$AKASH_ACCOUNT_ADDRESS\\&quot;\\n\\n#### **Step 5. Configure your Deployment**\\n\\nThe easiest way to deploy a Helium validator is using the working example of a deployment configuration for Akash. Clone the&nbsp;[**Helium-on-Akash**](https://github.com/tombeynon/helium-on-akash)&nbsp;from GitHub which includes three important files:\\n\\n- Dockerfile - Installs the AWS CLI on top of the&nbsp;[Helium validator docker image](https://quay.io/team-helium/validator)&nbsp;and sets boot.sh to run whenever the container starts.\\n- boot.sh - This script instructs the docker container to download swarm_key from S3 (if it exists), start the miner and prints the address. It then uploads the swarm_key if it didn't download it earlier (new miner).\\n- deploy.yml - The deployment configuration is stored in the deploy.yml file, which includes all the important information including CPU, memory, storage, port configuration.\\n\\nEnter your S3 bucket and IAM credentials into the env section. These settings will allow the container to connect to your S3 bucket and upload/download the swarm_key on boot.&nbsp;[Click here for step-by-step instructions on how to set up your S3 bucket.](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/userguide/example-walkthroughs-managing-access-example1.html#grant-permissions-to-user-in-your-account-step1)\\n\\nIf you have a swarm_key already, make sure this is uploaded to S3 in the same location as S3_KEY_PATH.\\n\\n image: tombeynon/helium-on-akash:v0.0.3\\n env:\\n \u2014 AWS_ACCESS_KEY=mykey\\n \u2014 AWS_SECRET_KEY=mysecret\\n \u2014 S3_KEY_PATH=mybucket/miner1/swarm_key\\n\\n#### **Step 6. Deploy on Akash**\\n\\nYou can deploy your Validator on Akash using the Akash CLI following the&nbsp;[Akash deployment guide](https://akash.network/docs/guides/deploy)&nbsp;or using Tom Beynon\u2019s&nbsp;[Deploy UI](https://github.com/tombeynon/akash-deploy).\\n\\nOnce the container is deployed, check the logs to see your address once the server starts (can take a while). If your swarm_key didn\u2019t exist in S3 before, the new one should have been uploaded. Subsequent deploys using the same S3 details will now use the same swarm_key.\\n\\n#### **Step 7: Stake Tokens to Your Validator**\\n\\nNow that your Validator node is running, the final step in the process is to formally stake TNT to your Validator. As part of the staking process the Validator address needs to both be in the staking transaction and sign the transaction.\\n\\nAfter a wallet stakes a validator node, the wallet becomes that node\u2019s owner, has control over that validator node, and receives rewards.\\n\\nFirst, double check your wallet balance to make sure you have the 10000 TNT required to stake, along with a few extra to cover the transaction fees. (The faucet provides all of this.)\\n\\n helium-wallet balance\\n +-----------------------------------------------------+----------------+--------------+-----------------+\\n | Address &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; | Balance&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; | Data Credits | Security Tokens |\\n +-----------------------------------------------------+----------------+--------------+-----------------+\\n | 1aP7nm6mGLMFtgiHQQxbPgKcBwnuQ6ehgTgTN8zjFuxByzJ8eA5 | 10005.00000000 | 0&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; | 0.00000000&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; |\\n +-----------------------------------------------------+----------------+--------------+-----------------+\\n\\nTo stake tokens, we need to get the validator node address. Obtain it using the following:\\n\\n miner peer addr\\n\\nThe resulting output will look like this (except with your specific validator address). The string after /p2p/ is your Validator address:\\n\\n /p2p/1YwLbGTCEhVbwKEehRVQRC8N3q35ydXTH1B6BQys5FB1paHssdR\\n\\nWe can now use this address with the Helium Wallet CLI validators stake command to formally stake the 10000 TNT required.\\n\\nHere's the full command using the Validator address from above as an example. (Make sure you replace it with yours.)\\n\\n helium-wallet validators stake 1YwLbGTCEhVbwKEehRVQRC8N3q35ydXTH1B6BQys5FB1paHssdR 10000 --commit\\n\\nAfter running this, you\u2019ll need to input your wallet passphrase to sign the transaction.\\n\\nAnd with that, you\u2019re done.\\n\\nCongratulations! You\u2019re running a Helium Network Validator.\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Network Provides Decentralized Cloud to the Largest Internet of Things (IoT) Network, Helium&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Migrating the Helium blockchain's consensus group from hosted hotspots to validators is a major upgrade for scalability and performance. From the Foundation's perspective, we want to see Helium validators optimize for diversity of infrastructure and decentralization, which is why we're thrilled to have Akash in the Helium ecosystem.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2021-05-27T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;News&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;News&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Colin Pollen&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.jq3W5sEw.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1600],&quot;height&quot;:[0,882],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-network-provides-decentralized-cloud-to-the-largest-internet-of-things-iot-network-helium/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-network-s-akash-token-akt-now-listed-on-bittrex-global/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-network-s-akash-token-akt-now-listed-on-bittrex-global&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\n> With its extraordinary growth over the last six months, we\u2019re excited to welcome AKT to our platform. I went from just knowing about Akash's existence to actually deploying on their decentralized cloud in a very short time frame.*\\n> \\n> EoM Games\\n\\nEoM\u2019s work excited the core development teams at Akash and Sovryn, the DeFi platform for Bitcoin, inspiring both teams to explore ways to work together.\\n\\nWith a shared goal to accelerate the future of DeFi, Akash is providing our DeCloud to participants and committing $100,000 in Akash Token (AKT) prizes for the&nbsp;[Sovrython Hackathon, powered by Gitcoin](https://gitcoin.co/hackathon/sovrython/onboard).&nbsp;\\n\\nThe hackathon kicks off June 4th and runs through July 18th, 2021. This is a game-changer because Sovryn is the first smart contract platform for Bitcoin to enable the DeFi ecosystem, and hosting Sovryn on Akash\u2019s decentralized and open-source cloud is a big win for both teams.  \\n> This partnership gives Sovryn an advantage over other DeFi ecosystems by tapping into Akash\u2019s powerful middleware layer for developers--critical for a better end-user experience. Sponsoring Sovryn\u2019s hackathon is an important way of empowering our community members by funding their projects._\\n> \\n> Greg Osuri, CEO of Akash Network\\n\\nCurrently, we see web apps running on Akash, Sovryn nodes running on Akash, and dApps with a UI or middleware layer running on Akash. In the future, we see The Unstoppable Cloud running smart contracts on Sovryn, the blockchain nodes and middleware on Akash, static client-side Javascript on a decentralized CDN like Filebase and Sia, and finally, DNS from Handshake.&nbsp;\\n\\n> _Akash Network\u2019s value proposition - and I mean this in an ethical sense - grabbed Sovryn's attention immediately when it first crossed our radar. Then we discovered their second value proposition of competitive pricing for serving data and infrastructure on distributed and decentralized networks, paired with the right economic incentives to ensure permanence in an adversarial environment. Having Akash join our Sovrython allows us to jointly develop productive relationships with developers looking to securely serve the next generation of DeFi infrastructure._\\n> \\n> exiledsurfer, year, [we announced a partnership with Solana](https://akash.network/blog/akash-partners-with-solana-to-bring-web-scale-smart-contracts-to-supercloud/) to bring web-scale smart contracts to Akash\u2019s decentralized and open-source cloud (DeCloud).\\n\\nAs we shared, Akash users will be able to leverage Solana\u2019s hyper-performant platform to run secure and scalable smart contracts and pay using Akash Token (AKT). Solana\u2019s users will be able to run distributed applications (like machine learning or web apps) and settle using Solana Token (SOL) on Akash.\\n\\nTo progress our integration and accelerate the development of Web3 and DeFi applications, we\u2019re excited to co-sponsor the Solana Season Hackathon!\\n\\nKicking off this Saturday, May 15th, and running through June 7th, 2021, the Solana Season Hackathon is being held around the world, with tracks encompassing DeFi, Web3, and NFTs across China, India, Eastern Europe, and Brazil.\\n\\nEach track will have its own set of supporting projects, a panel of judges, offline workshops, and events, and a 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place winner. Prizes include up to $1 million as well as seed funding.\\n\\nExclusive to the Solana Season Hackathon, we\u2019re offering up to $15,000 in grants and presenting four challenges for the Eastern European track. However, developers from all regions are welcome to submit and qualify to win.\\n\\nOur challenges include:\\n\\n- **Challenge 1**\\n\\n  - Deploy an open-source application on Akash MAINNET 2. Submit a deployment file (deploy.yml) to Akash to be included in the [Awesome Akash repo](https://github.com/ovrclk/awesome-akash) to be considered for a grant.\\n  - Akash\u2019s support team will provide tokens to fund the project\u2019s wallet during the hackathon, and if awarded a grant, funding will continue into the future.\\n\\n- **Challenge 2**\\n\\n  - Deploy an open-source application on Akash MAINNET 2 and integrate it with a separate decentralized storage solution.\\n  - Akash\u2019s support team will provide tokens to fund the project\u2019s wallet during the hackathon, and following. Submit an SDL file (deploy.yml) to Akash to be included in the Awesome Akash repo. You can use any decentralized storage solution (e.g. Sia, Filebase, ColdStack, Filecoin, Storj), and you can use any existing open source project.\\n\\n- **Challenge 3**\\n\\n  - Develop a gateway (bridge) between Akash and [Solana](https://docs.solana.com/cli/delegate-stake) blockchains to exchange directly.\\n\\n- **Challenge 4**\\n\\n  - Develop an integration between Akash and [Torus](https://docs.tor.us/) or another Login solution.\\n\\n**Click** [**here**](https://github.com/ovrclk/awesome-akash) **to check out the Awesome Akash repo** and see what kind of applications have already been deployed on Akash MAINNET 2.\\n\\nJudges for the hackathon include Ran Neuner, CEO of Onchain Capital; Seref Bayirli, Director of Global Business Growth at Binance; Larry Cermak, Director of Research at The Block; and Greg Osuri, CEO of Akash Network.\\n\\n[Sign up](https://solana.com/solanaszn) to participate in the Solana Season Hackathon and be sure [to join us on Discord for dev support](http://discord.akash.network/) during the hackathon!\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Network Sponsors Solana Season Hackathon to Accelerate Web 3 &amp;
