I feel like I\u2019m joining a rocketship that\u2019s about to lift off.\\n\\nA healthy, passionate, and self-sustaining global community is critical to materializing the vision of the world\u2019s first open-source cloud.\\n\\nYou may not know this, but Akash\u2019s current global community is only over a year and a half old. Over the past year, Michael Gushansky, Akash\u2019s marketing and community Jack-of-all-trades, has built and scaled The Unstoppable Cloud community into one of the fastest growing and largest communities in the Cosmos ecosystem, while also earning a devoted following of his own for his \u201cUnstoppable\u201d hair.\\n\\nQuick Akash Community Stats over 1 year:\\n\\n- 30,700+ Twitter followers and counting\\n- 13,500+ Telegram members--one of the largest in the Cosmos ecosystem\\n- 3 Chinese Community Summits with 4,000+ attendees each\\n- Established Akash Russian Telegram as the largest in the Cosmos Ecosystem\\n- 70+ global AMAs\\n\\nWe expanded our global community to China with the help of our Chinese Community Manager and Ourea Group (OG) co-founder Alex Wang, to Russia through the diligent efforts of our Russian Community Manager Andrew Hnatiuk, and we\u2019re making in-roads into Korea, and have plans underway to support additional Akash communities around the world.\\n\\nAs we accelerate Akash\u2019s next stage of growth, Michael Gushansky is transitioning fully into his global marketing role to drive campaign management and demand generation, helping expand product awareness and adoption.\\n\\nTo continue scaling our global community, while building an exceptional member experience, we needed to find the right community lead, and we searched for a long time (over 6 months!) to find the right person.\\n\\n**Today, we\u2019re excited to introduce you to Adam Wozney, our new Senior Global Community and Social Media Manager. Adam will be leading online and offline community programs that drive engagement with Akash and Akash\u2019s decentralized cloud (DeCloud), and help enable, educate, and inspire our global crypto and developer communities.**\\n\\n**(Adam will also continue our tradition of Community leads with good hair.)**\\n\\n#### **From Google to ConsenSys, Ten Years of Community Building**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nCurious and customer-centric, Adam brings a decade of community building and management experience at leading technology companies.\\n\\nBefore Akash, Adam developed and launched community initiatives at IEX Cloud, a fintech startup. Prior to that, he served as Director of Community during a pivotal period of growth for ConsenSys, where he quickly scaled community programs and built a passionate community for the Ethereum ecosystem, supporting Ethereum\u2019s wider adoption, and grew the developer community to 60,000 members.\\n\\nPrior to ConsenSys, Adam managed content, events, and community at Wix, and drove field marketing programs at Google.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620927058-balgookqgzom2ssjxy7kooolhmer5uwosvp8xkistkh6oau2uwvand30yt2elixq1a2tjtdalx4hjobprj59ezxfuyd91ghr67o5zyopcvg88qni2ecmsiee-ttbqlfb0cqgi.jpeg)\\n\\nWhat struck me most about Adam, a self-professed \u201csociologist at heart\u201d, was his curiosity, his willingness to listen, and his inclusive customer-centricity--the combination of attributes we were looking for in our Global Community leader.\\n\\n> _The more you walk in other people\u2019s shoes, the better community builder you can become. To build an inclusive, pluralistic community, you have to understand that everyone is different and one of the best ways to see that is by exploring the world around you._\\n>\\n> _My previous roles before joining Akash have also helped me develop my understanding of people. I\u2019ve sponsored events in Shanghai. I\u2019ve hosted meetups in Tel Aviv, and I\u2019ve managed community ambassadors from Guatemala, Canada, and Australia to name a few. The more I connected with people, the more I learned how to become a better community manager._\\n\\n#### **Community as a Strategic Advantage**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nBuilding and growing the passionate and devoted Ethereum community has taught Adam that Community is a strategic advantage.\\n\\nWhy is that?\\n\\n> _A million users pay for your product because you\u2019re solving a problem for them. But let\u2019s say a better product comes along at a lower cost. Those million users will happily jump ship. Whereas, 1,000 community members who not only get their problem solved by your product, but also receive intrinsic value from being a member of a community will stay, and defend you._\\n>\\n> *Passionate and engaged community members will not leave your product for just any other product that crosses their path.*&nbsp;  \\n> You can see this inside of the Ethereum community. Ethereum has some scaling issues that have been well documented. Many of those issues are being resolved in L2 and ETH2 solutions--think EIP 1559.\\n>\\n> _When newer blockchains have come along, why didn\u2019t the ETH community jump ship? Sure, partially it\u2019s because they believe in the future of ETH, but I\u2019d argue that the community built around ETH has given them something more, something besides the tech--a sense or purpose and belonging that other chains haven\u2019t._\\n>\\n> _TLDR; The more you as a company or project involve yourself in your community, the more ownership community members feel about your products._\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620927067-3uhwvfvuohfur7hjzfs6emosks7kuwnjptlse71kdzksip959a9wncjn0wlighzl7zfxparz7savkcgqetf0uj7kzzduwm0g5ehhtm9ksms6khvzeujysv6fmro6qbz5rgrp.jpeg)\\n\\n#### **On Joining The Unstoppable Cloud**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nHaving joined ConsenSys in late 2017, Adam witnessed the incredible developments, as well as the hype, excitement, and cash grabs of that period in crypto.\\n\\n> _I witnessed projects that were straight up cash grabs. Hey Bitconnect, not cool bro!_\\n>\\n> _I bring this up because when I was first approached by Akash, without first reading the whitepaper, my mind went immediately to, \u201chere we go, another pie in the sky project!_\\n\\nSo how did we convince Adam to join?\\n\\n> _Once I dug deeper, I found a project that is very real, and a team that is even more real! A marketplace for cloud compute is interesting by itself, but with crypto economic incentives, you have unique and powerful motivation for leaving traditional cloud providers. I feel like I\u2019m joining a rocketship that\u2019s about to lift off._\\n\\n#### **Presence as a Driver of Community Building**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nThere\u2019s no magic bullet for building a great community, but over ten years of learning, Adam has found that all successful community professionals are present.\\n\\n> _Being present means multiple things\u2014it means:_\\n>\\n> \u2022 _following through on your promises_  \\n> \u2022 _supporting the community through difficult times_  \\n> \u2022 _listening to the needs of members_  \\n> \u2022 _providing experiences that are memorable_\\n>\\n> _The more involved and the more present you are in a community, the more present other community members will choose to be._\\n>\\n> _When I look at great community teams, the ones that stand out are the ones that treat themselves as just another member of the community. They get just as excited about a new product launch or a product feature as the rest of the community does._\\n>\\n> _When community teams treat their community members as friends and not just users, that\u2019s when magic can happen._\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620927075-mbm1ndwkt0motpuarodekh20wijangh9lasyhqq7baaebkl2h8fb1nloo3fly4uyrttzbwn2eyr4k2hvunyaetyheqaw79pofnloxlvje9t7ocy4voik1kkp8vczce99ncngef.jpeg)\\n\\n#### **Scaling The Unstoppable Cloud Global Community**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nA big function of Adam\u2019s role will be to listen and to get community feedback. Gregarious and a born connector, Adam is most excited about the opportunity to do this by traveling to engage community members in person, and not just virtually.\\n\\nHe\u2019s also excited about enabling developers more freedom and flexibility to build. How will he know that we\u2019re successful?\\n\\n> _There are two things that feed off of each other in a company's growth--community health metrics and company health metrics. Community health metrics are number of active community members, number of RSVPs to an event, or community engagement numbers like message volume, for example._\\n>\\n> _Company health metrics are numbers of active users, number of new users or number of retained users. My aim is to provide SMART community goals that ladder up to business goals. SMART goals are Specific, Measurable, Attainable, Realistic and Timely._\\n\\n#### **Staying Unstoppable Outside of Work**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nHealthy body, healthy mind. Adam definitely espouses this ethos, biking around New York City at least four times a week and indoor climbing three to four times a week.\\n\\n> _Climbing is great. It\u2019s a sport that not only supports a healthy body, but it\u2019s very mental. Flexing those mental muscles are just as important as flexing your biceps._\\n>\\n> _I also try to get through at least one book a month, though some books take a little longer. I just finished a great book called, \u201cThink Again.\u201d It\u2019s all about letting go of what you think you know, and approaching things as a scientist would approach an experiment._\\n\\nThat\u2019s pretty aligned with Adam\u2019s listen-first approach.\\n\\n**Say \u2018hi\u2019 to Adam today in our community!**\\n\\n[**Join Our Telegram**](https://t.me/AkashNW)\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Introducing Adam Wozney, Akash Senior Global Community Manager&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;A marketplace for cloud compute is interesting by itself, but with crypto economic incentives, you have unique and powerful motivation for leaving traditional cloud providers. I feel like I\u2019m joining a rocketship that\u2019s about to lift off.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2021-05-10T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Team&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Team&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Maly Ly&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.CpY199ix.jpg&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1200],&quot;height&quot;:[0,675],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;jpg&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/introducing-adam-wozney-akash-senior-global-community-manager/banner-image.jpg&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-mainnet-2-update-april-29-2021/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-mainnet-2-update-april-29-2021&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\nAkash MAINNET 2 ([v0.10.1](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/releases/tag/v0.10.1)) launched on March 8th, and since then, we\u2019ve seen an exciting diversity of apps deployed on Akash, and we\u2019ll be sharing many of these pioneering use cases in the coming weeks.&nbsp;We\u2019ve had a 10x increase in deployments since the launch of MAINNET 2.\\n\\nSince the launch of the world\u2019s first decentralized cloud, our team has focused on strengthening and improving ecosystem security and interoperability, provider capabilities, and deployment UX to make it faster for developers to deploy.\\n\\nThis second MAINNET 2 update refers to the latest release ([v0.12.1](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/releases/tag/v0.12.1)) and incorporates all [changes](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/compare/v0.10.1...v0.12.1) since MAINNET 2 launch.\\n\\nWe\u2019re building out our ecosystem of partners to enable production-grade applications:&nbsp; traditional cloud-native, serverless, machine learning, and decentralized projects (DeFi, dApps, DAOs). We\u2019ll democratize the acquisition of compute by offering developers unprecedented choice--not only in where they deploy and how fast they\u2019ll be able to&nbsp;deploy, but also at a price they want to pay.\\n\\nOur goal is to change the power dynamics and put developers in control (self-sovereign).\\n\\nWe update frequently as we progress the platform. You can always check the [releases](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/releases) page in our GitHub repo for the latest enhancements and fixes.\\n\\n**NETWORK USAGE**\\n\\nThe most important KPI that we\u2019re monitoring is _Active Leases - Daily, Monthly_ (DAL/MAL).\\n\\nThis indicates new deployments per day. Note: deployments can be _active_ for more than 1 day. The day after our launch, we had 3 DAL and are now averaging 50.\\n\\nThere are a few other KPIs that we are tracking. We\u2019ll soon have a network stats page that will show the relevant KPIs that indicate network usage and growth.\\n\\n**IMPROVED UX FOR TENANTS**\\n\\nWe\u2019ve made several improvements to our Command Line Interface (CLI) for developers to make deploying faster and more streamlined.\\n\\n- [#1165](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/issues/1165) - changed default to query for all provider attributes if no arguments are provided. Makes it faster to vouch for the provider via signing for all attributes at once\\n\\n- [#1153](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/issues/1153) - improved error reporting\\n\\n- [#1187](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/issues/1187) - improved support for hardware wallets (e.g. [Ledger](https://shop.ledger.com/pages/hardware-wallets-comparison))\\n\\n- [#1151](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/issues/1151) - output and error messages stream to stdout/stderr\\n\\n- [#1149](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/issues/1149) - improved output messages when using option flags. Default is scoped to option flags\\n\\n**SAFETY NET FEATURE**\\n\\nWe recently added a safety net for Tenants. If a manifest is not sent to a provider within some period of time after a lease is created, the provider will close the lease. This safety net prevents tenants from paying for leases that do not have any workloads running.\\n\\n**PROVIDER PRICING**\\n\\n[Pricing Update](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/pull/1173): To account for Akash Token\u2019s (AKT) rising prices, providers will need a way to offer lower bids than the current minimum of 1 uAKT, or 0.000001 AKT. Included in this update is the first step towards implementing fractional uAKT pricing, and involves switching the pricing variables from integer type to decimal type.\\n\\nUltimately, providers will be able to structure their pricing in such a way that they may earn 0.25 uAKT per block and be able to withdraw 1 uAKT every four blocks.\\n\\n_In the future, we will support fractional uAKT._\\n\\n**IMPROVED NETWORK PERFORMANCE**\\n\\nWe now preemptively stop broadcasting so that as more providers come online, invalid transactions will not affect network performance. Providers only bid on deployments that attributes have been audited for, and have the correct signature. [This](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/pull/1162) determines which provider is allowed to bid, in order.\\n\\nThis reduces the network congestion on the blockchain for improved performance, and enables pre-filtering of acceptable matches. An additional filter has been added that enables providers to not bid on groups where the calculated price is too high ([#1147](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/pull/1147)).\\n\\n**CLIENT CERTIFICATES AUTO CREATE**\\n\\n[Client Certificates Check](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/pull/1169): To establish secure connections between Tenants and Providers on Akash, an mTLS certificate must be created and stored on-chain. If the certificate was not created, and a Tenant tried to use the deploy tool to create a deployment, the process would fail and the user\u2019s transaction fee would be wasted.\\n\\nThis fix now requires a certificate file to be present and on-chain before the transaction is broadcast to the network. It will auto-create if one doesn\u2019t exist.\\n\\n**ECOSYSTEM**\\n\\n- Security improvements to the ecosystem: [Cosmos SDK](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/pull/1171) and [Tendermint](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/pull/1202).\\n\\n- [Reliability improvement](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/pull/1193) _-_ This improves the reliability of the transaction written to the blockchain. Today, the transaction has a 10 second timeout. At times, it can take longer for approval by enough validators. We ensure that this timeout doesn\u2019t result in an error. We now auto-retry to check if the transaction is recorded, enabling the deployment workflow.\\n\\n- IBC is now live! - InterBlockchain Communication protocol enables interoperability between multiple blockchains in the Cosmos ecosystem. We\u2019re one of the core contributors to the Cosmos and Tendermint open-source projects.&nbsp; As core developers of the IBC relayer, we\u2019re excited to announce that IBC is now live on Akash. With IBC, Akash enables ATOM to AKT swap via Cosmos HUB, and multi-currency settlement, thus enhancing liquidity.\\n\\n**UPDATED FAQ**\\n\\nWe started consolidating developer questions into an [FAQ](https://akash.network/docs/documentation/faq) and will continue to expand this resource.\\n\\n#### **Don\u2019t Miss the Latest MAINNET 2, Akash, and AKT News!**\\n\\n\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\n\\n[**Join our Telegram**](https://t.me/AkashNW) for the latest news, giveaways, and invites to special events!\\n\\n[**Join our Discord developer chat**](https://discord.com/invite/DxftX67) for technical support and information.\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash MAINNET 2 Update: April 29, 2021&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash MAINNET 2 v0.10.1 launched on March 8th, and since then, we\u2019ve seen an exciting diversity of apps deployed on Akash, and we\u2019ll be sharing many of these pioneering use cases in the coming weeks. We\u2019ve had a 10x increase in deployments since the launch of MAINNET 2.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2021-05-05T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Neil Gehani&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.CPRAb1D2.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1200],&quot;height&quot;:[0,675],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-mainnet-2-update-april-29-2021/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akashcraft-minecraft-on-the-first-decentralized-cloud/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akashcraft-minecraft-on-the-first-decentralized-cloud&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\nWith the launch of Akash MAINNET 2, the world\u2019s first decentralized open-source cloud, developers can finally break free from the limitations of traditional cloud infrastructure.\\n\\nFor the first time, not only can developers deploy standard cloud applications, but [they can also launch DeFi apps, blogs, games, data visualizations, block explorers, blockchain nodes, and other blockchain network components _**on a lower cost, censorship-resistant and scalable decentralized cloud**_](https://github.com/ovrclk/awesome-akash).\\n\\nFor many users, the most entertaining apps deployed on Akash so far are games which include Minesweeper, Snake, Pac-man, SuperMario, and Doom.\\n\\nThree weeks ago, MAINNET 2 saw the first ever deployment of a Minecraft server on a decentralized cloud. For perspective, Minecraft is the fifth most played game in the world with 126 million current users, and _now, all its users can play Minecraft on Akash_.\\n\\nThis is significant for many reasons. First, running Minecraft on Akash means countless other games can run on the network as well. Secondly, we are positioned to unlock the benefits of Akash to a massive and entirely new user base, including developers, gamers, and businesses.\\n\\n#### **Minecraft in the World\u2019s First Open-Source Cloud**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620925257-2021-04-2316-48-54-1024x640.png)\\n\\nIn collaboration with the MothRuby community, we will be running a scavenger hunt for 1000 AKT in the world\u2019s first Minecraft server hosted on Akash. Akashcraft will be the first scavenger hunt ever for a cryptocurrency in a Minecraft server hosted on a decentralized cloud. Yes, this is _extremely_ meta. Yes, you should be excited for this historic event.\\n\\nAkashcraft lies at the intersection of blockchain, gaming, and cloud. With over 3.42 billion gamers and counting, gaming has become one of the biggest industries in the world. Advances in mobile gaming, edge computing and cloud technology are moving gaming to the cloud, and Akash is poised to support the growing cloud gaming industry.\\n\\n#### **What is MothRuby?**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620925359-mothwoobie-1024x760.png)\\n\\nMothRuby is a gaming community focused on the integration of&nbsp; Akash Network and gaming. Members of MothRuby aim to bring existing game server hosting onto Akash to leverage the cost savings and decentralized benefits of hosted applications on the world\u2019s first decentralized cloud. MothRuby also aims to build out entirely new games on Akash.\\n\\nFor the first event, MothRuby is partnering with Akash Network to host the first Minecraft world on the decentralized cloud: **Akashcraft**!\\n\\nBe on the lookout for a tutorial series on how to accomplish your own version of Akashcraft on Akash. [Please join the MothRuby Discord](https://discord.gg/ADf5XfnR8T) if you\u2019re interested in being a part of the MothRuby community.\\n\\n#### **Akashcraft Instructions**\\n\\n\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\n\\n**The server details will be given out during a special livestream event this Saturday, June 19, 2021 at 3PM UTC.** Leading up to the release of Akashcraft, please download Minecraft and familiarize yourself with the game. [Here is a link to getting the game](https://help.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/360029685252-How-do-I-install-Minecraft-Java-Edition-).\\n\\nThe server will be hosted on the Minecraft Java Edition, so make sure you have this version prior to the start of the event. [Here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bUudx1cPiAA) is a link to a tutorial to learn how to navigate your way around Survival Mode.\\n\\n#### **Akashcraft Server Details**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nThe Akashcraft server contains three cities - a large city to the east of Spawn, and two smaller towns North and South of Spawn along a road leading from the large city.\\n\\nChests containing private keys to AKT wallets will be hidden inside and around the structures within the cities. Castles, nearby farm buildings, lookout towers along roads - all hold AKT rewards, as well as anywhere on the surface within city walls (meaning you probably won't find any AKT in a far-away desert). Chests may also contain weapons, items, or potions that will help you out in the server--just because you found a chest does not guarantee there will be AKT inside!\\n\\nAny chest that contains AKT will be located next to a player-specific [Ender Chest](https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Ender_Chest). The contents of Ender Chests can only be viewed by you, so any loot or AKT you find can be placed in an Ender Chest (a darker color than usual chests) to be reclaimed upon death.\\n\\nIf you are standing in the Spawn location that contains the Akash Network logo, you will not be able to attack or be attacked by other players; however, the rest of the world will have player-versus-player (PvP) enabled for high stakes!\\n\\n\\\\*You may succumb to death from mobs and other players, and will drop your whole inventory on death, so make sure you take precautions to prepare yourself for combat.\\n\\n#### **Before the Akashcraft Event**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nPrior to the event, it would be wise to create your main AKT wallet. [Here](https://medium.com/cosmostation/how-to-create-your-personal-akash-network-akt-account-on-cosmostation-wallet-ios-android-web-16e51b568400#:~:text=How%20to%20create%2Fimport%20a,dashboard%20of%20Cosmostation%20Web%20Wallet.&amp;text=Press%20%E2%80%9CImport%20Wallet%2C%E2%80%9D%20type,is%20encrypted%20using%20the%20PIN.) is a guide to set up a Cosmostation AKT wallet. During the event, you might be tempted to immediately import your recently discovered AKT funds to your main wallet for maximum safety, _but this distraction could put your character in danger!_\\n\\nIf you choose to store them for later, you might risk having the AKT pillaged by other players on the server. Navigating these choices is part of what makes the stakes of this event so high!\\n\\n#### **Akashcraft Server Rules**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nModerators will be present during the scavenger hunt to ensure that both the Discord and Minecraft environments remain free of unpleasantries. **Please do not** spam chats or engage in distasteful remarks while chatting on MothRuby servers.\\n\\nFor any other questions on server rules or details, hop on over to the [MothRuby discord server](https://discord.gg/ADf5XfnR8T) where a moderator will be happy to assist.\\n\\n#### **Akashcraft Livestream**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620925375-akashcraftlivestream-twitter-1024x576.png)\\n\\nJoin Akash Senior Marketing Manager [Michael Gushansky](https://akash.network/blog/introducing-michael-gushansky/) and [Crypto Moth](https://twitter.com/JustaCryptoMoth) for a special livestream event Friday 4/30 6PM PST. They\u2019ll be discussing the origin of Akashcraft, walking through gameplay and taking questions from the audience! 5 lucky winners will leave with limited edition Akashcraft merch.\\n\\n[Join the livestream!](https://youtu.be/jKv5OPhB_-c)\\n\\n####\\n\\n**Important Dates**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n**Livestream:** 4/30/21 6PM - 7PM PST\\n\\n#### **Connect with us**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nMinecraft is one of countless games that can run on Akash DeCloud. If you\u2019re interested in deploying games on Akash, we\u2019d love to connect with you!\\n\\nPlease complete this [google form](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeSo8fBBapxLJsV3frpFljMJbZ8NR3qRNLiouJOWIk9E4EqVw/viewform?usp=sf_link) and a representative from Akash will reach out to you.\\n\\nAkash DeCloud is a perfect fit for high-growth industries, like gaming, that need a more scalable, cost-efficient, and resilient cloud solution.\\n\\nWe\u2019re incredibly excited to host you in the world\u2019s first Minecraft server hosted on the world\u2019s first decentralized and open-source cloud.\\n\\nJoin a guild or scavenge by yourself. Explore the world of Akashcraft and earn AKT rewards on your quest.\\n\\nHappy hunting Akashians!\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akashcraft: Minecraft on the First Decentralized Cloud&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;With the launch of Akash MAINNET 2, the world\u2019s first decentralized open-source cloud, developers can finally break free from the limitations of traditional cloud infrastructure. For the first time, not only can developers deploy standard cloud applications, but they can also launch DeFi apps, blogs, games, data visualizations, block explorers, blockchain nodes, and other blockchain network components on a lower cost, censorship-resistant and scalable decentralized cloud.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2021-04-27T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Insights&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Insights&quot;],[0,&quot;Product&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Michael Gushansky&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.Ddl9LLUx.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1200],&quot;height&quot;:[0,675],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akashcraft-minecraft-on-the-first-decentralized-cloud/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-network-partners-with-certik-certik/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-network-partners-with-certik-certik&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;  \\nAt Akash, we\u2019ve been fortunate to partner with organizations who share our vision for an open, safe, and unstoppable cloud that unlocks capabilities for the data-driven technologies of the future.&nbsp;\\n\\nToday, we\u2019re thrilled to announce a partnership with [CertiK](https://www.certik.io/), the leading Blockchain and Smart Contract Cybersecurity company. CertiK Chain provides developers with coding safeguards and flexibility, facilitating blockchain adoption for developers and large enterprises while empowering trust in blockchain technology.&nbsp;\\n\\nThis partnership materializes the potential and promise of Web3. To demonstrate Web 3.0\u2019s capabilities, Jay Jie\u2019s CertiK nodes were&nbsp;deployed on Akash MAINNET 2, the world\u2019s first decentralized cloud, via Starlink WiFi.&nbsp;\\n\\nThrough this partnership, CertiK\u2019s clients will be able to decentralize their cloud infrastructure on Akash\u2019s permissionless, censorship-resistant, and lower cost open-source cloud platform, while ensuring on-chain protection backed by CertiK\u2019s trusted products and services. Akash Network\u2019s community will be able to leverage CertiK\u2019s industry-leading suite of security solutions to secure deployments and node operations on decentralized cloud.\\n\\n> At CertiK, we've always admired what Akash has done for the general Cosmos community and the blockchain industry as a whole. We are a true believer in the DeCloud movement led by Akash Network. As we are seeing more and more projects joining the web3 revolution, it is only right if CertiK and Akash join forces to deliver a secure, scalable, and truly decentralized cloud that is not only cost-efficient but also powered by the people.\\n> \\n>   \\n> **Jay Jie, Head of CertiK Chain**\\n\\nWith [Akash MAINNET 2](https://akash.network/blog/akash-decloud-mainnet-2-teaser/), decentralized finance (DeFi), decentralized applications (dApp), and decentralized organizations (DAO), will now be able to migrate from their existing centralized cloud providers like Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud, or Microsoft Azure, to Akash, the first viable decentralized cloud solution in the market.&nbsp; And now with CertiK, they can layer on monitoring and security, providing an extra layer of protection in the DeCloud.\\n\\nAkash Network and CertiK are also exploring the possibility of deploying Pancake Swap\u2019s front-end on a decentralized cloud to demonstrate the capabilities of a censorship-resistant and permissionless cloud, protected by CertiK\u2019s cloud security product, [CertiKShield](https://shield.certik.foundation/), a decentralized on-chain tool to reimburse lost or stolen assets. DeFi protocols and users can leverage CertiKShield as a hedge against audits.&nbsp;\\n\\n> We\u2019re thrilled to partner with CertiK, a leader and pioneer in blockchain cybersecurity, to enable DeFi and blockchain projects to decentralize their cloud infrastructure, while layering on cutting-edge monitoring and security technologies. Together, we will expand the capabilities of Web3, enabling developers to build faster, with more freedom and security, and at lower cost.\\n> \\n>   \\n> **Boz Menzalji, COO of Akash Network**\\n\\n  \\nClick [here](https://github.com/jim380/certik-on-akash) to start migrating your CertiK nodes to Akash\u2019s decentralized open-source cloud.  \\n\\n  \\n  \\n**For the latest Akash, AKT, and Mainnet 2 news and promotions:**  \\n\\n[Join our Telegram!](https://t.me/AkashNW)&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Network Partners with CertiK&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;At Akash, we\u2019ve been fortunate to partner with organizations who share our vision for an open, safe, and unstoppable cloud that unlocks capabilities for the data-driven technologies of the future.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2021-04-22T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Partners&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Partners&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Kelsey Ruiz&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.C018RJTt.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1200],&quot;height&quot;:[0,675],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-network-partners-with-certik-certik/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-network-partners-with-hashquark-the-worlds-largest-staking-service-provider/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-network-partners-with-hashquark-the-worlds-largest-staking-service-provider&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;  \\nWe\u2019re excited to announce a partnership with HashQuark, the largest Asian staking company and one of the world\u2019s largest validators.&nbsp;\\n\\nSince 2018, HashQuark, a member of HashKey Group, has provided the most secure, stable, and convenient enterprise-level staking services, and is dedicated to supporting vital blockchain infrastructure and the safe operating of mainstream Proof of Stake (PoS) blockchains. Currently, HashQuark runs nodes for over 40 blockchain projects including Polkadot, Klaytn, Cosmos, Dfinity, and has partnered with the world\u2019s leading crypto wallets, exchanges, and capital firms. HashQuark will also be joining Akash Network\u2019s validator set.&nbsp;\\n\\n> Our partnership with Akash Network represents our belief and trust in their professional team and forward-looking plans. We are thrilled to work with Akash Network and become part of this awesome project, helping its network vastly expand while ensuring security, paving the way for a more enabling public blockchain ecology.\\n> \\n>   \\n> **Leo Li, CEO of HashQuark.**\\n\\nWe had the opportunity to connect with Leo Li, CEO of HashQuark, and a pioneer of the staking ecosystem, to get his take on supporting PoS blockchains and hear more about what they look for when partnering with new projects.&nbsp;  \\n\\n#### **Interview with Leo Li, Chief Executive Officer at HashQuark**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620925267-hashquark-ceo-1024x1000.png)\\n\\n  \\n\\n**HashQuark is one of the world's largest validators--what did the beginnings of HashQuark look like, and how has it grown since then?**  \\n\\nHashQuark was initially launched in late 2018 as a staking service provider, namely to offer attractive staking rewards for those who delegate their tokens to us. As the blockchain industry continues to thrive and our team grows, we began to serve enterprise-level clients and KOLs, apart from common users.&nbsp;  \\n\\nThat\u2019s when we recognized the value of the blockchain infrastructure and decided to develop ourselves into a professional and all-around infrastructure service provider, creating true value while safeguarding the security of proof-of-stake (PoS) backed blockchains by way of node operation.&nbsp;  \\n\\nWe\u2019ve joined several high-quality PoS-backed projects and partnered with many enterprises and institutions in terms of security, asset management, and trading. With the help of our extensive industry resources, we\u2019ve developed a diverse array of businesses, including node operation, delegation service, node set-up guide, and dedicated tools and products for different projects.&nbsp;  \\n  \\n\\n**HashQuark supports all mainstream Proof of Stake (PoS) blockchains. Why is supporting PoS blockchains important to the company versus Proof of Work (PoW)?**  \\n\\nWe\u2019ve thought highly of the PoS blockchain even before our official launch for a few reasons:&nbsp;\\n\\n1\\\\. We believe that blockchain will create a distributed business counterpart parallel to the physical one. However, for the moment it is widely accepted that most PoW blockchains do poorly in performance and are less friendly to common users; it\u2019s undoubtedly a major barrier to mass adoption and the promotion of use cases in the commercial field. The PoS-like consensus mechanisms, by contrast, do better in all the above aspects.  \\n\\n2\\\\. PoS now represents the general trend in the world of blockchain, as evidenced by the launch of so many high-quality projects such as ETH2.0, Polkadot, Cardano, and Akash.&nbsp;  \\n\\n3\\\\. The staking economy still has a lot to discover and develop, and we\u2019re excited to witness and grow with the promising industry as things are just beginning to take off. Staking, as a critical component of the DeFi system, will inevitably continue to develop with the prosperity of DeFi, and that\u2019s also why we have always thought highly of its future.  \\n  \\n\\n**HashQuark currently supports Eth 2.0, Binance, Polkadot, Cardano among other networks. How do you select what projects to partner with, and what attracted you to work with Akash Network?**&nbsp;  \\n\\nThere are three aspects we look at when evaluating a project:  \\n\\n1\\\\. Mainnet Launch: we prefer a PoS project that has launched to mainnet because it means it is technologically mature and that block producers and delegators can take part in the staking process.  \\n\\n2\\\\. DApps: we look to see if DApps are running on top of its distributed system. That\u2019s partly because we believe that the staking economy means more than staking services alone. Decentralized applications help constitute real successful and scalable blockchain projects.  \\n\\n3\\\\. Community: Lastly, we look for a well-developed community. Consensus among the community is what we believe matters in the staking economy\u2014or rather, in the blockchain industry.  \\n\\nWe were amazed by the concept of Akash\u2019s decentralized open-source cloud and recognized the significance and need for a DeCloud in the entire blockchain industry. Akash is lower-cost, more effective, and flexible, and HashQuark has expertise in blockchain infrastructure, a solid foundation for the decentralized cloud. We believe our partnership will help provide cloud services in a more decentralized manner.  \\n  \\n\\n**What blockchain/crypto sectors or types of projects are you currently excited about, and why?**  \\n\\nWe are currently interested in the now popular sectors of DeFi and NFT projects, both of which are great applications of blockchain and have attracted some traditional institutions.  \\n  \\n\\n**How do you envision blockchain changing the world?**\\n\\nWe\u2019ve seen an overwhelming digital/virtual tendency over our real, physical lives, especially after the year 2020. There\u2019s no doubt that in a more digital, _fiction-like_ world, identity is something not to miss, and only with a blockchain-based value Internet is there a real possibility of such a system.\\n\\nA few years ago, the World Economic Forum predicted that by 2025, 10% of the world\u2019s assets will be based on the blockchain. That\u2019s also what we envision in the future of the world when it comes to blockchain.  \\n  \\n\\n**If you had the opportunity to give advice to your younger self as you start venturing into the world of blockchain, what would it be?**  \\n\\nAlways have faith in the blockchain and Bitcoin.  \\n  \\n\\n**How can people get started earning rewards/staking AKT today?**&nbsp;  \\n\\nThere are generally two ways: delegation and node operation. But for most common players with limited access to relevant resources and technical know-how, we suggest the former one.&nbsp;  \\n  \\n\\n#### **Get the Latest Akash and AKT Token News and Giveaways!**\\n\\n[Join the Unstoppable Cloud](https://t.me/AkashNW)&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Network Partners with HashQuark, the World's Largest Staking+ Service Provider&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;We\u2019re excited to announce a partnership with HashQuark, the largest Asian staking company and one of the world\u2019s largest validators.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2021-04-20T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Partners&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Partners&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Kelsey Ruiz&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.TyCUBp_w.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1600],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1200],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-network-partners-with-hashquark-the-worlds-largest-staking-service-provider/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;wen-marketing-growing-the-first-open-source-cloud/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;wen-marketing-growing-the-first-open-source-cloud&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;  \\nWen Marketing?  \\n\\nFor me it started at the age of 7. After escaping landmines in the jungle of Cambodia, I had my first marketing role ever--convincing Khmer Rouge soldiers to let us cross the border to Thailand, and to the beginning of freedom.&nbsp;  \\n\\nMy path to Akash Network, and to the decentralized future of the cloud, was not a linear one. I\u2019m drawn to audacious challenges and transformative solutions that improve human experience.\\n\\n#### **From Star Wars, to 3D Printed Rockets, to DeCloud**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nOver the past 18 years, I\u2019ve helped materialize ideas and solutions that have never existed before, at companies including [Relativity](https://www.relativityspace.com/), [Eventbrite](https://www.eventbrite.com/l/sell-tickets/?&amp;mkwid=s_dc&amp;pcrid=436502086719&amp;pkw=eventbrite&amp;pmt=e&amp;plc=&amp;_bk=eventbrite&amp;_bt=436502086719&amp;_bm=e&amp;_bn=g&amp;gclid=Cj0KCQjwpdqDBhCSARIsAEUJ0hPwXBhdbyDhJv4tXf-dtWR5B46bNjCg8wPZQAIiqnG1w4IEZuCCrpkaAoOUEALw_wcB&amp;gclsrc=aw.ds), [AdRoll](https://www.adroll.com/), [Lucasfilm](https://www.lucasfilm.com/) / [Disney](https://www.disney.com/), [Square Enix](https://square-enix-games.com/en_US/home), [Ubisoft](https://www.ubisoft.com/en-us/), and [Nintendo](https://www.nintendo.com/). I\u2019ve developed and launched top 10 selling Star Wars, Tomb Raider, and Nintendo products.  \\n\\nIn the last 10 years, I\u2019ve helped founders realize their visions--the bigger, the better, and grown three early-stage startups to profitability and unicorn status ($1+ billion market cap).  \\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620925203-106734073-1602081721357-relativityspacetemplar-1024x576.jpeg)\\n\\n_Relativity_\\n\\nI met Akash Network\u2019s CEO, Greg Osuri when I was still at Relativity helping build humanity\u2019s multi-planetary future with robots, 3D printing, and rockets. Coming from a country devastated by authoritarian control, Greg\u2019s vision of a permissionless, self-sovereign, censorship-resistant, and decentralized open-source cloud deeply resonated with me.  \\n\\nAs more of our work and play continues to move online, an open-source cloud is critical for increasing access, freedom, privacy, and sovereignty for builders of the Internet, and empowers people around the world with control over their online future.  \\n\\nIn my 20 years in Silicon Valley, Akash was one of the few companies I\u2019d encountered that leveraged blockchain to solve a problem that almost all organizations faced--the ability to grow and scale, fast.&nbsp;  \\n\\nInspired by Akash\u2019s potential to transform the next generation of the Internet, I joined first as an Advisor, and after helping Relativity raise its Series C, I joined full-time as Chief Growth Officer to help build the world\u2019s first open-source cloud, and to drive global awareness, engagement, and growth.\\n\\n#### **Bootstrapping Growth for the World\u2019s First Decentralized Cloud**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620926937-23stqj0p0um-ilyah9mapnm5csdaqwxyfkus3oxg6sh04y1brpw6z4np8ilro6onmtlmyw20k73sfwmvb76vbx3tolbsztklhpegest3vipd-gjvvgh2zgj3vpbhjuxdwjn0bim.jpeg)\\n\\nIn October 2019 when I joined, I was fortunate to convince Michael Gushansky to join me as Marketing and Community Manager. Coming from music, events, and auto industries, Michael\u2019s extensive capabilities in online and offline community building, and his award-winning work in Sales and Customer Service in startup environments convinced me that he would thrive at our (then scrappy) enterprise.  \\n\\nA little known fun fact is that Michael happens to be a renowned DJ, and both of us are also music and event promoters in California, which is how we first met.&nbsp;  \\n\\nAs a tiny but mighty Growth team of two, with limited resources and no budget, we had no time or money to waste. We couldn\u2019t afford to make many mistakes. We studied similar projects and startups that had both failed and succeeded. We canvassed their channels and their content, tracked the tone and message volume of their social media, and then we experimented.&nbsp;  \\n\\nI brought best practices from over 18 years of building some of the world\u2019s most beloved brands, and we leveraged the four pillars I\u2019d leaned on to bootstrap my previous startups to hyper-growth and profitability--Content, Community, Campaigns, and Communications.\\n\\n  \\n**CONTENT**  \\n\\nContent is the fuel for marketing and community efforts. Relevant and valuable content delivered through multiple channels is the foundation for acquisition and retention efforts, especially with the dramatic shift in the buying process and attention economy.  \\n\\n*   94% use online research in their purchase journey\\n    \\n*   3x more traffic to B2B websites with 11+ blogs/month\\n    \\n*   67% complete buy process prior to brand engagement\\n    \\n\\nWhy is content at the core of my growth strategy? Content optimizes online channels so the right prospects find us, increases brand awareness and preference, influences purchase path and decision, and generates quality leads for less money. I also noticed that most of our analogues in crypto didn\u2019t invest in content, and realized it had the additional benefit of differentiating us from other projects.  \\n\\nInstrumental to our content efforts is Creative Content Manager and Visual Designer Olive Kimoto, a creative polymath who joined us last May.&nbsp;  \\n\\nIn addition to product, partnership, exchange, and team announcements, we also feature topics across cloud, crypto, and the future of dWeb. We\u2019ll continue to expand our global content and cadence while leveraging content marketing and SEO best practices.\\n\\n  \\n**COMMUNITY**  \\n\\nA healthy, supportive, and self-sustaining global community is essential to the success of Akash. Over the past year (in one of his three full-time roles at Akash), Michael has successfully led a dedicated global community team to build one of the largest communities in the Cosmos ecosystem.&nbsp;  \\n\\nThis past year, we expanded our global community to China with the help of our Chinese Community Manager and OG Group co-founder Alex Wang, and to Russia with the dedicated efforts of our Russian Community Manager Andrew Hnatiuk, and now, Korea.  \\n\\nThe foundation of our community growth is an exceptional member experience, content, and cadence.\\n\\n  \\n**CAMPAIGNS**  \\n\\nIntegrating campaigns across content, community, communications, and acquisition marketing enabled us to exceed key Growth metrics for Akash\u2019s utility token, AKT,&nbsp;and for Akash DeCloud. The weekly cadence of our campaigns enabled us to grow exponentially, as each channel was maximized to reinforce and strengthen our brand and positioning.  \\n\\nOur biweekly content and community promotions, as well as our Supermini pre-order campaign last year, allowed us to test and optimize across new channels. In the coming months, Michael will be focused on scaling our Growth Marketing funnel.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922422-akashsuperminifrontside-1024x576.jpg)\\n\\n  \\n**COMMUNICATIONS**  \\n\\nAs the fourth Growth pillar, communications encompasses thought leadership, public relations, analyst relations, events, and influencer marketing. I've helped take early stage startups to growth stage and unicorn status with communications as a key driver--it's a growth multiplier when done right.&nbsp;  \\n\\nAfter a long search, we were thrilled to have Kelsey Ruiz join the Dream Team as Head of Communications this past quarter. An award-winning Communications specialist with extensive experience building large developer communities, Kelsey previously directed communications at Ethereum Classic Labs, Leaf Group, and AngelHack, where she managed 50+ events and hackathons globally for a community of 175,000 developers.  \\n\\nKelsey will develop and run online and offline content and communications programs that will inspire and engage global audiences with our vision. She'll help drive brand and product awareness and engagement among journalists, influencers, and developers.\\n\\n#### **2020 Growth Results**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nIn only one year, we launched and promoted 4 successful testnets, including the three phases of The Akashian Challenge, and the historic MVP of the world\u2019s first open-source cloud, Akash MAINNET 2.  \\n\\nWe worked with CEO, Greg Osuri to develop specs for the Akash Supermini portable supercomputer, and progressed the design with creative duo Guillermo Sanchez del Corral and Rafael Saenz of debuti, and industrial designer Sungbum Park.&nbsp;  \\n\\nIn the second half of this year, we announced partnerships with Solana, Kava, Cosmos, Tendermint, Interchain Foundation, Chainlink, and Equinix Metal, the largest data center provider in the world. We also announced five exchange partnerships starting with BitMax (now AscendEx), with Gate.io as our latest listing partner.  \\n\\nAdditional Growth Results:\\n\\n*   In the past 52 weeks, we\u2019ve launched **111 blog articles**\\\\--about 2+ articles a week.\\n    \\n*   Grew Twitter from **800 to 28,000 followers** and counting\\n    \\n*   Grew Telegram from **1,000 to 14,400 members**\\\\--one of the largest in the Cosmos ecosystem\\n    \\n*   Produced **3 Chinese Community Summits with 4,000+ attendees each**\\n    \\n*   Established Akash Russian Telegram, **the largest in the Cosmos Ecosystem**\\n    \\n*   Produced over **70 global AMAs/Interviews**\\n    \\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620925368-team3-1024x706.png)\\n\\n#### **Growth in Q2 2021**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nNow that Akash MAINNET 2 has launched, our team will be focused on the following objectives for the next quarter:\\n\\n1.  Accelerate global awareness of Akash DeCloud and Akash Token (AKT)\\n    \\n2.  Drive product adoption among developers and organizations in the decentralized ecosystem\\n    \\n3.  Increase access to AKT\\n    \\n\\nWant to learn how we\u2019re planning to achieve these goals? Join us this **Friday, April 16, at 9 am PST**, for the Wen Marketing? Livestream. Bring your questions to our Q&amp;A, and win exclusive giveaways.  \\n  \\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620926960-wenmarketing-newtime-1024x576.png)\\n\\n  \\n\\n[Tune in here!](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BzCyXRr8y3c)&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Wen Marketing? Growing the First Open-Source Cloud&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Wen Marketing?&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2021-04-15T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Insights&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Insights&quot;],[0,&quot;Team&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Maly Ly&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.D60s2wy9.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1200],&quot;height&quot;:[0,675],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/wen-marketing-growing-the-first-open-source-cloud/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;the-unstoppable-update-q1-2021/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;the-unstoppable-update-q1-2021&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;  \\n\u201cHello World!\u201d  \\n\\nVaccinations have expanded, and the world is opening up again. Despite this, the migration of our work and life to the cloud, hastened by the pandemic this past year, continues inexorably.&nbsp;  \\n\\nAs cloud and Big Tech become more centralized and consolidated, our team is even more committed to building the world\u2019s first decentralized open-source cloud, and the first viable alternative to centralized cloud providers like Amazon Web Services (AWS) and Google Cloud.  \\n\\nIn Q1 2021, we launched Akash MAINNET 2, the MVP of the world\u2019s first decentralized open-source cloud. MAINNET 2 integrates five years of development, and learnings from four of the ecosystem\u2019s most ambitious testnets. Akash MAINNET 2 became one of the first platforms to launch on Cosmos\u2019s Stargate upgrade, integrated with Inter-Blockchain Communication (IBC), ushering in the beginnings of interoperability for the ecosystem.  \\n\\nWe progressed our development of the Inter-Blockchain Communication (IBC) Relayer, an essential component to unlocking IBC\u2019s features.  \\n\\nWe also announced an integration with Equinix Metal, the largest data center provider in the world, and a surprise listing on Gate.io, our fifth exchange listing.  \\n\\nFrom our development of the IBC Relayer, to the Equinix Metal integration, to the launch of MAINNET 2, Akash accelerated critical milestones across product, partnerships, and people in Q1 2021.  \\n\\n**PRODUCT**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n----------------------------\\n\\n#### **Akash MAINNET 2 Launch**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620925257-mainnet-banner-1024x768.png)\\n\\n  \\nIn early March, we announced the historic MVP launch of Akash MAINNET 2, the world\u2019s first decentralized open-source cloud.  \\n\\nMAINNET 2 Quick Stats:  \\n\\n*   The first deployment on Akash DeCloud was the [Bitcoin Whitepaper](http://7nd4hr8cepabrdvaldd1r4uf04.ingress.sjc1p0.mainnet.akashian.io/)\\n    \\n*   746 Application Deployments since launch\\n    \\n*   Up to 8x cost savings versus Amazon Web Services (AWS), being realized\\n    \\n\\nAkash MAINNET 2 is the culmination of five years of development and four of the ecosystem\u2019s most ambitious testnets, including Phase 3 of The Akashian Challenge, where we saw over 460 developers from around the world (second highest number of participants after Ethereum\u2019s testnet) deploy 3600+ applications on the world\u2019s first decentralized open-source cloud.  \\n\\nAs the first open-source cloud and the only viable decentralized cloud alternative to centralized cloud providers like AWS, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure, Akash MAINNET 2 empowers developers to break free from the limitations of traditional cloud infrastructure.  \\n\\n[**Learn More**](https://akash.network/blog/akash-network-launches-akash-mainnet-2-the-first-decentralized-open-source-cloud/)  \\n  \\n\\n####   \\n**Akash Network Develops Critical IBC Relayer**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620925348-ibc-banner-1024x768.png)\\n\\n  \\nIn development for over three years, IBC is the flagship feature of the Cosmos Network. For crypto and blockchain, where interoperability and composability are essential to continued growth for decentralized sectors like decentralized finance (DeFi), IBC is the most promising production ready solution.\\n\\nIBC enables different blockchain protocols to communicate and transact with each other independently, providing a framework to connect the global economy to the blockchain. Participants on existing blockchains will be able to interact and exchange with each other across chains.&nbsp;\\n\\nThe ability for chains to transact and interoperate will be transformational for the industry.\\n\\nThe ICF awarded Akash with a grant to build and maintain the IBC Relayer. Essential to launching the IBC protocol and the only way users will be able to use IBC, the Relayer is the user interface that enables all transfers and transactions on IBC.\\n\\nWe migrated and developed features from Cosmos\u2019s Game of Zones, Cosmos\u2019s proof-of-concept testnet, to a production ready IBC-compatible Relayer.\\n\\n[**Learn More**](https://akash.network/blog/akash-network-develops-critical-ibc-relayer-for-inter-blockchain-communication-protocol/)\\n\\n  \\n**PARTNERSHIPS**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n------------------------------------\\n\\n#### **Akash Network Integrates with Equinix Metal**  \\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620925374-equinix-banner-1-1024x768.png)\\n\\n  \\nWe announced that Akash Network is integrating with Equinix Metal and enabling developers and companies to decentralize their cloud infrastructure through Akash MAINNET 2.  \\n\\nEquinix is the world's largest data center and colocation infrastructure provider, with 220 data centers in 25 countries.&nbsp;  \\n\\nThrough Equinix Metal, Equinix\u2019s on-demand and interconnected bare metal service, we\u2019ll be able to provide developers, companies, and projects across the blockchain ecosystem with a faster, more efficient, and lower-cost decentralized cloud alternative, with nearly unlimited use cases.&nbsp;  \\n\\nTo start, Akash Network will enable a vibrant and growing, interconnected, and interoperable Cosmos ecosystem, beginning with non-critical workloads and eventually full nodes, to run on a decentralized high-performance non-custodial cloud at a lower cost.  \\n\\n[**Learn More**](https://akash.network/blog/akash-network-integrates-with-equinix-metal-to-provide-the-first-viable-decentralized-cloud-solution/)  \\n  \\n  \\n\\n#### **AKT Token On Gate.io**  \\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620926938-gateio-live-2-1024x768.png)\\n\\n  \\nWith the launch of MAINNET 2, we saw even more interest and demand for Akash and AKT. As the utility token powering [the world\u2019s first DeCloud for DeFi](https://akash.network/blog/akash-decloud-for-defi/) and high growth organizations, **Akash Token (AKT) has ~50% APR staking rewards, and a record-setting ~84% bonding rate**.  \\n\\nTo support accelerating growth and increasing global demand for access to Akash Token (AKT), our team has been hyper-focused on expanding liquidity for AKT. In Q1, we were excited to announce that Akash Token (AKT) got listed on Gate.io, [one of the Top 10 digital asset exchanges in the world](https://www.coingecko.com/en/exchanges).  \\n\\nWe were honored, as Gate.io had surprised us with this listing.&nbsp;  \\n\\n[Gate.io](https://www.gate.io/) became our _fifth exchange_ listing after the 2020 [BitMax](https://bitmax.io/en/global-digital-asset-platform) and [BitMart](https://www.bitmart.com/) listings, and the [Bithumb Gl](https://www.bithumb.pro/en-us)[o](https://www.bithumb.pro/en-us)[bal](https://www.bithumb.pro/en-us), and [DigiFinex](https://www.digifinex.com/en-ww/) listings earlier in Q1 2021.  \\n\\n[**Learn More**](https://akash.network/blog/akt-token-now-on-gate-io-exchange/)\\n\\n  \\n**PEOPLE**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n------------------------------\\n\\n#### **Kelsey Ruiz, Head of Communications**  \\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620926953-kelsey-banner-1024x768.jpg)\\n\\n  \\nPreviously, Kelsey served as Senior PR Manager at Ethereum Classic Labs where she focused on mainstream education and brand awareness of the Ethereum Classic blockchain. Before that, she was PR Manager at Leaf Group, a publicly traded Internet and media company and spent almost 5 years at AngelHack, managing PR and communications for 50+ events globally on an annual basis to a developer community of 175,000.  \\n\\nKelsey will be focused on engaging media and influencers with the possibilities of DeCloud. She\u2019ll be working across our global teams on communications and content programs, and events, that educate and inspire.  \\n\\n[**Learn More**](https://akash.network/blog/introducing-kelsey-ruiz-head-of-communications/)  \\n  \\n\\n####   \\n**Steph Bernstein, Finance &amp; Operations Manager**  \\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620926962-steph-less-text-1024x768.png)\\n\\n  \\nAs Finance and Operations Manager, Steph supports the organizational growth, financial strategy, and culture at Akash Network. She is a multifaceted business management and operations professional with over a decade of accounting, finance, human resources, and IT management experience.  \\n\\nSteph will be supporting company growth at Akash by providing resources and training for the team, building company culture programs, and supporting the recruitment and retention of our talented team.  \\n\\n[**Learn More**](https://akash.network/blog/introducing-steph-bernstein-finance-operations-manager/)  \\n  \\n\\n#### **Get the Latest Akash and AKT Token News and Giveaways!**\\n\\n[Join Our Telegram](https://t.me/AkashNW)&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;The Unstoppable Update: Q1 2021&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;\u201cHello World!\u201d&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2021-04-13T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;News&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;News&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Maly Ly&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.BxzMj4Jq.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1200],&quot;height&quot;:[0,675],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/the-unstoppable-update-q1-2021/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;a-vision-of-the-decentralized-web-with-chjango-unchained/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;a-vision-of-the-decentralized-web-with-chjango-unchained&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\n> **The train doesn\u2019t stop at DeFi or NFTs. We\u2019re headed for destination dWeb. That\u2019s kind of awesome to think about.**\\n\\nAs the decentralized ecosystem continues to grow and attract a diverse set of developers, we see the increasing need for simplicity, speed, and flexibility that serverless computing brings and a decentralized infrastructure that supports a future for decentralized web, also known as dWeb.\\n\\nTo discuss the transformational potential of a truly decentralized web and what that world would look like, we connected with Chjango Unchained, former VP of Ecosystem Development at Tendermint for the Cosmos Network, Director of the dWeb Foundation, and host of the [Interchain podcast](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4xlOVeUXd90).\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620925201-0d8355e6-6602-5366-8e0c-bd5f457021f4.jpg)\\n\\n#### **Diving into Crypto and Blockchain Technology**\\n\\n> **When the end of the bull market in mid-2018 came around, it was then while things quieted down when I could hear again. Handshake was being developed. I was close to the team as it was being built, and that became my gateway drug into dWeb.**\\n\\nChjango graduated with a Bachelor of Science from the University of California, San Diego where she credits her university experience and mathematical background with the capacity to understand abstract concepts in crypto.\\n\\nChjango first got involved in Bitcoin and started seriously researching its capabilities and potential in 2014, which inevitably led her to the blockchain. In 2017, the ICO era, she realized there wasn\u2019t just a Cambrian explosion of dApps, but of narratives. There were decentralized gaming, collectibles, IoT, GPS, exchanges, identity, storage, VMs, and more. By present-day, most of those narratives had lost steam, and the projects that pushed those narratives died along with the end of the bull market.\\n\\nAt that point, Handshake was being developed and she got close to the team as it was being built, which reeled her into the potential for dWeb. Chjango is currently a Director of the dWeb Foundation and advises cryptocurrency projects focused on solving some of the biggest problems in centralized technology.\\n\\n#### **Bullish on the Possibilities of Decentralized Web**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n> **The reason I\u2019m so bullish about dWeb is because the very projects that are needed to enable this vision to come to life are the ones that subsisted through the 2018-2019 bear market.**\\n\\nChjango believes decentralizing every piece of Internet infrastructure from top to bottom will be essential to the growth of Web 2.0 and dWeb.\\n\\n> We have Handshake as the uncensorable identity layer (i.e. your domain name as your online identity or social handle), Akash for decentralized cloud, Orchid and Sentinel for decentralized bandwidth, Sia, IPFS, and Footnote for every flavor of decentralized storage you can imagine, and what you get as a result of leveraging those components is a website or application that is censorship-resistant at every layer of Web 3.0.\\n\\n> Akash is the first and only project in the Cosmos ecosystem that is solving decentralized cloud computing. I only came around to seeing this as an important problem to solve when I watched what happened with Parler, where the Big 5 tech oligopoly fell like dominos to shut down Parler from its social media handle on Twitter and Facebook, to the Apple and Google app stores, and even down to its servers on AWS. That was the wake-up moment for me, which instructed me to pay closer attention to projects like Akash.\\n\\nOn top of that are integrations for cryptocurrency payments and DeFi--enabling a new yet familiar Internet with its own \u201cunbanking\u201d system. The next generation of Internet users may never even need a bank account.\\n\\n> Imagine browsing the dWeb with the same experience you have going online today, doing some grocery shopping, paying in crypto, and receiving your groceries without ever having to cash out in fiat and never needing a credit card and being part of a credit system again. That\u2019s the evolution of blockchain technology and where this is all going.\\n\\n> The train doesn\u2019t stop at DeFi or NFTs. We\u2019re headed for destination dWeb. That\u2019s kind of awesome to think about.\\n\\nWhen asked how she thinks Stargate and IBC will accelerate the decentralized ecosystem, Chjango reinforced that with IBC, builders finally have a good solution for composing their appchains in a manner that\u2019s more secure and censorship-resistant. The fact that IBC will ultimately accelerate blockchain interoperability standardization makes her bullish about seeing the different ways of allowing chains to talk to one another, converging on a single, standardized, and elegant design.\\n\\n#### **Highlighting Emerging and Anti-Censorship Technologies**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nAs the host of Interchain, Chjango covers cutting edge, emerging tech and more specifically, anti-censorship technologies. Every episode and guest offers each of their unique insights from vastly different worldviews, and she finds that each episode offers distinctive value, which is precisely the goal for her podcast.\\n\\nShe enjoys sourcing guests who are hidden gems in the cryptosphere, or projects that haven\u2019t become too mainstream yet. Helping people discover these projects before they get priced in by the market, is where most of the fun is for her.\\n\\nAs she gears up to interview our CEO, Greg Osuri today, **April 8th at noon PST**, she notes that Greg demonstrated himself as a thought leader speaking on behalf of the decentralized web, by speaking at Handycon, a Handshake conference the dWeb Foundation and Sky Include hosted together (see the full talk, [here](https://youtu.be/TB-IpeTQYsk)) and when he tweeted about the Pancake Swap and Cream Finance DNS hacks.\\n\\n> What people who are currently bullish about DeFi and NFTs are missing is that last connecting dot about dWeb. dWeb is the clear next iteration where blockchain tech is heading in the next 36 months, and it\u2019s not that it\u2019ll be mutually exclusive, but rather, it\u2019ll be additive.\\n\\nJust as after 2017, when the ICO narrative fizzled out, Chjango noticed in its wake, interoperability, DeFi and NFT narratives emerging to take center stage.\\n\\n> **The same shift will happen as the market moves to realize the not-yet-obvious next step. And if you take nothing else away from this interview with Greg on April 8th, my hope is that you take away the realization that dWeb is the next narrative. And if it\u2019s not obvious, it will become obvious within the next 18 months.**\\n\\nTune in today **Thursday, April 8th at noon PST** to hear more from Chjango Unchained and our CEO, Greg Osuri, as they discuss the future of dWeb and how Akash Network fulfills a foundational aspect of the complete decentralized stack.\\n\\n[Tune in here!](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4xlOVeUXd90)\\n\\n####\\n\\n**Don\u2019t Miss the Latest Akash and AKT News!**\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n[Join our Telegram](https://t.me/AkashNW)&nbsp;for the latest news, giveaways, and invites to special events!\\n\\nJoin our&nbsp;[Discord developer chat](https://discord.com/invite/DxftX67)&nbsp;for technical support and information.\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;A Vision of the Decentralized Web with Chjango Unchained&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;The train doesn\u2019t stop at DeFi or NFTs. I\u2019m excited to have a front-row seat to witness the way Akash\u2019s intersection of cloud computing, blockchain, and cryptocurrency will change the Internet as we know it.**_\\n\\nTaking on the $370 billion cloud industry with the successful launch of Akash MAINNET 2, the world\u2019s first decentralized open-source cloud and the only alternative to centralized cloud services, we\u2019re wasting no time when it comes to expanding the team, and priming Akash DeCloud for maximum acceleration and growth.\\n\\nSince Akash Network launched 5 years ago, the team has put in a lot of work to ensure that Akash DeCloud meets the needs of developers and high-growth companies, while growing a global community and partner ecosystem of leading technology companies like Equinix Metal and Cosmos.\\n\\nAfter a foundational year of milestones, we\u2019re excited to establish strong internal infrastructure and processes to enable our team to accelerate growth this year. To support this effort, we\u2019re proud to announce our first Finance &amp; Operations Manager, Steph Bernstein, who brings over a decade of experience managing business operations.\\n\\nHaving supported significant growth at a Madison Avenue private equity firm and an award-winning creative marketing and PR agency in New York City, Steph comes to us with extensive hands-on experience growing teams, overseeing office expansions, creating and implementing company policies and procedures, and shaping company culture.\\n\\nShe has always been interested in new technology developments and the impact they have on our work and ultimately on our lives.\\n\\n#### **On Establishing a Dynamic Company Culture**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nWith the mindset that our people are our most valuable asset, Steph believes it is important to build a dynamic and positive culture by making sure every team member is cared for and has a sense of purpose and ownership in their work.\\n\\nThrough employee wellness, inclusion, empowerment, connection, and gratitude, Steph has seen how company culture can be directly influenced by operations and the crucial role it plays in overall employee satisfaction.\\n\\nHer main goals to support company growth at Akash are to provide knowledge and training to the team, to build great company culture, to recruit and retain top talent, and to maximize company productivity by implementing a structure that best supports our team.\\n\\n#### **Supporting Organizational Growth at The First Open-Source Cloud**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n> _I was drawn to Akash for many reasons. I was incredibly impressed with the team and what they had already accomplished as an early-stage startup disrupting the cloud computing market._\\n>\\n> _Most importantly, Akash\u2019s company culture and key values aligned really well with that of my own. It was refreshing to know that empathy and equality were so highly regarded._\\n>\\n> _I am excited to make positive and meaningful contributions to Akash and in turn have a front-row seat to witness the way Akash\u2019s intersection of cloud computing, blockchain, and cryptocurrency will change the Internet as we know it._\\n\\nCurrently, Steph is working fast and furiously to expand employee benefits while supporting recruiting and onboarding.\\n\\nWhat Steph is looking forward to working on:\\n\\n> _I look forward to working with our CFO on our financial and accounting structure. I also look forward to getting more involved in the day-to-day operational functions of the organization._\\n\\nA natural problem solver with a passion for improving the lives of those around her, Steph loves thoughtful design, travel, and her 50lb rescue mutt.\\n\\n> _I have a strong appreciation for interesting architecture, smart interiors, furniture, and lighting design. I am interested in how these design elements are created and how they work. I believe this curiosity influences my ability to think outside the box when it comes to solving problems related to my work._\\n>\\n> _As Akash is a remote-first organization, I will have the freedom to travel when the world opens back up and still stay connected to my team. I believe this freedom will positively influence my work product simply based on my level of happiness. I also get to work with my dog by my side daily, which is hard to beat._\\n\\nIf you\u2019re interested in joining Akash Network, check out all open positions [here](https://jobs.lever.co/AkashNetwork)!\\n\\n#### **Don\u2019t Miss the Latest Akash and AKT News!**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n[Join our Telegram](https://t.me/AkashNW)&nbsp;for the latest news, giveaways, and invites to special events!\\n\\nJoin our&nbsp;[Discord developer chat](https://discord.com/invite/DxftX67)&nbsp;for technical support and information.\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Introducing Steph Bernstein, Finance &amp; Operations Manager&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;I was incredibly impressed with the team behind Akash Network and what they\u2019ve already accomplished as an early-stage startup.
