Osuri&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.CJg3bMde.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1200],&quot;height&quot;:[0,675],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/2020-to-2021-acceleration-to-the-decloud/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-decloud-from-phase-3-to-mainnet-2/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-decloud-from-phase-3-to-mainnet-2&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\nThrough running three phases of The Akashian Challenge, one of the ecosystem\u2019s most ambitious testnets, we\u2019ve been able to gather data, identify critical issues, and ensure our network\u2019s scalability, security, and usability before launching our DeCloud: Mainnet 2.\\n\\nIn the initial phases of The Akashian Challenge, we tested governance and voting, and improved the process for network upgrades to strengthen our platform. These explorations gave us critical insights on how to build a healthy and vital community for growth, and led to the successful [launch of our Mainnet 1](https://akash.network/blog/announcing-akash-mainnet-live-and-bitmax-ieo/) with a full 64-validator set.\\n\\nIn Phase 3, we integrated performance enhancements from Cosmos SDK v0.40, and tested Akash DeCloud\u2019s deployment platform.\\n\\nWith 500,000 Akash Token (AKT) in rewards and hundreds of participants joining from around the world, [The Akashian Challenge Phase 3: Developer Operations](https://akash.network/blog/the-akashian-challenge-phase-3-rewards-overview/) included guided challenges for deploying applications of increasing complexity \u2014 from simple single-page applications to blockchain network components, and open ended challenges where participants could show off their Akash OPS skills by extending the guided examples to deploy any application they desired \u2014 from DeFi to CI.\\n\\nWe also offered additional rewards for participation outside of the deployment challenges, including active validator participation, writing blog posts and how-to guides, and sharing novel uses of our platform.\\n\\nWe set out with the following goals:\\n\\n- Test platform functionality for Mainnet 2\\n\\n- Distribute tokens to potential users for Mainnet 2\\n\\n- Build a catalog of applications (SDLs) to launch Mainnet 2\\n\\n_So how did we do, and how is Phase 3 helping us build a stronger Mainnet 2?_\\n\\n#### **Recap of The Akashian Challenge: Phase 3 Testnet**\\n\\n\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\n\\nI\u2019m thrilled to share that over only two weeks, Phase 3 testnet participation, deployments, and learnings, exceeded our expectations.\\n\\nBy the metrics alone:\\n\\n- **3600+ applications deployed**\\n\\n- **460+ developers**\\n\\n- **149 registered validators**\\n\\nDuring Week 1, Forbole deployed their Big Dipper block explorer on Akash DeCloud, making it the first instance of a prominent block explorer to migrate from centralized cloud to decentralized cloud.\\n\\nAdditionally, Serum DEX UI became the first instance a major DeFi project is hosted on the DeCloud.\\n\\nIn Week 2, we had mind-bending Inception-style deployments, as Challengers deployed an Akash node on Akash. Challengers also deployed video games and well-known DeFi apps on Akash including SushiSwap and UniSwap.\\n\\nBy having its frontend deployed on Akash\u2019s decentralized cloud, UniSwap can provide its users unstoppable access to $1.4 billion of liquidity that can\u2019t be shut down by centralized cloud providers.\\n\\nDuring all this action, Akash surpassed 1,000,000 blocks.\\n\\nAmong the coolest Awesome Akash apps deployed:\\n\\n- **DeFi** - SushiSwap &amp; UniSwap\\n\\n- **Blog** - Ghost &amp; Wordpress\\n\\n- **Games** - DOOM &amp; Super Mario\\n\\n- **Databases** - mongoDB &amp; MySQL\\n\\n- **Data Visualization** - UFO Sightings\\n\\n- **Block Explorers** - Big Dipper &amp; Aneka\\n\\nYou can check out the [full Awesome Akash list](https://github.com/ovrclk/awesome-akash) for more.\\n\\n#### **The Journey to Mainnet 2**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nAmong the learnings from Phase 3 that we\u2019ll leverage for Mainnet 2:\\n\\n**Tendermint\u2019s State Sync works!** After some tinkering, we discovered a way to use state sync to quickly bring up nodes. This is great for developers who want to quickly bring up a node for any number of uses - querying the blockchain, using a web wallet, etc.\\n\\nWe identified **pain points in the deployment process,** which currently requires multiple transactions and is quite cumbersome. We\u2019re now developing a tool to streamline the process.\\n\\nWe also realized we need **better feedback (logs) when deployments are failing**. If an application uses too much memory, it terminates without telling the user specifically why. The \\\\`command\\\\` and \\\\`args\\\\` service fields of the SDL file aren't documented well enough. The service won\u2019t start if these fields are not inputted correctly. We now know we\u2019ll need to add validation up-front for items like invalid environment or service names.\\n\\nWe discovered that **inventory management needs tuning**. Under heavy load, there were cases where the provider would bid on orders that it didn\u2019t have sufficient capacity to run. These deployments would wait for other workloads to complete, but if that didn\u2019t happen in time, the workload would time out and be killed.\\n\\nUltimately, our aim was for Phase 3 to accelerate our vision for a decentralized cloud computing marketplace by serving as the launchpad for Mainnet 2. We\u2019ll continue to study the data and feedback from Phase 3 and leverage the learnings to strengthen Mainnet 2.\\n\\n_**Stay tuned for more information on Akash DeCloud: Mainnet 2, launching early in Q1 2021.**_\\n\\n#### **Don\u2019t Miss Critical Phase 3 Updates**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nJoin our [Discord dev](https://discord.akash.network/) chat for technical support and information.\\n\\nJoin our [Telegram](https://t.me/AkashNW) for the latest Akash Network and AKT announcements, events, and giveaways.\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash DeCloud: From Phase 3 to Mainnet 2&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Through running three phases of The Akashian Challenge, one of the ecosystem\u2019s most ambitious testnets, we\u2019ve been able to gather data, identify critical issues, and ensure our network\u2019s scalability, security, and usability before launching our DeCloud Mainnet 2.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-12-23T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Adam Bozanich&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.BzJ7y3xJ.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1200],&quot;height&quot;:[0,675],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-decloud-from-phase-3-to-mainnet-2/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;huobi-pool-partners-with-akash-network/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;huobi-pool-partners-with-akash-network&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;  \\nIn the cryptocurrency world, Huobi needs no further introduction, and Huobi Global Exchange is renowned around the world as one of the top two crypto exchanges.&nbsp;  \\n\\nLaunched in 2018, Huobi Pool is Huobi Group\u2019s mining and staking division. To date, Huobi Pool has grown staking operations to become the largest staking pool, participating in more than 40 proof of stake (PoS) projects, and is a leading proof of work (PoW) pool. Additionally, Huobi Pool ranked in the top three nodes in more than half of the projects it participated in.  \\n\\n**Today, we\u2019re thrilled to announce that Huobi Pool has joined Akash Network as a validator. With global leadership in staking operations and as one of Huobi Group\u2019s fastest growing divisions, Huobi Pool will be a valuable partner as we accelerate development of Akash DeCloud, the world\u2019s first decentralized cloud, for high growth industries including DeFi, decentralized projects, and machine learning/AI, and expand our global ecosystem.**  \\n\\nWe recently connected with Ding Yuan, Huobi Pool\u2019s Chief Analyst, to learn more about the firm\u2019s approach and perspective, and to find out why they chose to partner with Akash.\\n\\n#### **Interview with Ding Yuan, Chief Analyst at Huobi Pool**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620925199-yvvt7277bs9nckcxstfqy7rrompivtgm0m51c33sgojushkkaulvctirjigsijprtsolz9zwxngmjz5ogb8x8w-7zsplhytvrkme3iiesziccq-s80xpabnchgig6ca1sla1c.jpeg)\\n\\n  \\n**How and why was Huobi Pool created?**  \\n\\nDing: Huobi Group is one of the world\u2019s biggest crypto companies and our business covers almost the entire industry. As an integral part of the industry, the mining pool protects the security of the blockchain network and plays the role of infrastructure in the blockchain world. So Huobi Pool was set up for mining and also, staking business.  \\n\\n  \\n**How is Houbi Pool affiliated with Huobi exchange?**  \\n\\nDing: Many Huobi exchange users are also Bitcoin miners. Huobi Pool can provide them with, not only mining services, but also liquidity, financial derivatives, and other value-added services in combination with the exchange business.&nbsp;  \\n\\nBesides, dozens of staking services provided by Huobi exchange are actually operated by Huobi Pool. So far, we have provided users with staking services in more than 40 projects including ETH2.0.  \\n\\n  \\n**What is the goal of the organization?**  \\n\\nDing: Our goal is to provide users with the most professional mining and staking services.  \\n\\n  \\n**How do you select which projects to work with?**  \\n\\nDing: We will judge a project from different angles. We like a professional and experienced team--the technology should be creative, and the project can really solve problems.&nbsp;  \\n\\nAlso, we focus on the economic model and the inflation mechanism.  \\n\\n  \\n**What motivated you to validate for Akash Network?**  \\n\\nDing: As I mentioned above, we have high requirements for the quality of the project we work with. Akash has an excellent and professional team. The company has good influence and reputation in the Cosmos ecosystem, and the economic model is solid, with no shortcomings.&nbsp;  \\n\\nWhat's more, we think Akash can solve real problems.  \\n\\n  \\n**What types of crypto projects are you excited about, and why?**  \\n\\nDing: The first criteria I consider is a good team. The team needs to be made up of people with expertise across different fields. Then, the project should have special achievements in the technical field. And then, have strong creativity--not just fork others.  \\n\\n  \\n**How do you envision blockchain changing the world?**  \\n\\nDing: The change that blockchain brings to the world is fundamental. It is different from the invention of the steam engine, which just improved productivity.&nbsp;  \\n\\nWhereas, blockchain technology will transform productivity by decentralization and token economy.  \\n\\n  \\n**What is your advice for those who want to enter the blockchain industry?**  \\n\\nDing: The first thing is to own bitcoin, because only by holding cryptocurrency, you can really appreciate its magic.  \\n\\nSecond, the industry needs you to have more energy and capabilities to capture information, because the speed of development in the blockchain industry is faster than in any others--you need to keep learning.  \\n\\nFinally, the value investment is very important. Don't throw away your precious coins because of speculation and leveraged trading.  \\n\\n#### **Don\u2019t Miss Out!**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n[**Join our Telegram**](https://t.me/AkashNW) **for the latest Akash and AKT Token news, giveaways, and invites to special events!**  \\n  \\n  \\n\\n[**Join The Unstoppable Cloud**](https://t.me/AkashNW)\\n\\n  \\n  \\n**About Huobi Pool**  \\n\\nAs a significant part of Huobi Group's ecological layout, Huobi Pool mainly handles PoW mining, Staking mining and Huobi Pool ECO Exchange. With many public chain nodes and as the largest staking pool and leading PoW pool, Huobi Pool is devoted to providing one-stop financial services to all digital users.  \\n  \\nVisit [www.hpt.com](http://www.hpt.com).  \\n\\n  \\n**About Akash Network**\\n\\nAkash Network is developing the world\u2019s first and only decentralized cloud computing marketplace, enabling any data center and anyone with a computer to become a cloud provider by offering their unused compute cycles in a safe and frictionless marketplace. Akash DeCloud greatly accelerates scale and price performance for DeFi, decentralized organizations, and high-growth industries like machine learning/AI.  \\n  \\nThrough Akash\u2019s platform, developers can easily and securely access cloud compute at a cost ten times lower than the current market providers (AWS, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure). The platform achieves these benefits by integrating advanced containerization technology with a unique staking model to accelerate adoption.\\n\\n####   \\n[Telegram](https://t.me/AkashNW) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/akashnet_) | [Discord](http://discord.akash.network/) | [Blog](https://akash.network/blog/)&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Huobi Pool Partners with Akash Network&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;In the cryptocurrency world, Huobi needs no further introduction, and Huobi Global Exchange is renowned around the world as one of the top two crypto exchanges.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-12-21T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Partners&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Partners&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Maly Ly&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.C7h8etXo.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1200],&quot;height&quot;:[0,675],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/huobi-pool-partners-with-akash-network/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;the-unstoppable-update-december-2020/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;the-unstoppable-update-december-2020&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;  \\nAs more of our work and play continues to transition to the cloud, the need for a more flexible, scalable and lower cost cloud has never been greater.&nbsp;\\n\\nWith the successful launch of The Akashian Challenge Phase 3, one of the most ambitious testnets in the ecosystem, and our second exchange listing on BitMart this past month, we continue to accelerate our vision of The Unstoppable Cloud.\\n\\nWe\u2019ve been astounded by the level of global participation and excitement surrounding Phase 3, and we\u2019re grateful to Akashian Challengers and our community for helping us build the world\u2019s first decentralized cloud.&nbsp;\\n\\nAwesome stats from Phase 3:\\n\\n*   2,438 Application Deployments\\n    \\n*   379 Developers\\n    \\n*   100 Active Validators\\n    \\n\\nDuring Phase 3, [Serum DEX UI](https://dex.projectserum.com/#/) became the first instance a major DeFi project is hosted on the DeCloud.\\n\\nApps launched on Akash so far include Uniswap, Sushiswap, Steemit, Wordpress, Tetris and many more.&nbsp;\\n\\n####   \\n**The Akashian Challenge Phase 3 Launch**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620926429-5xugkono8gp-6prietaz8z9pnipyceocsc7o7ydwx4xjulgms2yvvbd0zsab3v92lla6usqfpy0xq2yzs1cdc1orcsm9gsozlake8runccqukadklcpdcnkbnlb5mqnglpru3kl7.png)\\n\\n  \\nWith 500,000 Akash Token (AKT) rewards at stake, The Akashian Challenge Phase 3 enables developers to explore the world\u2019s first decentralized cloud and help us build a strong Mainnet 2, while earning AKT.\\n\\nPhase 3 enables users to deploy web based cloud applications, such as static sites and API servers -- the most common DeFi application components. This phase also enabled dAPP developers to deploy blockchain nodes on our network as an alternative to expensive and inflexible cloud providers such as AWS and Google Cloud.&nbsp;\\n\\nHere\u2019s some love we\u2019ve received so far from our community:\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620926444-gysvzd02qe5tjcw5mw27uzju21o4h4hrxuiuajp0xdj5js-xmswqnihcqy7zqfht4xhsdtuehsq-ftsmmvjelu1x7bcfncawq-9gzahhz8en6rudhpe9-mfqrieb23iasrmok.jpeg)\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620926451-7ulszk3s4ermfa4hzfrcyk5qxrlbwehjg1wxoxn8d3h431wrtvygksxtz2wq6wh4dkwmsbv7wlkuixtrum4nf8e6q8x57otjkhfodei5ocuv5ll4y6gqsr5xpwmqg5cwne3.jpeg)\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620926458-7ukhkmaqdlcts1gn0jnbjqcweohzwlmfbsm7nvyviiyq1rrtzhtzqjasb4zzk4afjzbunth6s673cvhbvdnahzg8dlo6vydhovfwjam4o3lkdem7ryhyi-wnh2n5olqpbo92s1u.jpeg)\\n\\n  \\nAs we wrap up Phase 3 of the Akashian Challenge we look forward to taking key learnings from this testnet and applying them to the launch of our Mainnet 2.\\n\\n[**Learn More \u2192**](https://akash.network/blog/the-akashian-challenge-phase-3-week-1-is-live/)\\n\\n####   \\n**Akash Network Partnership with Cosmostation**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620926464-7wvjt0uy16dd7sz9xpukscpie8ei0kikozdrw52kkobfbbfzvxojcccsjmqmqfplospn7clsh6hla8c-gr-k9xtpjruerewhgdgezqwvm95zwhyvbqyb0wtskpxxm-glmly4yp.png)\\n\\n  \\nWe announced our integration with Cosmostation, the number one wallet for the Cosmos ecosystem. A trusted wallet provider for other top Cosmos projects including Akash partner Kava Labs, Terra, and Iris, Cosmostation is built on the Cosmos SDK and has mobile wallet apps on Android and iOS.  \\n  \\nCosmostation\u2019s goals are to operate and maintain a secure validator infrastructure for the stability of the network, and to provide essential tools for Cosmonauts to explore the Cosmos universe.\\n\\n[**Learn Mor**](https://akash.network/blog/akash-network-announces-integration-partnership-with-cosmostation-wallet)[**e&nbsp;\u2192**](https://akash.network/blog/akash-network-announces-integration-partnership-with-cosmostation-wallet)\\n\\n####   \\n**Announcing Akash Advisor Brian Fox, Creator of Bash Shell**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620926478-qp-qjljrjlrpmluya3lannseqwbhy4oppdfjwj-nvallvtz-swraplwomjn-sd7vfpi6ojirepgnfo2be1ugcwzrr1lw6vmuusyaxegsh745hqp90m6g7wjtoy0ywdiq3r-nr1.jpeg)\\n\\n  \\nWe\u2019re excited to announce that Brian Fox has joined Akash Network as an Advisor. If you\u2019ve ever used the GNU Bash, GNU Makeinfo, GNU Info, GNU Finger, GNU Echo, or GNU Emacs, chances are, you\u2019ve heard of open source pioneer and innovator Brian Fox and have leveraged his ubiquitous and valuable open source contributions. Brian\u2019s strategic and technical guidance, experience, and ideas will be invaluable as we build the world\u2019s first decentralized cloud to enable greater access, flexibility, and freedom for builders of the future.\\n\\n[**Learn More \u2192**](https://akash.network/blog/announcing-akash-advisor-brian-fox-creator-of-bash-shell/)  \\n\\n####   \\n**AKT Token Now On BitMart**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620926487-d0bljzhtstnlqhl-olmqmnqsvyklyun5luzdh34yppcfoaj8rcjh7kz3bajmcxvs6mmosw2b-rwxsrd-xpesbj4fhsvjlom78iltxeghnpn-axudju70crzan5ls68zfaju5.png)\\n\\n  \\nAs we\u2019ve continued to grow our global community and demand for AKT has increased, our team has been focused on expanding liquidity and access to AKT. As the first Akash exchange partner to enable residents of the United States to access AKT, we\u2019re thrilled that we can now offer even more people around the world access to AKT, and continue to grow our accelerating global community through our partnership with BitMart, a premier global digital asset platform.\\n\\n[**Learn More \u2192**](https://akash.network/blog/akt-token-now-on-bitmart-exchange/)\\n\\n####   \\n**Phase 3 Testnet Livestream**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620926502-bou6fdoee-rg74e5udgv5luw8qsehll8zej1rcopz61gwee4hxacel3ja97dihwn4dvkzymv5iwtv80dkiarbw1fmty33kkaa6gosrivdcfbot8yz5dbvdkh-3b1epkzxbnio.png)\\n\\n  \\nIn this week\u2019s Phase 3 live stream, featuring Akash Founders Greg Osuri and Adam Bozanich, we\u2019ll be sharing updates and a live demo, answering all your burning questions, and picking surprise giveaway winners.  \\n  \\nJoin our host Global Marketing Manager Michael Gushansky for another Akashian Challenge live stream event this Friday Dec. 11th at 9AM PST / 5 PM UTC!  \\n\\nLast week's surprise giveaway winners will be revealed!\\n\\n  \\n**See you there:**&nbsp;[**https://bit.ly/2VRHBce**](https://bit.ly/2VRHBce)\\n\\n####   \\n  \\n**Get the Latest Akash and AKT Token News and Giveaways!**\\n\\n[Join Our Telegram](https://t.me/AkashNW)&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;The Unstoppable Update: December 2020&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;As more of our work and play continues to transition to the cloud, the need for a more flexible, scalable and lower cost cloud has never been greater.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-12-10T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Michael Gushansky&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.Vx9A7EIK.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1200],&quot;height&quot;:[0,675],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/the-unstoppable-update-december-2020/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;the-akashian-challenge-phase-3-week-2-live/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;the-akashian-challenge-phase-3-week-2-live&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\n**Are you ready Akashian Challengers?!**\\n\\n**Week 2 of The Akashian Challenge Phase 3 is officially LIVE!!!**\\n\\nWith 500,000 Akash Token (AKT) rewards at stake, Phase 3 testnet has already seen record participation from developers around the world and plenty of action just in the first week.\\n\\nDuring Week 1, we had significant firsts. Forbole deployed their Big Dipper on Akash DeCloud, making it the first instance of a prominent block explorer to migrate from centralized cloud to decentralized cloud. Additionally, [Serum](https://dex.projectserum.com) DEX UI became the first instance a major DeFi project is hosted on the DeCloud.\\n\\nWeek 1 by the numbers:\\n\\n- 830 application deployments\\n- 249 participants\\n- 142 registered validators\\n- 100 active Validators\\n- 100+ validators and nodes running on Akash\\n- 200 web apps\\n- 181 multi-tier applications\\n\\nWeek 2 starts today, and challenges will focus on leveraging Akash DeCloud to deploy various node types and components for a live blockchain network. We\u2019ll provide connection details for a live Cosmos SDK-based network.\\n\\nStart the Week 2 challenges by clicking [Get Started Now](https://akash.network/docs/testnet-challenges/testnet-challenges/guided-deployments), or click on Learn More to visit The Akashian Challenge site for more information on Week 2 challenges and rewards.\\n\\nIt\u2019s not too late to get in on the action and earn AKT!\\n\\nGood luck to all Akashian Challengers as we enter Week 2.\\n\\nAnd remember, fortune favors the bold!\\n\\n#### [**Get Started Now**](https://akash.network/docs/testnet-challenges/testnet-challenges/guided-deployments) **|** [**Learn More**\\n\\n](https://akash.network/challenge/)\\n\\n#### **Testnet Block Explorers**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nCheck out the following Phase 3 testnet block explorers from our partners Vitwit and Forbole:\\n\\n- [Vitwit\u2019s Aneka Block Explorer](http://testnet.akash.aneka.io/)\\n- [Forbole\u2019s Big Dipper Block Explorer](https://edgenet.akash.bigdipper.live/)\\n\\n#### **How to Join**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nTo start, please [sign up here](https://app.akash.network/signup) if you have not participated in Akash\u2019s previous testnets.\\n\\n1.  **KYC/AML:** Complete KYC/AML. This is required to claim rewards, but not for participation. Please reach out on [our Discord](https://discord.akash.network/) dev chat if you have any problems with the KYC process.\\n2.  **Tax Documents:** W-8 BEN or W9. Once your KYC application is approved, our team will send either a W-8 BEN for international participants or a W9 via HelloSign.\\n\\n#### **Key Dates**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nThe Phase 3 network and challenges will be live for two weeks:\\n\\n- **Week 1**: November 30, 2020 - December 4, 2020\\n- **Week 2**: December 7, 2020 - December 11, 2020\\n\\nRewards Scoring:\\n\\n- **December 14, 2020**: Rewards earned from the first week will be posted\\n- **December 21, 2020:** Complete results of rewards will be posted.\\n- **Scoring Note**: where submissions satisfy more than one reward, all rewards will be granted for that submission.\\n\\n#### **Goals &amp; Overview**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nIntegrating performance enhancements from Cosmos SDK v0.40, The Akashian Challenge Testnet 3 will test and showcase Akash DeCloud\u2019s deployment platform. Akashian Challengers will be incentivized to deploy applications using the Akash Network.\\n\\nEncompassing two weeks, Phase 3 will include **guided challenges** for deploying applications of increasing complexity \u2014 from simple single-page applications to blockchain network components, and **open ended challenges** where users can show off their Akash OPS skills by extending the guided examples to deploy any application they desire \u2014 from DeFi to CI.\\n\\nThere are additional rewards for participation outside of the deployment challenges, including contributions such as active validator participation, writing blog posts and how-to guides, and sharing novel uses of our platform.\\n\\n**Phase 3 Goals:**\\n\\n- Test platform functionality for Mainnet 2\\n- Distribute tokens to potential users for Mainnet 2\\n- Build a catalog of applications (SDLs) to launch Mainnet 2\\n\\n**Phase 3 Challenges:**\\n\\n- Guided Challenges\\n\\n  - These challenges are meant to be used as step-by-step guides to deploying applications on our network.\\n  - Each challenge will have accompanying instructions and example deployment configurations.\\n\\n- Open Ended Challenges\\n\\n  - As a generic cloud platform, Akash DeCloud has the potential to be used in a wide variety of use cases. This open-ended challenge is meant to explore what kinds of applications can be deployed on DeCloud, and how.\\n  - You\u2019ll support the Akash DeCloud community by finding unique applications to deploy and sharing your deployment configuration via a pull request on Awesome Akash.\\n\\n- Network Support Challenges\\n\\n  - While validators and other network components are not necessarily targeted in this testnet, they are of course essential to maintaining a healthy DeCloud.\\n  - Leverage this testnet to practice your operations, or try new ones.\\n  - To earn rewards for this challenge, you should be actively participating \u2014 keep your component(s) up-to-date and respond to any network proposals that may come up.\\n\\n- Community Content Challenges\\n\\n  - Drop your knowledge about Akash DeCloud to earn rewards. The community content challenges support community members who independently publish articles and guides related to the Akash Network.\\n\\n    - **Anything Goes**: An open-ended category where \\&quot;Anything Goes!\\&quot; with community-generated content related to Akash.\\n    - **DeCloud for DeFi**: A category calling on our community to leverage Akash DeCloud as the infrastructure supporting DeFi applications.\\n\\nPhase 3 will accelerate our vision for a decentralized and open cloud computing marketplace and serve as the launchpad for Mainnet 2.\\n\\n#### **Rewards**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nYou can check out [The Akashian Challenge site](https://akash.network/challenge/) for a detailed schedule of reward opportunities. A total of **500,000 AKT** is allocated for Phase 3 Rewards including:\\n\\n1.  **Guided Challenges**\\n2.  **Open Ended Challenges**\\n3.  **Network Support Challenges**\\n4.  **Community Content Challenges**\\n5.  **Bonus Challenges**\\n\\n#### **This Week\u2019s Live Stream on Friday**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nDon\u2019t miss our weekly Phase 3 live stream this Friday December and special prizes.\\n\\n#### **Don\u2019t Miss the Latest Phase 3 Updates**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nJoin [our Telegram](https://t.me/AkashNW) to get the latest Akash Network and on Monday, November 30th, we [announced our second exchange listing on BitMart](https://akash.network/blog/announcing-akash-token-listing-on-bitmart-exchange/), further expanding liquidity for AKT token, and [launched Phase 3](https://akash.network/blog/the-akashian-challenge-phase-3-week-1-is-live/), the third and final phase of The Akashian Challenge incentivized testnet.\\n\\nYou may remember earlier this year, when we launched The Akashian Challenge, one of the ecosystem\u2019s largest and most ambitious testnets, with 99 active validators.\\n\\nPhase 3 accelerates our vision for a decentralized and open cloud computing marketplace and will serve as the launchpad for [Mainnet 2](https://akash.network/blog/akash-decloud-mainnet-overview/), the materialization of Akash DeCloud.\\n\\nWith 500,000 Akash Token (AKT) in rewards and the chance to explore the world\u2019s first decentralized cloud, [Phase 3](https://akash.network/challenge/) has attracted validators and developers from around the world. It\u2019s been exciting for us to see Akashian Challengers flex their technical chops through our guided and open ended challenges.\\n\\nJust in the first day of Phase 3, we\u2019ve seen 86+ application deployments in the world\u2019s first decentralized cloud. We appreciate the support of Phase 3 Challengers to help us build a stronger DeCloud.\\n\\n#### **Akash DeCloud Development Update**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n**New Release Candidate**\\n\\nOn November 23rd, we cut a new release candidate of our software: [Akash v0.9.0-rc4](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/releases/tag/v0.9.0-rc4).&nbsp; The primary feature of this release was the inclusion of Audited Attributes, which allows tenants to create leases only on providers who have met certain criteria and have that criteria verified, or audited, by a person or entity.\\n\\nFor example, Bob has a provider and declares its _region_ attribute to be US-West.&nbsp; Alice knows Bob personally and can confirm that his provider is in the US-West region, so she submits a transaction on the Akash blockchain signing off that his _region_ attribute is true.\\n\\nNow, Susan wants to launch an application onto Akash DeCloud, but has two requirements: first, it must run on a US-West server, and second, its region attribute must be audited by Alice, whom she trusts.&nbsp; Susan\u2019s application will now only be hosted by Bob, or any other provider that meets her two requirements.\\n\\n[This update](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/pull/925) improves the Audited Attribute functionality by allowing more flexibility to the tenant for choosing an appropriate provider for their needs.\\n\\n**Documentation**\\n\\nTo help prepare the developer community for The Akashian Challenge Phase 3, we\u2019ve worked diligently to overhaul our documentation. Improved [metadata organization](https://github.com/ovrclk/net) now allows for a much cleaner and deliberate interface, enabling developers to more easily gather information to join our Mainnet or any current testnet.\\n\\n**Telemetry**\\n\\nThe Cosmos SDK contains functionality to gain insight into the performance and behavior of applications through the use of what\u2019s called a \u201ctelemetry package.\u201d&nbsp; As Akash is built on the Cosmos SDK, we utilize this telemetry data and are [working to add](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/issues/921) additional metrics so developers have access to more detailed node information.\\n\\nSome of these new metrics will include deployment created, order created, order closed, and transfer amount.\\n\\n#### **What\u2019s Next?**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n- Gateway API authentication\\n- Provider services stability\\n- Provider services observability\\n- Provider services transaction batching\\n\\n#### **Don\u2019t Miss the Latest Akash Network Product Updates**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nJoin our [Discord dev chat](https://discord.com/invite/DxftX67) for technical support and information.\\n\\nJoin our [Telegram](https://t.me/AkashNW) for the latest Akash Network platform, product, and Akash Token (AKT) updates and around the world,** The Akashian Challenge Phase 3 Incentivized Testnet is the final phase of one of the ecosystem\u2019s most successful testnets, and includes a series of guided tasks and open-ended challenges. Akashian Challengers are able to explore different aspects of the world\u2019s first decentralized cloud computing marketplace.\\n\\nAs a decentralized system, we\u2019re leveraging The Akashian Challenge incentivized testnet to gather data, identify critical issues, and ensure our network\u2019s scalability, security, and usability.\\n\\n**Check out our Phase 3 Start Guide below to help you prepare for the beginning of Phase 3 set to launch next Monday, November 30th.**\\n\\n####\\n\\n**Phase 3: Week 1 Start Guide**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n**The Akashian Challenge Phase 3: Developer Operations will launch on Monday, November 30th at 1700 UTC / 9:00AM PST. Phase 3 will encompass two weeks of challenges.**\\n\\n**Check out our** [**Phase 3 Overview &amp; Rewards Schedule**](https://akash.network/blog/the-akashian-challenge-phase-3-rewards-overview/) **to plan your strategy!**\\n\\nThe Akashian Challenge Phase 3 will test and showcase Akash DeCloud\u2019s deployment platform. Akashian Challengers will be incentivized to deploy applications using the Akash Network.\\n\\nEncompassing two weeks, Phase 3 will include guided challenges for deploying applications of increasing complexity \u2014 from simple single-page applications to blockchain network components, and open ended challenges where users can show off their Akash OPS skills by extending the guided examples to deploy any application they desire \u2014 from DeFi to CI.\\n\\nThere are additional rewards for participation outside of the deployment challenges, including contributions such as active validator and developer participation, writing blog posts and how-to guides, and sharing novel uses of our platform.\\n\\n####\\n\\n**Qualification Criteria**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nTo start, please [sign up here](https://app.akash.network/signup) if you have not participated in Akash\u2019s previous testnets.&nbsp; Although we do not prohibit anyone from participating, to claim AKT rewards:\\n\\n- You must not be a resident of any of the [OFAC sanctioned countries](https://www.treasury.gov/resource-center/sanctions/Pages/default.aspx).\\n- You must pass KYC/AML verification to collect the rewards (located during signup). The details for collecting the reward will be posted at a later time.\\n\\n####\\n\\n**Guided Challenges**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n**\\\\*The linked instructions will be available on&nbsp; 9AM PST / 5PM UTC on Monday November 30th, 2020.\\\\***\\n\\n####\\n\\n**Community Content**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nFor _Anything Goes_ and _DeCloud for DeFi_, Content must be submitted, reviewed and verified to be considered for rewards. Please submit the following [here](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScX4VVheTeo-WmzHe2IHw1dXfRX2tGv-MHzs75-Hp-7yKuCjA/viewform)**:**\\n\\n- First &amp; Last name\\n- Email\\n- Link to blog (if applicable)\\n- Link to guide (if applicable)\\n- Your username github link\\n- Discord username\\n\\nYour content will be verified by following your guide to confirm deployment, and blogs will be weighed on quality of the content.\\n\\nLimited to one submission per form, but participants are able to submit multiple submissions for different blogs and guides of different projects.\\n\\n####\\n\\n**Phase 3 Rewards**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nYou can check out the [**Phase 3 Rewards Overview**](https://akash.network/blog/the-akashian-challenge-phase-3-rewards-overview/) for a detailed schedule of reward opportunities. Together with Akash Network, Cosmostation will work to give users access to the wide range of use cases enabled by DeCloud as a node operator securing the network and providing useful end-user infrastructures.\\n\\n\u2014 **David Park, CMO of Cosmostation**\\n\\nAs we shared in early November, to increase access and support for Akash Token (AKT), our team engaged with Cosmostation on an integration partnership.\\n\\n**Today, we\u2019re excited to announce that our integration with Cosmostation, the number one wallet for the Cosmos ecosystem, is complete!**\\n\\nA trusted wallet provider for other top Cosmos projects including Akash partner Kava Labs, Terra, and Iris, Cosmostation is built on the Cosmos SDK and has mobile wallet apps on Android and iOS.\\n\\nCosmostation\u2019s goals are to operate and maintain a secure validator infrastructure for the stability of the network, and to provide essential tools for Cosmonauts to explore the Cosmos universe. Cosmostation is also known for having an excellent block explorer [MintScan.io](http://mintscan.io). MintScan.io enables users to view transaction receipts, navigate through individual addresses, monitor network conditions, and browse validator lists.\\n\\n> Akash's vision of a true Decentralized cloud is only possible with a healthy ecosystem that supports our validators, stakers, and users.\\n>\\n> Cosmostation \u2014 considered one of the most respected players in the Proof of Stake world \u2014 supporting Akash with Validation and Wallet services not only strengthens our community but the PoS ecosystem as a whole.\\n>\\n> I'm thrilled to welcome Cosmostation to Akash.\\n\\n**\\\\-- Greg, CEO of Akash Network**\\n\\n**As Lunie will be sunsetting their operations,** _**AKT holders currently on Lunie wallet will need to transition to Cosmostation wallet before November 27th.**_\\n\\n####\\n\\n**What Can AKT Holders Do on Cosmostation Wallet?**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nThrough Cosmostation, AKT holders will be able to:\\n\\n- Import, create, watch wallet\\n- Check balance\\n- Send transactions\\n- Browse transaction history\\n- Vote for governance proposals\\n- Delegation, Undelegation, Re-invest, Rewards, etc.\\n\\nPlease note that both Lunie and Cosmostation are non-custodial wallets and private keys are not stored on wallets, and are recoverable on any wallet with the seed phrase generated during wallet creation. As all accounts are on the blockchain, your AKT will continue staking.\\n\\n_**\\\\*\\\\*\\\\*If you\u2019re currently using the Lunie browser extension, please make sure you backup your keys.**_\\n\\n####\\n\\n**Cosmostation Guides for AKT Holders**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nFollowing are helpful links and guides from Cosmostation for leveraging Cosmostation wallet for your AKT.\\n\\n[**Cosmostation Wallet iOS App**](https://apps.apple.com/app/cosmostation/id1459830339) **|** [**Cosmostation Wallet Android App**](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=wannabit.io.cosmostaion&amp;hl)\\n\\n- [Akash Mobile](<https://medium.com/cosmostation/how-to-create-your-personal-akash-network-akt-account-on-cosmostation-wallet-ios-android-web-16e51b568400%20(edited)>) [Wallet User Guide](https://medium.com/cosmostation/how-to-create-your-personal-akash-network-akt-account-on-cosmostation-wallet-ios-android-web-16e51b568400)\\n- [How HD Wallets &amp; Mnemonic Phrases Work](https://medium.com/cosmostation/the-magic-behind-a-mnemonic-phrase-and-hd-wallets-let-us-explain-43d9c97f6098)\\n- [How Redelegation for Cosmos SDK Based Networks Work](https://medium.com/cosmostation/what-you-need-to-know-about-cosmos-atom-redelegation-e45ca7da6fdf)\\n- [Top 10 Selection of Websites](https://casinoofthekings.com/top-10-canadian-online-casinos/)\\n- [Introduction to Keystation, an End-to-end Encrypted Key Manager](https://medium.com/cosmostation/introducing-keystation-end-to-end-encrypted-key-manager-for-dapps-built-with-the-cosmos-sdk-37dac753feb5)\\n\\n####\\n\\n**Don\u2019t Miss the Latest Akash Network and AKT News**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nPlease join [our Telegram](https://t.me/AkashNW) for the latest wallet, Akash, and AKT news.\\n\\n####\\n\\n[**Join The Unstoppable Cloud**](https://t.me/AkashNW)\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Network Announces Integration Partnership with Cosmostation Wallet&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Decentralized cloud computing allows for a faster and more efficient user experience at a cost much lower compared to traditional cloud. Together with Akash Network, Cosmostation will work to give users access to the wide range of use cases enabled by DeCloud as a node operator securing the network and providing useful end-user infrastructures.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-11-24T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Partners&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Partners&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Maly Ly&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.BE6tallI.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1600],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1200],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-network-announces-integration-partnership-with-cosmostation-wallet/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;announcing-akash-advisor-brian-fox-creator-of-bash-shell/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;announcing-akash-advisor-brian-fox-creator-of-bash-shell&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;If you\u2019ve ever used the GNU Bash, GNU Makeinfo, GNU Info, GNU Finger, GNU Echo, or GNU Emacs, chances are, you\u2019ve heard of open source pioneer and innovator Brian Fox and have leveraged his ubiquitous and valuable open source contributions.  \\n\\nAn early and core contributor to the open source movement, Brian is also renowned for having built the first interactive online banking software in the U.S. for Wells Fargo, and creating an open source election system, for which he [co-wrote a New York Times article with former CIA head R. James Woolsey](https://www.nytimes.com/2017/08/03/opinion/open-source-software-hacker-voting.html), advocating for open source election systems as a way to secure US elections against foreign interference.  \\n\\nWith decades advocating for, and advancing greater access to technology to improve people\u2019s lives, Brian espouses Akash\u2019s values of openness, sovereignty, equality, and empathy. He is also co-founder and CTO of [Orchid Labs](https://www.orchid.com/), the first incentivized, peer-to-peer privacy network.  \\n\\n**Today, we\u2019re excited to announce that Brian Fox has joined Akash Network as an Advisor. Brian\u2019s strategic and technical guidance, experience, and ideas will be invaluable as we build the world\u2019s first decentralized cloud to enable greater access, flexibility, and freedom for builders of the future.**&nbsp;  \\n\\nWe recently spoke with Brian about his perspectives on open source and blockchain adoption, and his current projects.\\n\\n####   \\n**How did you transition from open source to blockchain?**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nFor me, it wasn't so much of a transition from open source--it was \u201cAha!\u201d. By the time I got involved in blockchain--which was 2016-2017--it was already well on its way. And I was impressed with the existing spread that was out there.&nbsp;  \\n\\nAnd that's what made me think that there could be an even wider spread and a more mainstream acceptance and utilization of blockchain.\\n\\n####   \\n**What is your perspective on the \u201ccorporatization\u201d of open source?**&nbsp;  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nIn my perspective, the reason for open source is the same reason for mathematical formulas. I don't want you to own a mathematical formula because what you're doing when you give it away is raising the bar of technology for humanity, including me. And even though I haven't monetarily benefited from it, if my ideas are disseminated, then other people get to leverage my ideas to progress innovation. Other people get to build on my ideas, which allows me to build on their ideas, and so on.  \\n\\nThe Bash shell, for example, runs on every OS and is delivered with almost every OS. And this is a useful piece of software that runs under the hood and powers a lot of technology.&nbsp;  \\n\\nAnd you can look at the impact of the Linux kernel. You've got Debian, which is 100% free. You've got Ubuntu, which is not 100% free.&nbsp;  \\n\\nYou have Cygnus, the world's first open source company started by my partner and friend David Wallace. Cygnus began by offering services support for free software, eventually merging with Red Hat, which now serves corporate customers. You've got IBM, stating that they are the world's largest open source company.  \\n\\nAnd yet still managing to make zillions of dollars.\\n\\n####   \\n**What are current blockchain projects that excite you, and why?**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**  \\n\\nAny project with the fundamental aim of spreading the network and bringing blockchain to places where it didn't normally exist. For example, I believe we need the same kind of nodes that we have on Amazon, in other places in the cloud.&nbsp;  \\n\\nI believe that having a small device that you can put in a person\u2019s home, like the Akash Supermini, is a great move. I also think that putting software on phones and creating incentives for participating is key for adoption. If you look around the world, no matter where you look, even if the rest of the technical infrastructure isn't there, mobile phone technology is everywhere.\\n\\nBeing able to bring blockchain technology to small tribal communities in Africa, for example, to allow people to make payments and secure their transactions, and enabling small to large organizations to get veracity in record-keeping into these communities.&nbsp;  \\n\\nBlockchain is an excellent solution for that.  \\n\\nThere are many other things we can do with blockchain in those communities. The sooner we get it into these global communities, the faster we'll find out how useful it really is.\\n\\n####   \\n**What do you think are the challenges for mainstream adoption of blockchain?**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nBlockchain is still the Wild Wild West, and people are panning for gold. Somebody found that six pound nugget, and everybody else is now going nuts trying to pan for more. The reality is that most of this interest is driven by capitalism.&nbsp;  \\n\\nWhile there is so much interest during these earlier stages and so much opportunity, capitalists are focusing on speculation in a new token arriving in the market, or whether it's a utility token that has obvious transactional functions.&nbsp;  \\n\\nI believe that in a relatively short period of time, these speculative opportunities will be over, and people will build more valuable and enduring systems. We'll start to see blockchain flow into the mainstream more and more. I think it's already coming into the mainstream and you can see banks are starting to support it.&nbsp;\\n\\n####   \\n**What projects are you working on?**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nI have an organization called Open Source Election (OSE) Systems. I care deeply about transparency and accountability in our election process. I care deeply about the democratic process as a whole. I don't feel that the systems we have in place or that we've had in place since 2004 at least, have anything to do with transparency.&nbsp;  \\n\\nWe've got 350 million people living in the United States--about 150 million who vote. That's a lot of votes. We want to be able to track that information and we want to be able to support democracy.  \\n\\nI\u2019m also interested in getting technology into the hands of people who don\u2019t have access to it. For example, there is a great need for technology in the Niger Delta. And it should be there. Nigeria has a lot of people who are coding. There's a lot of technology in Nigeria, but not necessarily in the Delta and in the rural areas.&nbsp;  \\n\\nWe should get that technology out there, so more people can access it.\\n\\n####   \\n**Don\u2019t Miss the Latest Akash News**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nJoin [our Telegram](https://t.me/AkashNW) for the latest Akash Network and Akash Token (AKT) Thursday, we shared a teaser of [The Akashian Challenge Phase 3: Developer Operations](https://akash.network/blog/the-akashian-challenge-phase-3-teaser/), the third and final phase of our incentivized testnet.\\n\\nInspired by ecosystem projects from our partners and friends, such as Cosmos Game of Stakes, Solana Tour de Sol, and Kava Founder Rewards, The Akashian Challenge enables you to explore our decentralized cloud and help us strengthen and secure our platform.\\n\\n**With 500,000 Akash Token (AKT) in rewards, and validators and developers joining from around the world, The Akashian Challenge Phase 3: Developer Operations will test your technical and social cunning through a series of tasks and open-ended challenges that get progressively more difficult.**\\n\\n**Ready to get started?! Check out our challenges and token rewards overview below, and get ready for instructions next Wednesday, November 25, 2020.**\\n\\n_**May Akash be with you!**_\\n\\n####\\n\\n**Phase 3: Developer Operations Overview**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nIntegrating performance enhancements from Cosmos SDK v0.40, The Akashian Challenge Phase 3 will test and showcase Akash DeCloud\u2019s deployment platform. Akashian Challengers will be incentivized to deploy applications using the Akash Network.\\n\\nEncompassing two weeks, Phase 3 will include **guided challenges** for deploying applications of increasing complexity \u2014 from simple single-page applications to blockchain network components, and **open ended challenges** where users can show off their Akash OPS skills by extending the guided examples to deploy any application they desire \u2014 from DeFi to CI.\\n\\nThere are additional rewards for participation outside of the deployment challenges, including contributions such as active validator participation, writing blog posts and how-to guides, and sharing novel uses of our platform.\\n\\n**The Akashian Challenge Phase 3: Developer Operations will launch on Monday, November 30th at 1700 UTC / 9:00AM PST. Phase 3 will encompass two weeks of challenges.**\\n\\n**Phase 3 Goals:**\\n\\n- Test platform functionality for Mainnet 2\\n- Distribute tokens to potential users for Mainnet 2\\n- Build a catalog of applications (SDLs) to launch Mainnet 2\\n\\n**Phase 3 Challenges:**\\n\\n- Guided Challenges\\n- Open Ended Challenges\\n\\nPhase 3 will accelerate our vision for a decentralized and open cloud computing marketplace and serve as the launchpad for Mainnet 2.\\n\\n####\\n\\n**Key Dates**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nThe Phase 3 network and challenges will be live during the week of November 30, 2020 - December 4, 2020 and the week of December 7, 2020 - December 11, 2020.\\n\\nRewards from the first week will be posted on December 14, 2020. Complete results of rewards will be posted on December 21, 2020.\\n\\n_**Scoring Note**\\\\_\\\\_: where submissions satisfy more than one reward, all rewards will be granted for that submission._\\n\\n####\\n\\n**Phase 3 Guided Challenges**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nGuided challenges are meant to be used as step-by-step guides to deploying applications on our network.\\n\\nEach challenge will have accompanying instructions and example deployment configurations.\\n\\n####\\n\\n**Week 1**\\n\\nIn Week 1, challenges will focus on deploying stand-alone applications, from website deployments to single-node blockchain networks.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620925248-screen-shot-2020-12-01-at-1-01-39-pm-1024x408.png)\\n\\n#### **Week 2**\\n\\nIn Week 2, challenges will focus on leveraging Akash to deploy various node types and components for a live blockchain network. We\u2019ll provide connection details for a live Cosmos SDK-based network.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620925347-screen-shot-2020-12-01-at-5-57-36-pm-1024x410.png)\\n\\n#### **Week 1 and Week 2: Bonus Rewards**\\n\\nFollowing are bonus rewards that can be earned for participating in both weeks of Phase 3.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620925371-screen-shot-2020-12-01-at-1-02-43-pm-1024x279.png)\\n\\n####\\n\\n**Phase 3 Open Ended Challenges**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n**Open-Ended Deployment Challenge**\\n\\nAs a generic cloud platform, Akash DeCloud has the potential to be used in a wide variety of use cases. This open-ended challenge is meant to explore what kinds of applications can be deployed on DeCloud, and how.\\n\\nYou\u2019ll support the Akash DeCloud community by finding unique applications to deploy and sharing your deployment configuration via a pull request on [Awesome Akash](https://github.com/ovrclk/awesome-akash).\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620926269-screen-shot-2020-11-17-at-9-06-26-pm-1024x162.png)\\n\\n**Network Support Rewards**\\n\\nWhile validators and other network components are not necessarily targeted in this testnet, they are of course essential to maintaining a healthy DeCloud.\\n\\nLeverage this testnet to practice your operations, or try new ones.\\n\\nTo earn rewards for this challenge, you should be actively participating \u2014 keep your component(s) up-to-date and respond to any network proposals that may come up.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620926278-screen-shot-2020-11-17-at-9-07-24-pm-1024x223.png)\\n\\n**Community Content Rewards**\\n\\nDrop your knowledge about Akash DeCloud to earn rewards. The community content challenges support community members who independently publish articles and guides related to the Akash Network.\\n\\n**Community Content Rewards Categories:**\\n\\n1.  **Anything Goes**: An open-ended category where \\&quot;Anything Goes!\\&quot; with community-generated content related to Akash.\\n2.  **DeCloud for DeFi:** A category calling on our community to leverage Akash DeCloud as the infrastructure supporting DeFi applications.\\n\\n**1) Anything Goes**\\n\\nFor the first category, here are _Anything Goes_ ideas for you to explore:\\n\\n- [Discourse](https://www.discourse.org) (Forum) - widely used crypto forums\\n- [Wiki JS](https://wiki.js.org/) (Wiki) - beautiful open source Wiki\\n- [Mattermost](https://mattermost.com/) (Messaging) - Slack alternative\\n- [GitLab](https://about.gitlab.com/) (CI / CD) - Github alternative\\n- [N8N](https://n8n.io/) ( Task Automation) - Zapier alternative\\n- [Ghost](https://ghost.org/) (Blogging) - Medium alternative\\n- [Jitsi](https://jitsi.org/) (Private Video Conferencing) - running en ephemeral Jitsi server would be the gold standard of private video conferencing\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620926289-screen-shot-2020-11-17-at-9-08-15-pm-1024x332.png)\\n\\n**2) DeCloud for DeFi Rewards**\\n\\nFor the second category, Akash DeCloud's platform ensures DeFi protocols [remain sovereign and more accessible](https://akash.network/blog/akash-decloud-for-defi/).\\n\\nIn this bonus challenge, we\u2019re asking the community to help us demonstrate Akash\u2019s capabilities to support DeFi.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620926297-screen-shot-2020-11-17-at-9-08-48-pm-1024x247.png)\\n\\n**DeFi List**\\n\\nEach our Mainnet 1 launch and IEO on BitMax last month, we achieved key milestones to secure the Akash Network and achieve liquidity for Akash Token (AKT), developing a strong foundation for our platform.&nbsp;\\n\\nIn parallel, our Engineering and Product teams have accelerated platform functionality in preparation for The Akashian Challenge: Phase 3 Testnet, and Mainnet 2, soon after, to materialize Akash DeCloud.\\n\\nToday, we\u2019re excited to launch our biweekly _Developing Decloud_ Product Update to share more about the development of our platform and products with you.\\n\\n####   \\n**Akash DeCloud Development Update**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**  \\n\\n**Improved Bid Pricing**\\n\\nPreviously, a provider was only able to specify their bid pricing based on the memory requested for a given job. This worked as a proof of concept, and for internal and small scale testing, but we need a more robust pricing configuration system for real world applications.&nbsp;\\n\\nProviders [can now set](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/pull/904) pricing based on parameters such as CPU count, storage capacity, and endpoints!\\n\\n  \\n**Support for TCP &amp; UDP**\\n\\nUntil now, Akash only supported client traffic via the HTTP application protocol on port 80. HTTP supports virtual host routing which enables routing to multiple endpoints or tenants. However, Akash must support non-HTTP traffic and different protocols, and route to the appropriate tenant applications.&nbsp;\\n\\nAn Akash endpoint consists of two components, a host name or IP address, and a unique port chosen at random. [This enables routing](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/pull/904) to multiple unique application endpoints for a deployment, and allows users to choose which transport protocol the ingress router needs to support, either TCP or UDP.\\n\\n  \\n**Audited Attributes**\\n\\nWe\u2019ve been working on a system called \u201c[Audited Attributes](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/pull/905)\u201d, which will allow users deploying applications to be more selective about which providers can run their apps. Anyone on the Akash blockchain can assign these attributes to Providers via an on-chain transaction.\\n\\nBut the goal is for reputable persons or companies to be able to vouch for Providers by assigning them these audited attributes, and users can select Providers whose attributes fit their deployment needs.  \\n\\n  \\n**Preparation for The Akashian Challenge Phase 3 Testnet**\\n\\nTo prepare for the upcoming [The Akashian Challenge Phase 3](https://akash.network/blog/the-akashian-challenge-phase-3-teaser/) testnet, we\u2019re progressing a number of features including Audited Attributes, and implementation of the long-awaited Inter-Blockchain Communication protocol (IBC), which spans across the entire Cosmos ecosystem.\\n\\n####   \\n**Inter-Blockchain Communication (IBC) Development Update**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n**Typed Events**\\n\\n[Typed events have been merged](https://github.com/cosmos/relayer/pull/324) upstream on the Cosmos SDK and work has begun on the relayer implementation. This fix makes it easier for clients to consume events from all Cosmos SDK-based chains. These include active validator set changes, delegations, governance proposals, and other chain specific events.&nbsp;\\n\\nWhen you\u2019re watching new blocks show up on a block explorer, for example, these are events, and previously the code to implement them was complex and unruly. Typed events will make coding event-driven applications much simpler to write.&nbsp;\\n\\nAkash pushed these changes to the Cosmos SDK, as we\u2019re maintaining three of these types of applications: the provider daemon, the relayer, and the deploy daemon.  \\n\\n  \\n**API Server**\\n\\n[We\u2019ve also started work](https://github.com/cosmos/relayer/pull/323) on the API server. Presently, the relayer functions only via the command line interface, meaning there is no way to programmatically interact with it besides writing bash scripts against the command line tool. This work allows the relayer to expose an RPC server that enables a user to make common queries and use all the relayer functionality against a programmatic HTTP interface, i.e. a website.&nbsp;\\n\\nUnder the contract we have with the Interchain Foundation (ICF), one of the deliverables for the relayer is to expose this functionality via a REST interface. This will allow for remote management of relayer nodes.\\n\\n  \\n**Testnets**\\n\\nIBC has gone through major security audits, and is currently undergoing final preparations for the v1.0 release, which is a part of Cosmos SDK v0.40. Alongside this release, there will be v1.0 of the relayer, which functions as the secure bridge between IBC compatible chains.&nbsp;\\n\\nTo ensure compatibility, there will be a number of upcoming testnets that will connect multiple validator testnets between a number of ecosystem organizations including Akash, Agoric, Cosmos, and CosmWasm!\\n\\n####   \\n**What\u2019s Next?**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n*   Hands-on testing and bug fixing, including documenting and addressing possible workflow improvements\\n    \\n*   Reviewing and supporting a security audit.\\n    \\n*   Preparing for Testnet v3: documentation, guides, examples.  \\n      \\n    \\n\\n####   \\n**Don\u2019t Miss the Latest Akash Network Product Updates**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**  \\n\\nJoin our [Discord dev](https://discord.akash.network) chat for technical support and information.\\n\\nJoin our [Telegram](https://t.me/AkashNW) for the latest the world\u2019s first decentralized peer-to-peer cloud computing marketplace, our vision is to materialize a permissionless, sovereign, and open cloud where architects and builders have greater freedom to expand the human experience.&nbsp;\\n\\nTo gather data, identify critical issues, and ensure our network\u2019s scalability, security, and usability, we\u2019ve leveraged a series of testnets that started with our Founding Member Challenge in Q4 2019, and continued with the launch of The Akashian Challenge Incentivized Testnet Phase 1 in Q2 2020.\\n\\n####   \\n**Results from The Akashian Challenge Launch in Q2 2020**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**  \\n\\nThe Akashian Challenge launched in Q2 2020 and quickly became the second largest testnet in the Cosmos Hub since the Game of Stakes, with 99 active validators participating.\\n\\nThrough The Akashian Challenge, we tested governance and voting, and improved the process for network upgrades that strengthened our platform. These explorations have given us critical insights on how to build a healthy and vital community for growth and lead to a successful launch of our Mainnet 1 with full validator set of 64 mining blocks from Genesis.\\n\\nDuring Phase 1, our testnet withstood an AWS outage that brought down the centralized cloud (and a good portion of the internet), further validating market need for a _decentralized_ cloud. Our testnet also weathered a massive [zero fee transaction](https://medium.com/@novysf/the-outcome-from-akash-testnet-zero-fee-transaction-attack-5fd4aaa68d97) attack.\\n\\nWe were thrilled to see the massive community support and collaboration that occurred in Phase 1 and Phase 2, and we\u2019re grateful to our early Akashian Challenge participants for helping us build the foundation for a stronger network.\\n\\n####   \\n**What\u2019s Next: The Akashian Challenge Phase 3**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nWe invite you to join us in the final stage of exploration, Phase 3: Developer Operations!\\n\\nWith 500,000 AKT in rewards, you\u2019ll need to leverage your technical and social prowess to maneuver your way to victory.&nbsp;  \\n\\n**The Akashian Challenge Phase 3: Developer Operations will launch on Monday, November 30th at 1700 UTC / 9:00AM PST. Phase 3 will encompass two weeks of challenges.**  \\n\\nPhase 3 Goals:\\n\\n*   Test platform functionality for Mainnet 2\\n    \\n*   Distribute tokens to potential users for Mainnet 2\\n    \\n*   Build a catalog of applications (SDLs) to launch Mainnet 2\\n    \\n\\nPhase 3 will accelerate our vision for a decentralized and open cloud computing marketplace, serving as the launchpad for Mainnet 2. Users will be able to lease compute for deploying applications.\\n\\n  \\n**Performance Improvements from Cosmos SDK v0.40**  \\n\\nWith the upgrade to [Cosmos SDK v0.40](https://github.com/cosmos/cosmos-sdk/releases/tag/v0.40.0-rc0), also known as Stargate, there will be a number of performance enhancements to the testnet. The most notable improvement in Phase 3 will be the migration to Protobuf, which will increase transaction throughput and decrease the amount of data being sent between nodes.&nbsp;\\n\\nOther upgrades shipping with Stargate include state sync, full featured light clients, and support for the first standardized protocol for Inter-Blockchain Communication (IBC)!&nbsp;\\n\\n  \\n**Application Deployments**  \\n\\nWith Phase 3, users can deploy web-based cloud applications -- such as static sites and API servers -- most common DeFi application components.&nbsp; We look forward to seeing and rewarding deployment of innovations like stateless or \u201cstate light\u201d blockchain applications; these are self-bootstrapping and have light storage requirements.&nbsp;&nbsp;\\n\\nDeploying a blockchain node on our network will be one of the premier use cases, and will provide dApp developers an alternative to expensive and inflexible cloud provider services such as Amazon Web Services and Google Cloud. Even though Akash can support data-intensive full nodes, the scope of this testnet is limited to functionality tests and does not include stress tests.&nbsp;\\n\\nWe respectfully ask our community to refrain from deploying full-nodes for now as we have limited computing capacity.\\n\\n  \\n**Schedule**  \\n\\nPhase 3 of The Akashian Challenge will launch on Monday, November 30th, 2020 and run for two weeks.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\\n\\n  \\n**Rewards**  \\n\\nTo incentivize participation, 500,000 AKT will be distributed as Phase 3 rewards. Developers can build on the testnet and earn tokens by deploying applications. Validators can earn tokens by completing challenges and supporting the network.&nbsp;\\n\\nThere will be opportunities to earn additional rewards outside of deployment challenges.\\n\\n  \\n**How to Get Started**  \\n\\nStay tuned, as we\u2019ll be announcing information on how to participate, as well as a more detailed task and rewards schedule, next Wednesday November 18th.\\n\\n  \\n  \\n**Don\u2019t Miss Critical Phase 3 Updates**  \\n\\nJoin our [Discord dev](https://discord.akash.network/) chat for technical support and information.  \\n\\nJoin our [Telegram](https://t.me/AkashNW) for the latest Akash Network and AKT announcements.&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;The Akashian our Mainnet 1 launch and IEO on BitMax in the past month, we\u2019ve progressed key milestones to secure our network and achieve liquidity for Akash Token (AKT). To expand access and support for AKT, our team has engaged with a number of top ecosystem partners to add additional wallet solutions.&nbsp;\\n\\nAs our platform is built on the Cosmos SDK, [Cosmostation](https://www.cosmostation.io/), the number one wallet for the Cosmos ecosystem, was a top choice for our team. In addition to supporting Akash partner Kava Labs, Cosmostation is a trusted wallet provider for a number of other top tier Cosmos projects including Terra and Iris.\\n\\nIn addition to mobile wallet apps on Android and iOS, Cosmostation has an exceptional block explorer [MintScan.io](http://mintscan.io).&nbsp;\\n\\nThrough Cosmostation, AKT holders will be able to:\\n\\n*   Import, create, watch wallet\\n    \\n*   Check balance\\n    \\n*   Send transactions\\n    \\n*   Browse transaction history\\n    \\n*   Vote for governance proposals\\n    \\n*   Delegation, Undelegation, Re-invest, Rewards, etc.\\n    \\n\\nOur integration with Cosmostation will be ready by November 21st. Given [Lunie\u2019s announcement today that they\u2019ll be sunsetting their operations on November 27th](https://medium.com/luniehq/sunsetting-lunie-io-66d566c14ba1), _**AKT holders currently on Lunie wallet will need to transition to Cosmostation wallet.**_\\n\\nLunie and Cosmostation are both non-custodial wallets, meaning your private keys are not stored on wallets and recoverable on any wallet with the seed phrase generated during wallet creation. Additionally, as all accounts are on the blockchain, your AKT will continue staking.\\n\\nWe\u2019ll be sharing migration guides with you from Lunie and Cosmostation in the next two weeks, to help you ensure a smooth and friction-less transition.\\n\\n**For those of you using the Lunie browser extension, please make sure you backup your keys.**  \\n  \\nPlease join our Telegram for the latest wallet, Akash, and AKT news.  \\n  \\n\\n#### [**Join The Unstoppable Cloud**](https://t.me/AkashNW)&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Network to Transition from Lunie to Cosmostation Wallet&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;With our Mainnet 1 launch and IEO on BitMax in the past month, we\u2019ve progressed key milestones to secure our network and achieve liquidity for Akash Token (AKT).
