Akashians, I hope you\u2019ve been staying safe and well!\\n\\nSince 2016, when my cofounder and CTO Adam Bozanich and I started building Akash Network, we staked our lives and our reputation to enable developers and organizations around the world to have greater access, freedom, and flexibility to build and grow.  \\n\\nTogether, we lead a small global team of experienced technology platform and open source experts, and we\u2019ve been working to materialize The Unstoppable Cloud, the first viable alternative to centralized cloud providers like Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure.  \\n\\nIn the past month, we\u2019ve gotten much closer to realizing our vision for Akash\u2019s decentralized cloud marketplace with the launch of Akash Mainnet 1 and our Initial Exchange Offering (IEO) on BitMax--two critical milestones for securing and growing our platform.  \\n\\nWe recognize that this is a marathon and not a sprint, and our success depends on the continued support of Akashians around the world who believe in our vision.&nbsp;  \\n\\nBased on feedback we\u2019ve received from our global community following the IEO, we\u2019ve since realized that there was confusion around how staking rewards accrued, and how the staking rewards affect total token circulation.&nbsp;  \\n\\nWe would not do anything to jeopardize your trust, and our team has taken this feedback very seriously.  \\n\\n**First, we take full accountability for not providing more communications and information on how our staking rewards impact the total circulating supply.**\\n\\n####   \\n**Clarification on Total Akash Token (AKT) Supply**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nTo clarify several points around token supply since our IEO:  \\n  \\n\\n1.  On Akash Network, AKT holders stake AKT to secure the Akash PoS network and in exchange earn rewards.&nbsp;  \\n    a. In the early days of the network, when meaningful income is not yet realized from network utilization, stakers earn ~54% APR rewards from inflation (new tokens minted).  \\n    b. The ~54% APR staking reward starts accruing at Mainnet 1 launch.  \\n    c. This APR is subject to change as we aim to lower inflation as the network matures. We will likely submit the first governance proposal change to this before the end of October 2020.  \\n      \\n    \\n2.  On September 25th, BitMax announced our IEO on the same day our Mainnet 1 launched.&nbsp;The circulating supply at the Genesis block was 2.8M AKT with 54% APR as staking rewards announced, as reflected in BitMax promotions that day.  \\n      \\n    \\n3.  To provide more information to prospective investors, we launched and announced our [AKT Token mini-site](https://akash.network/token/) with our unlock schedule included.  \\n      \\n    \\n4.  On October 16th, when our listing went live on BitMax (Block #284,500), our total token in circulation of 5,651,695 AKT included 2,800,000 AKT unlocked at Genesis and 2,851,695 AKT from accrued Staking Rewards.  \\n      \\n    \\n5.  As of today (Block #342,312), we have a total of 6,239,818 AKT in circulation, including 2,800,000 AKT unlocked at Genesis and 3,439,818 AKT from accrued Staking Rewards.&nbsp;  \\n      \\n    \\n6.  **As of this post's writing (Block #342,467), Akash has a staking ratio of 85.10%, meaning 88.03M of AKT is locked up for at least 21 days:**  \\n    a. Akash has one of the highest bonding ratios in the Proof-of-Stake and highest in the Cosmos Ecosystem.  \\n    b. For comparison, Band Protocol has an 81.28% staking ratio, and Kava has a 73.93% staking ratio.\\n    \\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620926168-nanqvfcmj91247hjwcy6uuuoqtehr2cvffglssuxhwj5nytslue37mfqt4tauvwr2ofrkcd2ujms3ugbw-5x9ugz4vtuuusvljs6bgcy5jzakh3onuko2myk4vqlls12-cqbuz.png)\\n\\n#### **How We\u2019ll Improve Our Communications About AKT**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**  \\n\\nGoing forward, we are committed to ensuring clearer communications and education around our token economics:  \\n  \\n\\n*   We\u2019ve updated our [AKT Token mini-site](https://akash.network/token/) to include a more dynamic and detailed unlock and circulating supply schedule for your reference.\\n    \\n\\n*   We\u2019ll also provide and share a biweekly token supply and rewards update from our CFO Cheng Wang, on [The Unstoppable Blog](https://akash.network/blog/).\\n    \\n\\n*   For those new to staking, we\u2019ll be releasing a guide on how to stake your AKT and earn our generous token rewards.\\n    \\n\\nAs I\u2019ve mentioned before, we couldn\u2019t have achieved our Mainnet 1 and BitMax IEO milestones without your support. We\u2019re excited to share more soon about Phase 3 and Mainnet 2--the realization of Akash DeCloud aka The Unstoppable Cloud.  \\n\\nI\u2019m grateful for your belief in our vision, and for your patience and understanding as we improve our communications efforts.  \\n\\nI invite you to [join our Telegram](http://t.me/AkashNW(opens in a new tab)) and continue to give us feedback so we can improve our communications, product, and community.\\n\\n####   \\n  \\n[**Join The Unstoppable Cloud**](https://t.me/AkashNW)&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;CEO Statement on Total AKT Token Circulation&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Greetings Akashians, I hope you\u2019ve been staying safe and well!&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-10-20T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;],[0,&quot;News&quot;],[0,&quot;Product&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Greg Osuri&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.CKx9bueS.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1332],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1002],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/ceo-statement-on-total-akt-token-circulation/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-network-launches-korean-community/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-network-launches-korean-community&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;With a long history and familiarity with tokens and digital payments that has spanned decades, Koreans have been at the forefront of crypto adoption and growth. Korea has the highest percentage of citizens who use crypto, and the Korean government has made regulatory and investment commitments to expand the crypto/blockchain industry.  \\n  \\n\\n**Today, we\u2019re thrilled to announce the launch of Akash Network\u2019s Korean Community to expand our global vision for The Unstoppable Cloud.**\\n\\n####   \\n**Akash Network Korean Content**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nWe welcome Korean audiences around the world to learn more about Akash Network and Akash Token (AKT) by visiting our Korean [website](https://akash.network/about/?lang=zh-hans).\\n\\nFor those new to The Unstoppable Cloud, we welcome you to check out the following resources in Korean, to learn more about us:  \\n\\n*   [**Akash White Papers**](https://akash.network/whitepapers/?lang=ko)\\n    \\n*   [**Mainnet Launch &amp; IEO on BitMax**](https://akash.network/blog/%ec%95%84%ec%b9%b4%ec%8b%9c%ea%b0%80-%eb%a9%94%ec%9d%b8%eb%84%b7-%eb%a1%a0%ec%b9%ad%ea%b3%bc-bitmax%ec%97%90%ec%84%9c-ieo%eb%a5%bc-%ec%a7%84%ed%96%89%ed%95%a9%eb%8b%88%eb%8b%a4/?lang=ko)\\n    \\n*   [**AKT Token Page**](https://akash.network/token/?lang=ko)\\n    \\n*   [**Akash Supermini Portable Supercomputer**](https://akash.network/supermini/?lang=ko)\\n    \\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620925242-mainnet-and-bm-banner-1024x768.png)\\n\\n####   \\n  \\n**Q4 2020 Updates**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n**Akash IEO on BitMax**\\n\\nBitMax.io, the industry-leading digital asset trading platform built by Wall Street quant trading veterans, launched the primary listing and auction of the Akash Token (AKT) on October 15th, and the listing will go live today at 10am EDT, October 16th.\\n\\n####   \\n**Partnerships**  \\n\\n**Chainlink:** We recently announced that Akash Network is to integrate with Chainlink to enable more accurate, secure, and reliable price data on Akash\u2019s DeCloud platform.  \\n  \\n**Kava:** Through the integration of Kava's USDX, Akash becomes the first decentralized cloud platform to have a stablecoin, allowing cloud providers to avoid the market volatility of cryptocurrency, and developers to pay for cloud computing using USDX. This integration strengthens AKT's liquidity and provides Akash users with a stable medium of exchange, while achieving greater adoption for Kava's stablecoin and an increased debt ceiling from AKT collateral.\\n\\n**Cosmos\u2019s ICF for IBC Development:** We\u2019re thrilled to announce that Akash Network is solidifying an essential position in the Cosmos ecosystem through partnership with the Interchain Foundation. We\u2019re partnering with ICF to accelerate development of the IBC interoperability protocol. Our integral contribution to the development of IBC will enable us to adopt and benefit from interchain technologies faster than any other company.\\n\\n####   \\n**Akash DeCloud Platform**  \\n\\nIn Q2 2020, we successfully launched [The Akashian Challenge](https://akash.network/challenge/), our incentivized testnet. **The Akashian Challenge was the second largest testnet in the Cosmos ecosystem since Game of Stakes, and the second largest active testnet after Ethereum 2.0**, The Akashian Challenge attracted 99 active Challengers from around the world, competing for 64 validator positions at mainnet.  \\n\\nTo properly compensate cloud providers on Akash Network, we launched Mainnet 1 on September 25th with 64 validators to stabilize the staking set and establish economic value for Akash Token (AKT).&nbsp;  \\n\\nMainnet 1 is the beginning of Akash DeCloud and network governance. Mainnet 1 enables staking and governance operations including the ability to delegate to validators and vote on governance proposals.\\n\\n####   \\n**Akash Supermini**\\n\\nWe sold out of pre-orders for the first production run of our hardware product, [Supermini portable supercomputer](https://akash.network/supermini/), within 3 weeks. We developed Supermini to give people control and privacy over their data, and to become participants of the cloud.&nbsp;  \\n\\nOwners will be able to run server apps and machine learning workloads, and offer their Supermini\u2019s unused compute on Akash to earn Akash Token (AKT).&nbsp;  \\n\\nSupermini leverages Akash\u2019s proprietary cloud and blockchain technologies, developed over four years. Join our Korean Community Telegram to get the latest updates on the Supermini.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922460-akashsuperminiconceptrenderday1-1024x576.jpg)\\n\\n####   \\n**Join Our Korean Community Now**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**  \\n\\nTo celebrate the launch of our Korean community, we\u2019ll be launching exclusive giveaways next week in Akash\u2019s Korean Telegram channel.  \\n\\nWe invite you to join the Akash Korean community to get the latest Akash and AKT Token news and updates, and help us build the decentralized future of the Internet!&nbsp;  \\n\\n####   \\n  \\n[**Join Akash Korean Community**](https://t.me/AkashNW_KR)&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Network Launches Korean Community!&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;With a long history and familiarity with tokens and digital payments that has spanned decades, Koreans have been at the forefront of crypto adoption and growth. Korea has the highest percentage of citizens who use crypto, and the Korean government has made regulatory and investment commitments to expand the crypto/blockchain industry.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-10-16T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;News&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;News&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Maly Ly&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.ycrMYLYg.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,660],&quot;height&quot;:[0,480],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-network-launches-korean-community/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-network-to-integrate-chainlink-oracles-to-power-pricing-data/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-network-to-integrate-chainlink-oracles-to-power-pricing-data&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Network operates a decentralized exchange (DEX), which is at the core of matching buyers and sellers on our decentralized cloud computing marketplace. Initially, our native utility token, Akash Token (AKT), will be used to purchase cloud compute on our platform.&nbsp;  \\n\\nIn partnership with Cosmos\u2019s Interchain Foundation, Akash will be accelerating development of the Inter-Blockchain (IBC) interoperability protocol, and deploying interchain technologies faster than any other company. With IBC, we\u2019ll also be expanding our settlement options to include multiple currencies [such as integrating stablecoins like Kava\u2019s USDX into our platform](https://akash.network/blog/akash-integrates-kava-labss-usdx/).  \\n\\nTo support multi-currency settlement on Akash\u2019s decentralized cloud marketplace, we need reliable, accurate, and decentralized price data feeds to set exchange rates for computation. Sourcing inaccurate data or data exposed to vulnerabilities will negatively impact prices for cloud compute on our platform.  \\n\\nToday, we\u2019re excited to announce that Akash Network is to integrate with Chainlink, the market-leading decentralized oracle network. By integrating with Chainlink, we\u2019ll be able to ensure that Akash\u2019s users have access to the most secure and accurate price data available.  \\n\\n> As a market leading and proven decentralized oracle network, Chainlink was our first choice to provide accurate, secure, and reliable price data on Akash\u2019s DeCloud marketplace, giving our users additional confidence around pricing for computation.\\n\\n**\u2014 Boz Menzalji, COO at Akash Network**  \\n\\n  \\n  \\nWe selected Chainlink due to the multitude of assurances it provides our platform, including:  \\n\\n*   **Accurate Prices** - Chainlink Nodes pull data from numerous off-chain data aggregators, ensuring that price feeds reflect an volume-adjusted aggregate of all trading environments\\n    \\n*   **Secure Nodes** - All Chainlink Nodes are Sybil resistant and run by leading blockchain DevOps, providing our users with high-quality oracle services\\n    \\n*   **Decentralization &amp; Transparency** - All oracles are made of decentralized networks consisting of multiple nodes and data sources, protecting users against any single point of failure in the data sourcing and delivery processes  \\n      \\n    \\n\\nAs Akash\u2019s decentralized cloud marketplace is built on Cosmos SDK, we\u2019ll be able to leverage a Chainlink and Cosmos SDK integration to quickly bring the Chainlink oracle network data to Akash. With a proven track record of successful Mainnet integrations and smart contract deployments, Chainlink is our preferred oracle provider, enabling more secure, reliable, and verifiable off-chain data on our network.\\n\\n> We look forward to helping Akash Network expand the number of currencies it can support for computation by providing them with secure and reliable oracles that set fair market exchange rates for users.\\n\\n**\u2014 Daniel Kochis, Head of Chainlink Business Development**\\n\\n  \\n  \\nIn the future, we look forward to expanding the integration with Chainlink to bring on-chain data for application uptime to Akash DeCloud.  \\n\\n####   \\n**About Akash**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nAkash Network is developing the world\u2019s first and only decentralized cloud computing marketplace, enabling any data center and anyone with a computer to become a cloud provider by offering their unused compute cycles in a safe and frictionless marketplace. As the first decentralized cloud for DeFi, Akash DeCloud greatly accelerates scale and price performance for DeFi, decentralized organizations, and high-growth industries like machine learning/AI. Through Akash\u2019s platform, developers can easily and securely access cloud compute up to 10x less than the current market providers (AWS, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure). The platform achieves these benefits by integrating advanced containerization technology with a unique staking model to accelerate adoption.  \\n\\n####   \\n**About Chainlink**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nIf you are a smart contract developer and want to take advantage of the Chainlink VRF feature, visit their [developer documentation](https://docs.chain.link/docs/chainlink-vrf) and join the technical discussion on [Discord](https://discordapp.com/invite/aSK4zew). If you want to schedule a call to discuss the integration more in-depth, reach out [here](https://chainlink.typeform.com/to/gEwrPO).  \\n\\nChainlink is an open source blockchain abstraction layer for building and running decentralized oracle networks that give smart contracts on any blockchain access to secure and reliable data inputs and outputs. It provides oracles to leading DeFi applications like Synthetix, Aave, and Bancor; numerous blockchains such as Ethereum, Polkadot, and Tezos; as well as large enterprises including Google, Oracle, and SWIFT.  \\n\\n[Website](https://chain.link) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/chainlink) | [Reddit](https://www.reddit.com/r/Chainlink/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCnjkrlqaWEBSnKZQ71gdyFA) | [Telegram](https://t.me/chainlinkofficial) | [Events](https://blog.chain.link/tag/events/) | [GitHub](https://github.com/smartcontractkit/chainlink) | [Price Feeds](https://feeds.chain.link/) | [DeFi](https://defi.chain.link/)&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Network to Integrate Chainlink Oracles to Power Pricing Data&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Network operates a decentralized exchange (DEX), which is at the core of matching buyers and sellers on our decentralized cloud computing marketplace. Initially, our native utility token, Akash Token (AKT), will be used to purchase cloud compute on our platform.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-10-15T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Partners&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Partners&quot;],[0,&quot;Product&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Maly Ly&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.YhxQWHPJ.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,2000],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1500],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-network-to-integrate-chainlink-oracles-to-power-pricing-data/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;snz-joins-akash-network/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;snz-joins-akash-network&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;Based out of China, one of the largest global centers for crypto, SNZ progresses their mission to empower blockchain projects, through their SNZ hub - a network of global top tier venture capitalists, state-of-the art blockchain technologies, and diverse crypto communities. Founded by passionate engineers, blockchain evangelists, and entrepreneurs, SNZ has a long track record of supporting disruptive technologies to accelerate a new era of decentralized applications.\\n\\nWith a shared vision for leveraging blockchain to expand organizational and human experience, Akash Network is proud to welcome SNZ as valued validators and investors.\\n\\nRecently, we had the opportunity to connect with Kai of SNZ to chat about projects that have been on his radar and his insights on blockchain\u2019s influence on the ways we collaborate.&nbsp;  \\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620925197-kai3-300x300.png)\\n\\n  \\n**What did the beginnings of SNZ look like, and how has it grown since then?**\\n\\nIn the early days, we are in search of promising projects, teams, and partnerships, so we are early investors of projects like Ethereum, Cosmos, Dfinity, Polkadot, MakerDAO, and Brave. We believe that blockchain will usher in a new era of decentralized information technology that may change human history fundamentally. We see the coexistence of risks and opportunities and are relentlessly building the SNZ hub with kindred spirits and co-religionists through ups and downs in anticipation of that era.\\n\\n  \\n**SNZ was founded by a group of individuals, ranging from engineers and blockchain evangelists, with deep roots in the crypto community. How has your knowledge and experience influenced your investment process?**\\n\\nOur team\u2019s strong technical background has allowed us to explore the fundamental technologies and infrastructures of blockchain at length, diving deeply into the analysis and research behind it. Thanks to this, in the early days we understood that cross-chain was a vital technology, which prompted us to invest in Polkadot and Cosmos.&nbsp;\\n\\nIn recent years, our expertise also led us to invest in public chain, encryption, and other technologies.&nbsp;\\n\\nBased on our knowledge and research, we have our own framework of how the ecosystem will grow, as well as what the internal and application needs of blockchain will be. For instance, if blockchain were a tree, we wouldn\u2019t just want to invest in the foundational roots and trunk, we\u2019d want to invest in the totality of the tree -- including the applications of what the roots and trunk can produce -- its branches and leaves.&nbsp;  \\n\\n  \\n**How do you select what projects to partner with, and what drew you to work with Akash?**&nbsp;\\n\\nWe invest a lot in the public chain side. Public chain is more like a platform, and the success of the platform is dependent on how the ecosystem is growing on the platform.&nbsp;\\n\\nAkash is one of the important projects within the Cosmos ecosystem, which piqued our interest. Decentralized cloud is ultimately going to be the future, which is why we also decided to invest in other projects like Dfinity.&nbsp;\\n\\nAkash building the decentralized marketplace for the decentralized cloud is potentially a very important project. Based upon these two concepts, we believe that Akash is a great project with a bright future worth investing in.  \\n\\n  \\n**What blockchain/crypto sectors or types of projects are you currently excited about, and why?**\\n\\nBesides supporting the ecosystem, which is always exciting for us, decentralized finance (DeFi) is still hot, and there are a lot of interesting things happening in the DeFi track that keep it moving.&nbsp;\\n\\nLooking beyond DeFi, there is growing buzz surrounding non-fungible tokens (NFT), as well as decentralized autonomous organizations (DAO). From the technical side, we\u2019re also interested in privacy preserving computation.&nbsp;\\n\\nWhat excites me about these projects is the differing logic behind them -- for example, DAO is one of the ultimate applications of blockchain. DAO enables blockchain\u2019s potential to enrich and diversify the way people collaborate with one another.\\n\\nNFT has a large range of applications, extending from the weather and gaming, to assets and finance.&nbsp;\\n\\nPrivacy preserving computation is a hot topic. The concerns about Facebook leaks and people\u2019s privacy are ever-present. With blockchain and encryption, there is open data that we can verify to preserve the privacy of those individuals.\\n\\n  \\n**How do you envision blockchain changing the world?**\\n\\nTwo years ago, a famous investor and friend of mine said something to me that I remember to this day: The biggest social activity of mankind is trading and blockchain technology consolidates this social activity.&nbsp;\\n\\nTo echo what I spoke about in regards to DAO, we believe that blockchain will evolve the way we collaborate. For example, today there are lots of collaborations requiring a middle man or trust organization, but in the future of blockchain, we only need trust within the code and math.  \\n\\n  \\n**If you had the opportunity to give advice to your younger self as he starts venturing into the world of blockchain, what would it be?**\\n\\nI would tell myself, simply, to invest earlier. Embrace and believe in the technology, and dive right in.  \\n\\n  \\n  \\n  \\n**To get the latest news on Akash partnerships, products, and promotions**\\n\\n#### [**Join The Unstoppable Cloud**](https://t.me/AkashNW)  \\n[  \\n](https://t.me/AkashNW)&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;SNZ Joins Akash Network\u2019s Unstoppable Cloud&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Based out of China, one of the largest global centers for crypto, SNZ progresses their mission to empower blockchain projects, through their SNZ hub - a network of global top tier venture capitalists, state-of-the art blockchain technologies, and diverse crypto communities. Founded by passionate engineers, blockchain evangelists, and entrepreneurs, SNZ has a long track record of supporting disruptive technologies to accelerate a new era of decentralized applications.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-10-13T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Partners&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Partners&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Olive Kimoto&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.qioCjXwU.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1990],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1492],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/snz-joins-akash-network/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;the-unstoppable-update-october-2020/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;the-unstoppable-update-october-2020&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;At an accelerating pace, we find more of the ways we connect, play, transact, and work transitioning to the cloud. Developers and organizations need cloud computing and services that enable greater scale, flexibility, and price performance to meet this global demand for throughput and content.\\n\\nAnd yet, they continue to have few options beyond the four cloud service providers (Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure, and Alibaba Cloud).  \\n  \\nWe set out to build a decentralized alternative, a faster, more efficient, and lower cost cloud--one that would make developers and organizations _unstoppable_.  \\n  \\nWith the recent launch of Akash Mainnet 1 and our upcoming IEO this month on BitMax, we are much closer to realizing this vision of The Unstoppable Cloud.\\n\\nWe couldn\u2019t have gotten here without your support, and we thank you for joining us on our journey.\\n\\nFor Akashians around the world, this is just the beginning.  \\n\\n####   \\n  \\n**Mainnet 1 Launch &amp; BitMax IEO**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620925242-mainnet-and-bm-banner-1024x768.png)\\n\\nOn September 25th, we launched Akash Mainnet 1 and announced our upcoming IEO on BitMax, one of the world\u2019s top exchanges. Mainnet 1 is the beginning of Akash DeCloud and network governance, enabling staking and governance operations including the ability to delegate to validators and vote on governance proposals. The auction will begin on October 15th at 10:00am EDT, and the listing will go live on October 16th, at 10:00am EDT. [**Learn More >**  \\n  \\n](https://akash.network/blog/announcing-akash-mainnet-live-and-bitmax-ieo/)\\n\\n####   \\n**AKT: Akash Token Page**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620925347-featuredimg-1024x683.png)\\n\\nWe recently launched a new Token web page to share more information about AKT. Akash Network is a sovereign proof-of-stake chain built on Cosmos Hub, that leverages Akash Token (AKT), a native utility token, as the primary means to govern, secure the blockchain, and provide a default mechanism to store and exchange value. AKT will act as the reserve currency in Akash\u2019s multi-currency and multi-chain ecosystem, while ensuring economic security of the platform\u2019s public blockchain by means of Staking. Check out our new AKT Token page for information on Token supply, staking rewards, and unlock schedule. [**Learn More >**](https://akash.network/token/)\\n\\n#### &nbsp;  \\n  \\n**Akash to Integrate Kava\u2019s USDX**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620925372-kava-partnership-banner-1024x768.png)\\n\\nA few weeks ago, we announced an integration with Kava, the first cross-blockchain DeFi platform, to enable Kava\u2019s stablecoin USDX as the first coin for fee settlement on Akash\u2019s DeCloud platform. The integration with Kava will also enable Akash Token (AKT) to be used as collateral for USDX loans.\\n\\nThis integration strengthens AKT\u2019s liquidity and provides Akash users with a stable medium of exchange, while achieving greater adoption for Kava\u2019s stablecoin and an increased debt ceiling from AKT collateral.&nbsp; [**Learn More >**](https://akash.network/blog/akash-integrates-kava-labss-usdx/)\\n\\n####   \\n  \\n**Get the Latest Akash and AKT Token Updates and Giveaways!**  \\n\\n#### **.:** [**Join Our Telegram**](https://t.me/AkashNW) **:.**&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;The Unstoppable Update: October 2020&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;At an accelerating pace, we find more of the ways we connect, play, transact, and work transitioning to the cloud. BitMax.io applauds the Akash team for bringing a DeCloud alternative to the booming Cloud Service Provider (CSP) market. We aim to provide extensive support for AKT spanning from listing, staking, and more extensive infrastructure buildout.\\n\\n\u2014 **Shane Molidor, Global Head of Business Development at BitMax.io**\\n\\nAs more of our work and personal lives move online, demand for throughput and content has driven explosive demand for cloud computing and services, projected to be a $370 billion market by 2022 (IDG 2019).\\n\\nAs open source developers, my cofounder Adam Bozanich and I wanted to create an alternative to the pricing inefficiency, inflexibility, and anti-competitive practices of centralized cloud services providers.\\n\\nDevelopers like us, and organizations, have few options beyond the four CSPs (Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure, and Alibaba Cloud) who dominate with 71% market share.\\n\\n####\\n\\n**The Journey to Akash DeCloud: Mainnet 1**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nWe envisioned a world where cloud computing is permissionless, sovereign, and open, where builders of the internet, like us, can have greater freedom, flexibility, and sovereignty to create, becoming truly unstoppable.\\n\\nWhen we started Akash Network, we learned from decentralized cloud platforms who failed in the market due to their technical and integration complexity and limited use cases.\\n\\nWe set out to build a decentralized cloud marketplace that would serve broader use cases by easily integrating with existing tech stacks, and providing high-growth organizations with much needed scalability and price advantages.\\n\\nLeveraging advanced containerization technology and a unique staking model to accelerate adoption, Akash will be a faster, more efficient, and lower cost cloud built for DeFi, decentralized applications and organizations, and high growth companies.\\n\\nUp to 10x lower cost than the market, our serverless computing platform will be compatible with all cloud providers and all applications that run on the cloud, enabling easier integration and wider adoption in the market.\\n\\nAkash will unlock 85% of underutilized cloud capacity in 8.4 million data centers, and in individual servers. Anyone will be able to buy and sell cloud compute in our marketplace.\\n\\n####\\n\\n**Mainnet 1 Launch and BitMax IEO**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n**Today, I\u2019m thrilled to share that we are much closer to realizing this vision with the launch of Akash Mainnet 1 and the announcement of our Initial Exchange Offering (IEO) on BitMax.**\\n\\nTo properly compensate cloud providers on Akash Network, we will first stabilize the staking set to establish economic value for AKT with today\u2019s launch of Mainnet 1 with 64 validators.\\n\\nMainnet 1 is the beginning of Akash DeCloud and network governance. Mainnet 1 enables staking and governance operations including the ability to delegate to validators and vote on governance proposals.\\n\\nEarlier today, [BitMax.io](https://bitmax.io/), the industry-leading digital asset trading platform built by Wall Street quant trading veterans, announced the primary listing and auction of the Akash Token (AKT). The auction will begin on October 15th at 10:00am EDT, and the listing will go live on October 16th, at 10:00am EDT.\\n\\n[**Check Out BitMax's Akash Token**  \\n**Announcement**](https://bitmaxhelp.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360056045413-Join-Upcoming-Auctions-for-Exclusive-Primary-Listing-of-Akash-AKT-)\\n\\n####\\n\\n**Accelerating to Akash DeCloud: Mainnet 2**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nAfter this initial phase of network bootstrapping is complete, we'll begin work on the Akash Economic model, which will incentivize providers to offer lower prices, and incentivizes stakers to participate in the network longer term.\\n\\nScheduled to launch in Q4 2020, Mainnet 2 will have upgraded platform functionality that will include: a spot market for cloud compute, trusted providers, a developer friendly deployment definition language (Akash SDL), and take income for AKT holders.\\n\\nMainnet 2 will include:\\n\\n- **Cloud Decentralized Exchange (DEX)**: To determine which provider runs which app, a decentralized exchange helps match orders to bids.\\n- **Provider Operations**: The ability for data centers to register themselves on the blockchain as providers, as well as the infrastructure to help those providers manage their clusters.\\n- **Deployment on Akash DeCloud:** Users will be able to submit application manifests to the Akash Network that will then be deployed on providers registered on the network.\\n\\nMainnet 2 will realize the full functionality of Akash DeCloud.\\n\\n**We couldn\u2019t have achieved these two phenomenal milestones without the support of our community and our team. I\u2019m grateful to the investors, validators, and partners who believed in us, and in our vision for The Unstoppable Cloud.**\\n\\n**To the Akashian Dream Team, thank you for making us truly** _**unstoppable**_**!**\\n\\n**For Akash and AKT Token news and rewards, join our Telegram!**\\n\\n[**Join The Unstoppable Cloud**](https://t.me/AkashNW)\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Announcing Akash Mainnet Live and BitMax IEO&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;The primary listing of AKT is one of the most important projects of BitMax.io in Q3. The integration with Kava will also enable Akash Token (AKT) to be used as collateral for USDX loans.\\n\\nThrough the integration of Kava\u2019s USDX, Akash becomes the first decentralized cloud platform to have a stablecoin, allowing cloud providers to avoid the market volatility of cryptocurrency, and developers to pay for cloud computing using USDX. This integration strengthens AKT\u2019s liquidity and provides Akash users with a stable medium of exchange, while achieving greater adoption for Kava\u2019s stablecoin and an increased debt ceiling from AKT collateral.\\n\\n> We built Akash to give developers and companies faster, lower cost, and more flexible access to cloud computing with multi-currency settlement,\u201d said Greg Osuri, CEO at Akash Network. \u201cWe\u2019re excited to partner with Kava Labs to integrate the first stablecoin in the Cosmos ecosystem, bringing dollar denominated payments to Akash.\\n\\n> Akash\u2019s promise to provide decentralized compute resources at significantly lower costs than leading providers like Amazon makes it one of the most promising projects in the blockchain space today. Akash\u2019s technology will transform the compute industry and be a critical foundation for decentralized projects and Web 3 applications going forward,\u201d said Brian Kerr, CEO of Kava Labs.\\n\\nBoth companies are pioneers in the blockchain and crypto spaces. As global demand for content and throughput increases, Akash Network is developing the world\u2019s first and only decentralized cloud computing marketplace, leveraging 85% of underutilized cloud capacity in 8.4 million data centers around the world. Akash enables any data center and anyone with a computer to become a cloud provider by offering their unused compute cycles in a safe and frictionless marketplace. Akash\u2019s DeCloud is the first decentralized cloud and vertically integrated solution that increases scalability and security, and the best price performance for DeFi, in the market.&nbsp;\\n\\nKava Labs has built the first cross-blockchain and multi-asset lending platform that allows users to collateralize a multitude of crypto assets in exchange for a loan in the form of Kava\u2019s stablecoin USDX.&nbsp;\\n\\nIn Q2 2020, Akash Network launched The Akashian Challenge Incentivized Testnet, which, to date, has attracted 211 teams and 99 active validators, making it one of the largest Testnets in the Cosmos Hub and one of the largest active Testnets globally. Akash will launch Mainnet 1 on Friday, September 25th, 2020, followed by Phase 3 of The Akashian Challenge.\\n\\nIn Q3 2020, Akash announced a partnership with Cosmos\u2019s Interchain Foundation to accelerate development of the Inter-Blockchain Communication interoperability protocol. For crypto and blockchain, where interoperability and composability are essential to continued growth for decentralized sectors like DeFi, IBC is the most promising and production-ready solution.&nbsp;\\n\\n####   \\n**About Akash Network**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nAkash Network is developing the world\u2019s first and only decentralized cloud computing marketplace, enabling any data center and anyone with a computer to become a cloud provider by offering their unused compute cycles in a safe and frictionless marketplace. As the first decentralized cloud for DeFi, Akash DeCloud greatly accelerates scale and price performance for DeFi, decentralized organizations, and high-growth industries like machine learning/AI. Through Akash\u2019s platform, developers can easily and securely access cloud compute at a cost ten times lower than the current market providers (AWS, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure). The platform achieves these benefits by integrating advanced containerization technology with a unique staking model to accelerate adoption.\\n\\n####   \\n**About Kava**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nKava is the first decentralized hub for cross-chain DeFi applications and services. Kava\u2019s platform operates like a decentralized bank for digital assets connecting users with products like stablecoins, loans, and interest bearing accounts so that they can do more and earn more with their digital assets. By enabling staking and governance, it will unlock value for the network, and accelerate growth for our community.\\n\\nThis week, we\u2019re excited to launch Akash DeCloud: Mainnet, and progress our vision for The Unstoppable Cloud, a permissionless, sovereign, and open cloud where builders of the Internet have greater freedom and sovereignty.\\n\\nTo provide our validators more time to submit GenTX and bring up their validator nodes, we\u2019ll be _updating our Mainnet launch date from Wednesday, September 23rd to Friday, September 25th_.\\n\\nBelow is our Mainnet Launch Schedule and key actions needed from Akash validators. If you\u2019re a validator, please join our [Discord](http://discord.akash.network) channel for important updates.\\n\\n**Mainnet Launch Schedule**  \\n\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\n\\n**ActionStart Date/TimeEnd/Time**Collect GenTxSept 20: 2PM PST /  \\n10PM UTC&nbsp;Sept 23: 9AM PST /  \\n5PM UTC&nbsp;Genesis FileSept 23: 10AM PST /  \\n5PM UTC&nbsp;  \\nMainnet Launch (Genesis Time)Sept 25, 6AM PST /  \\n2PM UTC\\n\\n**Collect GENTX: Sept. 20th, 2PM PST / 10PM UTC**  \\n\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\n\\nYou can submit your GenTx starting **Sunday, September 20th at 2PM PST / 10PM UTC**.&nbsp; Please follow our [Validator guide here.](https://akash.network/docs/validator-guides/gentx) Note, all GenTx will be the same amount, as you are limited to 1,000 AKT for bonding.\\n\\nThe deadline to submit GenTx is Wednesday September, 23rd at 9AM PST / 5PM UTC.\\n\\n**Genesis File:&nbsp; Sept. 23rd, 10AM PST / 5PM UTC**  \\n\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\n\\nAt this time, you\u2019ll be able to bring up your validator node online--we\u2019re excited to share this special moment with our validator community! **As a special thank you, we\u2019re incentivizing the first 64 validators to get online, with an additional 5,000 AKT,** _**before**_ **our official Genesis Mainnet Launch: Friday, 6AM PST / 2PM UTC.**\\n\\n**Akash Mainnet Launch:&nbsp;Sept. 25, 6AM PST / 2PM UTC**  \\n\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\n\\nAnd we LAUNCH! We look forward to achieving this milestone together this Friday!\\n\\n**What's Next for Mainnet and Akash Token Economics**  \\n\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\n\\nWe\u2019re implementing a phased rollout to enable [Akash\u2019s tokenomics model](https://akash-web-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/2020/03/akash-econ.pdf') (2021).&nbsp; You can find more information on Akash Token (AKT) and Akash\u2019s token economics on our Token landing page, live on our site this week.\\n\\nOur Mainnet 1 blockchain is based on the Cosmos Hub. In order to properly compensate providers on the network (providers are users contributing cloud compute to the network e.g. datacenters), AKT must first have economic value. Launching a mainnet and stabilizing the staking set is the first step in establishing economic value.\\n\\nMainnet 1, as shared previously, is a minimum viable product with three core objectives:\\n\\n- Launch with 64 validators\\n- Ensure platform stability\\n- Enable staking model to earn rewards\\n\\nPost Mainnet 1 Launch and after The Akashian Challenge: Phase 3 Testnet in October, the network will vote to enable our deployment functionality.&nbsp; After bootstrapping of our network is complete, we\u2019ll begin work on the Akash economic model, which incentivizes providers to offer lower prices, and incentivizes stakers to participate in the network over the longer term.\\n\\nOther notable networks that run on Cosmos Network\u2019s economic model are:\\n\\n- Kava\\n- Band\\n- eMoney\\n\\nFor more information on Akash\u2019s token economic model, please check out our [whitepaper](https://akash-web-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/2020/03/akash-econ.pdf).\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Mainnet Launch Update&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;As our CTO Adam Bozanich shared in his Mainnet Overview article last Thursday, Mainnet is the beginning of Akash DeCloud, our decentralized cloud marketplace. By enabling staking and governance, it will unlock value for the network, and accelerate growth for our by increased consumer demand for throughput, a global surge of smartphones, rapid development of applications, and high DevOps server management costs, the cloud computing industry, projected to be a $370 billion market by 2022 (IDG 2019), is dominated by an oligarchy of four cloud service providers (Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure, and Alibaba Cloud).&nbsp;\\n\\nAs a concentrated market with pricing inefficiency and anti-competitive practices, centralized cloud providers are stifling innovation, choice, and flexibility.&nbsp;\\n\\nDecentralized cloud platforms have failed in the market due to _complexity of technical integration and adoption, limited use cases, and a lack of price advantages._\\n\\nAdditionally, the growth of DeFi and decentralized projects are limited by high transaction costs, scalability, and high censorship and security risks on centralized cloud platforms.\\n\\nMainstream and decentralized companies and developers have had few alternatives.\\n\\n####   \\n**The Vision of The Unstoppable Cloud**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nAs open source and blockchain developers ourselves, Greg and I set out to realize the vision of a permissionless, sovereign, and open cloud where builders of the Internet have greater freedom to create.  \\n\\nWith advanced containerization technology and a unique staking model to accelerate adoption, Akash is a faster, more efficient, and lower cost cloud built for DeFi, decentralized projects, and high growth companies, providing unprecedented scale, flexibility, and price performance.&nbsp;  \\n\\nUp to 10x lower cost than the market, our serverless computing platform is compatible with all cloud providers and all applications that run on the cloud, easily integrating with a company\u2019s existing technology stack.  \\n\\nAs the world\u2019s first decentralized cloud computing marketplace, Akash leverages 85% of underutilized cloud capacity in 8.4 million data centers. Akash enables anyone to buy and sell cloud compute.\\n\\n####   \\n**Akash DeCloud: Mainnet 1**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**  \\n\\nCore to Akash\u2019s platform is a token economic model that uses a native currency, Akash Token (AKT), to solve for volatility (one of the biggest challenges for adoption in crypto), while ensuring economic security of the platform\u2019s public blockchain.&nbsp;  \\n\\nThe model bootstraps early supply by using inflation as a subsidy, and activates an incentive structure that unlocks network effects to accelerate growth.  \\n\\nIn order to properly compensate providers on the network (providers are users contributing cloud compute to the network e.g. datacenters), AKT must first have economic value. Launching a mainnet and stabilizing the staking set is the first step in establishing economic value.&nbsp;  \\n\\nAkash Mainnet 1 is the launch of the Akash DeCloud and the true beginning of network governance. Akash Mainnet 1 (based on the [Launchpad release](https://blog.cosmos.network/launchpad-a-pre-stargate-stable-version-of-the-cosmos-sdk-e0c58d8c4e24?gi=5e98f3fdc4eb)) enables basic staking and governance operations, including the ability to delegate to validators and vote on governance proposals.&nbsp;  \\n\\nWe\u2019ll be launching Mainnet with 64 validators to establish economic value and to stabilize the staking set. AKT holders will then vote to enable the decentralized cloud modules after the Phase 3 Testnet.\\n\\n####   \\n**What\u2019s Next? Akash DeCloud: Mainnet 2**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**  \\n\\nOnce Mainnet 1 is live and The Akashian Challenge: Phase 3 Testnet is complete, AKT holders will be able to vote to enable Mainnet 2.&nbsp;  \\n\\nMainnet 2 will include:  \\n\\n*   **Provider Operations**: The ability for data centers to register themselves on the blockchain as providers as well as the necessary infrastructure to help those providers manage their clusters.\\n    \\n*   **Ability to deploy applications on Akash DeCloud:** Users will be able to submit application manifests to the Akash network that will then be deployed on the providers registered on the network.\\n    \\n*   **Cloud Compute DEX**: In order to decide which provider runs which app, a decentralized exchange helps match orders to bids.  \\n    \\n\\nAs we continue the acceleration of Akash DeCloud in Q4, we look forward to sharing more product updates with you.&nbsp;  \\n\\n**Akash Network\u2019s Mainnet 1 is scheduled for launch on Friday, September 25th at 9AM PST / 4PM UTC.**\\n\\n**For the latest Akash news and rewards, join our Telegram!**  \\n\\n###   \\n[**Join The Unstoppable Cloud** month, our team will be closing out an incredibly productive Q3 with the realization of our Mainnet, launching next week on Friday, September 25th**.\\n\\nIn the past month, we continued to focus on Q4 product roadmap planning while preparing to integrate upstream software updates to Cosmos SDK.\\n\\nWe also announced an industry-defining partnership with Cosmos\u2019s Interchain Foundation to accelerate development of Inter-Blockchain protocol, and bring true interoperability and scale to blockchain and crypto. As the first decentralized cloud for DeFi, Akash\u2019s partnership with ICF will further enable us to accelerate growth for DeFi, and decentralized projects and organizations.\\n\\nWe continued to expand our global reach and launched [our Russian community](https://akash.network/blog/akash-network-launches-russian-community/), with many more regional expansions in the coming months.\\n\\nWe thank you for being a part of The Unstoppable Cloud, and look forward to sharing more exciting news in the coming weeks.\\n\\n**Q4 2020 Roadmap**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620925257-roadmap-update-v2-banner-1024x768.png)\\n\\nAs we enter the fourth quarter of the year, we\u2019re excited to share a number of exciting updates to our product roadmap. Akash Network\u2019s Mainnet is scheduled for launch on Friday, September 25th at 9AM PST/4PM UTC. Our focus areas for Akash Network\u2019s Mainnet launch are to ensure network stability, support staking, and enable transfers via governance.  \\nPhase 3 of The Akashian Challenge incentivized testnet will serve as the launchpad for Mainnet 2.&nbsp; We\u2019ll be dedicating 1,000,000 AKTs in rewards, and are aiming for a mid-to-late October launch, leading up to Mainnet 2 in November 2020. Our goal for Phase 3 is to build a catalogue of deployed applications. [**Learn More >**  \\n](https://akash.network/blog/akash-q4-2020-roadmap-update/)\\n\\n**Akash DeCloud for DeFi**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620925359-decloud-v6-3-1024x768.png)\\n\\nDecentralized finance needs decentralized cloud. Akash is building the first DeCloud for DeFi, enabling unprecedented scale and performance. In an article launched this month, I explore some of the challenges facing this nascent industry, and propose solutions.\\n\\nAkash DeCloud is a vertically integrated solution that enables developers to deploy interfaces and nodes without friction with the best price-performance in the market. Find out how Akash makes DeFi Unstoppable. [**Learn More >**](https://akash.network/blog/akash-decloud-for-defi/)\\n\\n**Akash + Cosmos\u2019s Interchain Foundation Partnership**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620926016-interchain-banner-copy-1-1024x768.png)\\n\\nWe announced a partnership with Cosmos's ICF to make IBC protocol a reality, enabling us to integrate interchain technologies faster than any other company. With this partnership, Akash solidifies an essential position in the Cosmos ecosystem to accelerate development of the IBC interoperability protocol.\\n\\nWe\u2019ll be working on the leading edge of research, deploying live production systems to make IBC a reality. Our partnership will increase composability and massive scaling for decentralized projects like DeFi. [**Learn More >**](https://akash.network/blog/akash-partners-with-cosmoss-interchain-foundation-to-accelerate-development-of-inter-blockchain-communication/)\\n\\n**Earning Potential of AKT**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620926031-earning-potential-banner-1024x768.png)\\n\\nCore to the Akash platform is a token economic model that uses a native currency, Akash Token (AKT) to solve for volatility (one of the biggest challenges for adoption in crypto), while ensuring economic security of the platform\u2019s public blockchain.\\n\\nOur token economics model bootstraps early supply by using inflation as a subsidy, and activates an incentive structure that unlocks network effects to accelerate growth. Through this article by Cheng Wang, Akash\u2019s CFO, you can develop an understanding of the economic nuts and bolts of the Akash Token (AKT) and its economic potential.&nbsp; [**Learn More >**](https://akash.network/blog/the-earning-potential-of-akash-token/)\\n\\n###\\n\\n**Get the Latest Akash News!**  \\n**.:** [**Join Our Telegram**](https://t.me/AkashNW) **:.**\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;The Unstoppable Update: September 2020&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;This month, our team will be closing out an incredibly productive Q3 with the realization of our Mainnet, launching next week on Friday, September 25th.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-09-16T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Greg Osuri&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.BL-iahDn.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,660],&quot;height&quot;:[0,480],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/the-unstoppable-update-september-2020/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-partners-with-cosmoss-interchain-foundation-to-accelerate-development-of-inter-blockchain-communication/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-partners-with-cosmoss-interchain-foundation-to-accelerate-development-of-inter-blockchain-communication&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;For blockchain based systems to gain wider adoption and achieve consumer scale in high growth industries like decentralized finance (DeFi), we need to quickly solve the scalability problems that have plagued the space since its inception. The industry, and our team at Akash, has tried many different approaches to solving this problem.&nbsp;\\n\\n  \\n**Three Approaches to the Blockchain Scalability Problem**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**  \\n\\nOne approach that a number of blockchain projects are taking to expand blockchain scalability is to develop faster databases with hardware, and increase transactions per second (TPS). However, there are limits to the scalability of individual computers, which in turn limits the scalability of chains that rely on individual computers. Another approach is to shard the blockchain. This approach is technically complicated, and there are many well funded teams working on it with little to show in terms of production systems.  \\n  \\nWith both these approaches, there are still unsolved technical problems, no working implementations, and solutions are at least a year away from deployment.  \\n\\nThere is a third approach, called Inter-Blockchain Communication (IBC), led by Cosmos Network\u2019s non-profit Interchain Foundation, that solves the scalability problem by enabling different blockchain protocols to communicate and transact with each other independently.&nbsp;\\n\\n  \\n**Inter-Blockchain Communication and Interoperability**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**  \\n\\nThe proposed IBC standard provides a framework to connect the global economy to the blockchain, and parties on existing blockchains will be able to interact and exchange with each other across chains.  \\n\\nIn development for over three years, IBC is the flagship feature of the Cosmos Network. For crypto and blockchain, where interoperability and composability are essential to continued growth for decentralized sectors like DeFi, IBC is the most promising and production ready solution.&nbsp;  \\n\\nThe ability to transact quickly across chains will be transformational for the industry.  \\n\\nSo much so that Polkadot and Ethereum 2 are working to adopt IBC and join the broader interchain system.&nbsp;\\n\\n  \\n**Akash Partnership with Interchain Foundation**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**  \\n\\nIBC will underlie the next generation of blockchain protocols. It\u2019s no secret that Akash has been [a committed proponent of Cosmos Network and Tendermint](https://akash.network/blog/decentralized-serverless-computing-coming-to-cosmos/). We were early believers in Cosmos and Tendermint\u2019s mission, technology, and community, and intentionally built our decentralized cloud marketplace with Cosmos SDK.  \\n\\nToday, we\u2019re thrilled to announce that Akash Network is solidifying an essential position in the Cosmos ecosystem through partnership with the Interchain Foundation. We\u2019re partnering with ICF to accelerate development of the IBC interoperability protocol.  \\n  \\nWith the ICF, we\u2019ll be working on the leading edge of research, deploying live production systems to make IBC a reality. The ICF has awarded Akash with a grant to maintain and build the relayer for IBC. Critical to launching the protocol, the relayer is the user interface that will enable all transfers and transactions on IBC. It is the only way users will initially be able to use IBC.  \\n\\nIBC development has a legacy at Akash. As former Head of Product at Cosmos/Tendermint, I worked with Iqlusion founder Zaki Manian on Game of Zones, IBC\u2019s successful testnet implementation. Leveraging my early work on IBC development, I will be leading Akash\u2019s team in building the relayer, and Akash\u2019s IBC implementation.  \\n\\nThrough the work with IBC, Akash will be one of the first companies to implement and integrate IBC. With IBC, Akash DeCloud\u2019s distinct and differentiating features like multi-currency settlement and the ability to pay for cloud compute using stablecoins (such as Kava\u2019s USDX) will be coming much sooner, rather than later.&nbsp;  \\n\\nIn the future, decentralized organizations (DAOs) will be able to purchase cloud compute programmatically on Akash DeCloud, over IBC, instead of relying on centralized exchanges or centralized cloud providers.\\n\\n  \\n**The Possibilities of Akash DeCloud with Inter-Blockchain Communication**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**  \\n\\nAkash Network\u2019s partnership with ICF, and our integral contribution to the development of IBC will enable us to adopt and benefit from interchain technologies faster than any other company.  \\n\\nAkash DeCloud, integrated with IBC, will enable more composability, innovation, and massive scaling for exciting decentralized sectors like DeFi.&nbsp;\\n\\nAnd this is just the beginning.&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Partners with Cosmos\u2019s Interchain Foundation&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;For blockchain based systems to gain wider adoption and achieve consumer scale in high growth industries like decentralized finance (DeFi), we need to quickly solve the scalability problems that have plagued the space since its inception. The industry, and our team at Akash, has tried many different approaches to solving this problem.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-09-09T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Partners&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Partners&quot;],[0,&quot;Product&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Jack Zampolin&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.C9AYZtBK.jpg&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,2000],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1500],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;jpg&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-partners-with-cosmoss-interchain-foundation-to-accelerate-development-of-inter-blockchain-communication/banner-image.jpg&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-decloud-for-defi/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-decloud-for-defi&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\nFinance\u2014an industry that is expected to reach $26.5 trillion by 2020\u2014is being disrupted at an atomic speed by its degenerate cousin, decentralized finance or simply **DeFi**.\\n\\nWe\u2019re witnessing rapid experimentation in every critical sector of finance, from lending and borrowing to insurance--finance hasn\u2019t been this exciting for a long time.\\n\\nAs of the writing of this article, DeFi [added billions](https://defipulse.com) of dollars in assets locked, the past 2 days, a rate which is exponentially growing.\\n\\nIn this article, I\u2019ll make a case for DeFi as the future of finance, explore some of the challenges facing this nascent industry, and propose solutions.\\n\\n####\\n\\n**Why Decentralization will Disrupt Finance**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nBesides the obvious benefits of decentralization, like lower fees and sovereignty, DeFi presents novel opportunities that are only possible on DeFi, such as Flash Loans and Perpetual Swaps. In my view, there are two main reasons why DeFi will take prominence in finance:\\n\\n**1) Atomic Composability for Endless Possibilities**\\n\\nAtomic Composability enables developers to build programs that work across multiple protocols that perform a series of actions in a single transaction, wherein if any of the actions in that transaction were to fail, all the prior actions will revert back to the original state they were in before the transaction began.\\n\\nThis property is referred to as \u201catomicity\u201d and is common in modern databases, particularly in blockchain based systems (blockchain is a state machine).\\n\\nThis presents amazing opportunities that were not possible in traditional finance. One intriguing application of Atomic Composability is \u201cFlash Loans\u201d.\\n\\nUsing Flash Loans, one can borrow at a very high leverage, make a trade (usually an arbitrage), and pay back the loan in the same transaction. As the system knows how much profit one can make from the trade (since it's on blockchain), the loan is guaranteed by a smart contract.\\n\\nFlash Loans enable hyper-efficient money markets because they can effectively crush any arbitrage opportunities.\\n\\nFor a salient example, the trader in the tweet below walked out with $46k in profits from a $6k investment. How? By taking a margin loan at 16x leverage on DyDx to conduct an arbitrage trade on Ethereum between two decentralized exchanges. While lucrative in the early days of the market, arbitrage opportunities diminish as the networks mature, especially in DeFi because of its openness and composability.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620925254-screen-shot-2020-09-06-at-6-34-27-pm-711x1024.png)\\n\\n**2) Permissionless and Open Systems for HyperScale Adoption**\\n\\nPermissionless enabled the Internet to reach the scale it\u2019s at today. Even though permissioned models (AOL) gained traction in the early days of the Internet, a permissionless model fueled by the web browser (Netscape and Mozilla) and hypertext protocol (HTTP over TCP) was key for the Internet to reach the adoption it has today.\\n\\nThere is no question that a permissionless system would do the same for finance.\\n\\nThere is no signup on DeFi and no one can stop you from using DeFi.\\n\\nFinance is on the brink of a revolution, and permissionless systems are leading the charge.\\n\\n####\\n\\n**Current State of DeFi**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nThe way I see it, there are four major stakeholders in DeFi and they can be summarized as follows:\\n\\n- **Retail Users**: Regular users using DeFi for trading, borrowing etc.\\n- **Traders**: Traders that usually trade on a daily basis and are technically competent.\\n- **Protocol Developers:** Software developers that design and build various protocols that make DeFi happen.\\n- **Validators**: Blockchain node operators that secure the blockchain that DeFi protocols use.\\n\\nThese stakeholders currently face a distinct set of challenges and risks including:\\n\\n**Censorship Risk**\\n\\nA rising trend with the DeFi boom are Stateless (such as [Uniswap](https://app.uniswap.org) or [Aave](https://app.aave.com)) interfaces.&nbsp;  \\nand [online apps for real money](https://aussielowdepositcasino.com/real-money-casino-apps/).\\n\\nThese interfaces improve user experience exponentially while ensuring sovereignty, but risk censorship as they are hosted on a centralized platform with a DNS name.\\n\\nWhile the protocols themselves are censorship resistant, the interfaces are not.\\n\\nAdditionally, Stateless static interfaces are extremely limiting since they are executed on the client (versus a server, which is common). Overburdening the client for computational resources (for shared features) leads to poor user experience.\\n\\nCensorship resistance for user interfaces is critical to ensure DeFi is resilient.\\n\\n**Prohibitive Costs**\\n\\nDeFi users incur two types of costs. The Take Fee (usually a percentage of the trade charged by the protocol) and a Gas Fee (charged to validators that maintain the blockchain).\\n\\nTo swap assets, protocols such as Uniswap charge a 0.03% Take Fee, which is significantly lower than their centralized counterparts. This Take Fee is then distributed back to the liquidity providers as an incentive to build the order book liquidity. As of the writing of this article, the [ETH-USDT](https://uniswap.info/pair/0x0d4a11d5eeaac28ec3f61d100daf4d40471f1852) market pair has the largest liquidity on Uniswap and provides a healthy 45% APY return to its liquidity providers.\\n\\nThe Gas Fees, however, are paid to blockchain maintainers, usually referred to as Validators or Miners, as an incentive for maintaining the security of the blockchain.\\n\\nUsers paid $7,830,064 per day in [Gas Fee](https://bitinfocharts.com/ethereum/) to Ethereum miners with a median cost per transaction currently at $6.40. These prohibitive Gas Fees are due to enormous hosting fees charged by the centralized cloud providers that the validator community depends on for running their nodes.\\n\\nIt is estimated that over [60% of Ethereum](https://thenextweb.com/hardfork/2019/09/23/ethereum-nodes-cloud-services-amazon-web-services-blockchain-hosted-decentralization/) nodes currently run on Amazon Web Services. This centralization not only leads to increased costs due to constrained supply but is also at risk of being centralized and prone to censorship.\\n\\nHigh gas costs prevents DeFi from being more accessible to the wider retail market.\\n\\n**Scalability Challenges**\\n\\nThe high transaction costs are indicative of the scalability challenges blockchain protocols face today. Ethereum blockchain currently supports around 15 transactions per second (TPS), which is prohibitive for smaller transactions and impossible to build high volume money markets (such as high margin trading).\\n\\nNew and promising blockchains such as Solana boast an impressive 50,000 TPS but have limited ecosystem support compared to Ethereum.\\n\\nCommon challenges node operators for new blockchains face are increasing costs and the centralized nature of the cloud service providers, which in turn increase gas costs.\\n\\nIncreasing costs limit validators\u2019 resources and ability to scale their operations to meet demand in a cost-efficient way.\\n\\n####\\n\\n**Decentralized Cloud for Decentralized Finance**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nA permissionless and decentralized cloud infrastructure is imperative to ensuring DeFi remains sovereign and becomes more accessible.\\n\\nDecentralized cloud networks such as Akash and Storj not only provide viable alternatives to centralized cloud providers, but also address DeFi\u2019s challenges in the following ways:\\n\\n**Unstoppable DeFi**\\n\\nCloud applications hosted on Akash are censorship resistant, meaning the applications can be controlled only by the owner of the key-pair.\\n\\nThis ensures that Stateless interfaces and the underlying node infrastructure to support them, are not at the mercy of centralized cloud providers.\\n\\nIn other words, Akash makes DeFi [unstoppable](https://news.bitcoin.com/decentralizing-the-web-handshake-akash-and-the-quest-for-censorship-resistance).\\n\\n**Lower Costs**\\n\\nAkash taps into underutilized cloud capacity across millions of data centers around the world. An estimated 85% of global cloud capacity remains unused today.\\n\\nAt Akash, users set the price they\u2019re willing to pay and the network optimizes for the lowest cost possible for the application to function. Along with a novel subsidy model, this pricing mechanism is projected to reduce cloud computing costs 3x to 15x.\\n\\nNot only can Layer 1 validators who switch to Akash get significantly better price-performance, but it enables them to stay decentralized.\\n\\nAdditionally, DeFi developers and technical traders can leverage lower costs on Akash for hosting full nodes to bot infrastructure.\\n\\nLower cloud costs result in lower fees, which benefits the ecosystem as a whole.\\n\\n**Increased Scalability**\\n\\nAkash\u2019s permissionless model enables anyone with a computer to become a cloud provider, unlocking 85% of underutilized cloud computing capacity in 8.4 million data centers around the world\\n\\nOn Akash, developers have unlimited access to all network resources at any time--thus removing barriers to scalability.\\n\\n####\\n\\n**What's Next?**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nAt Akash, we\u2019re building the first DeCloud for DeFi, and making DeFi developer challenges a thing of the past.\\n\\nAkash DeCloud is a vertically integrated solution that enabless developers to deploy interfaces and nodes without friction, and with the best price-performance in the market.\\n\\nIf you are a validator or developer, we invite you to participate in the Akash DeCloud Early Access Program.\\n\\n#### [**Join Akash DeCloud Early Access Program** \u2192 ](https://akashnet.typeform.com/to/UImjD7bs)\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash DeCloud for
