Osuri&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.y3V1uZlk.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,896],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1290],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-decloud-for-defi/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;partner-profile-dacm/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;partner-profile-dacm&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\n> _\\&quot;We were excited about Greg and team\u2019s experience and knowledge of the market--even down to customer-by-customer granularity. We like to invest in teams that can build great tech but just importantly help drive usage of it. The Akash team\u2019s knowledge and passion for what they are building made the decision for us.\\&quot;_ **\u2014 Richard Galvin, CEO**\\n\\nWe are proud to introduce DACM as a valued partner of Akash, helping us bring our vision of an open, decentralized, and unstoppable cloud to the world. Since its inception 3 years ago, DACM has grown into a pre-eminent force in a burgeoning new asset class, accruing accolades for their performance, including&nbsp; 2019\u2019s #1 performing Crypto Fund by DAF Liquid Venture Fund.\\n\\nWe recently synced up with Richard Galvin, CEO of DACM, to gain insight into the firm\u2019s success, and to learn about his journey from Goldman and JPMorgan \u201cbankster\u201d to CEO of an award-winning global digital assets firm.\\n\\n**How did DACM start, and grow into what it is today?**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nI worked in banking in Australia for 20 years at both Goldman and J.P. Morgan across both advisory and financing teams. For most of my career I was focused on the TMT sectors \u2013 Tech, Media and Telco. When I left banking I was looking for something very different, but also wanted it to utilise the things I had enjoyed the most over the last two decades \u2013 high-growth tech opportunities and financial markets. In the break I had after leaving banking, a good friend encouraged me to research Bitcoin and, in a familiar story to many, once I started reading, I never looked back.\\n\\nI started investing my own capital and fell for the pace, innovation and market-ecosystem \u2013 building out an investment management business focused on what I believe is the most exciting and disruptive tech of a generation was a compelling business prospect. However, a core understanding of the tech and connectivity with thought leaders, in what is still an opaque sector, was key, and the same friend who led me to Bitcoin introduced me to Gabriel Abed.\\n\\nGabe has been in the space for many years and has a cryptography background \u2013 it was clear immediately that our respective skill sets were complementary. We had the same perspectives on where digital asset technology was headed, and we both had the time to commit to growing what we wanted to be the leading investment manager for global institutional and family office investors.\\n\\nWe started building the business in early 2017, managing our first external capital in Q3 2017 and launching our first public fund, Digital Asset Fund in January 2018, our second fund, DAF Liquid Venture Fund in August 2018, and our third fund, a market-neutral derivatives-focused fund, DAF Greeks Fund in August 2019.\\n\\nDigital Asset Fund was the second best performing long-only crypto fund globally in 2019 and DAF Liquid Ventures was the top-performing VC crypto fund. It\u2019s exciting for the team that the vision we had in 2017 and the investment approach we have stayed true to, has helped see us through both bullish and bearish markets.\\n\\n**You are self-described reformed Goldman and JPMorgan bankster \u2014 I'd love to hear more about that. What was your experience like there, and what inspired you to go into the digital asset sector?**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nI had a great career in investment banking. The pace and excitement of the work was both addictive coming straight out of university, as well as an incredible training ground through the inspiring senior bankers I worked for over my career, and my junior years in the training programs that the banks have in place.\\n\\nThe roles I kept being drawn to in the industry had two things in common \u2013 high-growth/tech oriented clients and interacting with financial markets \u2013 so when I was looking for the next opportunity, digital assets were the purest form of both those attributes I have yet found. I knew it was for me.\\n\\n**How has your experience at these firms informed your digital assets investments? What translates from that world, and what doesn\u2019t?**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nYes \u2013 very much so. We lean heavily upon the core valuation and diligence practises learnt at those firms, and I believe it has helped us make better investment decisions for our funds. Staying true to these approaches has helped us cut through the noise that the crypto market, and all markets, create \u2013 continue to invest through bearish markets and don\u2019t get distracted by the hype and emotion that comes with strong bull markets.\\n\\nWhat doesn\u2019t work? Banking is, from my perspective, still a fast-moving industry but it's nothing compared to this sector. You need to adapt the speed of decision making dramatically in this sector or you will have a long list of missed opportunities and regrets!\\n\\n**What drew you to work with Akash?**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nWe actively run a number of nodes/validators for our portfolio companies and through this, and other business-related activities, we have become significant (for us at least) users of cloud computing services \u2013 it can get expensive! We have always seen this as a great use-case for crypto to disrupt but, until Akash, hadn\u2019t come across the right opportunity.\\n\\nThe core differentiators we saw for Akash were its understanding of the end-market, focus on re-setting the cost-curve, and simplifying the experience for users. The design leverages crypto at what it can be good at - bringing distributed resources together - but also minimises its involvement in what it traditionally hasn\u2019t been good at \u2013 UX.\\n\\nWe were excited about Greg and team\u2019s experience and knowledge of the market--even down to customer-by-customer granularity. We like to invest in teams that can build great tech but just importantly, help drive usage of it. The Akash team\u2019s knowledge and passion for what they are building made the decision for us.\\n\\n**What makes DACM different from other investors in the ecosystem?**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nI can only speak for our own processes, but it is very focused on what I would classify as \u201ctraditional\u201d analytical methodologies \u2013 we utilise the experience our team has in detailed financial analysis and modeling as well as our experience in granular due-diligence to make what we believe are informed investment decisions.\\n\\nWe also ensure we make assessments of a project\u2019s entire value creation chain \u2013 not just the design and ability to build the tech, but the team\u2019s ability to build a community and manage the myriad stakeholders that are involved in a successful crypto project with a listed token.\\n\\nI believe this process, and sticking to it without exception, has not only helped us avoid a number of potential mistakes, but also to find differentiated opportunities that have been incredible investments for our funds.\\n\\n**Crypto is an idiosyncratic environment that\u2019s constantly evolving, and you\u2019ve established yourselves as experts at navigating it. How do you keep your finger on the pulse?**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nWe work very hard at building and maintaining global networks of both founders and investors to ensure we hear different perspectives and global news flow. Part of that is in running a decentralised team ourselves - we have team members in Australia, Southeast Asia, Middle East, and the Caribbean \u2013 which gives us great geographical coverage but, given the majority of information flows electronically, we also lead and participate in a broad range of online networks.\\n\\nWe encourage everyone on our team to be active members in these communities \u2013 both sharing and listening to perspectives.\\n\\n**I see that you\u2019re based out of Australia \u2014 what is the ecosystem like there, and how does it effect the way you invest?**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nGrowing! It's been a great base for me personally \u2013 Australia has, what I believe, an enviable position in the world with strong business ties and networks through Asia alongside historical and language connectivity through the UK and US, which is invaluable in a truly global sector like this.\\n\\nThe local ecosystem is really coming into its own over the last 18 months with local teams or Australian founders - the key drivers of the DeFi revolution including sector leaders Synthetix, mStable, RenVM, dHedge and Thorchain.\\n\\n**How do you envision cryptocurrency changing the world?**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nWe have a high-level thesis that three key trends in the world are ongoing digitisation, decentralisation, and falling trust in traditional institutions. Whilst the third may be disappointing in some respects, we still believe these are likely multi-decade trends the world is facing. In our opinion, cryptocurrencies, and more broadly digital assets, have emerged at the perfect time - they are essential tools to help facilitate this change.\\n\\nGiven our team\u2019s background, the ability for this tech to disrupt and reshape the traditional financial sector has been a focus for us but the use-cases are broader than that and really only limited by innovators\u2019 ability to find instances where costs can be reset, and efficiencies generated.\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Partner Profile: DACM&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;We were excited about Greg and team's experience and knowledge of the market--even down to customer-by-customer granularity. We like to invest in teams that can build great tech but just importantly help drive usage of it.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-09-02T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Partners&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Partners&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Olive grateful for the continued support of our global community as we build the world\u2019s first decentralized cloud marketplace.**\\n\\nIn the first half of the year, we successfully:\\n\\n- launched our incentivized testnet, **The Akashian Challenge, with 106 active validators**\\n- sold through our first run of **300 Superminis within 3 weeks**\\n- doubled our team, and **expanded global support to Chinese and Russian audiences**\\n\\nToday, as we enter the fourth quarter of the year, we\u2019re excited to share a number of exciting updates to our product roadmap.\\n\\n###\\n\\n**Akash Network Mainnet 1**  \\n\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\n\\nOver the past few weeks, and immediately after Phase 2 of The Akashian Challenge incentivized testnet in July, our team focused on Q4 roadmap planning while preparing to integrate upstream software updates to Cosmos SDK.\\n\\nAdditionally, we are:\\n\\n- continuing to improve the platform and ship releases.\\n- organizing our developer ecosystem, partnerships, data center operations, get started guides, deployment tools, and more\\n- expanding our efforts with content and community programming, both in our official [Telegram](https://t.me/AkashNW), as well as our international presence in China and Russia (our second and third largest global audiences)\\n\\n**Akash Network\u2019s Mainnet is scheduled for launch on Wednesday, September 23rd at 9AM PST/4PM UTC.**\\n\\nOur core focus areas for Akash Network\u2019s Mainnet launch are the following:\\n\\n- Launch with 64 validators\\n- Ensure network stability\\n- Support staking, and enable transfers via governance\\n\\nLeading up to Mainnet, we\u2019ll be following up with our testnet participants to confirm they\u2019ve completed KYC before distribution of Akash Token (AKT).&nbsp; We\u2019ll also be collecting genesis wallet addresses from AKT holders, including all participants in our first testnet in Q4 of 2019, The Akashian Challenge: Phase 1, and Phase 2, as well as our stakeholders.\\n\\n###\\n\\n**The Akashian Challenge: Phase 3 Testnet**  \\n\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\n\\nPhase 3 of The Akashian Challenge incentivized testnet will serve as the launchpad for Mainnet 2.&nbsp; We\u2019ll be dedicating 1,000,000 AKTs in rewards, and are aiming for a mid-to-late October launch, leading up to Mainnet 2 in November 2020.\\n\\nOur goal for Phase 3 is to build a catalogue of deployed applications, and further expand on the initial testnet\u2019s success:\\n\\n- **1,800+ deployed applications**, ranging from privacy-preserving to machine learning deployed applications\\n- **Onboarded 160 unique cloud providers** from all over the world\\n- **Grew at 130% Week-over-Week** over a 5-week period\\n\\nLeading up to Phase 3, we\u2019ll also be focused on streamlining cloud providers\u2019 on-boarding processes, and testing OSS applications.\\n\\nFrom all of us at Akash Network, we sincerely appreciate your continued support, and look forward to closing 2020 strong with all of you.\\n\\n**Stay tuned for more announcements, and join our** [**Telegram**](https://t.me/AkashNW) **for the latest updates.**\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Q4 2020 Roadmap Update&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;We\u2019re of the US, Akash\u2019s Russian audience is our _second largest community_. We\u2019ve also been fortunate to have a number of Russian participants among the 106 validators in The Akashian Challenge, our incentivized testnet.\\n\\n**That\u2019s why today, we\u2019re excited to announce the launch of the Akash Network Russian Community, and expand our global vision for the world\u2019s first decentralized cloud marketplace.**\\n\\nWe welcome Russian audiences around the world to learn more about Akash Network and Akash Token (AKT) by visiting our Russian [website](https://akash.network/?lang=ru) and joining our [Russian Telegram Group](https://t.me/akash_ru).\\n\\n####\\n\\n**Introducing Andrii Hnatiuk, Akash Russian Community Manager**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nTo help us share our vision for the future of the cloud, and grow our Russian community, we\u2019re thrilled to announce that Andrii Hnatiuk has joined Akash as our new Russian Community Manager. A passionate trader and crypto enthusiast, Andrii is very involved in building the Russian ecosystem and community.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620923345-andrew-pic.jpg)\\n\\n> After graduating with a Master\u2019s Degree in Foreign Economics and Communication, and a Bachelor's Degree in Accounting and Auditing, I worked as an Economist at a bank for 6 years. Working with customers daily allowed me to learn more about people\u2019s behaviors, and how to support them with different types of solutions. I left my role at the bank in search of new opportunities, and started trading stocks on the NYSE and NASDAQ--I\u2019m still trading.\\n>\\n> At the end of 2017, my friends gave me a present--0.5 ETH and a wallet. That was the first cryptocurrency I got. I was so excited and started to learn more about blockchain technology, cryptocurrencies, new blockchain projects, and decentralization. I started to research and trade crypto every day, and became a community moderator. It became my passion. Now I can\u2019t imagine my life without crypto, trading, and the crypto community.\\n>\\n> I believe that Akash is a game changer in the cloud computing industry. The project has a great vision of the future, a world where cloud computing is permissionless, sovereign, and open. I look forward to helping the team build that future.\\n\\n#### **Zavodil Reviews Akash Network**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nWith over 11,000 subscribers and hundreds of thousands of views, the [Zavodil](https://www.youtube.com/c/Zavodil/about) YouTube show is one of the most influential among Russian audiences. Zavodil reviews and analyzes new crypto projects from a developer\u2019s perspective, informed by market context and an industry insider\u2019s insight. Segments of the content are exclusively available only to subscribers.\\n\\nThrough an incisive episode, Zavodil conducted a comprehensive assessment of Akash Network, from the cloud market landscape, to our technology, and our team.\\n\\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1Up1ZsHIlPw\\n\\n#### **Community AMAs with Gagarin &amp; Solana Russia**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n**In support of the Russian Community launch this week, the Gagarin Crypto Group hosted an AMA in their Telegram group on Monday, July 20th at 9AM PST / 4PM UTC featuring Akash CEO Greg Osuri and VP of Product Jack Zampolin.**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620923791-gagarin-1024x575.jpeg)\\n\\nGagarin's community is one of the most influential among Russian audiences. Their Telegram group has about 4,000 members made up of Russian and CIS traders and investors. They review projects, share investment ideas, and conduct trading. They have a very active community, and we found our AMA with them one of the most exciting and rewarding AMAs we\u2019ve participated in.\\n\\nWe were impressed with the level of engagement, and the depth of the questions the Gagarin community asked us. We probably got inundated with about 150 insightful and thoughtful questions during our AMA--you can check out the action in the video.\\n\\n**This Thursday at 9AM PST / 4PM UTC, Solana\u2019s Russian Community is hosting Greg and Jack in their Telegram group. We\u2019ll be sharing more about our partnership and technology integration with Solana.**\\n\\n####\\n\\n**Join Our Russian Community and Win Akash Gear**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n**We\u2019re** **giving away special branded Akash gear and prizes** in celebration of our Russian Community launch. We invite you to join the Akash Russian Telegram Group for a chance to win, and to help us build the decentralized future of the Internet!\\n\\n[**Join Akash Russian Telegram**](https://t.me/akash_ru)\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Network Launches Russian Community!&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Outside of the US, Akash\u2019s Russian audience is our second largest community. We\u2019ve also been fortunate to have a number of Russian participants among the 106 validators in The Akashian Challenge, our incentivized testnet.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-07-22T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;News&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;News&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Maly Ly&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.CkrOZxac.jpg&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,380],&quot;height&quot;:[0,512],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;jpg&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-network-launches-russian-community/banner-image.jpg&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-network-at-singapore-blockchain-week-2020/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-network-at-singapore-blockchain-week-2020&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\n**With the launch of our Chinese community this month, we\u2019re accelerating efforts across the Asian Pacific region**. Today through Thursday, July 23rd, the Akash team is participating in [Singapore Blockchain Week](https://www.blockchainweek.com.sg/).\\n\\nWith over 5,000 attendees, Singapore Blockchain Week will be held as a virtual event this year and brings together government, industry leaders, academics, and innovators, with the goal of aiding blockchain governance and technology collaboration on both the regional and international levels.\\n\\nOur CEO Greg Osuri is speaking on the **Blockchain Governance 2020 and Decentralisation** panel _today from 3:30PM to 4:15PM SGT / 12:30AM PST_. The panel is moderated by Charles d\u2019Haussy, Director of Consensys Hong Kong, and also features Alex Mashinsky, CEO, Celsius Network; Dr. Ben Goertzel, Founder &amp; CEO, SingularityNET; Alexandre Kech, CEO, Onchain Custodian; and Eddy Travia, Regional Director, Asia Pacific, IOV Labs.\\n\\nIf you\u2019ll be attending, please stop by the [Akash Network Virtual Booth](https://next.brella.io/events/SGBCW/sponsors/29688) and say hi--we\u2019d love to connect with you!\\n\\n**Get the latest Akash news, events, and giveaways!**\\n\\n[**Join Our Telegram**](https://t.me/AkashNW)\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Network at Singapore Blockchain Week 2020&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;With the launch of our Chinese community this month, we\u2019re accelerating efforts across the Asian Pacific region. Today through Thursday, July 23rd, the Akash team is participating in Singapore Blockchain Week.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-07-21T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;News&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;News&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Michael Gushansky&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.Br8tncU-.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,2000],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1500],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-network-at-singapore-blockchain-week-2020/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;the-akashian-challenge-phase-2-close-update/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;the-akashian-challenge-phase-2-close-update&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\n**In Phase 2 of The Akashian Challenge, we enabled end-to-end functionality of our network by completing the migration from Tendermint to Cosmos SDK. We set out to test the performance of the Akash Network decentralized exchange (DEX).**\\n\\nWhat Phase 2 ended up testing was the performance of Tendermint and Cosmos SDK, surfacing well-known performance issues that constrained prior testnets, such as Game of Stakes and Game of Zones. In both GoS and GoZ, spam attacks took down significant portions of the network and caused service disruptions.\\n\\nAs a result of these issues, Akashians experienced a series of tesnet performance limitations during Week 1 and Week 2. We\u2019re grateful for all those who persevered and continued to push through.\\n\\nThe performance limitations the network is facing will be significantly reduced once the protobuf migration and other changes are released in 0.34 Tendermint and 0.40 Cosmos SDK. These releases are expected in the coming weeks, and can be tracked at the [Tendermint v0.34 Milestone](https://github.com/tendermint/tendermint/milestone/27) and [Cosmos SDK v0.40 Project Board](https://github.com/cosmos/cosmos-sdk/projects/38).\\n\\nWe\u2019ve already completed the initial work to integrate the new changes in preparation for Inter-Blockchain Communication (IBC) protocol, and the network will benefit from improved performance and additional features. We\u2019ll also have full network functionality much sooner than we\u2019d previously anticipated.\\n\\n#### **The Close of The Akashian Challenge: Phase 2**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n**Due to these performance limitations and in preparation for integrating the new Tendermint and Cosmos SDK releases, we\u2019ll be closing the Phase 2 competition early, on 0000UTC / 5PM Friday, July 17th.** For Week 1 and Week 2, we\u2019ll be rewarding teams based on the original [Reward Schedule](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1v5OxKfYE3yzJevg_oWNyRQ5vKci3lwTZcFpbTXQ_bBE/edit#gid=0).\\n\\n45,213 AKT in AKT rewards were budgeted for Week 3: Cast a Wide Net. We\u2019ll be distributing these rewards equally to all Akashians who participated in Phase 2 in gratitude for their fortitude, patience, and commitment to The Akashian Challenge.\\n\\nWe\u2019ll announce the winners of the Phase 2 qualitative rewards on Monday, July 27, 2020, as scheduled.\\n\\n#### **Looking Ahead to The Akashian Challenge: Phase 3**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nPrior to the start of Phase 3, we\u2019ll be running a long lived public testnest with a faucet to enable users to try the platform on a live network.\\n\\nOnce we\u2019ve integrated the changes to the chain, we\u2019ll be launching Phase 3 of The Akashian Challenge with a test of the full decentralized cloud compute network.\\n\\nWe\u2019ll be incentivizing providers to deploy compute capacity to the network, and incentivizing users to deploy applications. We\u2019ll be testing the user experience of our platform and refining application deployments on the network. Unlike Phase 2, we will not be testing the performance of the blockchain.\\n\\nSince Phase 2 has been focused on testing the on-chain aspects of our network, we\u2019ve been unable to showcase the non-blockchain progress that our engineering team has achieved. We look forward to publishing our release notes in the coming weeks.\\n\\n**We deeply appreciate the feedback, understanding, and support we\u2019ve received from Akashians, and we thank all participants for helping us build a stronger and more resilient decentralized cloud.**\\n\\n#### **Get the Latest Akash Updates!**\\n\\n[**Join Our Telegram**](https://t.me/AkashNW)\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;The Akashian Challenge: Phase 2 Close &amp; Update&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;In Phase 2 of The Akashian Challenge, we enabled end-to-end functionality of our network by completing the migration from Tendermint to Cosmos SDK. We set out to test the performance of the Akash Network decentralized exchange (DEX).&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-07-17T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Testnets&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Testnets&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Maly Ly&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.Chit_Jar.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,660],&quot;height&quot;:[0,480],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/the-akashian-challenge-phase-2-close-update/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;partner-profile-simply-vc/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;partner-profile-simply-vc&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\n**We\u2019re excited to announce that we\u2019ve partnered with Simply VC to help us build the future of the decentralized cloud.**\\n\\nWhat we value in our partnership with Simply VC is that we share a vision for a truly decentralized cloud. Can a network be truly decentralized if it exists on a centralized cloud? Simply VC doesn\u2019t think so, and neither do we. That\u2019s why Simply VC runs all of their validator operations out of their own Tier 3 data center. That\u2019s also why we chose to partner with Simply to bring their capacity, validator operation, and vision to our cloud marketplace.\\n\\nAs one of Cosmos\u2019s genesis validators, Simply VC has supported the Cosmos ecosystem since its inception. With a veteran team of IT, Security, and blockchain specialists, Simply has been supporting decentralized networks such as Cosmos, Chainlink, Polkadot, and Kusama, for the last 6 years.\\n\\nWe recently connected with Simply VC CEO Matthew Felice Pace, CTO Isaac Zarb, and&nbsp; Blockchain Technology Analyst Daniel Magro, to discuss what makes Simply VC unique and how they envision the future of the decentralized web.\\n\\n**Tell us a little about yourselves and how you came to join Simply VC?**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n**Daniel**: I take care of the Infrastructure and DevOps side of Simply VC. I also get involved in development.\\n\\n**Isaac**: I\u2019ve been in the IT industry for about 20 years and I\u2019ve been interested in IT since I was about 12 years old. I\u2019ve worked at ISPs, software companies, fintech companies, and consulting companies. I started in networking before moving to security. At Simply VC, I started as a subcontractor, and implemented security. I got into blockchain because the team was doing a lot of work around masternodes at the time. I became interested in proof of stake.\\n\\n**Matthew**: I\u2019d like to clarify one thing first. The VC in Simply VC is not venture capital--it stands for virtual currencies. The company was set up in 2015 by our founder who is now very much hands off. He set it up to mine bitcoin here in Malta, and then we met in 2018, technically to work on something else, and over time it evolved into blockchain. I was very interested beforehand. I have a computer science background, and was working towards a PhD that I didn\u2019t complete. I worked on&nbsp;data science, and became interested in blockchain around 2017.\\n\\nI knew about it before I read \u201cMastering Bitcoin\u201d in 2015. We were thinking about doing asset management, but shifted completely to just doing tech and delegated proof of stake. We got into Cosmos, and at launch, we were one of the genesis validators.\\n\\n**You\u2019re all from Malta--what in your opinion has made the island such a hot space in crypto?**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n**Isaac**: I think it started from fintech about 10 years ago and igaming, internet gambling, and then there was a huge tech community. We have a large number of developers, and network and security guys. People wanted to work in tech and companies found it easy to recruit tech people. We speak english so that helps a lot. The weather is good. Companies come from Europe where the weather sucks.\\n\\n**Matthew**: There was a push to try and create a new industry on the island. Since it worked for igaming and fintech, the government decided to try and pitch Malta as blockchain island. They developed legal frameworks as there were very few that existed at the time. They were quite thorough and well designed. But there was a lot of hype. They joined with industry players to produce conferences and tried to get people, as they did with igaming, to move their base to Malta.\\n\\n**Blockchain technology is in a nascent stage. How did you develop the skills necessary to contribute at Simply VC Daniel?**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n**Daniel**: I became interested in blockchain 6 or 7 years ago. Later on, Simply VC\u2019s CEO was recruiting at my university, and I\u2019ve been working at Simply VC ever since. I learned along the way. Each time I had a new project, I learned the skills necessary for the project, and over time, I gained holistic knowledge.\\n\\n**How did Simply VC form? Was Simply VC\u2019s vision always to help support the decentralization of the internet or did that develop over time?**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n**Matthew**: I think it was always in the mind of our founder. In the beginning, we didn\u2019t really know where we were headed. This is why Daniel mentioned that you learn things as you go based on the project you\u2019re working on. I think that\u2019s the spirit.\\n\\n**Daniel**: Our founder is obsessed with decentralization. Decentralization was always a part of the vision.\\n\\n**Isaac**: I\u2019m not sure if you\u2019re aware, but we have our own Tier 3 data center which we run our operations from, and we have colocated servers across Europe, and others in Malta. So we do not rely on the cloud at all because we believe that the internet and blockchain should be decentralized. So it doesn't really make sense if everything is running on Amazon or Google Cloud. Which _you_ must understand completely!\\n\\n**You said you have some colocated servers across Europe. What is the purpose of running them?**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n**Isaac**: It\u2019s for sentries mostly, and high availability in case something happens to our node. We have another data center in Malta where we run other sentries which we can turn into validators if we have a complete outage. Malta is small so we could even move our HSMs if we wanted, to the other data center. We want to make sure we\u2019re highly resilient. If something happens, we could literally move the hardware from one place to the other, and everything is set up and can continue functioning quickly.\\n\\nWe actually simulate outages, and a week or two ago, we had maintenance going on in the data center. We missed a few blocks, but I was extremely happy that our main fiber optic link went down for maintenance and everything shifted over nicely. Our automation scripts work well--once you see it working when you need it, you really appreciate it.\\n\\n**It seems that having a background in IT and Security prepared you well for the needs of running a node for a blockchain--you really care about downtime.**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n**Isaac**: My experience working for ISPs enforces that downtime is bad. If you\u2019re an ISP and you have downtime, customers are going to complain and you\u2019re going to end up in the newspapers. I come from a background where all my services have to be online. I\u2019ve worked for digital terrestrial TV companies so downtime was impossible. You\u2019d have live football streaming and if you have a second of downtime, people would literally kill you, and come knock on your door!\\n\\n**Matthew**: Not any downtime--acceptable downtime. There\u2019s maintenance. Otherwise you would sacrifice security for no downtime. Security is paramount, and then downtime.\\n\\n**Do you feel that specializing early on in blockchain infrastructure has given Simply VC a competitive advantage to other data center operations stepping into the space? If so, why?**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n**Matthew**: The space was very young, and when it moves so quickly, the earlier you can get in, the better. You get a competitive advantage because personal documentation for these processes have not been developed yet. You have to learn as you go and it\u2019s a matter of putting the hours in. Because everyone on the team was thrown into the deep end every time, it gave us the mental fortitude and clarity to move forward. It\u2019s very easy to get lost, but when you do it over and over, you learn. For example, I would say Daniel is a blockchain native. In the same way as people are internet native, which maybe my parents weren\u2019t.\\n\\n**You specialize in supporting decentralized networks. What complexities specific to those networks are the most challenging?**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n**Isaac**: It doesn\u2019t make it more difficult--short block times make downtimes very important and high availability is more of an issue. With a blockchain, you have a reputation to keep and the agility of the protocol pushes you to be better. Blockchain software is actually less complex.\\n\\n**Matthew**: It\u2019s a little different because it\u2019s a community effort and adjustments happen as a group to identify the right parameters. The interesting thing that I see in blockchain is that it forces communication. In a centralized environment, communication breaks down very quickly because you can do things by yourself. You can silo yourself and do it alone.\\n\\nIt\u2019s alright to install and run a system but there are lots of potential issues upgrading a decentralized system. If you take Cosmos Hub for instance, the challenges that come from agreeing on what to upgrade because the software is decentralized is not something you have in a centralized system.\\n\\n**Being on the infrastructure side of things, where do you see the biggest need for growth in blockchain?**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n**Daniel**: With something like Cosmos for example, you have the top 5 validators controlling around 32% of the network. I personally think that\u2019s a big problem.&nbsp;The network is set up such that it can be decentralized but the players that are in it force it not to be that way.\\n\\n**Matthew**: Apart from the growth of DeFi, it is concerning that we are building decentralized systems _assuming_ that they are going to be decentralized. We need to develop systems that enforce decentralization. It\u2019s the law of nature--if you can do it, you will do it.\\n\\n**Daniel, you\u2019ve been a very active member of The Akashian Challenge community, which we are incredibly thankful for. Could you share a highlight from your experiences with Phase 1 or 2 so far?**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n**Daniel**: The proposal from Phase 1 was quite interesting for me. Lots of discussion and opinions from all members. I also liked the second proposal which was sort of a trick proposal. I enjoy all the new faces and that a lot of people new to the space joined. It's good to see new people getting involved. I\u2019m looking forward to seeing what solutions people come up with to get the most bids and leases.\\n\\n**What kind of a rig are you running for the challenges?**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n**Isaac**: For the validators, we\u2019re using a virtualized shared server of our own and for the workloads we have dedicated hardware which we prefer for the workloads. We tested out through the challenges, but at the moment, we\u2019re only using the virtualized solution. The difference between our hardware and cloud hardware is that&nbsp; we don\u2019t over provision our servers. We never go over 30% to 40% capacity whereas servers on the cloud could be over-provisioned by 20 to 30 times.\\n\\n**Daniel**: We\u2019re using 8 cores for our validator, 32 gb of ram (20 gb of ram to the provider operations), 200 gb hard drive. We have GPU servers ready to dedicate to Akash\u2019s mainnet.\\n\\n**What excites you about Akash?**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n**Matthew**: Our vision is of a decentralized future and it has to start with Akash. In today\u2019s world, if we\u2019re going to move away from large conglomerates, which used to be good because they innovated, we\u2019re going to need tools like Akash. I\u2019m excited to partner.\\n\\n**Daniel**: Akash is exactly in line with our beliefs of truly decentralizing the cloud, and giving power back to the little guys. I believe it\u2019s the way forward.\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Partner Profile: Simply VC&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;We're excited to announce that we\u2019ve partnered with Simply VC to help us build the future of the decentralized cloud.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-07-16T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Partners&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Partners&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Michael Gushansky&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.DHyrwi3M.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1998],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1458],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/partner-profile-simply-vc/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;introducing-boz-menzalji-general-manager/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;introducing-boz-menzalji-general-manager&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;Across every function at Akash, from engineering, to partnerships, to marketing, one Akashian has made a profound impact in the way we collaborate and scale.\\n\\nHe enables our team to relentlessly materialize the world\u2019s first decentralized cloud marketplace.\\n\\n**Today, we\u2019re thrilled to introduce Boz Menzalji, Akash\u2019s General Manager. Unshakably optimistic, curious, and empathetic, Boz is a problem solver with an irrepressible growth orientation. He is no stranger to the roller coaster of building a startup.**&nbsp;\\n\\nA serial entrepreneur and business development leader, Boz spent 13 years navigating the successes and failures of entrepreneurship. Prior to Akash, Boz saw two acquisitions and was GM at Refereum, a blockchain-based gaming rewards and marketing platform. Before that, he led business development for multiple SaaS startups in gaming, agtech, martech and fintech, including Paydici, a billing and payments platform.&nbsp;\\n\\nBoz and his family immigrated to Oregon from Lattakia, Syria, when he was young. His early experiences gave him an understanding of how economic and political constraints impact companies and innovation. He graduated from the University of Oregon in 2008 at the height of the recession.&nbsp;\\n\\nA knack for problem solving and an insatiable curiosity made him well-suited for the demands of building and growing startups across industries. This experience prepared him for the challenges and opportunities of building Akash.\\n\\n> I've always enjoyed solving problems, building things, and creating value -- entrepreneurship is one of my core passions. My capabilities in growth, business development, and partnerships grew out of an innately pragmatic and programmatic approach\\n\\n#### **Building the Market for the Decentralized Cloud**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**  \\n\\nBefore he would agree to join full time, Boz started first as a consultant at Akash with one condition--to verify prospective customers\u2019 pain points.&nbsp;\\n\\n> After multiple meetings with companies, I quickly saw that they shared acute pain points, and there was a clear problem with a common denominator between everyone we spoke with. I saw that the problem was a massive one. 85%+ of servers are sitting idle around the world. Across 10+ million servers, that represents $30 billion of capital--incredibly wasteful. Compounding the issue is an oligopolized cloud services industry...change is needed, and the product, the time, and the market are aligned well for disruption.\\n\\nOver the first few months with Akash, Boz came to see CEO Greg Osuri as someone he\u2019d be willing to go to battle with every day.\\n\\n> What most people don't realize, is that the startup becomes your family. You\u2019ll fight and bump heads. You\u2019ll lose your cool. You\u2019ll cry. You\u2019ll celebrate wins and losses...and all of it will be _together_ because at the end of the day, you\u2019re one team. Period. Greg\u2019s core value for everything he does is _empathy_. That says quite a bit about who you\u2019re working with.\\n\\nAs Akash\u2019s General Manager, Boz leads fundraising, partnerships, business development, and operations. For Boz, sales is a company\u2019s lifeline and requires continual iteration from lead generation, to signed contract, to onboarding and customer success. That journey needs to be comprehensively understood and replicated to enable scale.\\n\\n> First, recognize that your sales process is an engine--make sure you know every moving part of your engine, and how it interacts with each other.  \\n>   \\n> Second, be ruthlessly focused on the customer by executing a root/cause analysis during your customer development initiatives; the _what_ is simple, but always ask the _why_. Don\u2019t build features that don\u2019t solve problems or add value - verify before you build. Do not repeat the timeless mistake of _build it and they will come_\\n> \\n> Third, think about moats and how to build them early on. Stay pragmatic and disciplined. Focus on one problem and solve it well, and stay laser focused on the shortest path to generating value at first (it\u2019s not as easy as it sounds). For an understanding of moats, I recommend Peter Thiel's Zero to One and Blue Ocean Strategy by W. Chan Kim and Ren\u00e9e Mauborgne.\\n\\n#### **Growing the Dream Team**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**  \\n\\nBoz\u2019s invaluable contributions beyond his role include clearing roadblocks for the team, establishing a collaborative culture, championing the happiness of our team, and ensuring we celebrate together.&nbsp;\\n\\nIn the past two quarters, Akash has doubled in team size. Boz has been involved in recruiting and hiring each new team member. At Akash, culture starts with empathy. Boz also looks for candidates with a deep sense of ownership and purpose.&nbsp;  \\n  \\nBut if empathy doesn\u2019t come with ownership and purpose, we don\u2019t make the hire.\\n\\n> Startups aren\u2019t your typical 9-5. You\u2019re going to share large milestones and deliverables. You have to care enough about your team to support them, and you\u2019ll need them to support you. Startups are family. I want to ensure our people grow alongside the company and share in the prosperity of the company\u2019s success.\\n\\nEmpathy impacts Akash\u2019s one metric that matters, which is total network spend on Akash\u2019s marketplace, or GMV (gross merchandise value).\\n\\n> We build our platform with empathy for the developer. We want to remove the cognitive tax it takes for developers to adopt Akash and deploy their applications.\\n\\n#### **Looking to the Future**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**  \\n\\nAfter launching our successful incentivized testnet competition, The Akashian Challenge, with 211 teams, and selling out the first production run of our Superminis,&nbsp; Boz is excited to bridge the gap between crypto and traditional markets, first with strategic partnerships, and customer development.\\n\\n> At Akash, I\u2019m excited about creating a new market category of edgeless cloud infrastructure, and leveraging blockchain to enable permissionless access to compute from anyone, anywhere.\\n\\nAn insatiable learner, Boz\u2019s core passion is space and like space, his desire to grow and push himself seems limitless. After completing consecutive cloud certifications, he\u2019s currently learning Bash/Shell and voraciously studying the rise of FinTech 2.0 (DeFi), which he believes will have tremendous implications for global markets.&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Introducing Boz Menzalji, General Manager&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Across every function at Akash, from engineering, to partnerships, to marketing, one Akashian has made a profound impact in the way we collaborate and scale.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-07-15T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Team&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Team&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Maly Ly&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.C_hkscRa.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,660],&quot;height&quot;:[0,480],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/introducing-boz-menzalji-general-manager/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;the-unstoppable-update-july-2020/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;the-unstoppable-update-july-2020&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\n**This past month was a month of acceleration for Akash**. After completion of a successful Phase 1 of The Akashian Challenge, our incentivized testnet, we launched the 3 weeks long Phase 2 to test and demonstrate the decentralized exchange features of our cloud platform.\\n\\nWe also expanded our global vision for the future of the cloud and launched our Chinese Community channels with a WeChat AMA hosted by OG Group, broadcast to 5,000 new community members. We\u2019re excited to increase participation in our platform through a new partnership with Lunie Wallet, enabling more users to participate in the economic security of Akash\u2019s blockchain.\\n\\nIt takes a tenacious and talented team to build a future at the intersection of cloud, blockchain, and machine learning. We\u2019re thrilled to welcome our newest team members **Jack Zampolin, Olive Kimoto, Michael Gushansky, and Cheng Wang**. More about each of these extraordinary individuals below.\\n\\nAs more of people\u2019s lives continue to transition to the cloud, our team is even more committed to progressing **a future that provides faster, better, and significantly lower cost access to the cloud, enabling greater growth and innovation for organizations of all sizes.**\\n\\n####\\n\\n**The Akashian Challenge Phase 2 Launch!**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620923790-week2-banner-1-1024x768.png)\\n\\nPhase 2 of The Akashian Challenge, our incentivized testnet, is [currently underway](https://akash.network/blog/the-akashian-challenge-phase-2-week-2-chaos-is-a-ladder/) and **encompasses 3 weeks of challenges, 600,000 AKT rewards, and special prizes.**\\n\\nThe Akashian Challenge Phase 2 introduces, demonstrates, and tests the decentralized exchange features of Akash. This decentralized exchange (DEX) is different from others in the cryptocurrency world, which are focused on settling trades; the Akash DEX is designed to settle requests for application deployments. Track our progress on [Forbole\u2019s The Big Dipper](https://testnet.akash.bigdipper.live/) and [Vitwit\u2019s Aneka](https://akash.aneka.io/) block explorers. [**Learn More >**](https://akash.network/blog/the-akashian-challenge-phase-2-is-live/)\\n\\n####\\n\\n**Akash Chinese Community Launch**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620923804-chinese-banner-1024x768.png)\\n\\nAt Akash Network, outside of the US, our Chinese audience makes up the second largest group of visitors to our website and communities. We\u2019re also fortunate to have a number of Chinese investors and partners, including [Outpost Capital](https://outpostvc.com/), [Hone Capital](http://honecap.com/), [Forbole](https://www.forbole.com/), and [Steven Fan](https://www.linkedin.com/in/stevenweifan/) of Tencent\\n\\nThis past month, we launched the Akash Network Chinese Community, and expanded our vision globally for the world\u2019s first decentralized cloud marketplace. We welcomed Chinese audiences to our new Chinese [website](https://akash.network/about/?lang=zh-hans) and WeChat. We also hosted an AMA with OG Group that was broadcast to 5,000 attendees. [**Learn More >**](https://akash.network/blog/akash-network-launch-chinese-community/)\\n\\n####\\n\\n**Akash + Lunie Partnership**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620923813-lunie-banner-1024x768.png)\\n\\nWe\u2019re excited to announce an integration and partnership with Lunie Wallet. Lunie is a non-custodial staking tool that allows users to safely store, manage and stake crypto assets in Proof of Stake (PoS) networks.\\n\\nWe\u2019ve been admirers of Lunie\u2019s user experience, ease of set-up, and deep integration with Cosmos validators. As a trusted wallet in the Cosmos ecosystem, Lunie provides a great user interface to simplify delegation, voting, and staking.\\n\\nWith a reputable and high integrity team led by CEO Jordan Bibla, Lunie is a company we\u2019d wanted to partner with to enable more users to participate in the economic security of Akash\u2019s blockchain. [**Learn More >**](https://akash.network/blog/akash-network-announces-partnership-with-lunie-wallett/)\\n\\n####\\n\\n**Growing the Dream Team**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620923822-team-bw-1.png)\\n\\nBuilding the future of the cloud takes a talented and unstoppable team courageous and ambitious enough to challenge the status quo. We\u2019re excited to introduce our newest Dream Team members helping us materialize the world\u2019s first decentralized cloud!\\n\\n- [**Introducing Jack Zampolin, VP of Product**](https://akash.network/blog/introducing-jack-zampolin/)**:** Former head of product at Cosmos, Jack\u2019s experience in cloud, blockchain, and Cosmos SDK will help us accelerate to market the world\u2019s first decentralized cloud compute marketplace.\\n- [**Introducing Olive Kimoto, Creative Content Manager**](https://akash.network/blog/announcing-olive-kimoto/)**:** What\u2019s remarkable about Olive\u2019s creative point of view is her understanding and inclusion. She approaches her work with empathy, one of Akash\u2019s core values, and a value that makes Olive such an adaptable and exceptional creative designer.\\n- [**Introducing Michael Gushansky, Marketing &amp; Community Manager**](https://akash.network/blog/introducing-michael-gushansky/)**:** A relentless problem solver and relationship-builder, Michael has a user-first mentality and a growth orientation well-suited for the demands of an entrepreneurial and high growth organization.\\n- [**Introducing Cheng Wang, CFO**](https://akash.network/blog/introducing-cheng-wang/)**:** A savvy entrepreneur and operational leader, with finance chops from legendary firms like Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley, Cheng has _unstoppable_ financial and operational capabilities to help us materialize the future of the cloud.\\n\\n#### **Be first to get Akash news!**\\n\\n**.:** [**Join Our Telegram**](https://t.me/AkashNW) **:.**\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;The Unstoppable Update: July 2020&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;This past month was a month of acceleration for Akash. After completion of a successful Phase 1 of The Akashian Challenge, our incentivized testnet, we launched the 3 weeks long Phase 2 to test and demonstrate the decentralized exchange features of our cloud platform.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-07-14T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Maly Ly&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.Cfu6KSUm.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1330],&quot;height&quot;:[0,996],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/the-unstoppable-update-july-2020/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;the-akashian-challenge-phase-2-week-2-chaos-is-a-ladder/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;the-akashian-challenge-phase-2-week-2-chaos-is-a-ladder&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\n**In The Akashian Challenge Phase 2 Week 1: Capture the Orders, Challengers explored how to operate as a provider by finding and bidding on leases.**\\n\\nDuring the first two days, high traffic on the Phase 2 network caused a transaction completion issue and P2P inconsistencies. We addressed this by stopping the order flow and restarting the network from a new genesis.\\n\\nOn Friday July 3rd, our CEO Greg Osuri and VP of Product Jack Zampolin hosted an AMA live stream to share progress and updates on Phase 2, and presented a demo. If you missed the live stream, you can check out the [video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=shFtDmsCGNc&amp;t=219s).\\n\\n**Today, we\u2019re excited to launch The Akashian Challenge Phase 2 Week 2: Chaos is a Ladder, at 1600 UTC / 9:00AM PST.**\\n\\n[**Get Started Now**](https://akash.network/docs/akashian/phase2#week-2-chaos-is-a-ladder)\\n\\n##### **Week 2: Chaos is a Ladder**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nWeek 2 is a test for throughput of the DEX. This will allow our team to identify performance bottlenecks in our code under realistic network conditions. The challenge builds on Challengers' provider experience from the Week 1: Capture the Orders challenge and encourages them to explore how to operate as a tenant on the network.\\n\\n**Reward Opportunities:**\\n\\n- **Provider: Total Lease-Hours per Provider**: Points awarded to the provider that accumulates the greatest total number of lease-blocks. A lease block is an open lease for one block - if a provider has two leases during one block it is counted as two lease-blocks.\\n\\n- **Provider: Total Lease Count**: Points awarded to the provider that accumulates the greatest total number total leases.\\n\\n- **Tenant: Total Lease-Hours:** Points awarded to the tenant that accumulates the greatest total number of lease-blocks. A lease block is an open lease for one block - if a tenant has two leases during one block it is counted as two lease-blocks.\\n\\n- **Tenant: Total Lease Count**: Points awarded to the tenant that accumulates the greatest total number total leases.\\n\\n##### **Long-Running Challenges**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nA reminder that long-running challenges are active for the entire Akashian Challenge and we encourage you . They\u2019re designed to encourage participation, and present an opportunity for us to observe longer term behaviors of the network.\\n\\nThese long-running challenges include the following, [detailed in the Phase 2 blog](https://akash.network/blog/announcing-the-akashian-challenge-phase-2/):\\n\\n- Validator Architecture and Monitoring\\n- Network Infrastructure Support\\n\\n##### **Ready to Get Started?**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n1.  **Review the** [**Challenge Schedule**](https://akash.network/challenge/phase2/schedule)\\n2.  **Review the** [**Rewards Schedule**](https://akash.network/challenge/phase2/rewards)\\n3.  [**Get Started Now**](https://akash.network/docs/akashian/phase2#week-2-chaos-is-a-ladder)\\n\\n##### **Don\u2019t Miss Critical Updates**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nJoin [our Telegram](https://t.me/AkashNW) and [Riot](https://riot.im/app/#/room/#akashnet:matrix.org) to get the latest news, giveaways, and special invitations to events and AMAs!\\n\\n[**Get**](https://akash.network/docs/akashian/phase2) [**Started**](https://akash.network/docs/akashian/phase2#week-2-chaos-is-a-ladder) [**Now**](https://akash.network/docs/akashian/phase2)\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;The Akashian Challenge Phase 2 Week 2: Chaos is a Ladder&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;During the first two days, high traffic on the Phase 2 network caused a transaction completion issue and P2P inconsistencies. We addressed this by stopping the order flow and restarting the network from a new genesis.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-07-13T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Testnets&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Testnets&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Michael Gushansky&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.BHGjK44z.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,2000],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1500],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/the-akashian-challenge-phase-2-week-2-chaos-is-a-ladder/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;introducing-cheng-wang/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;introducing-cheng-wang&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\n_**Cheng is one of the most creative, curious, and articulate thinkers in the world of finance. We\u2019re incredibly excited to have Cheng leverage his extensive financial and operational experience from Wall Street, to digital commerce and ensure Akash has healthy liquidity and scale to support our ambitious growth goals.**_\\n\\n\\\\- **Greg Osuri, CEO Akash Network**\\n\\nBuilding the world\u2019s first decentralized cloud marketplace requires a master level of organizational structuring and scaling, alignment, and growth planning.\\n\\nWe\u2019re thrilled to introduce our new CFO Cheng Wang. A savvy entrepreneur and operational leader, with finance chops from legendary firms like Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley, Cheng has _unstoppable_ financial and operational capabilities to help us materialize the future of the cloud.\\n\\n> At Akash, I saw a massive opportunity to solve a universal problem with global impact on growth and innovation--escalating cloud costs. Akash provides faster, more efficient, and 10x lower cost access to the cloud.\\n\\n#### **From Debates, to Decentralized Cloud**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nAs the son of immigrant parents with modest means, Cheng developed a precocious financial acumen early, approaching his future through an analytical cost-benefit perspective. His parents inculcated the importance of education and hard work. Growing up, Cheng\u2019s family did not have much.\\n\\nThis experience drove an early ambition and competitiveness that, combined with a keen mind, enabled Cheng to become a champion debater in high school and the recipient of a full scholarship to Macauley Honors College CUNY in New York.\\n\\nIf there is a person who exemplifies Akash\u2019s core value of sovereignty, that person is Cheng, in full control of his future outcomes. Although he had a knack for debate, and considered a career in law, his pragmatism led him to a fast-track career in finance. Accepted into a competitive internship at JP Morgan, Cheng quickly progressed across Wall Street\u2019s most renowned and storied firms, including Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, and Merrill Lynch.\\n\\n> Earlier in my career, I found myself in political and hierarchical environments, and I was driven and focused on achievement. I learned important early lessons about leadership and culture. At Goldman Sachs, I found myself surrounded by incredibly intelligent problem solvers--I learned humility there.\\n\\nCheng later served as Vice President at Royal Bank of Scotland, focusing on debt and valuations. After 8 years at financial institutions, he transitioned his operational and financial acumen to entrepreneurship. He founded multiple retail businesses before relocating to California to serve as CFO for WRKSHP, a high growth San Francisco gaming startup.\\n\\nThe lure of blockchain brought him to Refereum, an incentivization platform built on blockchain, and the vision of the decentralized cloud and the experienced Akash team brought him, finally, to Akash Network.\\n\\n> Akash attracted me for several reasons--a highly experienced and talented team with an analytical and programmatic approach, a large market with a prevalent and ubiquitous need, and the opportunity to join at an early stage where I can actually impact growth and culture.\\n\\n#### **Pioneering Token Economics and Building Culture**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nAt Akash, Cheng leads financial and operational strategy, forecasting, internal systems, and reporting, with a sharp eye on growth planning and treasury management to anticipate turbulence and opportunities in the market. His organizational and planning dexterity enables the company to weather multiple outcomes, especially in a global climate of uncertainty.\\n\\n> I\u2019m looking forward to managing the token market, ensuring token value, and engaging token holders and investors, as well as mitigating potential risks to the token and to the company. With Akash\u2019s pioneering token economics, we\u2019re implementing a system that hasn\u2019t been done in capital markets--that\u2019s exciting.\\n\\nOn treasury and growth management, an Achilles Heel that has felled many projects in the ecosystem, Cheng shares:\\n\\n> Building our markets along with our treasury is the on-going challenge for the foreseeable future. I look forward to helping us get in position to leverage our resources as optimally as possible. There are many companies with amazing opportunities, but squander their potential by mismanaging tokens, monetary capital, and human capital--that\u2019s not going to be us.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922423-cheng-pic.jpg)\\n\\n#### **Guiding Growth for the Decentralized Future of the Cloud**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nPropelled by controlling outcomes, and operating in a volatile global market, Cheng believes in growth planning and management, and proper funding to ensure more runway than is needed.\\n\\nHow will he help Akash achieve this?\\n\\n1. Build a strong, healthy, and durable market for Akash Token (AKT)\\n\\n2. Overall treasury and balance sheet management--maximizing our assets\\n\\n3. Proper organizational scaling\\n\\n> Projecting that forward, I have no doubt that our future constraints will not be growth, capital, or opportunities, but time, and timing. Regarding time, we\u2019ll have more to do and more to pursue than we actually have time for. We\u2019ll have to constantly choose between competing opportunities. And timing is equally as important--choosing when to do or not to do is just as important as determining if we should or shouldn\u2019t. We can sum this up as proper scaling.\\n\\nA financial strategist moved, not only by metrics, but by maximizing the health and happiness of teams, Cheng shares his perspective on culture:\\n\\n> Culture starts from the top with the founder. I\u2019m a firm believer that a company\u2019s culture and values aren\u2019t determined by some consultant or a set of books, but determined and propagated by the founder(s) and the management team. Its success or failure depends on its robustness, consistency, and clarity. Every single individual matters immensely in building the right organization. As individuals, we\u2019re taught to believe in who we are--why shouldn\u2019t companies and teams?\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Introducing Cheng Wang&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Cheng is one of the most creative, curious, and articulate thinkers in the world of finance. We\u2019re incredibly excited to have Cheng leverage his extensive financial and operational experience from Wall Street, to digital commerce and ensure Akash has healthy liquidity and scale to support our ambitious growth goals. - Greg Osuri, CEO Akash Network&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-07-09T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Team&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Team&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Maly Ly&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.BkKhI5v2.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,660],&quot;height&quot;:[0,480],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/introducing-cheng-wang/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;why-akash-network-a-primer-on-the-first-decentralized-cloud-marketplace/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;why-akash-network-a-primer-on-the-first-decentralized-cloud-marketplace&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\n#### **The Market Landscape for Cloud Computing**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n**The cloud computing industry is expected to exceed $210 billion by 2022**. We\u2019re seeing more of the ways we connect and collaborate move to the cloud.\\n\\nWith more of our work and play moving online, this accelerated growth is tied to increased consumer demand for throughput and content, a global surge of smartphones, rapid development of web and mobile applications, and high costs of developer operations on-premise server management.\\n\\nThe leading centralized cloud service providers (CSP)\u2013Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure, and Alibaba Cloud\u2013dominate with 71% market share. AWS alone is triple the size of Microsoft Azure, the second largest CSP.\\n\\nCloud computing is a concentrated and oligopolized market with pricing inefficiency and anti-competitive practices like strip-mining, where a big CSP copies the products of a smaller cloud company (already offered on its platform) and sells the products, often alongside the copied product.\\n\\nWith the market oligopolized, innovation, choice, and flexibility are stifled, and current services come at a high recurring cost with lock-in agreements.\\n\\nFor greater access, flexibility, efficiency, and security, the cloud needs to evolve to a decentralized infrastructure. New innovations, such as serverless technology, are shifting the paradigm in computing, freeing developers from set-up and server management, and enabling them to manage the resources needed to run applications.\\n\\nWithin this market context, there are 8.4 million data centers with an estimated 85% of server capacity underutilized.\\n\\n#### **Akash Network\u2019s Solutions**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922422-akashsuperminiconceptrendernight1-1-1024x576.jpg)\\n\\n**Akash Supercloud**\\n\\nAs the first decentralized alternative to the cloud oligopoly, Akash Network is developing Supercloud, **the world\u2019s first and only decentralized cloud computing marketplace**, enabling any data center and anyone with a computer to become a cloud provider by offering their unused compute cycles in a safe and frictionless marketplace.\\n\\nAkash Supercloud enables organizations to access the 85% of server capacity currently underutilized at 8.4 million data centers, and on individual servers.\\n\\nThe Supercloud platform achieves these benefits by integrating advanced containerization technology with [a unique staking model](https://akash.network/blog/an-evolution-of-akash-network-token-economics/) to accelerate adoption, [built on Tendermint and Cosmos](https://akash.network/blog/decentralized-serverless-computing-coming-to-cosmos/). The Akash Token (AKT) is a utility token used in the platform to achieve economic security, incentivize early adoption, and normalize exchange rates.\\n\\n**Akash Supermini**\\n\\nAkash also develops [**Supermini**](https://akash.network/supermini/)**, a powerful portable supercomputer**. Supermini enables individuals to become cloud providers on Akash from their home or office. Supermini owners can deploy applications, run a machine learning workload, and offer Supermini\u2019s unused compute on Akash to earn income.\\n\\nMore than ever, we need a decentralized, permissionless, and open cloud where people become participants, and not just users.\\n\\nBuilt on blockchain technology, Supercloud and Supermini also provide organizations and individuals sovereignty and privacy over their data.\\n\\n#### **Competitive Advantage**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n**How Akash Differs from Cloud Service Providers**\\n\\nThrough Akash\u2019s platform, developers can easily and securely access cloud compute at 10x lower cost than the current market providers (AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure, and Alibaba Cloud).\\n\\n- Efficient\\n\\n  - Pay for what you need, when you need it\\n  - Sell excess capacity you are not using\\n\\n- Compatible\\n\\n  - Easy to adopt (built for mainstream)\\n  - No vendor lock-ins\\n  - Compatible with existing cloud applications\\n\\n- Price Advantage\\n\\n  - 10X less than market offerings for developers\\n  - Up to 4x more for providers of compute\\n\\n- Secure\\n\\n  - Encryption at rest, run time, transit\\n  - Web of trust model (PGP) through accreditation\\n  - Optimized for node failure\\n\\n**How Akash Differs from Decentralized Cloud Companies**\\n\\nExisting blockchain projects have high friction points for adoption without advantages such as cost. They also serve a small or unknown market size.\\n\\n- **Golem** is a supercomputer with on-chain computing. Their solution serves a small addressable market, requires users to learn a new language, and does not have cost advantages.\\n- **Dfinity** is focused on smart contracts, which have limitations.\\n- **Blockstack** is built on top of Bitcoin and is not suitable for compute.\\n\\nAkash's technology is developed to address general compute and broader market use cases. The platform is positioned to serve the mainstream market, and addresses growing needs in the machine learning market. If an application runs on existing cloud service providers like AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure, it can run on Akash.\\n\\n#### **Primary Customers**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nAkash is currently focused on serving high-growth companies with data intensive workloads, and will expand to support lower growth organizations with a diverse set of workloads. The company\u2019s primary market is growth stage machine learning organizations, including artificial intelligence and deep learning companies.\\n\\nEscalating cloud costs from the major cloud service providers make running machine learning, deep learning, and artificial intelligence workloads increasingly expensive and cost-prohibitive. Cloud costs have a compounding annual growth rate of 43.6% through 2022, and [with 25% of machine learning/AI companies\u2019 revenues spent on cloud resources](https://akash.network/blog/reducing-cloud-costs-for-machine-learning/), managing costs is critical to growth.\\n\\nDuring the global pandemic, [these workloads have become increasingly expensive and cost-prohibitive](https://akash.network/blog/battling-covid-19-with-blockchain-ai-and-cloud-computing/) for startups, academic institutions, researchers, and clinicians who need to accelerate critical research to fight COVID-19, and develop life-saving treatments.\\n\\n10x lower in cost, Akash Supercloud is a faster, more secure, and lower cost alternative to cloud service providers.\\n\\n#### **Akash Token (AKT) Economics**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922431-screen-shot-2020-07-07-at-3-01-05-pm.png)\\n\\n[Akash\u2019s economic model](https://akash.network/blog/an-evolution-of-akash-network-token-economics/) uses a native currency, Akash Token (AKT) to solve for volatility (one of the biggest challenges for adoption in crypto), while ensuring economic security of the platform\u2019s public blockchain. The model bootstraps early supply by subsidizing using inflation (i.e., borrowing from the future), and activates an incentive structure that not only fairly distributes, but will unlock network effects to accelerate growth.\\n\\nThe [Akash Token (AKT)](https://akash.network/blog/category/token-economics/) is a utility token that performs three main functions: Resolve, Reward, and Reserve.\\n\\n**Resolve**\\n\\nAkash relies on a blockchain where a set of validators vote on proposals. Each proposal is weighed by the proposer\u2019s voting power, which is the total tokens they staked and the tokens bonded to them (stakers can delegate voting power to validators).\\n\\n**Reward**\\n\\nProviders on Akash stake tokens to subsidize operating and capital expenditures. Stakers are rewarded proportional to the number of tokens staked, the length of lockup time, and the overall tokens staked in the system. Lock up times can vary anywhere from one month to one year. Flexibility in lockup encourages stakers that stake for shorter periods (bear markets), in a self-adjusting inflationary system that is designed to optimize for lower price pressure during bear markets.\\n\\n**Reserve**\\n\\nFees on Akash can be settled using a multitude of currencies, however, the market order book uses Akash Token (AKT) as the reserve currency of the ecosystem. AKT provides a novel settlement option to lock in an exchange rate between AKT and the settlement currency. This way, providers and tenants are protected from the price volatility of AKT expected to result from its low liquidity. This paper also presents a method \u201cTransaction Ordering using Consensus Weighted Median\u201d to establish exchange rates without the need for an oracle.\\n\\n#### **Founders**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nAkash was founded by Greg Osuri and Adam Bozanich, globally recognized open source developers and among the top 20 programmers worldwide for authoring open-source libraries adopted by organizations including Ubuntu, HashiCorp, and Kubernetes. They lead [a team](https://akash.network/about/) of renowned open source and blockchain developers, and seasoned experts from leading technology platform companies.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922455-greg-osuri-akash-1024x768.jpg)\\n\\n**Greg Osuri, CEO**\\n\\nPrior to Akash, Greg built information technology (IT)&nbsp; infrastructure at IBM early in his career and founded AngelHack, the world\u2019s largest hackathon organization with over 150,000 developers across 50 cities worldwide.\\n\\nA renowned open source, distributed systems, and blockchain developer and applied economist, Greg\u2019s libraries regularly trend among top 5 (globally) in the Golang space, which are open sourced on GitHub. He is the author of UI Progress and Amazon RDS Cookbook -- widely used DevOps toolkits with more than 25 million downloads.\\n\\nGreg has helped launch multiple developer companies including Firebase (acquired by Google). He is a frequently featured speaker, and was instrumental in the passing of California\u2019s first Blockchain law, providing the first expert-witness testimony at the Senate.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922471-adambozanovichakash.jpg)\\n\\n**Adam Bozanich, CTO**\\n\\nPrior to Akash, Adam led software development at WeWork, Symantec, One King\u2019s Lane, and Marketron. Before that, he worked as an engineer and developer for music monetization platform Topspin, which was acquired by Apple in 2014 following an initial acquisition by Beats.\\n\\nAdam holds a U.S. patent for the invention of network protocol fuzzing, a security analysis methodology that dynamically tests a system\u2019s resilience to protocol abuse.\\n\\n#### **Investors**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nAkash partners with thought leaders and global organizations across technology and venture capital to materialize the vision of The Unstoppable Cloud.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922482-investors-1024x167.jpg)\\n\\n#### **Partners**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nThe Unstoppable Cloud movement enables the creators of the future to build with more freedom, and to give people control over their data.\\n\\nThe principle behind The Unstoppable Cloud is fully sovereign cloud infrastructure that cannot be challenged or taken down by adversaries and hackers.\\n\\nAkash partners with organizations who share a vision for an open, safe, and unstoppable cloud that unlocks capabilities for the data-driven technologies of the future.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922489-partners-copy-1024x298.jpg)\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;A Primer on the First Decentralized Cloud Marketplace&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;The Market Landscape for Cloud
