Computing&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-07-07T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Insights&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Insights&quot;],[0,&quot;Product&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Maly Ly&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.N8JOnos-.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1992],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1492],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/why-akash-network-a-primer-on-the-first-decentralized-cloud-marketplace/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;partner-profile-trg-capital/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;partner-profile-trg-capital&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\nAs a former basketball coach, you look at people to fulfill the offense and defense you\u2019re trying to play - can the people you select on your roster execute this plan? Even though I left the basketball world four years ago, it is still a part of me: the way I see people, how teams operate, and how they can work together to achieve success.\\n\\n**\\\\- Etienne vantKruys, Founder &amp; Director of TRG Capital**\\n\\nWe\u2019re excited to announce TRG Capital as a partner, joining our vision for the future of an open, sovereign, and unstoppable cloud.\\n\\nRecently, we connected with founder and director of TRG Capital, Etienne vantKruys, to dive deeper into his background and his vigilance on due diligence ( he _really_ wants to make sure you triple-check your info), and to glean his words of wisdom.\\n\\nEtienne has been passionately demystifying the world of crypto with an uncanny prowess for due diligence, uncovering the true value of companies. With his extensive experience, TRG Capital evolved and emerged into what it is today: a force of pragmatism and support, and a partner that can uncover the intricacies of what makes a team successful.\\n\\n#### **Q&amp;A with Etienne vantKruys of TRG Capital**\\n\\n**How did you start TRG Capital?**  \\n\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\n\\nIt was a small build up - I was a stock trader before I got into crypto, and amidst the financial crisis I started to wonder: What _really_ is money? What _really_ is the economy? What _really_ is finance?\\n\\nAs I began digging through these questions, I discovered Bitcoin, and shortly after, the whole industry of madness began kicking off in 2016 and 2017. I got a group together to form, what was then called, Token Research Group. Prior to this, I was trading stocks and was primarily a short seller looking into biotech, to give you perspective on where that hardcore investing approach came from.\\n\\nBasically, what a short seller does is that they look for the problems in your company. You want to burst that bubble and examine these startups to filter out the nonsense, the hype, and find its actual value.\\n\\nWe set out to have this product of writing research reports so that we could sell that to funds and fund managers. It\u2019s all about due diligence and we wanted to get to the bottom of what it is that\u2019s really there in these nice, flashy websites and pitch decks.\\n\\nThat\u2019s how we began, and we\u2019d start investing along, but then in 2018 the whole market changed.\\n\\nWe pivoted, and instead of just doing the research, we took our gains and transitioned to doing the investments ourselves, and that\u2019s where TRG Capital came along - that\u2019s its birth and evolution.\\n\\n**What makes TRG Capital different from other validators?**  \\n\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\n\\nOur emphasis on pragmatism. I meet so many entrepreneurs and developers with a strong mindset for product, but oftentimes what\u2019s lacking is an operational execution plan.\\n\\nIt\u2019s imperative to distill it down to what it is that you're building - your vision and whatever is in your white paper among all those mathematical equations - and identify the clear essence of: Who is going to use this, how do I get this to market, and what problem is this solving?\\n\\nI find that many developers and entrepreneurs somehow just breeze past these simple questions. I think to myself, \u201cThis sounds great and all, but if my mom can\u2019t use it, this isn\u2019t going to find any adoption.\u201d Reason being, you aren\u2019t building it for your developer friends. If you want adoption, it needs to be frankly, for a 5 year old. Sometimes I would look at projects and they want me to install a wallet, write 200 lines of code, and I just think, \u201cThat\u2019s cute, but you\u2019re not ready\u201d.\\n\\nProviding that mirror to these entrepreneurs and developers, it\u2019s almost like I\u2019m a bit like a business coach or strategic advisor. We\u2019re not just passive checkwriters, we aim to add something extra, beyond validation. We\u2019re really down there, on the ground and dirt, as we build value and scale the company alongside you by running validator infrastructure or key industry connections.\\n\\n**How do you choose what projects to work with?**  \\n\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\n\\nYou filter, because once you add the word \u201cCapital\u201d to your Linkedin profile, you get bombarded with all kinds of offers and pitch decks. You have to be sure before you evangelize and put this out to 6 billion people to use it, so first and foremost, I focus on the people, secondly is product, and third is execution.\\n\\nAs a former basketball coach, you look at people to fulfill the offense and defense you\u2019re trying to play - can the people you select on your roster execute this plan? Even though I left the basketball world four years ago, it is still a part of me: the way I see people, how teams operate, and how they can work together to achieve success.\\n\\nI first met Greg last year in San Francisco during SF Launch Week in October of 2019, and got introduced by Brian of Kava. To my surprise, Boz was also there, whom I\u2019d already met in 2018 when he was still at Refereum. From there, I realized what a great team of people they were, and as Brian vouched for him, I began to do some digging into the final 2 qualities that I look for.\\n\\nLooking at Kava, and now Akash, I\u2019m seeing similar characteristics of both a strong team and product that makes me believe they can actually pull it off. We\u2019ll be rooting for that, we\u2019ll be putting our shoulders down, down in the mud, to take this forward.\\n\\n**What are current projects you\u2019re working on?**  \\n\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\n\\nWithout revealing my hidden gems\u2026 Kava, Jarvis, Orion, Ava Labs, StakerDAO, Ferrum, Cere, and we\u2019re looking into a couple of ecosystem startups.\\n\\n**What new developments in the ecosystem are you excited about?**  \\n\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\n\\nGoing back to my top criteria of great people, the addition of Jack Zampolin has really stood out. As a former coach I will tell you,\u201cYou can\u2019t win the Kentucky Derby with donkeys\u201d. If you want to win the Kentucky derby, you need quality horses, and with Jack joining, I think it will really compliment Boz, Greg, and everyone else on the team to move forward and execute the plan.\\n\\nOne thing that stuck out for me about Jack is his ability to onboard developers and amass communities of people to build and plug in. With blockchain, we\u2019re adding another trust layer on top of the internet and the way we transact value globally. You need the builders for that, and Jack is that guy that really compliments the vision that Greg set out. You need those types of people on your team who can pull them in, excite them, show them the win-win, and incentivize them to be a part of the Akash ecosystem.\\n\\nSecondly, I\u2019ve been impressed by Akash\u2019s ability to stay true and disciplined with the on-schedule launches of the product and platform.\\n\\n**What are your future plans?**  \\n\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\n\\nTo be a part of this global blockchain evolution. We haven\u2019t even seen 1% of its potential. I\u2019ll be here backing and supporting revolutionary developers and disruptive entrepreneurs as we chip away piece by piece at this global juggernaut monster. Part of that is being in SF for Akash\u2019s launch.\\n\\n**What advice would you give to someone interested in entering blockchain?**  \\n\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\n\\n1\\\\. Everything that\u2019s thrown at you: double check the info, triple check it even.\\n\\n2\\\\. Dare to dream, then go build it.\\n\\n3\\\\. Be more bold. It\u2019s not like we\u2019re blowing up the planet, we\u2019re just building. So it doesn\u2019t hurt to be more aggressive in what you\u2019re trying to achieve. It doesn't have to be something you start thinking about only when you pass the age of 35.\\n\\nBut to reiterate\u2026 Triple check the info! You can even put it on a stamp that reads, \u201cTriple check the info!\u201d\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Partner Profile: TRG Capital&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;As a former basketball coach, you look at people to fulfill the offense and defense you\u2019re trying to play - can the people you select on your roster execute this plan? Even though I left the basketball world four years ago, it is still a part of me the way I see people, how teams operate, and how they can work together to achieve success.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-07-02T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Partners&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Partners&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Olive Kimoto&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.BSjvALUF.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1694],&quot;height&quot;:[0,828],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/partner-profile-trg-capital/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-network-launch-chinese-community/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-network-launch-chinese-community&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\nAt Akash Network, our _second largest audience is our Chinese audience_, and Chinese visitors make up _the second largest group of visitors to our website and communities_. We\u2019re also fortunate to have a number of Chinese investors and partners, including [Outpost Capital](https://outpostvc.com/), [Hone Capital](http://honecap.com/), [Forbole](https://www.forbole.com/), and [Steven Fan](https://www.linkedin.com/in/stevenweifan/) of Tencent.\\n\\n**Today, we\u2019re excited to launch the Akash Network Chinese Community, and expand our vision globally for the world\u2019s first decentralized cloud marketplace.**\\n\\nWe welcome Chinese audiences around the world to learn more about Akash Network and Akash Token (AKT) by visiting our Chinese [website](https://akash.network/about/?lang=zh-hans) and WeChat (through the QR code below).\\n\\n#### **The World\u2019s First Decentralized Cloud Marketplace**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nAs more of our lives are moving online to the cloud, there is increased consumer demand for throughput and content, high adoption of smartphones, rapid development of web applications, and higher costs of server management.\\n\\nThis accelerating demand is fueling the growth of the cloud services industry, which is expected to exceed $210 billion by 2022. The leading centralized cloud service providers\u2013Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure, and Alibaba Cloud\u2013dominate the market with 71% market share.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922423-screen-shot-2020-06-29-at-2-06-35-pm-1024x525.png)\\n\\nIn an increasingly competitive global market, companies have few alternatives for more flexible, faster, and lower cost cloud services.\\n\\nAkash Network is the world\u2019s first decentralized cloud computing marketplace, leveraging 85% of underutilized cloud capacity in 8.4 million data centers, and in individual servers.\\n\\nAkash enables anyone to safely buy and sell unused cloud compute. Through Akash\u2019s platform, companies get cloud compute for 10x less cost than the market, and providers earn up to 4x more.\\n\\nThe platform achieves these benefits by integrating advanced containerization technology with [a unique staking mode](https://akash.network/blog/an-evolution-of-akash-network-token-economics/)l to accelerate adoption, [built on Tendermint and Cosmos](https://akash.network/blog/decentralized-serverless-computing-coming-to-cosmos/). The [Akash Token (AKT)](https://akash.network/blog/the-economics-of-akash-network-and-token/) is a utility token used in the platform to achieve economic security, incentivize early adoption, and normalize exchange rates.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922443-superminiheaderx2-1024x1024.jpg)\\n\\n#### **Technology Progression**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n**Akash Supercloud Platform**\\n\\nAkash is currently running [The Akashian Challenge](https://akash.network/challenge/), our incentivized testnet. **As the second largest testnet in the Cosmos ecosystem since Game of Stakes, and the second largest active testnet after Ethereum 2.0**, The Akashian Challenge currently has 106 active Challengers from around the world, including Chinese teams, competing for 64 validator positions at mainnet.\\n\\nParticipants are able to explore different aspects of our decentralized cloud computing platform. Phase 2 of the competition is currently underway. The Akashian Challenge enables us to strengthen the scalability, security, and usability of our platform, as we progress to the Akash mainnet launch later in July.\\n\\n**Akash Supermini**\\n\\nWe also sold out of pre-orders for the first production run of our hardware product, [Supermini portable supercomputer](https://akash.network/supermini/), launching in late 2020. We developed Supermini to give people sovereignty and privacy over their data, and to become participants of the cloud.\\n\\nOwners will be able to run server apps and machine learning workloads, and offer their Supermini\u2019s unused compute on Akash to earn Akash Token (AKT).\\n\\nSupermini leverages Akash\u2019s proprietary cloud and blockchain technologies, developed over four years.\\n\\nWe\u2019re fortunate to have the support of our Akashian Challengers and new Supermini owners as we materialize the future of the cloud, and the internet.\\n\\n#### **Join Our Chinese Community Now**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nJoin the Akash Chinese WeChat community and our [Telegram](https://t.me/AkashNW) to help us build the decentralized future of the Internet!\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922460-image-13.png)\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Network Launches Chinese Community!&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;At Akash Network, our second largest audience is our Chinese audience, and Chinese visitors make up the second largest group of visitors to our website and communities. We\u2019re also fortunate to have a number of Chinese investors and partners, including Outpost Capital, Hone Capital, Forbole, and Steven Fan of Tencent.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-06-30T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;News&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;News&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Michael Gushansky&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.DiO4rrq2.jpg&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1243],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1242],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;jpg&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-network-launch-chinese-community/banner-image.jpg&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;the-akashian-challenge-phase-2-is-live/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;the-akashian-challenge-phase-2-is-live&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\n**Last week, we shared** [**an overview of The Akashian Challenge Phase 2**](https://akash.network/blog/announcing-the-akashian-challenge-phase-2/)**, including the Challenge Schedule and Rewards Schedule. Phase 2 will encompass 3 weeks of challenges, 600,000 AKT rewards, and special prizes.**\\n\\n**Today, we\u2019re excited to launch The Akashian Challenge Phase 2 Week 1: Capture the Orders, at 1600 UTC / 9:00AM PST.**\\n\\nThe Akashian Challenge Phase 2 will introduce, demonstrate, and test the decentralized exchange features of Akash. This decentralized exchange (DEX) is different from others in the cryptocurrency world, which are focused on settling trades; the Akash DEX is designed to settle requests for application deployments.\\n\\nWeekly challenges will focus on provider and tenant DEX operations--creating orders, bidding, handling leases--while long-running challenges will focus on supporting a healthy network foundation.\\n\\n[**Get Started Now**](https://akash.network/docs/akashian/phase2)\\n\\n##### **Weekly 1: Capture the Orders**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nThe Akashian Challenge: Phase 2 will encompass three weeks of challenges. Weekly challenges focus on different aspects of network functionality each week. These challenges are designed to test specific features of the DEX.\\n\\nThe Akashian Challenge team will be creating orders continuously. The Week 1 challenge asks users to explore how to operate as a provider by finding and bidding on leases. This can be accomplished by running the provider daemon, using \\\\`akashctl\\\\` and some \\\\`bash\\\\` scripting, or by building custom tooling.\\n\\n**Reward Opportunities:**\\n\\n- Validators whose providers have won the most number of leases.\\n- Validators whose providers have placed the most number of bids.\\n- Bonus Category: Blog post detailing how winning provider bids works in the Akash system, and custom code to do so.\\n\\n##### **Long-Running Challenges**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nLong-running challenges are active for the entire Akashian Challenge. They\u2019re designed to encourage participation, and present an opportunity for us to observe longer term behaviors of the network.\\n\\nThese long-running challenges include the following, [detailed in last week\u2019s Phase 2 blog](https://akash.network/blog/announcing-the-akashian-challenge-phase-2/):\\n\\n- Validator Architecture and Monitoring\\n- Network Infrastructure Support\\n\\n##### **Ready to Get Started?**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n1.  **Review the** [**Challenge Schedule**](https://akash.network/challenge/phase2/schedule)\\n2.  **Review the** [**Rewards Schedule**](https://akash.network/challenge/phase2/rewards)\\n3.  [**Get Started Now**](https://akash.network/docs/akashian/phase2)\\n\\n##### **Akash Block Explorers**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nCheck out Vitwit's and The Big Dipper's block explorers to track our progress:\\n\\n- [Aneka Block Explorer](https://akash.aneka.io/)\\n- [The Big Dipper: Akash Block Explorer](https://testnet.akash.bigdipper.live/)\\n\\n##### **Don\u2019t Miss Critical Updates**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nJoin [our Telegram](https://t.me/AkashNW) and [Riot](https://riot.im/app/#/room/#akashnet:matrix.org) to get the latest news, giveaways, and special invitations to events and AMAs!\\n\\n[**Get Started Now**](https://akash.network/docs/akashian/phase2)\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;The Akashian Challenge Phase 2 is LIVE!&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Last week, we shared an overview of The Akashian Challenge Phase 2, including the Challenge Schedule and Rewards Schedule. Phase 2 will encompass 3 weeks of challenges, 600,000 AKT rewards, and special prizes.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-06-29T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Testnets&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Testnets&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Maly Ly&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.CS9oZ_pU.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,2000],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1500],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/the-akashian-challenge-phase-2-is-live/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;announcing-the-akashian-challenge-phase-2/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;announcing-the-akashian-challenge-phase-2&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\n**After much anticipation, we\u2019re excited to announce THE SHIP HAS LANDED for The Akashian Challenge Phase 2: DEX Operations!**\\n\\nAs a decentralized system, and the world\u2019s first distributed cloud computing marketplace, we\u2019re leveraging The Akashian Challenge incentivized testnet to gather data, identify critical issues, and ensure our network\u2019s scalability, security, and usability for a strong mainnet.\\n\\n**With 3,000,000 AKT in rewards, Supermini prizes, and 106 validators vying for 64 validator spots at Mainnet,** Challengers will need to leverage their technical and social prowess to maneuver their way to victory. Through The Akashian Challenge, participants are able to explore different aspects of our decentralized cloud computing platform.\\n\\n[**Get Started Now**](https://akash.network/docs/akashian/phase2)\\n\\n### **Phase 1 Recap**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nIn Phase 1, The Akashian Challenge became the second largest testnet in the Cosmos Hub since the Game of Stakes, and is currently the second largest testnet after Ethereum 2.0.\\n\\nWe tested governance and voting, and gained insights on network upgrades that strengthened our platform. Our testnet also withstood an AWS outage that brought down the centralized cloud (and internet), and weathered a [massive zero fee transaction attack](https://medium.com/@novysf/the-outcome-from-akash-testnet-zero-fee-transaction-attack-5fd4aaa68d97).\\n\\nWe were elated to see all the collaboration that occurred in Phase 1, and we\u2019re grateful to participants for helping us build a healthy and vital community for growth.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922441-akash-v6-1-1024x768.png)\\n\\n### **Phase 2: DEX Operations**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n**The Akashian Challenge Phase 2: DEX Operations will launch next Monday, June 29th at 1600 UTC / 9:00AM PST. Phase 2 will encompass three weeks of challenges.**\\n\\n**Check out our** [**Phase 2 Challenge Schedule**](https://akash.network/challenge/phase2/schedule) **and** [**Phase 2 Rewards Schedule**](https://akash.network/challenge/phase2/rewards) **to plan your strategy!**\\n\\nTo incentivize participants we\u2019ve allocated 600,000 AKT for Phase 2 rewards.\\n\\nThe Akashian Challenge Phase 2 will introduce, demonstrate, and test the decentralized exchange features of Akash. This decentralized exchange (DEX) is different from others in the cryptocurrency world, which are focused on settling trades; the Akash DEX is designed to settle requests for application deployments.\\n\\nAs this phase of the competition is primarily focused on the on-chain code, we won\u2019t be running the network in a decentralized fashion.\\n\\nWeekly challenges will focus on provider and tenant DEX operations--creating orders, bidding, handling leases--, while long-running challenges will focus on supporting a healthy network foundation.\\n\\n###\\n\\n**Long-Running Challenges**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nLong-running challenges are active for the entire Akashian Challenge. They\u2019re designed to encourage participation, and present an opportunity for us to observe longer term behaviors of the network.\\n\\nThese long-running challenges include the following, detailed below:\\n\\n- Validator Architecture and Monitoring\\n- Network Infrastructure Support\\n\\n###\\n\\n**Validator Architecture and Monitoring**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nThe process of operating a validator is varied and there are [many](https://blog.polychainlabs.com/tendermint/2020/03/26/threshold-validator-for-tendermint.html) [possible](https://iqlusion.blog/a-look-inside-our-validator-architecture) [architectures](https://certus.one/sign-os) that can be used.\\n\\nThe choice of architecture depends primarily on the security model the validator operator chooses to protect against. Whatever architecture is chosen, monitoring and alerting tooling is necessary to help the validator maintain uptime and respond to on-chain events like proposals, slashing events, delegations, etc.\\n\\nTeams will earn rewards for:\\n\\n- Writing blog posts detailing their validator setup with supporting code/configuration\\n- Writing blog posts detailing their monitoring infrastructure with supporting code/configuration\\n- Making PRs that add additional prometheus metrics to the [x/deployment](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/tree/master/x/deployment), [x/market](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/tree/master/x/market) or [x/provider](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/tree/master/x/provider) modules facilitating network monitoring.\\n\\n###\\n\\n**Network Infrastructure Support**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nIn order to support the network, a validator needs to run full nodes and sentries. This long running challenge will reward validators who run seed nodes with publicly available P2P endpoints or full nodes/sentries with publicly available RPC/p2p ports.\\n\\nNote that running [tenderseed instances](https://gitlab.com/polychainlabs/tenderseed) is allowed/encouraged. Nodes must be reachable and posted in the [ovrclk/net](https://github.com/ovrclk/net) repository to be eligible for this reward.\\n\\n###\\n\\n**Weekly Challenges**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nThe Akashian Challenge: Phase 2 will encompass three weeks of challenges. Weekly challenges focus on different aspects of network functionality each week. These challenges are designed to test specific features of the DEX.\\n\\n**Week 1: Capture the Orders**\\n\\nThe Akashian Challenge team will be creating orders continuously. The Week 1 challenge asks users to explore how to operate as a provider by finding and bidding on leases. This can be accomplished by running the provider daemon, using \\\\`akashctl\\\\` and some \\\\`bash\\\\` scripting, or by building custom tooling.\\n\\n**Reward Opportunities:**\\n\\n- Validators whose providers have won the most number of leases.\\n- Validators whose providers have placed the most number of bids.\\n- Bonus Category: Blog post detailing how winning provider bids works in the Akash system, and custom code to do so.\\n\\n**Week 2: Chaos is a Ladder**\\n\\nWeek 2 is a test for throughput of the DEX. This will allow our team to identify performance bottlenecks in our code under realistic network conditions. The challenge builds on users' provider experience from the Week 1: Capture the Orders challenge and encourages them to explore how to operate as a tenant on the network.\\n\\n**Reward Opportunities:**\\n\\n- **Provider: Total Lease-Hours per Provider**: Points awarded to the provider that accumulates the greatest total number of lease-blocks. A lease block is an open lease for one block - if a provider has two leases during one block it is counted as two lease-blocks.\\n\\n- **Provider: Total Lease Count**: Points awarded to the provider that accumulates the greatest total number total leases.\\n\\n- **Tenant: Total Lease-Hours:** Points awarded to the tenant that accumulates the greatest total number of lease-blocks. A lease block is an open lease for one block - if a tenant has two leases during one block it is counted as two lease-blocks.\\n\\n- **Tenant: Total Lease Count**: Points awarded to the tenant that accumulates the greatest total number total leases.\\n\\n**Week 3: Cast a Wide Net**\\n\\nThe Week 3 challenge encompasses more throughput DEX testing, and encourages participants to explore large-scale deployment options. During this time, the provider daemon will be in Beta, in preparation for Phase 3.\\n\\n**Reward Opportunities:**\\n\\n- **Tenant: deployment with the largest number of individual providers:** Tenants can create deployments that have many orders - who can make a deployment that is fulfilled by the highest number of individual providers?\\n- **Provider: largest number of concurrent leases:** Providers may have more than one active lease at any given time. Award tokens to the provider that has the most active leases at one time over the period of the challenge.\\n\\n###\\n\\n**Phase 2 Rewards**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nYou can check out the [**Phase 2 Rewards Schedule**](https://akash.network/challenge/phase2/rewards) for a detailed schedule of reward opportunities. A total of **600,000 AKT** is allocated for Phase 2 Rewards that include:\\n\\n1.  **One-Off Challenges**\\n2.  **Phase Completion**\\n3.  **Long Running Challenges**\\n4.  **Bi-Weekly Winners**\\n5.  **Bonus Challenges**\\n\\n###\\n\\n**Ready to Get Started?**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n1.  **Review the** [**Challenge Schedule**](https://akash.network/challenge/phase2/schedule)\\n2.  **Review the** [**Rewards Schedule**](https://akash.network/challenge/phase2/rewards)\\n3.  **Check out the** [**Phase 2 Docs**](https://akash.network/docs/akashian/phase2)\\n4.  **Plan for launch next Monday, June 29th at 1600 UTC / 9:00 AM PST**\\n\\n###\\n\\n**Don\u2019t Miss Critical Updates**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nJoin [our Telegram](https://t.me/AkashNW) and [Riot](https://riot.im/app/#/room/#akashnet:matrix.org) to get the latest news, giveaways, and special invitations to events and AMAs!\\n\\n[**Get Started Now**](https://akash.network/docs/akashian/phase2)\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Announcing The Akashian Challenge: Phase 2&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;After much anticipation, we\u2019re excited to announce THE SHIP HAS LANDED for The Akashian Challenge Phase 2 DEX Operations! As a decentralized system, and the world\u2019s first distributed cloud computing marketplace, we\u2019re leveraging The Akashian Challenge incentivized testnet to gather data, identify critical issues, and ensure our network\u2019s scalability, security, and usability for a strong mainnet. With 3,000,000 AKT in rewards, Supermini prizes, and 106 validators vying for 64 validator spots at Mainnet, Challengers will need to leverage their technical and social prowess to maneuver their way to victory.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-06-25T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Testnets&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Testnets&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Maly Ly&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.DVbTIUmf.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,660],&quot;height&quot;:[0,480],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/announcing-the-akashian-challenge-phase-2/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-network-announces-partnership-with-lunie-wallett/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-network-announces-partnership-with-lunie-wallett&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\n_We\u2019re very excited to have Akash as integration partners. We are fans of how Akash\u2019s \u201cAkashian\u201d testnet is progressing thus far,_  \\n*and are eager for their mainnet launch.*&nbsp;  \\n**\\\\- Jordan Bibla, CEO**\\n\\nToday, we\u2019re excited to announce an integration and partnership with Lunie Wallet. Lunie is a non-custodial staking tool that allows users to safely store, manage and stake crypto assets in Proof of Stake (PoS) networks.\\n\\nWe\u2019ve been admirers of Lunie\u2019s user experience, ease of set-up, and deep integration with Cosmos validators. As a trusted wallet in the Cosmos ecosystem, Lunie provides a great user interface to simplify delegation, voting, and staking.\\n\\nWith a reputable and high integrity team led by CEO Jordan Bibla, Lunie is a company we\u2019d wanted to partner with to enable more users to participate in the economic security of Akash\u2019s blockchain. Through Lunie, users can learn more about our validators and delegate their tokens. Lunie also allows our validators to earn community trust, and connect with delegators.\\n\\nThrough this partnership, Lunie will provide a range of functions for Akash Token (AKT) via Lunie browser, Lunie iOS/Android, Lunie browser extension, and Ledger Nano S, and Ledger Nano X with a cable (no bluetooth yet) and the Cosmos Ledger app:\\n\\n##### \u25cf Wallet&nbsp;\\n\\n- Create address\\n- Restore from seed phrase\\n- Send tokens\\n- Check balance and rewards\\n- View transaction history\\n\\n##### \u25cf Staking&nbsp;\\n\\n- View Akash validator list in Lunie\\n- View Akash Network portfolio\\n- Stake tokens\\n- Unstake and restake tokens\\n- Claim rewards\\n\\n##### \u25cf Governance&nbsp;\\n\\n- Create a proposal\\n- Deposit on a proposal\\n- Vote on a proposal\\n- View current and past proposals\\n\\n##### \u25cf Block explorer&nbsp;\\n\\n- View user generated transactions per block\\n\\n**You can learn more in** [**Lunie\u2019s Akash Staking Guide**](http://help.lunie.io/en/articles/4154821-lunie-staking-guide-akash)**.**\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Network Announces Integration Partnership with Lunie Wallet&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;We\u2019re very excited to have Akash as integration partners. Last week, we concluded Phase 1 of The Akashian Challenge, our incentivized testnet, with 99 active validators from around the world, and moved closer to the launch of our mainnet.  \\n  \\nWe also _sold out_ of pre-orders for the first production run of our Supermini portable supercomputers, launching later this year.  \\n  \\nWe\u2019re fortunate to have the support of our Akashian Challengers and new Supermini owners as we materialize the future of the cloud, and the internet. What I\u2019m most excited about is that we\u2019re building a healthy and vital community for the world\u2019s first decentralized cloud computing marketplace.  \\n  \\nStay tuned for the launch of The Akashian Challenge: Phase 2 this month.\\n\\n###   \\n**The Akashian Challenge: Phase 1 Completion**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922425-tac-phase-1-complete-banner-1-1024x768.png)\\n\\nLast week, we completed Phase 1 of The Akashian Challenge, our incentivized testnet. The results?\\n\\n*   **211 Teams**\\n    \\n*   **99 Active Validators (for 64 spots at Mainnet)**\\n    \\n*   **#2 Largest Testnet in the Cosmos Hub (after Game of Stakes)**\\n    \\n*   **#2 Largest Testnet after Ethereum 2.0**\\n    \\n\\nDuring Phase 1, our testnet withstood an AWS outage that brought down the centralized cloud (and internet). It also weathered [a massive zero fee transaction attack](https://medium.com/@novysf/the-outcome-from-akash-testnet-zero-fee-transaction-attack-5fd4aaa68d97). Both the AWS outage and the attack showcased the resilience of our decentralized platform.&nbsp;  \\n  \\nNext week, we\u2019ll be sharing information about Phase 2, and CEO Greg Osuri alongside Pylon\u2019s Jack Zampoline will host a live stream with Phase 2 updates and surprise giveaways.  \\n  \\nTrack our progress on [Forbole\u2019s The Big Dipper](https://testnet.akash.bigdipper.live/) and [Vitwit\u2019s Aneka](https://akash.aneka.io/) block explorers.\\n\\n###   \\n**Superminis Sold Out!**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922452-this-one-1024x576.jpg)\\n\\nEarly in May, we launched a test online pre-order campaign for a limited production of 300 Superminis launching in late 2020. We\u2019re excited to report that **we sold out within 4 weeks of the campaign launch**.&nbsp;  \\n  \\nSupermini leverages Akash\u2019s proprietary cloud and blockchain technologies, developed over five years. The first 300 Superminis will be manufactured and launched in the United States with premium materials and powerful NVIDIA VOLTA processors.  \\n  \\nWith a Supermini, you can:\\n\\n*   become an Akash node with no technical knowledge or additional equipment\\n    \\n*   earn income by offering your Supermini\u2019s unused compute on Akash\u2019s peer-to-peer cloud computing marketplace\\n    \\n*   run machine learning workloads or server applications\\n    \\n*   own a private cloud for full control over your data\\n    \\n\\nYou can [learn more about Supermini](https://akash.network/supermini/) and add yourself to the waitlist.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922422-akashsuperminifrontside-1024x576.jpg)\\n\\n**.:** [**Join Supermini Waitlist Now**](https://akash.network/supermini) **:.**&nbsp;\\n\\n[Sign up for our newsletter](https://akash.network/) to get the latest updates first.&nbsp;  \\nJoin our [Telegram](https://t.me/AkashNW) channel and add us on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/akashnet_)\\\\--we\u2019d love to connect with you!&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;The Unstoppable Update: June 2020&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;We've had a month of milestones! Last week, we concluded Phase 1 of The Akashian Challenge, our incentivized testnet, with 99 active validators from around the world, and moved closer to the launch of our mainnet.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-06-11T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Greg Osuri&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.DXWutZc9.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1330],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1000],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/the-unstoppable-update-june-2020/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;the-akashian-challenge-phase-1-cygni-release-announcement/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;the-akashian-challenge-phase-1-cygni-release-announcement&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\n**Quick facts about The Akashian Challenge Incentivized Testnet:**\\n\\n- **211 Teams**\\n- **99 Active Validators (for 64 spots at Mainnet)**\\n- **#2 Largest Testnet in the Cosmos Hub (after Game of Stakes)**\\n- **#2 Largest Testnet after Ethereum 2.0**\\n\\nEarlier this week, we conducted a testnet reboot to Centauri 2 and resolved upgrade module issues in the last version of our testnet. We appreciate the feedback and participation of Akashians to help us build a stronger Mainnet.\\n\\n**Today, we announce Cygni, the fourth and final release in Phase 1 of The Akashian Challenge.** With 3,000,000 AKT in rewards, Supermini prizes, and 64 validator spots for Mainnet, the stakes are even higher going into Phase 2.\\n\\nThe goal of Cygni release is to ensure frictionless upgrades, and to identify and correct coordination gaps. The release will include updates to params and staking to reduce the voting power centralization of genesis validator(s).&nbsp; The Cygni Network Upgrade proposal **goes live for voting Friday May 29th at 1600 UTC**.\\n\\n**Please be sure** to check the schedule and details below before voting.\\n\\nConnect with us on [our Telegram](https://t.me/AkashNW), or [our Riot dev chat](https://riot.im/app/#/room/#akashnet:matrix.org), and visit [The Akashian Challenge website](https://akash.network/challenge/) for more information.\\n\\n**Go forth Akashians!**\\n\\n[**Get Started Now**](https://akash.network/docs/akashian/centauri-2)\\n\\n[**Learn More**](https://akash.network/challenge/)\\n\\n### **Cygni Release**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nCygni, the fourth and final release of The Akashian Challenge: Phase 1, launches on Friday May 29th at 1600 UTC with the proposal to upgrade the network to Cygni release. Akashian Challengers will have until Sunday May 31st 1600 UTC to vote on the proposal.\\n\\n**Please note that the release updates (changelog) and proposal details are** _**critical**_**\\\\--review the information before casting your vote.** If the community votes in favor of the proposal, Cygni Network Upgrade will occur on June 1st, 2020 1600 UTC.\\n\\nCygni Network Upgrade will use the updated testnet centauri-2 chain. If you have not upgraded your node to Centauri 2, please follow [these instructions](https://akash.network/docs/akashian/centauri-2) to do so.\\n\\n**You can view more details** _**tomorrow**_ **on** [**the Cygni release changelog**](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/releases/tag/v0.7.1).\\n\\n### **Cygni Rewards**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n_**\\\\*\\\\*\\\\*The Cygni Network Upgrade reward is only for on-time upgrade. The validators who are online at upgrade will receive the rewards.\\\\*\\\\*\\\\***_\\n\\nIn case of a failed upgrade, the reward will be distributed to validators who are part of making the chain (skip-upgrade). **There are a total of 250 AKT rewards for completion of Cygni.**\\n\\n### **Cygni Voting**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nAll validators and delegators will have 48 hours to cast their votes on the proposal\\n\\n- The voting starts on Friday, May 29th, 2020 1600 UTC\\n- The voting closes on Sunday, May 31st, 2020 1600 UTC.\\n- **Instructions to vote for the proposal will be** [**here**](https://akash.network/docs/akashian/centauri-2)**.**\\n\\n**There are a total of 250 AKT rewards for completion of Cygni.**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922423-screen-shot-2020-05-27-at-10-19-46-pm-1024x236.png)\\n\\n### **Track Our Progress with Block Explorers**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nCheck out the following block explorers to track our progress:\\n\\n- [Aneka: Akash Block Explorer](https://akash.aneka.io/)\\n- [The Big Dipper: Akash Block Explorer](https://testnet.akash.bigdipper.live/)\\n- [Look: Akash Block Explorer](https://look.ping.pub/#/validator)\\n\\nFor those who want to integrate their wallets, staking dashboards, or any other tools with Akash, we have the **open** [**RPC**](http://akash-rpc.vitwit.com:26657) **and** [**LCD**](http://akash-lcd.vitwit.com:1317) **available**.\\n\\n### **The Akashian Challenge Rewards**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nVisit [The Akashian Challenge website](https://akash.network/blog/the-akashian-challenge-incentivized-testnet-live/) for a detailed schedule of rewards. A total of **3 million AKT (3% of total AKT supply)** is allocated for rewards that include:\\n\\n1.  **64 Finalist Rewards**\\n2.  **One-Off Challenges**\\n3.  **Phase Completion**\\n4.  **Top 5, 10, 20 Finalists**\\n5.  **Bi-Weekly Winners**\\n6.  **Bonus Challenges**\\n\\n### **Get the Latest Updates**\\n\\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n[Join our Telegram](https://t.me/AkashNW) for the latest announcements and news. \\\\*_Please ensure you create a username and adjust your privacy settings to access our Telegram group._\\n\\n[Join our Friday, 5/22 4PM UTC: 9AM PST  \\n**Hosts**: Greg Osuri, Jack Zampolin  \\n**Duration**: 30 min  \\n**How to Access:** [Live stream link](https://www.crowdcast.io/e/the-akashian-challenge)\\n\\n**The Live Stream Event**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n**We\u2019re into the third week of The Akashian Challenge, our incentivized testnet. 211 teams and 91 active validators are vying for 3,000,000 AKT total rewards and 64 validator spots for Mainnet--the competition is heating up!**\\n\\nWith participants from around the world, The Akashian Challenge is set to be the largest testnet will share insights and updates, and present awards to participants. Get your burning Challenge questions answered during our Q&amp;A.\\n\\nAkashian Challengers who attend through the end of the live stream will get a chance to win the super limited and highly coveted Supermini, the most powerful portable supercomputer.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922422-akashsuperminifrontside-1024x576.jpg)\\n\\n**About Greg Osuri**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\nAs cofounder and CEO of Akash Network, Greg has transformed the future of cloud computing. It also weathered a massive zero fee transaction attack. You can check out an excellent [summary of the attack](https://medium.com/@novysf/the-outcome-from-akash-testnet-zero-fee-transaction-attack-5fd4aaa68d97) by Russian Validators Club.\\n\\nBoth the AWS outage and the attack showcased the resilience of our platform--The Akashian Challenge testnet kept going strong!\\n\\nWe also found a bug in the Sirius Network Upgrade last week, and we'll be sharing an update with you in the next few days.\\n\\nThis week, we announce Eridani, the third release in Phase 1 of The Akashian Challenge. With 3,000,000 AKT in rewards and 64 validator spots for Mainnet, the stakes are high!\\n\\nAs with Sirius release last week, the goal of Eridani release is to test governance and voting, and network upgrades. The Eridani Upgrade Proposal **goes live for voting Tuesday May 19th at 1600 UTC**.\\n\\nBe sure to check the schedule and details below, before voting.\\n\\nAnd don\u2019t miss **The Akashian Challenge Live Stream Event this Friday, May 22nd at 4pm UTC**! We\u2019ll be presenting awards and giving attendees a chance to win a [Supermini](https://akash.network/supermini/). Details below.\\n\\nFeel free to connect with us on [our Telegram](https://t.me/AkashNW), or [our Riot dev chat](https://riot.im/app/#/room/#akashnet:matrix.org), and visit [The Akashian Challenge website](https://akash.network/challenge/) for more information.\\n\\n**Go forth Akashians!**\\n\\n[**Get Started Now**](https://akash.network/docs/akashian/phase1#eridani-upgrade)  \\n[**Learn More**](https://akash.network/challenge/)\\n\\n#### **Eridani Release**\\n\\n\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\n\\nEridani, the third release of The Akashian Challenge: Phase 1, starts with the proposal to upgrade the network to Eridani release v0.6.5, which **goes live Tuesday May 19th at 1600 UTC. There are a total of 250 AKT rewards per validator for completion of Eridani.**\\n\\n**Please note that the release updates (changelog) and proposal details are** _**critical**_**\\\\--review the information before casting your vote.**\\n\\n**Proposal ID:** 3\\n\\n**Proposal Title:** [Eridani Network Upgrade release (v0.6.5)\\n\\n](https://github.com/ovrclk/akash/releases/tag/v0.6.5)**Description:\\\\*\\\\* Software upgrades are critical and determine the future of the network. In a PoS network, validators are responsible for deciding on upgrades. Every node operator needs to validate upgrades for the health of the ecosystem. Securing the network with decision-making is vital to the governance process.\\n\\n**Changelog:**\\n\\n- Mint more tokens to the founder's account\\n- Update slashing conditions\\n- Effectively remove the proposal voting process by reducing it to 1 second\\n\\n####\\n\\n**Eridani Voting**  \\n\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\n\\nAll validators and delegators will have 48 hours to cast their votes on the proposal\\n\\n- The voting starts on May 19th, 2020 1600 UTC\\n- The voting closes on May 21st, 2020 1600 UTC.\\n- **Instructions to vote for the proposal will be** [**here**](https://akash.network/docs/akashian/phase1#eridani-upgrade)**.**\\n\\n**There are a total of 250 AKT rewards for completion of Eridani. Follow the Eridani release guide for instructions.**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922422-screen-shot-2020-05-18-at-12-22-35-pm.png)\\n\\n####\\n\\n**Don\u2019t Miss the Live Stream this Friday**  \\n\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\n\\nDon\u2019t miss **The Akashian Challenge Live Stream Event this Friday, May 22nd at 4pm UTC**!\\n\\nHosted by Akash CEO Greg Osuri and Pylon Validator\u2019s Jack Zampolin, we\u2019ll be sharing updates, presenting awards, and giving attendees a chance to win a Supermini by the end of the stream.\\n\\n####\\n\\n**Rewards**  \\n\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\n\\nVisit [The Akashian Challenge website](https://akash.network/blog/the-akashian-challenge-incentivized-testnet-live/) for a detailed schedule of rewards. A total of **3 million AKT (3% of total AKT supply)** is allocated for rewards that include:\\n\\n1.  **64 Finalist Rewards**\\n2.  **One-Off Challenges**\\n3.  **Phase Completion**\\n4.  **Top 5, 10, 20 Finalists**\\n5.  **Bi-Weekly Winners**\\n6.  **Bonus Challenges**\\n\\n####\\n\\n**Get the Latest Updates**  \\n\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\n\\n[Join our Telegram](https://t.me/AkashNW) for the latest announcements and news. \\\\*_Please ensure you create a username and adjust your privacy settings to access our Telegram group._\\n\\n[Join our Riot](https://riot.im/app/#/room/#akashnet:matrix.org) dev chat for The Akashian Challenge support and information.\\n\\n[**Get Started Now**](https://akash.network/docs/akashian/phase1#eridani-upgrade)  \\n[**Learn More**](https://akash.network/challenge/)\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;The Akashian Challenge  Phase 1: Eridani Release Announcement&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;With 211 Teams and 91 Active Validators (for 64 spots at Mainnet), The Akashian Challenge is now the largest testnet in the Cosmos hub since Cosmos\u2019 Game of Stakes.Last week, our testnet withstood an AWS outage that brought down the centralized cloud (and internet). It also weathered a massive zero fee transaction attack.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-05-18T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Testnets&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Testnets&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Maly Ly&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.5zFQHMRj.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1200],&quot;height&quot;:[0,675],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/the-akashian-challenge-phase-1-eridani-release-announcement/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;the-unstoppable-update-may-2020/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;the-unstoppable-update-may-2020&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;We\u2019ve witnessed how our centralized systems, organizations, and governments were slow to coordinate and share life-saving information during the pandemic. We\u2019re seeing more of the ways we connect and collaborate move to the cloud.  \\n  \\nMore than ever, we need a decentralized, permissionless, and open cloud where people become _participants_, and not just users.&nbsp;  \\n  \\nAs we continue to maneuver through the new world order, our team is committed to creating a future where builders and participants of the internet have greater freedom to improve the human experience.  \\n  \\nThis month, our team took a big step towards realizing this future with the successful launch of The Akashian Challenge, our incentivized testnet, and our Supermini reservation campaign.  \\n  \\n  \\n**PRODUCT: THE AKASHIAN CHALLENGE**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922428-akashian-challenge-1024x768.png)\\n\\nThe Akashian Challenge testnet reached consensus immediately and went live at 1600 UTC. Since then, we\u2019ve released [Phase 1: Centauri](https://akash.network/blog/the-akashian-challenge-phase-1-centauri-release-update/) and [Sirius](https://akash.network/blog/the-akashian-challenge-phase-1-sirius-release-update/). With **211 Teams and 91 Active Validators (for 64 spots at Mainnet)**, it\u2019s the largest testnet since Cosmos\u2019 Game of Stakes**.**&nbsp;\\n\\nOn Tuesday, May 12th, there was an AWS outage that brought down the centralized cloud (and internet) and yes, Akash testnet was still going strong!\\n\\nTrack our progress on [Forbole\u2019s The Big Dipper](https://testnet.akash.bigdipper.live/) and [Vitwit\u2019s Aneka](https://akash.aneka.io/) block explorers.\\n\\n  \\n**PARTNERS: FORBOLE PROFILE**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922455-forbole-1024x576.jpg)\\n\\nWith a shared vision for data sovereignty and a decentralized future, we're proud to partner with Forbole, a top validator and developer of decentralized applications. We\u2019ve admired the thoughtfulness and commitment with which Kwun, Terence (his cofounder), and the [Forbole](https://www.forbole.com/) team approach their projects and their communities.&nbsp;  \\n  \\nThe Forbole team are tireless in materializing a decentralized future. In addition to being validators for the ecosystem\u2019s top projects, they develop The Big Dipper block explorer, and Desmos, a decentralized social network that includes Mooncake, it\u2019s DApp counterpart. [Check out our Q&amp;A with Forbole](https://akash.network/blog/the-unstoppable-cloud-partner-profile-forbole/).  \\n  \\n  \\n**PEOPLE: INTRODUCING ARTUR TROIAN**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922477-hires-1-1024x683.jpg)\\n\\n\u201cI\u2019m excited to join Akash to help achieve 100% utilization of all cloud compute resources around the world.  \\n  \\nWe\u2019re excited to welcome a multi-talented architect and builder, Artur Troian, to our team. Artur is known in the open-source community for his work on VolantMQ, a High-Performance MQTT Server, and has an exciting [Github](https://github.com/troian).&nbsp;  \\n  \\nWith a background encompassing hardware and software solutions in the IoT and wearables industry, Artur previously led product architecture and engineering at NotifAi, an IoT hardware company he cofounded. [Learn more about Artur](https://akash.network/blog/introducing-artur-troian-senior-software-engineer/).  \\n  \\n  \\n**PROMOTION: SUPERMINI RESERVATION**  \\n**\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_\\\\_**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922485-akashsuperminifrontsidewithoutshadow-1024x576.jpg)\\n\\nWe developed Supermini to give people sovereignty and privacy over their data, and to become participants of the cloud. Owners will be able to run server apps and machine learning workloads, and offer their Supermini\u2019s unused compute on Akash to earn crypto. Supermini leverages Akash\u2019s proprietary cloud and blockchain technologies, developed over five years.&nbsp;  \\n  \\nWe just launched a reservation campaign for a limited production of 300 Superminis. Supermini will be manufactured and launched in the United States with premium materials and powerful NVIDIA VOLTA processors. **We\u2019re already close to selling out our 300 Superminis**. [Learn more about Supermini](https://akash.network/supermini/).  \\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922493-akashsuperminiconceptrenderday2-1024x576.jpg)\\n\\n[**Reserve Your Supermini**](https://akash.network/supermini)&nbsp;\\n\\n[Sign up for our newsletter](https://akash.network/) to get the latest updates first.&nbsp;  \\nJoin our [Telegram](https://t.me/AkashNW) channel and add us on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/akashnet_)\\\\--we\u2019d love to connect with you&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;The Unstoppable Update: May 2020&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;We\u2019ve witnessed how our centralized systems, organizations, and governments were slow to coordinate and share life-saving information during the pandemic. We\u2019re seeing more of the ways we connect and collaborate move to the cloud.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-05-15T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Greg Osuri&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.DSNH9uRf.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1332],&quot;height&quot;:[0,992],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/the-unstoppable-update-may-2020/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;introducing-artur-troian-senior-software-engineer/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;introducing-artur-troian-senior-software-engineer&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\n_**\u201cI'm excited to join Akash to help achieve 100% utilization of all cloud compute resources around the world.\u201d**_\\n\\nOur vision is to enable architects and builders of the internet greater freedom to improve the human experience. This week, we\u2019re excited to welcome an incredibly talented architect and builder, Artur Troian, to our team.&nbsp;Artur is known in the open-source community for his work on VolantMQ, a High-Performance MQTT Server, and has an exciting [Github](https://github.com/troian).\\n\\n_\u201cI connected with the Akash team, and the interviews felt more like discussions, where my time and experience were respected--this was different from the usual formal interview process. I was impressed with Akash\u2019s documentation, and the market opportunity.\u201d_\\n\\nWith a background encompassing hardware and software solutions in the IoT and wearables industry, Artur previously led product architecture and engineering at NotifAi, an IoT hardware company he cofounded. Prior to that, he served as tech lead and managed the software engineering team at Cyber Vision, Jawbone\u2019s offshore entity.\\n\\n**A Focus on Real-World Application**\\n\\nArtur started building hardware at the age of 13. This early nurture of his builder tendencies transitioned into a career in workable hardware and software solutions. He approaches development with a focus on functionality and real-world use cases.\\n\\n_\u201cBlockchain has been over-hyped and misused. You have to understand it and apply it to where it can be useful. For Akash, blockchain is a great fit to handle marketplace transactions on the platform.\u201d_\\n\\n**Integrating Hardware and Software at Akash**\\n\\nOn the difference between hardware and software development, Artur says,_\u201cThe cost of error for hardware is higher than for the cloud. You need a higher quality of code as well.\u201d_\\n\\nAt Akash, where we have both a platform, Supercloud, and a hardware product, [Supermini](https://akash.network/supermini/), Artur will apply his background in hardware and software development to help us materialize The Unstoppable Cloud.\\n\\n_\u201cI like getting my hands in the code. You can\u2019t be a good architect without writing code.\u201d_\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Introducing Artur Troian: Senior Software Engineer&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;\u201cI'm excited to join Akash to help achieve 100% utilization of all cloud compute resources around the world.\u201d Our vision is to enable architects and builders of the internet greater freedom to improve the human experience. This week, we\u2019re excited to welcome an incredibly talented architect and builder, Artur Troian, to our team.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-05-13T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Team&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Team&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Maly Ly&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.Coj7rNfI.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,660],&quot;height&quot;:[0,480],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/introducing-artur-troian-senior-software-engineer/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;the-unstoppable-cloud-partner-profile-forbole/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;the-unstoppable-cloud-partner-profile-forbole&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\n\u201c_**Start at any time. We are all learning and developing something new for the next generation, so never think that you are too late**_**.\u201d**&nbsp;  \\n**\\\\- Kwun Yeung, Cofounder Forbole**\\n\\nWe\u2019ve been fortunate to partner with leading companies and teams who share our vision for an open, safe, and unstoppable cloud that enables the creators of the future more freedom to build, and gives people sovereignty over their data.\\n\\nWe recently connected with Kwun Yeung, cofounder of [Forbole](https://www.forbole.com/), one of the top validators in the Cosmos Hub, as well as a highly valued and regarded partner of Akash, for a Q&amp;A.\\n\\nWe\u2019ve admired the thoughtfulness and commitment with which Kwun, Terence (his cofounder), and the Forbole team approach their projects and their communities. The Forbole team are tireless in materializing a decentralized future. In addition to being validators for the ecosystem\u2019s top projects, they develop The Big Dipper block explorer, and Desmos, a decentralized social network that includes Mooncake, it\u2019s DApp counterpart.\\n\\n**Q&amp;A: Kwun Yeung, Cofounder of Forbole**\\n\\n**How did you start Forbole?**\\n\\nTerence and I have been partners for 10 years, and we originally ran a digital marketing agency together. We built apps and websites, and guided clients on online advertising.\\n\\nIn 2017, a client introduced us to Internet of Things (IoT) and through research on IoT, we learned about blockchain. We didn\u2019t know anything about blockchain at the time.\\n\\nWe were amazed and surprised by the potential of blockchain, and continued researching it further. We realized that we could leverage it to build a social network in a decentralized way. We didn\u2019t like the centralization authority and control by companies like Google and Facebook.\\n\\nSince 2013, we\u2019d been trying to figure out if there was a way we could change the status quo. When we learned about blockchain, we realized we could build a decentralized social network, and see if the market would adapt. That\u2019s how we formed Forbole.\\n\\nForbole in Chinese means \u201csomeone who can pick talent\u201d.\\n\\nWe started building a decentralized social network that helped people find talent--similar to LinkedIn, but through referrals. Through chance and multiple opportunities, we also became validators.\\n\\nIn late 2019, we started building and running a decentralized network called Desmos. We built an app called Mooncake that builds on Desmos.\\n\\n**What makes Forbole different from other validators?**\\n\\nOur background and experiences in digital marketing, communications, app development, and user experience make us unique. Communication is a strength, as we know how to communicate to the mass market, and as a global team, we speak multiple languages.\\n\\n**How do you choose what projects to work with?**\\n\\nWe focus on the technology and the team, and look for founders with a similar vision to ours. When we were looking at different technologies to build a decentralized social network, we started with Ethereum but realized it wasn\u2019t possible.\\n\\nIn the search for a new technology we could use, we discovered Steemit and its consensus engine. Through that, we found Tendermint, and learned about Jae Kwon. After reading his paper and learning more about him, we decided to work with Cosmos.\\n\\nWe try the technology first, before we decide to work with the team.\\n\\nWe learned about Akash through a tweet from Jack Zampolin. We researched Akash, learned more about Greg Osuri, and through participation in Akash\u2019s Founding Member Challenges (Testnet Alpha), we were able to play around with Akash\u2019s technology, and found it to be incredibly user-friendly.\\n\\nWe saw the potential for Akash\u2019s applications to open up a shared economy. This aligned with our vision, and we knew that this team shared a similar approach with our team.\\n\\n**What are current projects you\u2019re working on?**\\n\\nWe\u2019re validators and developers.\\n\\nFor validation, we work with Cosmos, IRISnet, Solana, Kava, and a few others.\\n\\nWe develop The Big Dipper, a block explorer. Anyone using Cosmos SDK can leverage the Big Dipper to easily explore the chain.\\n\\nWe also develop Desmos, a decentralized social network, and we built a DApp on top called Mooncake, a mobile app.\\n\\n**What new developments in the ecosystem are you excited about?**\\n\\nI\u2019m excited about decentralized VPN, like Sentinel. What happened last year in Hong Kong and China showed us the importance of being able to speak freely. One of the reasons we built Desmos is to enable censorship-resistance.\\n\\n**What are your future plans?**\\n\\nFor The Big Dipper, we\u2019ll be developing a separate dedicated dashboard to delegate or monitor from different networks, and we\u2019ll be working on a mobile version.\\n\\nFor Desmos, we started an incentivized testnet early this year and will release in different phases to attract validators and users. We\u2019ll bootstrap first before seeking venture capital funding.\\n\\n**What advice would you give to someone interested in entering blockchain?**\\n\\nFollow your passion and your heart. **Start at any time. We are all learning and developing something new for the next generation, so never think that you are too late.**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922423-kwun-y.jpg)\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;The Unstoppable Cloud Partner Profile: Forbole&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;\u201cStart at any time. We are all learning and developing something new for the next generation, so never think that you are too late.\u201d&nbsp;- Kwun Yeung, Cofounder Forbole We\u2019ve been fortunate to partner with leading companies and teams who share our vision for an open, safe, and unstoppable cloud that enables the creators of the future more freedom to build, and gives people sovereignty over their to participants of the Challenge!**\\n\\nOur good friends at Vitwit and The Big Dipper made us block explorers--check them out to track our progress:\\n\\n- [Vitwit: Akash Block Explorer](https://akash.aneka.io/)\\n- [The Big Dipper: Akash Block Explorer](https://testnet.akash.bigdipper.live/)\\n\\nFor those who want to integrate their wallets, staking dashboards, or any Supermini prizes at stake, the competition is heating up as we enter Sirius, the second release of Phase 1.\\n\\nThe goal of Sirius is to test governance and voting, and network upgrades. There are a total of 334 AKT rewards for completion of Sirius.**\\n\\nThe new governance proposal will be created to upgrade the software to v0.6.4.\\n\\nJust an update that we'll be replacing Proposal (1) for Sirius upgrade with a new Proposal (2) that has the corrected voting period to ensure all participants in the community get to vote.\\n\\nWe'd initially communicated that the voting period would end on May 14th, 2020, 1600 UTC, when we'd publicly indicated that the voting period ends on May 13th, 2020, 12:19:26pm UTC:\\n\\n- We created Proposal (1) on May 11th, 2020, 12:19: 07 am UTC with an expectation of submitting the deposit on May 12th, 2020, 1600 UTC and a voting period deadline of May 14th, 2020 1600 UTC.\\n- A community member ended up posting a deposit instead of us (which will not happen on Mainnet), resulting in a voting period deadline of May 13th, 2020, 12:19:26pm UTC.\\n- Since this caused the voting period to end sooner than what was initially communicated, we're replacing the current upgrade proposal to ensure all participants get to vote.\\n\\n**The proposal details will be shared at 1600UTC on May 12th**.\\n\\nProposal details:\\n\\nTitle: &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; \\&quot;Sirius Upgrade\\&quot;  \\nDescription: &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; \\&quot;The first ever on-chain upgrade on Akash Network. Sirius upgrade fixes the issues with rewards and double-sign slashing. A new release v0.6.4 will be&nbsp; tagged to handle the upgrade.\\&quot;,  \\nVoting Start Time:&nbsp; \\&quot;12th May, 1600UTC\\&quot;  \\nVoting End Time:&nbsp; &nbsp; \\&quot;14th May, 1600UTC\\&quot;\\n\\n### **Sirius Voting**\\n\\n**What do validators need to do?** All validators and delegators will 48 hours to cast their votes on the proposal\\n\\n- The voting starts on May 12th, 2020 1600 UTC\\n- The voting closes on May 14th, 2020 1600 UTC.\\n- **Instructions to vote for the proposal will be** [**here**](https://akash.network/docs/akashian/phase1)**.**\\n\\n**There are a total of 334 AKT rewards for completion of Sirius. Follow the Sirius release guide for instructions.**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922422-screen-shot-2020-05-11-at-12-20-24-pm.png)\\n\\n**Rewards**\\n\\nVisit [The Akashian Challenge website](https://akash.network/blog/the-akashian-challenge-incentivized-testnet-live/) for a detailed schedule of rewards. A total of **3 million AKT (3% of AKT)** is allocated for rewards that include:\\n\\n1.  **64 Finalist Rewards**\\n2.  **One-Off Challenges**\\n3.  **Phase Completion**\\n4.  **Top 5, 10, 20 Finalists**\\n5.  **Bi-Weekly Winners**\\n6.  **Bonus Challenges**\\n\\n**Get the Latest Updates**\\n\\n[Join our Telegram](https://t.me/AkashNW) for the latest announcements and news. If it\u2019s your first time using Telegram, please ensure you create a username and adjust your privacy settings to access.\\n\\n[Join our Riot](https://riot.im/app/#/room/#akashnet:matrix.org) dev chat for The Akashian Challenge support and information.\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;The Akashian Challenge  Phase 1: Sirius Release Update&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;With 3,000,000 AKT rewards and Supermini prizes at stake, the competition is heating up as we enter Sirius, the second release of Phase 1.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-05-11T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Testnets&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Testnets&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Maly Ly&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.Di5_WtGg.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1200],&quot;height&quot;:[0,675],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/the-akashian-challenge-phase-1-sirius-release-update/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;the-akashian-challenge-phase-1-centauri-release-update/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;the-akashian-challenge-phase-1-centauri-release-update&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\n**With 185 registrants from around the world and 3,000,000 AKT at stake, The Akashian Challenge Phase 1 is underway!**\\n\\nRegistration is [still open](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1oM8eQcaWkpt3nRLh_H0tvQ2AeLpgjkdLn6rfhKyrsJk/edit), and you can [get started](https://akash.network/docs/akashian/phase1) if you\u2019ve already registered.\\n\\nA reminder that Phase 1 is made up of four week-long stages with different objectives. ON!**\\n\\n**We\u2019re excited to announce the launch of The Akashian Challenge Phase 1: Node Operations today.**\\n\\nPhase 1 is the start of our three phase incentivized testnet challenge that will take place over the next eight weeks, with **3,000,000 Akash Tokens (AKT) at stake, and special prizes like our** [**Akash Supermini**](https://akash.network/supermini/).\\n\\nUse your technical and strategic prowess to out-maneuver opponents on your way to ultimate victory! Play as an individual or as part of a team.\\n\\n**May the most tenacious of you win.**\\n\\n**Let the games begin!**\\n\\n[**Get Started Now**](https://akash.network/akashian/docs) **|** [**Learn More**](https://akash.network/challenge/)\\n\\n### **The Akashian Challenge Phase 1:**\\n\\n**Node Operations**\\n\\nPhase 1 comprises four separate week-long stages with different objectives. Participants earn tokens by solving different challenges related to operating and validating the Akash Blockchain. The challenges will range from setting up Akash nodes to governing the network.\\n\\n### **Objectives**\\n\\n- Bring a network live in a decentralized manner with a minimum set of 64 validators\\n- Verify and test network upgrade procedures, identify and fix any gaps\\n- Stress test the network to understand scalability parameters\\n- Drive community participation for contributions to code and documentation\\n- Encourage engagement across teams for a self-sustaining ecosystem\\n\\n### **Releases**\\n\\nDuring Phase 1, we\u2019ll be testing four releases of Akash Network in the span of four weeks starting April 30th, 2020:\\n\\n- Each of these releases have important milestones published [here](https://akash.network/akashian/phase1/plan).\\n- Instructions for getting started on Centauri are published [here](https://akash.network/akashian/phase1/guide).\\n- Instructions for each release will be published before the week begins.\\n\\n### **Release Schedule**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922423-screen-shot-2020-04-29-at-10-12-43-pm.png)\\n\\n### **Reward Structure**\\n\\nPhase 1 has four categories of rewards a team can earn by completing tasks for the category. Each participant can earn up to 67,556 AKT. A detailed reward schedule for Phase 1 is published [here](https://akash.network/akashian/phase1/rewards). Below is a summary:\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922441-screen-shot-2020-04-29-at-10-16-16-pm.png)\\n\\n### **Centauri Release**\\n\\nCentauri is the first release of the testnet and has three critical milestones that eventually lead to the launch of the network on May 8th, 2020 1600 UTC.\\n\\nFollow the Phase 1 [guide](https://akash.network/akashian/phase1/guide) for instructions.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922458-screen-shot-2020-04-29-at-10-17-41-pm.png)\\n\\n### **Registration**\\n\\n1.  **Registration:** Submit the form [here](https://docs.google.com/a/akash.network/forms/d/1oM8eQcaWkpt3nRLh_H0tvQ2AeLpgjkdLn6rfhKyrsJk/edit?usp=sharing). Once the form is submitted, our team will review the information and integrate the information into a publicly viewable spreadsheet for tracking.\\n2.  **KYC/AML:** Complete KYC/AML [here](https://app.akash.network/verifications). This is required to claim rewards, but not for participation.\\n3.  **Tax Documents:** W-8 BEN or W9. Once your KYC application is approved, our team will send either a W-8 BEN for international participants or a W9 via HelloSign.\\n4.  **Status:** The status of your participation agreement will be tracked along with the other registration information. We will also notify you upon completion or rejection of any submitted participation agreements.\\n\\n### **Rewards**\\n\\nVisit The Akashian Challenge page for a detailed schedule of rewards. A total of **3 million AKT (3% of AKT)** is allocated for rewards that include:\\n\\n1.  **64 Finalist Rewards**\\n2.  **One-Off Challenges**\\n3.  **Phase Completion**\\n4.  **Top 5, 10, 20 Finalists**\\n5.  **Bi-Weekly Winners**\\n6.  **Bonus Challenges**\\n\\n### **Get the Latest Updates**\\n\\n[Join our Telegram](https://t.me/AkashNW) for the latest announcements and news.\\n\\n[**Get Started Now**](https://akash.network/akashian/docs) **|** [**Learn More**](https://akash.network/challenge/)\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;The Akashian Challenge Incentivized Testnet LIVE&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Node Operations today. Phase 1 is the start of our three phase incentivized testnet challenge that will take place over the next eight weeks, with 3,000,000 Akash Tokens (AKT) at stake, and special prizes like our Akash Supermini. Use your technical and strategic prowess to out-maneuver opponents on your way to ultimate victory!&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-04-30T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Testnets&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Testnets&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Maly Ly&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.CQ_y25Db.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,2000],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1500],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/the-akashian-challenge-incentivized-testnet-live/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;the-akashian-challenge-token-rewards-prizes-schedule/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;the-akashian-challenge-token-rewards-prizes-schedule&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\n**Last Thursday, we** [**announced open registration for The Akashian Challenge**](https://akash.network/blog/announcing-the-akashian-challenge-incentivized-testnet/)**, our incentivized testnet.** With a sprawling challenge that encompasses three phases over eight weeks, and massive token rewards--**3,000,000 Akash Tokens (AKT) or 3% of the 100,000,000 AKT** that will ever be pre-mined at genesis--, the competition has attracted registrations from individuals and teams from around the world.\\n\\nInspired by ecosystem projects from our partners and friends, such as Cosmos Game of Stakes, Solana Tour de Sol, and Kava Founder Rewards, The Akashian Challenge enables us to strengthen the scalability, security, and usability of our platform, and help us grow a vibrant and robust community.\\n\\nWe invite you to leverage your technical and social cunning to maneuver your way to victory, through a series of tasks that get progressively more difficult.
