Along the way, you\u2019ll explore different aspects of our decentralized cloud computing platform.\\n\\n**Validators who persevere will be generously rewarded.**\\n\\nAhead of The Akashian Challenge Phase 1 launch this Thursday, April 30th, we\u2019re excited to **announce the schedule and details for token rewards and exclusive prizes (hint: what is** [**the world\u2019s sleekest and most powerful portable supercomputer**](https://akash.network/supermini/)**?).**\\n\\nReady to get started?\\n\\n[**Register Now**](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeZjlvoXnezs2eoxUx4L_fUKsOyGe_He63KlUkaht6flnVqYg/viewform) **|** [**Learn More**](https://akash.network/blog/announcing-the-akashian-challenge-incentivized-testnet/)\\n\\n**The Akashian Challenge Rewards &amp; Prizes**\\n\\n**Goals for Incentivization**\\n\\n- Establish clear objectives for each challenge while ensuring validators\u2019 creative freedom\\n- Identify desired behavior from validators and reward accordingly\\n- Ensure participants are rewarded for actual efforts rather than access to capital (level the playing field)\\n- Design a reward structure to incentivize long term participation instead of short term financial gain\\n- Maintain fairness throughout the competition\\n\\nA total of **3 million AKT (3% of AKT)** is allocated for rewards that include:\\n\\n1.  **64 Finalist Rewards**\\n2.  **One-Off Challenges**\\n3.  **Phase Completion**\\n4.  **Top 5, 10, 20 Finalists**\\n5.  **Bi-Weekly Winners**\\n6.  **Bonus Challenges**\\n\\n**Rewards Schedule**\\n\\nBelow is the proposed reward schedule, and individual rewards may vary depending on the number of participants. We may shuffle rewards as we introduce challenges for each phase.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922422-screen-shot-2020-04-27-at-6-30-00-pm.png)\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922434-screen-shot-2020-04-27-at-6-23-49-pm.png)\\n\\n**Exclusive Prizing**\\n\\nIn addition to their token rewards, the Top 5 Finalists (individuals or teams) for The Akashian Challenge will receive our Supermini portable supercomputer at launch later this year (only 300 Superminis available at launch).\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922457-screen-shot-2020-04-15-at-12-17-18-pm.png)\\n\\n**Biweekly Live Streamed Rewards Announcements**\\n\\nEvery two weeks, we\u2019ll be live streaming reward announcements. Registered and active Akashian challengers who attend each of these live streams will have the opportunity to win a Supermini.\\n\\n**Terms**\\n\\nReward compensation is subject to Terms listed&nbsp;[here](https://akash-web-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/2020/04/Akashian-Participation-Terms-20200423-1-1.pdf).&nbsp; Terms are subject to change by Akash Network.\\n\\n**The Akashian Challenge Phase 1**\\n\\nGet ready for The Akashian Challenge Phase 1 **this Thursday, April 30th, 2020**.\\n\\n**Phase 1: Node Operations**\\n\\nParticipants earn tokens by solving different challenges related to operating and validating the Akash Blockchain. The challenges will range from setting up an Akash node to governing the network.\\n\\n[**Register Now for The Akashian Challenge**](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeZjlvoXnezs2eoxUx4L_fUKsOyGe_He63KlUkaht6flnVqYg/viewform)\\n\\n**Get the Latest Updates for The Akashian Challenge**\\n\\n[**Join our Telegram**](https://t.me/AkashNW) for the latest updates and announcements, and for exclusive invites to our AMAs with special guests.\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;The Akashian Challenge Token Rewards &amp; Prizes Schedule&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Last Thursday, we announced open registration for The Akashian Challenge, our incentivized testnet. With a sprawling challenge that encompasses three phases over eight weeks, and massive token rewards-- 3,000,000 Akash Tokens (AKT) or 3% of the 100,000,000 AKT that will ever be pre-mined at genesis--, the competition has attracted registrations from individuals and teams from around the world. Inspired by ecosystem projects from our partners and friends, such as Cosmos Game of Stakes, Solana Tour de Sol, and Kava Founder Rewards, The Akashian Challenge enables us to strengthen the scalability, security, and usability of our platform, and help us grow a vibrant and robust community.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-04-28T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Testnets&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Testnets&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Maly Ly&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.wgsbP235.jpeg&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1024],&quot;height&quot;:[0,768],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;jpg&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/the-akashian-challenge-token-rewards-prizes-schedule/banner-image.jpeg&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;announcing-the-akashian-challenge-incentivized-testnet/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;announcing-the-akashian-challenge-incentivized-testnet&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash means \u201copen space, sky\u201d in ancient Sanskrit.  \\n  \\nAs a decentralized system, and the world\u2019s first distributed peer-to-peer open cloud computing marketplace, our aim is to materialize the vision of an open cloud that\u2019s as boundless and free as the sky. To this end, we\u2019re leveraging a series of testnets to gather data, identify critical issues, and ensure our network\u2019s scalability, security, and usability before we launch our mainnet.&nbsp;  \\n  \\nThese explorations will also enable us to understand our community dynamics and governance, and help us build a healthy and vital community for growth.  \\n  \\n**Results from Akash Testnet Alpha Founding Member Challenges**  \\n  \\nFor our Testnet Alpha, we launched the [Akash Founding Member Rewards Program](https://akash.network/blog/announcing-our-founding-member-challenge-winners-leaderboard/) for early contributors to Akash\u2019s testnet and community. Of the 100,000,000 tokens that will ever be pre-mined at genesis, we allocated 2% (2,000,000 AKTs) to the Founding Member program. The program involved three progressively difficult challenges along with bonus challenges, and contributors joined from all over the world, including the U.S., Korea, Japan, China, Europe, India, and South America.  \\n  \\nEach challenge had a corresponding reward, for a total of 3,500 Akash Tokens (AKT), with bonuses of up to 2,000 AKT. The challenges engaged contributors with Akash Supercloud, and taught them how to become compute providers and deploy applications on our open, permissionless, and secure marketplace for compute cycles, resulting in 1,802 deployments and 144 providers.&nbsp;\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922423-the-image-1024x1024.jpg)\\n\\n**Incentivized Testnet Launch**  \\n  \\n**Today, we\u2019re excited to announce the launch of our Incentivized Testnet with The Akashian Challenge next Thursday, April 30th 2020.**\\n\\n[**Register for The Akashian Challenge**](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeZjlvoXnezs2eoxUx4L_fUKsOyGe_He63KlUkaht6flnVqYg/viewform)\\n\\nTo incentivize participants in the Akashian Challenge, we're allocating 3% (3,000,000 AKTs!) of the 100,000,000 tokens that will ever be pre-mined at genesis.&nbsp;  \\n  \\nThe Akashian Challenge focuses on a series of tasks that get progressively more difficult, and enable participants to explore different aspects of the platform, from performing user operations to node operations.  \\n  \\nOur Testnet Beta and Akashian Challenge program is inspired by ecosystem projects from the community, such as Solana Tour de Sol, Cosmos Game of Stakes, and Kava Founder Rewards.  \\n  \\n**The Akashian Challenge**\\n\\nThe Akashian Challenge will begin on Thursday, April 30th, 2020, and run for 8 weeks in three distinct phases:\\n\\n**Phase 1: Node Operations**  \\n**Phase 2: Provider Operations**  \\n**Phase 3: Developer Operations**  \\n  \\n**Phase 1:** The participants earn tokens by solving different challenges related to operating and validating the Akash Blockchain. The challenges will range from setting up Akash node to Governing the network.  \\n  \\n**Phase 2:** Phase 2 involves setting up a secure, production-ready, and scalable Datacenter operation as a provider and/or validator on the Akash network. The goal of this phase is to test various adversarial conditions, identify security loopholes and scalability limits of the Akash network. Beyond setting up the operations, participants are incentivized to stress test the limits of the Akash Network.  \\n  \\n**Phase 3:** Phase 3 incentives developers to build on the Akash network. Developers earn tokens by deploying applications. The most creative applications will be selected every fortnight by committee and public in a live-streamed ceremony.\\n\\n**Rewards**\\n\\nA total of **3 million AKT (3% of AKT)** is allocated for rewards that include:\\n\\n1.  **64 Finalist Rewards**\\n    \\n2.  **One-Off Challenges**\\n    \\n3.  **Phase Completion**\\n    \\n4.  **Top 5, 10, 20 Finalists**\\n    \\n5.  **Bi-Weekly Winners**\\n    \\n6.  **Bonus Challenges**\\n    \\n\\n**\\\\*Rewards Calculator will be published next week**\\n\\n**Registration**\\n\\n1.  **Registration:** Submit the form [here](https://forms.gle/9HV2V5s6Abny7tyv9). Once the form is submitted, our team will review the information and integrate the information into a publicly viewable spreadsheet for tracking.\\n    \\n2.  **KYC/AML:** Complete KYC/AML [here](https://app.akash.network/verifications).&nbsp;\\n    \\n3.  **Tax Documents:** W-8 BEN or W9. Once your KYC application is approved, our team will send either a W-8 BEN for international participants or a W9 via HelloSign.\\n    \\n4.  **Status:** The status of your participation agreement will be tracked along with the other registration information. We will also notify you upon completion or rejection of any submitted participation agreements.\\n    \\n\\n**Important Dates**\\n\\n*   **Registration Open:** April 22, 2020\\n    \\n*   **Rewards Details:** April 28, 2020\\n    \\n*   **Phase 1:** April 30, 2020\\n    \\n\\n[**Register for The Akashian Challenge**](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeZjlvoXnezs2eoxUx4L_fUKsOyGe_He63KlUkaht6flnVqYg/viewform)\\n\\n**Don\u2019t Miss Critical Updates on The Akashian Challenge**  \\n  \\nJoin [our Telegram](https://t.me/AkashNW) to get the latest news, and you\u2019ll get a special invite to the Testnet Beta and The Akashian Challenge AMA next week with our CEO Greg Osuri and Pylon Validator Jack Zampolin!&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Announcing The Akashian Challenge: Incentivized Testnet&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash means \u201copen space, sky\u201d in ancient Sanskrit. As a decentralized system, and the world\u2019s first distributed peer-to-peer open cloud computing marketplace, our aim is to materialize the vision of an open cloud that\u2019s as boundless and free as the sky.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-04-23T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Testnets&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Testnets&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Greg Osuri&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.BIBNE12u.jpg&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,2048],&quot;height&quot;:[0,2048],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;jpg&quot;],&quot;orientation&quot;:[0,1],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/announcing-the-akashian-challenge-incentivized-testnet/banner-image.jpg&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-q1-recap-updates/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-q1-recap-updates&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;Greetings,\\n\\nI hope you\u2019ve been staying safe, healthy, and sane during a time of unprecedented global uncertainty and transformation. Our families and communities have been impacted, and the way we live and work will never be the same. At Akash, being a distributed team has made it a little easier to transition to what is becoming \u201cthe new normal\u201d.&nbsp;&nbsp;\\n\\nWhat\u2019s happening in the world today has made our team more committed to building the world\u2019s first decentralized cloud computing marketplace, and the first viable alternative to cloud service providers (CSPs). Cloud costs from the major CSPs make running machine learning, deep learning, and artificial intelligence workloads increasingly expensive and cost-prohibitive for startups, academic institutions, researchers, and clinicians who need to accelerate critical research to fight COVID-19, and develop life-saving treatments.\\n\\n**Q1 Progress to a Faster, Better, and Lower Cost Cloud**\\n\\nOur world won\u2019t be the same after the virus, and we\u2019ll see an even greater need for cloud compute and services, as the ways we work and play transition even more to the cloud. By leveraging the power of a free market and a permissionless, open cloud, Akash Network unlocks 85% of cloud compute capacity in 8.4 million data centers currently underutilized. 90% lower in cost, Akash is a _faster, better, more secure, and lower cost_ alternative to cloud service providers.\\n\\nDespite the global volatility of this past quarter, our team has remained focused and diligent in the progression of our mission. I wanted to share highlights of what our team has been working on this past quarter across product, partnerships, people, and promotions. I\u2019m excited to unveil our [new website](https://akash.network/) and our new Supermini portable supercomputer, as well as update on what\u2019s to come in Q2.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922423-000035340013-copy-1-1024x678.jpg)\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922446-0-1.jpg)\\n\\n**PRODUCT**\\n\\n*   **Migration to Cosmos SDK:** In Q1, we migrated to Cosmos SDK and in the process, we reduced our codebase by a massive 150,000 lines.&nbsp;\\n    \\n*   **Incentivized Testnet:** We made big strides in the development of our incentivized testnet--stay tuned for an announcement this week.\\n    \\n*   **Supermini Portable Supercomputer**: We\u2019ve significantly progressed design, technical specifications, and production on Supermini. We worked with design duo Guillermo Sanchez del Corral and Rafael Sanchez of debuti, and industrial designer Sungbum Park, to come up with Supermini\u2019s distinctive chassis and infinity mirror design. After much research and prototyping, we amped up the specs to a 512-core Volta GPU with 64 Tensor Cores. Production is underway for a limited launch later this year. Check out our new Supermini below.\\n    \\n*   **Decentralized Cloud Standards:** We put together a design repository for the Testnet Alpha that we released last November, in order to provide a framework for others to create and run their own testnets. With input from our community we decided to name it [Decentralized Cloud Standards](https://dcs.akash.network/spec/dcs-4).\\n    \\n*   **Akash Economics**: We evolved our Akash Network Token Economic Model. We [introduced two additional powerful drivers](https://akash.network/blog/an-evolution-of-akash-network-token-economics/) for growth and income generation in the ecosystem\u2013the allocation of subsidies, in the form of a Subsidy Pool, and the distribution of a network dividend from a portion of the lease fees, Take Income.\\n    \\n\\n**PARTNERSHIPS**\\n\\n*   **Solana**: Our goal is to provide developers with increased access to decentralized services. Last month, we announced that we were partnering with Solana to bring web-scale smart contracts to Akash Supercloud.&nbsp; Akash users will be able to run secure and scalable smart contracts on Solana\u2019s hyper-performant platform and pay using Akash Token (AKT). Solana\u2019s users will soon be able to run distributed applications (like machine learning or web apps) and settle using Solana Token (SOL) on Akash. Our partnership will also give Solana Validators the ability to run their nodes on a truly decentralized cloud and significantly decrease their cloud costs.\\n    \\n*   **The Unstoppable Cloud:** This past quarter, we expanded our ecosystem by partnering with a number of data centers, a Telco provider, and continuing to build partnerships with storage, security, and DNS providers who share our vision for an open, safe, and \u201cunstoppable\u201d cloud that unlocks capabilities for the data-driven technologies of the future. We can\u2019t wait to announce these and many more partnerships in Q2.\\n    \\n*   **Our First Stablecoin**: We\u2019ve been working on a key integration and partnership to bring a strong stablecoin into our multi-currency ecosystem that will be used for payment and settlement on our platform. We\u2019re looking forward to announcing this partnership in the coming weeks.\\n    \\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922423-new-solana-blog-home-page.png)\\n\\n**PEOPLE**\\n\\n*   **Jack Zampolin:** We\u2019re fortunate to have Jack join as an advisor. As cofounder of Pylon Validation Services and former Director of Product at Tendermint / Cosmos, he is renowned as one of the top Cosmos validators and instrumental in developing Cosmos\u2019 Inter-Blockchain Communication (IBC) protocol. Jack provided valuable insights and guidance on our migration to Cosmos SDK.\\n    \\n*   **Chris Remus**: Chris has been validating since the Cosmos validator working group formed in October 2017. He has project and product managed crypto projects like ENS and Aragon, managing Mainnet launches. He's advised networks such as Solana, Nucypher, and Regen, and he\u2019s currently working with Akash on validator program development and incentivized testnet design.&nbsp;\\n    \\n*   **Vitwit Technologies:** We came to know the Vitwit team from our last testnet challenges. They\u2019ve helped global companies across AI, blockchain, and cloud build applications, with a focus on tools for the Cosmos ecosystem. The Vitwit team has been working with us on testnet development and support. They\u2019re currently validating Regen Network, E-Money (mainnet), Kusama, and Oasis.\\n    \\n*   **Cheng Wang:** With a background that includes extended tenures with Merrill Lynch, Morgan Stanley, Goldman Sachs, and the Royal Bank of Scotland, Cheng Wang has joined our team as CFO to scale finance and operations. Prior to Akash, Cheng served as CFO at Refereum, a blockchain startup. His financial expertise includes both equity and debt valuation, derivative instruments, treasury management, and portfolio management.\\n    \\n*   **Josh Roppo:**&nbsp;Hailing from Portland, Oregon, Josh just joined our team as Senior Software Engineer. Prior to Akash, Josh served in lead infrastructure and senior development roles at ShiftLeft and Lytics. Creative and curious, he\u2019ll be leveraging his experience in infrastructure, distributed systems, and containerization to help us build the foundation for the world\u2019s first Supercloud.\\n    \\n\\n**PROMOTIONS**\\n\\n*   **New Akash Website &amp; Blog**: To better share and engage with our audiences, we worked with design firm Abeck Inc. to update our visual brand and website. I invite you to visit our new website and learn more about what we\u2019re up to.\\n    \\n*   **OKCoin Podcast**: [OKCoin](https://www.okcoin.com/), one of the world\u2019s leading crypto exchanges, invited me to speak on their popular OK Let's Chat Podcast. On the [podcast](https://medium.com/okcoin-blog/ok-lets-chat-why-blockchain-will-support-the-next-gangnam-style-813c6ffc3a5f), I discussed everything from Akash\u2019s unique value proposition, to Akash economics and Gangnam Style.&nbsp;\\n    \\n*   **Hashing It Out Podcast:** In January, I joined the Hashing It Out podcast on its [70th episode](https://thebitcoinpodcast.com/hashing-it-out-70/) to discuss our tokenomics, permissionless trust, and the Akash Supermini. Hosted by Dr. Corey Petty and Colin Cusce, Hashing It Out is a podcast that covers tech innovators and decentralized networks.\\n    \\n*   **How to Get Crypto by Staking Crypto Panel**: Our CMO Maly Ly and advisor Jack Zampolin joined [The Crypto Underground](https://www.meetup.com/Crypto-Underground/)\u2019s panel on staking \u201cHow to Get Crypto by Staking Crypto\u201d moderated by Cointelegraph\u2019s Rachel Wolfson, and including Coinbase\u2019s Luke Youngblood, Solana\u2019s Stephen Akridge, and Tezos\u2019 Kevin Nielson.&nbsp;\\n    \\n*   **Articles**: If you missed them, check out some of our favorite articles launched on our blog this past quarter:\\n    \\n    *   [An Evolution of Akash Network Token Economics](https://akash.network/blog/an-evolution-of-akash-network-token-economics/)\\n        \\n    *   [A Founder\u2019s Guide to The SEC\u2019s Safe Harbor Proposal for Utility Tokens](https://akash.network/blog/a-founders-guide-to-the-secs-safe-harbor-proposal-for-utility-tokens/)\\n        \\n    *   [Battling COVID-19 with Blockchain, AI, and Cloud Computing](https://akash.network/blog/battling-covid-19-with-blockchain-ai-and-cloud-computing/)\\n        \\n    *   [How Blockchain is Transforming Cloud Computing](https://akash.network/blog/how-blockchain-is-transforming-cloud-computing/)\\n        \\n    *   [Brave New World of Staking: A Primer on Proof of Stake (PoS)](https://akash.network/blog/brave-new-world-of-staking-a-primer-on-proof-of-stake-pos/)\\n        \\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922467-jack-speaking-1024x768.jpg)\\n\\n**ACCELERATING IN Q2**\\n\\nAs we continue to assess COVID-19\u2019s impact on global markets and communities going into Q2, our team is committed to accelerating efforts to get closer to our vision of a distributed open cloud that enables innovations that save lives and improve the human experience. We\u2019ll be continuing to grow our network of validators and delegators to secure our platform, while focusing on our incentivized testnet launch.\\n\\nSince I first unveiled the supermini on stage at IFX, it has come a long way in terms of technical specs and design. With the Supermini, you can plug in and run your favorite blockchain node or machine learning workload, and offer your Supermini\u2019s unused compute on Akash to earn crypto.&nbsp;\\n\\nI\u2019m excited to introduce to you the new Supermini, the most powerful portable supercomputer.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922477-akashsuperminiconceptrenderday3-1024x576.jpg)\\n\\nProduction on the Supermini is underway, and we\u2019re only producing 300 units for a launch later this year. We invite you to be one of the first 300 people in the world to reserve and own this powerful in-home supercomputer, before we launch our online pre-order campaign in a few weeks.\\n\\n[**\\\\[ Learn More About Supermini \\\\]**](https://akash.network/supermini/)&nbsp;\\n\\nPlease visit our [new website and sign up for our newsletter](https://akash.network/) to get announcements and articles first. Join our [Telegram](https://t.me/AkashNW) channel and add us on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/akashnet_)\\\\--we\u2019d love to connect with you!&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Q1 Recap &amp; Special Unveil&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Greetings,&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-04-20T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Updates&quot;],[0,&quot;News&quot;],[0,&quot;Product&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Greg Osuri&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.3cS5WjXX.jpg&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,2560],&quot;height&quot;:[0,1696],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;jpg&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-q1-recap-updates/banner-image.jpg&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;battling-covid-19-with-blockchain-ai-and-cloud-computing/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;battling-covid-19-with-blockchain-ai-and-cloud-computing&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620921613-og.png)\\n\\nWe\u2019re just beginning to experience the \u201cnew normal\u201d of lockdowns, quarantines, and social distancing, of a complete disruption to our way of living and our way of working. Each week, we have more colleagues, neighbors, friends, and loved ones getting infected, or felled, by a virus we still don\u2019t fully understand.\\n\\n**Leveraging Blockchain, AI, Machine Learning, and Cloud Computing**\\n\\nFirst detected on December 31st, 2019, in the Chinese town of Wuhan, it wasn\u2019t too long ago on March 11th that the World Health Organization (WHO) declared the coronavirus outbreak a pandemic. Throughout the month of March, COVID-19 progressively wreaked havoc around the world, with the number of global cases surpassing 750,000, and over 36,000 deaths. Italy has been the worst affected, and the U.S. has become the new epicenter of the infection with over 160,700 cases and 3,000 deaths. Infections and deaths continue to climb.\\n\\nOn March 25th, the government of India put its 1.3 billion people on the strictest and most severe lockdown yet, and in the absence of community transmission. A third of the world\u2019s population is now under lockdown, with economies around the world in various stages of paralysis or breakdown.\\n\\nThe global fight against coronavirus requires that doctors, scientists, researchers, and governments are able to track, collect, integrate, model, and analyze disparate verified data sources that can be trusted. The most promising coordinated efforts to battle the virus are those that leverage blockchain technology to securely and anonymously capture and integrate massive public and private data sets, and harness the powerful modeling and computational analysis of artificial intelligence, machine learning, and deep learning fueled by massive cloud computing resources.\\n\\n**Blockchain Enabled Capture and Tracking of Verified Data**\\n\\nWith a worldwide outbreak, real-time data needs to be quickly and securely shared across continents, countries, and teams. Given the decentralized, permissionless, and privacy characteristics of the technology, the World Health Organization (WHO) chose to build its \u201cverifiable information highway\u201d project on blockchain technology.\\n\\nTo develop the project, named MiPasa, the WHO partnered with corporations like IBM, Oracle, and Microsoft; academic institutions like John Hopkins University; and U.S., Canadian, European, and Chinese national health institutions. MiPasa leverages [IBM Blockchain](https://www.ibm.com/blockchain/platform?utm_medium=OSocial&amp;utm_source=Blog&amp;utm_content=000026VG&amp;utm_term=10005805&amp;utm_id=MiPasa+project+and+IBM+Blockchain+team+on+open+data+platform+to+support+Covid-19+response+In+Text&amp;cm_mmc=OSocial_Blog-_-Blockchain+and+Strategic+Alliances_Blockchain-_-WW_WW-_-MiPasa+project+and+IBM+Blockchain+team+on+open+data+platform+to+support+Covid-19+response+In+Text&amp;cm_mmca1=000026VG&amp;cm_mmca2=10005805) and is a distributed ledger technology (DLT) based platform built on Hyperledger Fabric.\\n\\nAs a global data capture, integration, and communication platform, it will aid in faster and more reliable early detection of COVID-19 carriers and virus hotspots. Utilizing advanced and powerful data analytics and privacy tools, with a dedicated user app, MiPasa\u2019s platform enables private and anonymized data sharing between individuals, state authorities, and health institutions.\\n\\nMiPasa validates data in three ways:\\n\\n- Reconciliation of disparate data sources from WHO, CDC, and others\\n- Ensuring new data entered into the system matches the original\\n- Reports from the public of inconsistencies or bad data\\n\\nBeing able to collect and analyze verified, trusted, and validated data about the virus\u2019 spread will help us better coordinate and improve efforts to contain it.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620921613-og.png)\\n\\n**Accelerating the Search for a Vaccine with AI, ML, and DL**\\n\\nWhen Chinese scientists decoded the genome sequence of the coronavirus, dubbed SARS-CoV-2, and posted the results in a public database on January 10th, researchers and biotech companies raced to find a vaccine. By leveraging AI, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning, several biotech firms already have clinical trials underway.\\n\\nIn just three hours, Inovio Pharmaceuticals, a biotech company in San Diego, developed a DNA-based vaccine called INO-4800 with its SynCon machine learning system. The vaccine is progressing rapidly through preclinical, animal, and human clinical trials later this year. Another company, Moderna Therapeutics, has its mRNA-1273 vaccine ready for a clinical trial after only twenty three days.\\n\\nScientists recently set IBM\u2019s Summit, the world\u2019s fastest supercomputer, to work running thousands of simulations to find drug compounds that could fight the coronavirus. Housed at the Oak Ridge National Laboratory in Tennessee, the supercomputer screened thousands of chemical compounds and found seven that could potentially treat the SARS-CoV-2 virus, by binding to the virus\u2019 \u201cS-protein\u201d and rendering it ineffective.\\n\\n**Cloud Computing, at Scale and Distributed**\\n\\nMachine Learning, Deep Learning, and Artificial Intelligence workloads take enormous computing power. To provide COVID-19 researchers worldwide with free access to the world\u2019s most powerful high performance computing resources and accelerate the pace of research to stop the virus, The White House announced the launch of the [COVID-19 High Performance Computing Consortium](https://www.ibm.com/covid19/hpc-consortium) on March 23rd, 2019, a public-private project led by The White House, the U.S. Department of Energy, and IBM, and including Amazon, Google, Microsoft, and HP; academic institutions like MIT, and government agencies like the National Science Foundation and NASA.\\n\\nThrough the Consortium, a number of institutions\u2019 supercomputers and advanced computing systems--in addition to horsepower from the three biggest cloud-computing services: Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud--will be made available to researchers rushing to contain the virus and accelerate treatment discoveries, enabling them to process enormous amounts of calculations in hours or days, instead of weeks or months.\\n\\nFolding@Home, a distributed computing project, is leveraging a vast network of volunteered computers to aid in the battle against COVID-19. At 470 petaFLOPS, it has more computing power than the world\u2019s top seven supercomputers combined.\\n\\nLate in February as the virus started to spread, the Folding@Home project enlisted volunteers to donate their computers\u2019 unused compute to help accelerate the development of life-saving therapies, in collaboration with multiple laboratories around the world. Just in the last two weeks of March 2020, there has been a ~1,200% increase in contributors, with 400,000 new members signing up.\\n\\nLeveraging the strength of a distributed network of computing power, Folding@home\u2019s 470 petaFLOPS is helping scientists research ways to block the COVID-19 virus from attaching to human cells.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620921613-og.png)\\n\\n**Fighting Future Outbreaks**\\n\\nNow imagine a future where there is a decentralized, permissionless, and open cloud--a supercloud--made up of a network of 8.5 million data centers, and a global network of in-home supercomputers.\\n\\nParticipants in such an immense and distributed cloud could mobilize to securely and safely capture, integrate, and share vast amounts of public and anonymized private data sets asynchronously and in real-time around the world, to help track and stop future outbreaks before they progress. This same supercloud could provide much lower cost and underutilized computing to aid health organizations, governments, scientists, and clinicians to accelerate efforts to find a cure, and prevent future outbreaks.\\n\\nAt Akash, we\u2019re building this future.\\n\\nWe\u2019re developing Supercloud, the world\u2019s first decentralized cloud computing marketplace, to unlock the unused compute of those 8.5 million data centers and a network of in-home Superminis. We\u2019re currently underway on production of the Supermini, a powerful portable server and supercomputer. Built on blockchain technology, Supercloud and Supermini also provide organizations and individuals sovereignty and privacy over their data.\\n\\nEscalating cloud costs from the major cloud service providers make running machine learning, deep learning, and artificial intelligence workloads increasingly expensive and cost-prohibitive for startups, academic institutions, researchers, and clinicians. Up to 90% lower in cost, Akash Supercloud is a faster, better, more secure, and lower cost alternative to cloud service providers.\\n\\nWe\u2019ll be sharing more about our Supercloud and Supermini in the coming weeks. For now, here\u2019s a teaser for our Supermini.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620921613-og.png)\\n\\n[**Learn More About Supercloud**](https://akash.network/)\\n\\n**Join Our** [**Telegram**](https://t.me/AkashNW) **for Updates**\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Battling COVID-19 with Blockchain, AI, and Cloud Computing&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;We\u2019re just beginning to experience the \u201cnew normal\u201d of lockdowns, quarantines, and social distancing, of a complete disruption to our way of living and our way of working. Each week, we have more colleagues, neighbors, friends, and loved ones getting infected, or felled, by a virus we still don\u2019t fully understand.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-04-01T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Insights&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Insights&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Maly Ly&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.DoH4g0-5.jpg&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,300],&quot;height&quot;:[0,218],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;jpg&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/battling-covid-19-with-blockchain-ai-and-cloud-computing/banner-image.jpg&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;reducing-cloud-costs-for-machine-learning/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;reducing-cloud-costs-for-machine-learning&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;The full global economic impact of the coronavirus is hard to put into words or fancy graphs.&nbsp; At best, we can guess with some degree of confidence what a multi-trillion dollar stimulus package and unlimited money printing will do in the mid and long term to prop up the economy. But we know for certain that technology startups like ours, especially those at early and growth stage, need to be more focused and vigilant than ever, as we don\u2019t have billions in cash of runway and a safety net.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922425-reducing-1.png)\\n\\nThere are many examples of companies being forged in times of chaos (dot com crash, \u201809 recession, etc), and this time is no different.&nbsp; Resilience matters because it demonstrates your team\u2019s adaptability to changing environments, and today, if you\u2019re a big data company (ML, AI, DL), you\u2019re confronted with a multitude of challenges.\\n\\n**Challenges with Cost Reduction in Machine Learning**  \\n  \\nFirst, focus on what's valuable for your customers right now as their priorities have most likely shifted in an economic downturn.&nbsp; Your company's value proposition, at a high level, does two things:\\n\\n1.  Helps increase revenue\\n    \\n2.  Helps reduce costs\\n    \\n\\nGenerally, increasing revenue holds more weight, but during economic uncertainty and a looming recession, reducing costs becomes critical.&nbsp; With traditional companies, there are ways to minimize COGS (inexpensive raw materials, better rates with suppliers, etc.), but for machine learning companies that rely on cloud computing, options are few and inflexible.&nbsp; Costs can increase exponentially due to an increase in volume, a code configuration change, or vendor lock in.&nbsp; Simply migrating to different Cloud Service Providers isn\u2019t simple or inexpensive_._  \\n  \\nWith 25% of ML/AI\u2019s revenue spent on cloud resources, reducing costs will benefit your margins, and ML/AI margins aren\u2019t as attractive to VCs if you\u2019re fundraising.&nbsp; Relative to SaaS companies with 70%-80% margin benchmarks, ML/AI are mirroring that of service companies at 50-60% margins ([A16Z on new business of AI](https://a16z.com/2020/02/16/the-new-business-of-ai-and-how-its-different-from-traditional-software/)).&nbsp; Additionally, SaaS solutions can be sold as subscriptions for recurring revenue, ensuring longer client retention.  \\n  \\nFor machine learning companies, there are many aspects that hinder margins, like model inference, training, and rich media. With high cloud operations costs and more demanding software, cloud bills are acute pain points for ML companies with limited options.&nbsp;&nbsp;\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922443-reducing-2.png)\\n\\nCloud costs have a compounding annual growth rate of 43.6% through 2022, eroding&nbsp; healthy growth and margins for growth stage ML companies with a minimum annual cloud compute spend in the six-figures. There have been few alternatives to the CSP oligopoly.  \\n  \\nWithin this market context, there are 8.4 million data centers with an estimated 85% of server capacity underutilized.&nbsp;  \\n  \\nTo provide an alternative to the cloud oligopoly and to leverage this underutilized capacity from data centers, Akash is developing the Supercloud, the world\u2019s first and only decentralized peer-to-peer cloud marketplace for serverless compute and services, enabling any data center and anyone with a computer to become a cloud provider by offering their unused compute cycles in a safe and frictionless marketplace.  \\n  \\n**How Akash Can Help**  \\n  \\nOn Akash\u2019s platform, developers (tenants) _set_ their own prices and allow cloud providers to _bid_ for the workload in a reverse auction.&nbsp; Coupled with our economics, we\u2019re able to save up to 10x on your cloud compute bill, and help cloud providers earn up to 4X more than AWS ([_Akash Token Economics_](https://akash.network/blog/2020/02/05/an-evolution-of-akash-network-token-economics/) _and_ [_Research_](https://akash.network/static/akash-econ.pdf)_)_.&nbsp;&nbsp;  \\n  \\nML/AI companies (or anyone with a computer) can become a node in our network to sell their excess compute, providing an additional income source and greater flexibility to ramp up or down based on your needs with:\\n\\n*   no vendor lock-in agreements\\n    \\n*   exponential savings\\n    \\n*   increased efficiency and productivity&nbsp;&nbsp;\\n    \\n\\nFor developers, we\u2019ll soon be announcing more about Akash\u2019s Supermini, a plug-and-earn portable server and supercomputer for the home packed with 512 CUDA cores with 4x NVIDIA maxwell GPUs.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922460-akashsuperminiconceptrenderday1-1024x576.jpg)&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Reducing Cloud Costs for Machine Learning&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;The full global economic impact of the coronavirus is hard to put into words or fancy graphs. At best, we can guess with some degree of confidence what a multi-trillion dollar stimulus package and unlimited money printing will do in the mid and long term to prop up the economy.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-03-25T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Insights&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Insights&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Boz Menzalji&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.BVQ8JEL-.jpeg&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1024],&quot;height&quot;:[0,805],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;jpg&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/reducing-cloud-costs-for-machine-learning/banner-image.jpeg&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-partners-with-solana-to-bring-web-scale-smart-contracts-to-supercloud/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;akash-partners-with-solana-to-bring-web-scale-smart-contracts-to-supercloud&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;Today, I\u2019m excited to announce that we\u2019ve partnered with Solana to bring web-scale smart contracts to Akash Supercloud.  \\n  \\nAkash provides a serverless platform where users can run any application currently running on the cloud while leveraging the benefits of decentralized computation enabled by the Akash blockchain.&nbsp;  \\n  \\nAkash leverages blockchain for provisioning and settlement but deployment happens off-chain. This limits Akash\u2019s users from running verifiable smart contracts as the scalability envelope is not designed for on-chain execution.  \\n  \\nSolana is the most performant permissionless blockchain in the world. On current iterations of the Solana Testnet, a network of 200 physically distinct nodes supports a sustained throughput of more than 50,000 transactions per second when running with GPUs. These performance numbers are unheard of in crypto.  \\n  \\nWhen we were exploring potential ways to enable smart contracts, Solana was the only platform that met our requirements.  \\n  \\nBy interoperating with Solana, Akash users will soon be able to run secure and scalable smart contracts on Solana\u2019s hyper-performance platform and pay using Akash Token (AKT). Whereas Solana\u2019s users will soon be able to run distributed applications (like machine learning or web apps) and settle using Solana Token (SOL) on Akash.  \\n  \\nAdditionally, Akash will provide first-class support for Solana\u2019s validators to run nodes in highly secure and scalable environments.  \\n  \\nCurrently, validators have little to no option other than to run their nodes on centralized cloud service providers like Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, or Google Cloud.&nbsp;  \\n  \\n60% of Ethereum nodes currently run on AWS and other centralized cloud service providers. This threatens decentralization at the core.  \\n  \\nValidators have few alternatives and are forced to make a massive upfront investment in talent, servers, and flexible scalability or choose the big cloud.  \\n  \\nBy leveraging Akash decentralized cloud, Solana\u2019s validators will no longer be required to do this, and they\u2019ll be able to stay decentralized.  \\n  \\nThis is a win-win scenario for both Solana\u2019s and Akash\u2019s users.  \\n  \\nSince the beginning, I\u2019ve been a big fan of Solana, and I\u2019m excited for what this partnership will bring to our users.&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Akash Partners with Solana to Bring Web-Scale Smart Contracts to Supercloud&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Today, I\u2019m excited to announce that we\u2019ve partnered with Solana to bring web-scale smart contracts to Akash Supercloud. Akash provides a serverless platform where users can run any application currently running on the cloud while leveraging the benefits of decentralized computation enabled by the Akash blockchain.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-03-13T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Partners&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Partners&quot;],[0,&quot;Product&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Greg Osuri&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.XJpF33Ac.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1440],&quot;height&quot;:[0,750],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/akash-partners-with-solana-to-bring-web-scale-smart-contracts-to-supercloud/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;the-rise-of-tokens-in-blockchain/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;the-rise-of-tokens-in-blockchain&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\n**What is a Token?**\\n\\nIn the blockchain ecosystem, a token is an asset that represents a certain value, stake, or voting right and one that can be digitally transferred between two people. Tokens serve as incentives that are usually sold by a company through a public sale (Initial Exchange Offering), or as a reward for user behavior that benefits the issuing platform.\\n\\nSpecific rights awarded to a token holder include\\\\[efn_note\\\\]&nbsp;S+C Intelligence, Token Rights: Key Considerations in Cryptoeconomic Design.\\\\[/efn_note\\\\]:\\n\\n- **Profit or fees:** A token can entitle its holders to a portion of fees or profits from using the network. It\u2019s similar to a company stock, though generally such tokens do not assign voting rights.\\n- **Access rights:** Tokens can be used to determine access to a network and to pay transaction fees. Usually they are not the sole means of payment and other currencies can be used, but small amounts of the specific token are required to use the platform at a minimum.\\n- **Governance rights:** This type of token entitles its holders to influencing the direction of the platform/protocol, including feature selection, vendor selection, etc. It is a basic feature of distributed autonomous organizations.\\n- **Block creation rights:** This type of token is most commonly found in a proof-of-stake system. Token holders can become block validators, and their&nbsp; chances to become the validator roughly equal to their proportion of tokens staked.\\n\\n**The Primary Types of Tokens**\\n\\nAt a higher level, tokens are generally categorized along the following types. Based on their categorization and the financial interest involved, they are treated differently by regulatory bodies.\\n\\n**Payment tokens** are synonymous with cryptocurrencies. They don\u2019t have further functions or links to other development projects. Tokens may in some cases only develop the necessary functionality and become accepted as a means of payment over a period of time. Examples for payment tokens include Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (Ether).\\n\\n**Utility tokens** are intended to provide digital access to an application or service. They help in building an internal economy within the system, e.g., by rewarding its users to verify transactions within the blockchain. Utility tokens can give the holders the opportunity to vote on the network\u2019s overall stability and security.\\n\\nUtility tokens do not fall under securities treatment from a financial and tax perspective. However, with limited token supply and relevant utility of the token, its price can increase significantly due to supply-demand discrepancies. Examples for utility tokens include Basic Attention Token (BAT) and Akash Token (AKT). At Akash, AKT is core to [our token economic model](https://akash.network/static/akash-econ.pdf), and leveraged to secure and scale our distributed cloud computing marketplace.\\n\\n**Security, or asset tokens** award a token holder the right to implement investment interests, e.g., by participating in a legal entity\u2019s earnings streams or via receiving dividends or interest payments. To determine whether a token falls into this category, the Howey test is applied: If a transaction is an investment of money in a common enterprise and there is an expectation of profit from the work of the promoters or third party, then the underlying token is a security token\\\\[efn_note\\\\]https://www.investopedia.com/terms/h/howey-test.asp.\\\\[/efn\\\\_note\\\\].\\n\\nIn terms of their economic function, the tokens are analogous to equities, bonds or derivatives. Like traditional financial instruments, they are regulated by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission\\\\[efn_note\\\\]https://www.sec.gov/ICO.\\\\[/efn\\\\_note\\\\]. Examples for security tokens include Blockchain Capital (BCAP) and Science Blockchain (SCI).\\n\\n**How Tokens are Used in Blockchain**\\n\\nIssuing tokens enables a platform to raise the funds necessary to implement projects, and it can also engage individuals with the projects over time. Tokens may be used to validate transactions and create new blocks on a blockchain.\\n\\nFor example, platforms that leverage a proof of stake consensus mechanism require the staking of tokens to verify transactions. In return for commiting tokens to staking, individuals receive staking rewards and potentially a share of transaction fees from the platform\u2019s offering\\\\[efn_note\\\\]https://blog.akash.network/2020/02/11/brave-new-world-of-staking-a-primer-on-proof-of-stake-pos/.\\\\[/efn\\\\_note\\\\].\\n\\n**The Rise of Initial Exchange Offerings (IEO) and Security Token Offerings (STO)**\\n\\nThe landscape of token offerings has changed significantly in the past few years. During 2017 and 2018, a large number of Initial Coin Offerings (ICO) took place. Companies were able to raise $5+ billion in 2017 and $20+ billion in 2018 through ICOs. ICOs have significantly declined in frequency and valuation, due to concerns about lacking due diligence, investor protection via regulation,&nbsp; and even fraudulent activities\\\\[efn_note\\\\]https://fortune.com/2018/05/12/ico-blockchain/.\\\\[/efn\\\\_note\\\\]. As a result, the number of ICOs declined over 70% in 2019, and the amount raised dropped by over 90% compared to 2019.\\n\\nAt the same time, Initial Exchange Offerings (IEO) and Security Token Offerings (STO) have significantly increased in popularity.\\n\\nIn IEOs, tokens with a specified use case such as accessing the blockchain\u2019s solution or verifying its transactions, are offered through an exchange, rather than directly to investors. This ensures that the exchange performs due diligence before listing the token, thus ensuring that dodgy tokens are weeded out. After the IEO, tokens should be immediately tradeable\\\\[efn_note\\\\]https://thenextweb.com/hardfork/2019/03/21/initial-exchange-offering-ieo-ico/.\\\\[/efn\\\\_note\\\\].\\n\\nIn STOs, the use case for a token doesn\u2019t have to be specified in detail, all tokens are backed up by specific assets. Tokens additionally offer legal rights such as voting and revenue distribution, and are subject to regulation. In essence, security tokens are investment contracts that represent legal ownership of a physical or digital asset, and the blockchain is used to verify ownership.\\n\\nThe key difference between IEOs and STOs is that IEOs are for projects that launch utility tokens, which allow the token holder to leverage the network they are issued on and to participate in voting. STOs on the other hand are very similar to traditional investment contracts. In short, STOs have to pass the Howey test, while IEOs have to fail it.\\n\\nBoth IEOs and STOs have shown strong growth in recent years. Binance, the largest cryptocurrency exchange in the world in terms of trading volume, pioneered token sales via IEOs, with highly successful initial token sales starting in late 2018. In the first half of 2019 alone, IEOs increased by 6000% to over 120, via 15+ launchpads. The first STO took place with Blockchain Capital in 2017. Since then, the annual count of STOs jumped from 5 in 2017 to 35 and 55 in 2018 and 2019, respectively\\\\[efn_note\\\\]https://blockstate.com/global-sto-study-en/.\\\\[/efn\\\\_note\\\\].\\n\\nThe wide ranging impact of ICO busts in 2017/2018 brought valuable learnings to token offerings, reflected in IEOs\u2019 and STOs\u2019 improved transparency, security and liquidity. With the accelerating adoption of proof of stake consensus, more organizations are adopting novel ways to leverage token economics to build and scale their networks.\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;The Rise of Tokens in Blockchain&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;What is a Token?&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-03-06T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Insights&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Insights&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Maly Ly&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.BgP_RDN8.jpg&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1024],&quot;height&quot;:[0,683],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;jpg&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/the-rise-of-tokens-in-blockchain/banner-image.jpg&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;how-blockchain-is-transforming-cloud-computing/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;how-blockchain-is-transforming-cloud-computing&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;Today\u2019s market for cloud computing is heavily consolidated, with the top 4 cloud service providers, Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, and Alibaba Cloud dominating 70% of the entire market as of the end of 2019 .\\n\\nIn this oligopolistic market structure, there is decreasing competition and over time, less choice and flexibility for organizations needing cloud computing[1](https://blog.akash.network/2020/02/26/how-blockchain-is-transforming-cloud/#easy-footnote-bottom-1-631). Early on, these organizations get locked into the technology frameworks and contracts of the CSPs as they scale and as their cloud infrastructure and computing needs grow.\\n\\nWith over 80% of enterprise workloads projected to be in the cloud in 2020, there is increased risk of market power abuse and distortions, with broad ripple effects across a range of industries[2](https://blog.akash.network/2020/02/26/how-blockchain-is-transforming-cloud/#easy-footnote-bottom-2-631).&nbsp;\\n\\n**Massive supply-side inefficiencies**\\n\\nOn the cloud capacity supply side, a massive inefficiency is noteworthy: on average, data centers worldwide are running at only 70% utilization of their total capacity. Companies that have data centers, in particular ones that are not participating in the cloud market as suppliers, on average overspend 30% on their total cost of ownership of the required cloud capacity[3](https://blog.akash.network/2020/02/26/how-blockchain-is-transforming-cloud/#easy-footnote-bottom-3-631). This allocation inefficiency provides a huge opportunity to increase utilization, amortize cost, and reduce cloud compute pricing.&nbsp;\\n\\n**Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning accelerates cloud compute demand**\\n\\nArtificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) are driving the accelerating growth for computing capacity. The economic impact of AI and ML companies across all industries cannot be overstated. They are projected to create an additional 15% of global GDP by 2030. Growth of the AI and ML market is massive, with annual revenues expected to surpass $200 billion in the next 5 years, from $20 billion just a couple of years ago. The US alone now has over 2,100 AI companies, China 1,000+, with the UK, Canada, and India following at 400, 300, and 150 respectively[4](https://blog.akash.network/2020/02/26/how-blockchain-is-transforming-cloud/#easy-footnote-bottom-4-631).&nbsp;&nbsp;\\n\\nThe infrastructure requirements driven by this growth are significant: the amount of data processed through artificial intelligence algorithms will reach 1.4 zettabytes (1 zettabyte is 1 trillion gigabytes) by 2025.&nbsp;\\n\\n**Key benefits of cloud computing for AI and ML companies**\\n\\nThe cloud brings a number of benefits to AI and ML companies, especially for earlier stage startups:\\n\\n*   **Startup cost and scale:**&nbsp;The standard pay per use model eliminates costly startup investments and allows for accommodating spikes in workloads based on data volume. While the lowered startup cost is beneficial to just about any early stage company, the ability to accommodate peak workloads flexibly is particularly valuable to ML companies, for example, when training data models.\\n    \\n*   **Easy access:**&nbsp;The cloud allows easy access for companies of all sizes to experiment with ML, and accommodate scaling of capacity when projects go into production, and demand for the new service increases.&nbsp;\\n    \\n*   **Ease of use:**&nbsp;Through the cloud, companies can get access to advanced ML options and tools without requiring large-scale advanced AI and data science expertise. This enables companies to experiment with AI tools with small teams to validate the benefits before committing to a substantial ramp up of an AI/ML organization.&nbsp;\\n    \\n\\nThe main benefits from cloud computing for companies evolve with a company\u2019s experience in AI/ML, the volume and size of AI/ML projects, and the internal technical expertise a company assembles to solve AI/ML problems.&nbsp;\\n\\n**Why blockchain will transform cloud computing**\\n\\nThe benefits of cloud computing to companies throughout their lifecycle can be enhanced significantly through blockchain technology. In fact, the main virtues of blockchain make it possible to address unfavorable market dynamics, reduce supply-side inefficiencies, and enhance the usability, scalability, and total cost for companies.&nbsp;&nbsp;\\n\\n**Market efficiency:**&nbsp;Through blockchain technology, the marketplace for cloud compute capacity opens up for companies and individuals that have surplus data capacity. Blockchain allows them to become suppliers of cloud capacity, and companies/users in need of cloud capacity can flexibly purchase the surplus capacity at a fraction of the prices offered by the major cloud service providers. The outcome is highly efficient utilization of data center capacity, as well as a significantly lower market price for every gigabyte of cloud computing capacity.&nbsp;\\n\\n**Security and transparency:**&nbsp;Blockchain\u2019s underlying protocol and consensus mechanism ensures a maximum level of security for every transaction and underlying data, as well as establishing transparency and accountability for every participant. Through a distributed ledger, a permanent audit trail is created that protects the anonymity of every participant, while maintaining a record of every transaction.&nbsp;\\n\\n**Decentralization benefits:**&nbsp; The decentralized secured nature of blockchain enhances the overall security of cloud computing. Activating unused data center capacity around the world enables cloud capacity to be leveraged closest to the user and their technologies and devices, reducing latency and faster disaster recovery.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;\\n\\n**What\u2019s next**\\n\\nCloud computing has hit a new peak in 2020 due in large part to the accelerating growth of AI and ML technologies that require massive computing capacity. Blockchain provides a powerful solution to addressing current inefficiencies that impact pricing, innovation, and cost structure for users and suppliers. At Akash Network, we\u2019ve leveraged blockchain to build the world\u2019s first decentralized peer-to-peer cloud marketplace for serverless computing, enabling any data center and anyone with a computer to easily sell their unused compute.\\n\\nWith the advent of blockchain-powered cloud offerings, there will be more secure, more flexible, and significantly lower cost alternatives to the top 4 CSPs. More efficiently utilized data centers will achieve better utilization and amortization of their capital expenditures, and in-home innovations like the Helium Hot Spot and the&nbsp;[Akash Supermini server](https://akash.network/supermini/reserve)&nbsp;will enable individual users to participate in the marketplace.&nbsp;\\n\\n1.  Forrester Research 2019, \u201c[Predictions 2020: Cloud Computing](https://blog.akash.network/2020/02/26/how-blockchain-is-transforming-cloud/#easy-footnote-1-631)\u201d\\n    \\n2.  LogicMonitor\u2019s [Cloud Vision 2020: The Future of the Cloud Study](https://blog.akash.network/2020/02/26/how-blockchain-is-transforming-cloud/#easy-footnote-2-631)\\n    \\n3.  Data Center Dynamics Whitepaper, \u201c[Avoiding costs from oversizing data center and network room infrastructure](https://blog.akash.network/2020/02/26/how-blockchain-is-transforming-cloud/#easy-footnote-3-631)\u201d\\n    \\n4.  McKinsey Global Institute, \u201c[Notes from the AI Frontier: Modeling the Impact of AI on the World Economy](https://blog.akash.network/2020/02/26/how-blockchain-is-transforming-cloud/#easy-footnote-4-631)\u201d&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;How Blockchain is Transforming Cloud Computing&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Today\u2019s market for cloud computing is heavily consolidated, with the top 4 cloud service providers, Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, and Alibaba Cloud dominating 70% of the entire market as of the end of 2019 .&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-02-27T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Insights&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Insights&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Maly Ly&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.D5VNGRTk.jpg&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1024],&quot;height&quot;:[0,684],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;jpg&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/how-blockchain-is-transforming-cloud-computing/banner-image.jpg&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;a-founders-guide-to-the-secs-safe-harbor-proposal-for-utility-tokens/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;a-founders-guide-to-the-secs-safe-harbor-proposal-for-utility-tokens&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\nIt\u2019s no secret the regulatory regime in the US hasn\u2019t been friendly to budding decentralized projects. This is because the SEC has tried to apply Howey analysis to crypto projects that effectively classify any token that requires management as a Security.\\n\\nSince the token value of an early stage crypto project depends on the efforts of the team to achieve decentralization, the tokens for such projects are classified as securities under the Howey lense.\\n\\nSecurities have limitations for distribution. One such limitation is purchasability. For example, the tokens can only be purchased by accredited investors, meaning purchasers need to have at least $1 million in liquid assets. This limits users from purchasing tokens to use them.\\n\\nThis created a regulatory catch-22. Projects need to distribute tokens to achieve decentralization but cannot do so in a compliant manner.\\n\\nRecently, SEC Commissioner Hester Peirce proposed a&nbsp;[framework](https://www.sec.gov/news/speech/peirce-remarks-blockress-2020-02-06)&nbsp;that allows promising decentralized projects to distribute (sale/drop) tokens in the US and avoid being regulated as securities as long as they satisfy a set of five conditions.\\n\\nDisclaimer: I\u2019m not a legal professional and this is not legal advice; this is merely my analysis and opinion.\\n\\n## 1\\\\. Meaningful Decentralization in Three Years\\n\\nThe initial project must enable the network to achieve meaningful decentralization in three years, upon which the token will no longer be considered a security. To assess decentralization, the network should not be controlled by a single individual or a group of individuals, or entities under common control\u2013this goes beyond just preventing 51% attacks.\\n\\nAnother assessment would be if the token is actually used to exchange value pertaining to the network by the end of three years. For example, a token used to trade compute cycles or storage is moving value in the network.\\n\\n## 2\\\\. Disclose Key Information\\n\\nSince three years is a long period, the team should disclose key information to address asymmetry concerns and should be on a freely accessible public website. A minimum set of disclosure falls into three key categories: protocol design, token metrics and economics, and operational transparency.\\n\\n### 2.1 Network\\n\\n- Any key information that affects the token value should be disclosed.\\n- The source code and all the transaction history must be made public.\\n- The token buyers need to clearly understand the purpose and the mechanics of the network.\\n- The team should encourage the development of block explorers, dashboards, and wallets.\\n- The team must explain the launch and supply process for the token.\\n- There has to be a governance mechanism for making changes to the protocol.\\n\\n### 2.2 Token Mechanics\\n\\nThe Team must disclose the below information pertaining to the token:\\n\\n- The number of tokens to be issued in the initial allocation\\n- The total number of tokens to be created\\n- The release schedule for the tokens\\n- The total number of tokens outstanding\\n- The token mining (generation) protocol\\n- Token burning protocol\\n- The process for validating transactions\\n- The consensus mechanism\\n\\n### 2.3 Operational Transparency\\n\\n- The team must publish a roadmap with the development plan, the current state, and the timeline for development and how and when the team plans to achieve network maturity.\\n- The team must explain how they\u2019ll finance the roadmap.\\n- The team must disclose the team member profiles with names, relevant experience, qualifications, and skills.\\n- The team must disclose the number of tokens owned by each member of the team with the transferability (lockup) limitations.\\n- The team must disclose any time a member sells 5% or of their originally held tokens over any period of time.\\n- The team must periodically publish development updates or updates to token economics or network protocol.\\n\\n## 3\\\\. The Token Must Have Utility\\n\\nThe token should be sold for facilitating access to, participation on, or the development of the network. Meaning the safe harbor does not apply for debt or digitized securities (STO for eg).\\n\\n## 4.&nbsp; Ensure Token Liquidity\\n\\nThe project team should ensure sufficient liquidity for the token. If the team chooses to secure secondary trading of the token on a trading platform (OTC for eg), the platform should comply with state and federal laws relating to money transmission, anti-money laundering (AML), and consumer protection. SEC recognizes secondary trading is necessary to get tokens into the hands of people that will use them, and to offer developers and people who provide services on the network a way to exchange their tokens for fiat or cryptocurrency. The team should also disclose to the public any secondary trading platforms on which the token trades.\\n\\n## 5\\\\. The Team Would Have to File a Notice of Reliance.&nbsp;\\n\\nThe final condition is that a team member must file a notice of reliance on EDGAR within fifteen days of the date of the first token sale in reliance on the safe harbor.&nbsp; As part of the filing, a member of the team would have to attest that all the conditions of the safe harbor are satisfied.\\n\\n## Conclusion\\n\\nI believe this proposal is a great first step towards creating a healthy regulatory climate for decentralizing innovation in the US and around the world. If you see an error in my analysis or would like to discuss further, please reach out to me on twitter at&nbsp;[@GregOsuri.](https://twitter.com/GregOsuri)\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620921613-og.png)\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;A Founder's Guide to The SEC's Safe Harbor Proposal for Utility Tokens&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;It\u2019s no secret the regulatory regime in the US hasn\u2019t been friendly to budding decentralized projects. This is because the SEC has tried to apply Howey analysis to crypto projects that effectively classify any token that requires management as a Security.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-02-19T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Insights&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Insights&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Greg Osuri&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.BLnujRfn.jpg&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,650],&quot;height&quot;:[0,489],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;jpg&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/a-founders-guide-to-the-secs-safe-harbor-proposal-for-utility-tokens/banner-image.jpg&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;brave-new-world-of-staking-a-primer-on-proof-of-stake-pos/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;brave-new-world-of-staking-a-primer-on-proof-of-stake-pos&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\nProof of Stake (PoS) mechanisms are steadily expanding in their use across a variety of blockchain applications. Superiority in their energy efficiency, lower barriers to entry, and governance aspects like a lower tendency for centralization make PoS an increasingly popular alternative to Proof of Work (PoW), which is leveraged to reach consensus in current iterations of Bitcoin and [Ethereum](https://www.brokerchoices.com/ethereum-ira/), for example.\\n\\nStaking market capitalization is approaching $18 billion, an 18-month high, with the total value locked in staking at an all-time high of over $11 billion. About 50% of the highest-valued cryptocurrencies by market cap are utilizing a PoS&nbsp;[mechanism](https://www.stakingrewards.com/journal/research/Proof-of-Work-vs-Proof-of-Stake-Research-report/). Several major projects are in progress to transition into PoS, for example, Ethereum. These developments are driven by a number of advantages that PoS brings compared to the historically more dominant Proof of Work algorithms.\\n\\n**Reaching Consensus, from Work to Stake**\\n\\nIn blockchain, a consensus mechanism ensures that every transaction on the blockchain is verified and all participants in the blockchain agree on the status of the ledger. There are various consensus mechanisms in use today. Among the most predominant ones are Proof of Work (PoW) and Proof of Stake (PoS).\\n\\nPoW requires the solving of a complex, computation-heavy problem before new transactions can be added to the blockchain. Participants with the highest computing power have the highest probability of solving the problem and thus securing the next block.\\n\\nPoW is very energy-intensive to operate, and resource consumption only intensifies as networks scale in adoption and number of transactions. Bitcoin alone is exceeding the annual energy use of a number of sizable nation states. Additionally, PoW blockchains tend to centralize, mainly driven by economies of scale in the establishment of computing power needed for mining.\\n\\nThe heavy resource and energy requirements and disadvantages of PoW have increased the popularity of Proof of Stake (PoS) consensus.\\n\\n**The Benefits of Proof of Stake**\\n\\nPoS assigns validation of the next block of transactions on the blockchain to a participant based on the number of tokens held. Instead of focusing on computing power, participants are incentivized to maximize their staked token holdings in the blockchain\u2019s currency. Fairness is ensured through coin-age based selection or randomization processes.\\n\\nFollowing are key differences between PoS and PoW:\\n\\n- **Energy efficiency:**&nbsp;With Proof of Stake, there isn\u2019t a collective rat race to solve a complex, heavy-compute problem. As a result, PoS is significantly more energy efficient as a consensus mechanism than PoW.\\n- **Decentralization:**&nbsp;PoW fosters concentrated investments in computing power. Joining a mining pool unlocks exponential rewards for individual miners, as the concentrated mining capacity enables a disproportionately higher probability of mining the next block. In PoS, rewards are linear to the proportion of staked coins. This may lead to some centralization, but with much lower incentives than PoW.\\n- **Security:**&nbsp;In PoS networks, a bad actor would have to own 51% or more of the staked tokens to manipulate the network. This implies that the initiator of a network manipulation would also be the most negatively impacted by the damage. Further, controls like slashing of the invested stake of a bad actor removes all incentives for such behaviors.\\n- **Currency stability:**&nbsp;In PoS networks, new transactions are validated by the participants most invested in the staking currency. As a result, holding and staking the network\u2019s currency is incentivized. This contrasts to PoW networks, where heavy investments in compute power and energy are required. These investments require fiat currency, and miners have to withdraw network tokens for conversion, causing downward pressure on token valuation.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922314-hal-gatewood-ogvqxgl7xo4-unsplash.jpg)\\n\\n**A New World of Reaching Consensus**\\n\\nA number of compelling blockchain projects are leveraging PoS mechanisms to secure their networks, prevent centralization, and increase speed of consensus:\\n\\n[**Ethereum**](https://ethereum.org/)&nbsp;has been working on a transition from PoW to PoS for several years, with a first public draft spec of their Casper consensus protocol published in 2017. The main drivers for this transition are the centralization tendency and heavy energy consumption of PoW. Ethereum\u2019s Casper protocol will integrate a slashing mechanism to better secure the chain.\\n\\n[**EOS**](https://eos.io/)&nbsp;is running a delegated PoS algorithm to manage the consensus process. Delegates are selected through a continuous approval system to lead consensus. By reducing the number of validating parties through delegation, new blocks of transactions can be verified in shorter time intervals.\\n\\n[**Tezos**](https://tezos.com/)&nbsp;uses a liquid PoS algorithm that leverages both direct and delegated voting to achieve consensus. Participants with staked currency can vote directly or delegate their voting responsibilities. Through delegation, this model becomes highly scalable, as any participant who isn\u2019t able to submit a vote can simply delegate their vote.\\n\\nIn the&nbsp;[**Cosmos Network**](https://cosmos.network/)**,**&nbsp;where the Tendermint engine handles networking and consensus for each blockchain, the application layer defines the validator set. A public blockchain on Cosmos leverages a PoS mechanism if its validators are elected based on the number of coins they hold (as opposed to a private blockchain where validators are appointed by the application).\\n\\nAs part of the Cosmos ecosystem,&nbsp;[**Akash Network**](https://blog.akash.network/2020/02/05/an-evolution-of-akash-network-token-economics/)&nbsp;also leverages PoS in the form of a native currency to solve for volatility (one of the biggest challenges for adoption in crypto) while ensuring economic security of our public blockchain. The core utility of our Akash Token (AKT) acts as a staking mechanism to secure the network and normalize cloud compute prices for Akash\u2019s marketplace auction.\\n\\nThe amount of AKTs staked towards a validator defines the frequency by which the validator may propose a new block and its weight in votes to commit a block. In return for bonding (staking) to a validator, an AKT holder becomes eligible for block rewards (paid in AKT) as well as a proportion of transaction fees and service fees (paid in any of the whitelisted tokens).\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922324-pietro-jeng-n6b49ltx7nm-unsplash.jpg)\\n\\n**Opening Access for Staking Incentives**\\n\\nIn addition to stabilizing blockchains, participants in PoS blockchains can make money by staking coins. In exchange for locking up tokens, the token holders receive incentives based on the amount they stake and other parameters. At Akash, we also distribute incentives based on the length of time Akash Tokens (AKT) are locked up.\\n\\nToken holders can stake the project\u2019s tokens via a wallet, staking pool, or exchange. As new blocks are created, stakers receive staking rewards. Rewards vary for different tokens. Across 70+ tokens, Staking Rewards is tracking an average return of 13.4%.\\n\\nMore and more instruments are created to support staking, ranging from specialized wallets to staking pools. These tools focus on addressing the main barriers to entry for new participants, in particular security and ease of use.\\n\\nIn a standard PoS mechanism, stakeholders need to always be online to be eligible to produce a new block. This drives heavy power consumption and increases the risk of hacker attacks.\\n\\nThrough staking pools, token holders don\u2019t have to be online continuously. The pools need to ensure that the foundation is well controlled and block production is secured. The disadvantages to staking pools are higher risk for hacking and the lack of guidance on taxation.\\n\\n**What\u2019s Next for Proof of Stake**\\n\\nThe advantages of Proof of Stake over Proof of Work mechanisms, in particular energy efficiency, scalability, and lower tendency to centralization, have led to a rapid rise of PoS networks.\\n\\nAny residual concerns about the security of PoS blockchains, as they have not been exposed to the historically high transaction volumes of PoW, are getting addressed with continuous refinements and development in the ecosystem.\\n\\nStaking PoS blockchains and reaping investment benefits is becoming easier and more secure through wallets, staking pools, and exchanges, significantly lowering the barrier to entry for new participants. To support a rising number of applications and a steady increase in transaction volume, the proliferation of PoS is a critical step towards sustainability, scalability, and continued decentralization of the blockchain.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922332-laimannung-bnz895q8ne-unsplash-1.jpg)\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Brave New World of Staking: A Primer on Proof of Stake (PoS)&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Proof of Stake (PoS) mechanisms are steadily expanding in their use across a variety of blockchain applications.
