Superiority in their energy efficiency, lower barriers to entry, and governance aspects like a lower tendency for centralization make PoS an increasingly popular alternative to Proof of Work (PoW), which is leveraged to reach consensus in current iterations of Bitcoin and Ethereum, for example.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-02-12T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Insights&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Insights&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Maly Ly&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.GujAGjAR.jpg&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1024],&quot;height&quot;:[0,681],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;jpg&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/brave-new-world-of-staking-a-primer-on-proof-of-stake-pos/banner-image.jpg&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;an-evolution-of-akash-network-token-economics/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;an-evolution-of-akash-network-token-economics&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\nLast fall, we released our Akash Network Token Economic Model, a system that leverages Akash Token (AKT), a native currency, to solve for volatility (one of the biggest challenges for adoption in crypto) while ensuring economic security of our public blockchain. In the paper, we presented various strategies to mitigate inherent adoption challenges that face an early market economy \u2014 lack of sufficient demand from the tenants (consumers of computing), which in turn hurts demand because of lack of supply.\\n\\nWe shared a framework that can be applied to any marketplace to bootstrap early supply by subsidizing using inflation (i.e., borrowing from the future). We created a model to activate an incentive structure that not only fairly distributes but will unlock network effects to accelerate growth. With AKT, we create subsidies by borrowing from the future to create the effects of liquidity at an agreeable price point. These subsidies nurture continued network growth and lead to more liquidity, which further accelerates growth.\\n\\nIn this article, we present the market context for Akash\u2019s compelling alternative to the cloud infrastructure oligopoly, and an evolution of our Akash Network Token Economic Model. We introduce two additional powerful drivers for growth and income generation in the ecosystem\u2013the allocation of subsidies, in the form of a Subsidy Pool, and the distribution of a network dividend from a portion of the lease fees, Take Income.\\n\\n**The Cloud Infrastructure Oligopoly**\\n\\nOligopolies can result in various forms of collusion which reduce competition and lead to higher prices for consumers.\\n\\nOligopolies happen when a product or service is commoditized. With the advent of containerization, catalyzed by technologies like kubernetes, cloud computing has effectively evolved into a commodity.\\n\\nFueled by accelerated global demand for cloud computing, cloud infrastructure is projected to reach $210 billion by 2022 with four companies controlling 71% of the market\u2013Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure, and Alibaba Cloud.\\n\\nCloud computing is a concentrated market with pricing inefficiency, built on the premise that you can only source cloud capacity through a central cloud infrastructure.\\n\\nTo be competitive, technology platforms have needed to either enhance existing capabilities, introduce a novel solution to a problem, or engage in&nbsp;[anti-competitive practices](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/15/technology/amazon-aws-cloud-competition.html).\\n\\n**Breaking the Oligopoly by Decentralization**\\n\\nWithin this market context, there are 8.4 million data centers with an estimated 85% of server capacity underutilized.\\n\\nTo provide an alternative to the cloud oligopoly and to leverage this underutilized capacity from data centers, Akash is creating the Supercloud, the world\u2019s first and only decentralized peer-to-peer cloud marketplace for serverless compute and services, enabling any data center and anyone with a computer to&nbsp;[become a cloud provider](https://akash.network/docs/providers/kube)&nbsp;by offering their unused compute cycles in a safe and frictionless marketplace.\\n\\nFor a system to reach or exceed the scale of the internet, the system should improve on the foundational principles of the internet while solving for inefficiencies inadvertently introduced. We designed Akash to be a decentralized and open ecosystem that is censorship-resistant and self-sovereign.\\n\\nAkash\u2019s marketplace employs a novel reverse auction mechanism where the tenant (the buyer of computing) sets the price they\u2019re willing to pay and providers bid for the order where the compute provider that bids the lowest wins the job. This ensures that computing is offered at a price point set by a free market, determined by the forces of demand and supply.\\n\\n**Reducing The Barrier to Entry and Accelerating Growth**\\n\\nWhile there clearly is an abundant supply of computing and the Akash Platform is priming up to unlock this supply, the early stages of a market economy need to solve the demand-supply paradox of short-term undersupply, to reach market equilibrium and unlock network effects.\\n\\nTo solve the demand-supply paradox, we can use the subsidies from inflation (i.e., borrowing from the future) as described in our framework \u201c[Bootstrapping the Free Market By Borrowing From Future\u201d.](https://akash.network/blog/bootstrapping-a-free-market-by-borrowing-from-the-future/)\\n\\nAkash employs an inflation model where a portion of block rewards are captured by a subsidy pool that is distributed to achieve adoption goals depending on the stage of the network, and involves stakeholders performing challenges to claim the subsidy. These subsidy distributions and claim challenges are governed by means of community proposals that are expected to evolve as the network grows. The Subsidy Pool Rate is a governed network parameter that\u2019s subject to change based on community consensus. The proposed Subsidy Pool Rate at genesis is 50%.\\n\\n**Exponential Cost Savings by Subsidizing Supply**\\n\\nIn the first phase of Akash, we propose using \u201cexponential cost savings\u201d as the initial subsidy trigger. An exponential cost reduction (10x-15x the market) is an extremely attractive incentive for cloud users where cost remains a top industry priority for three years in a row \u2014 particularly to price-sensitive segments such as machine learning and big data.\\n\\nIn this model, the subsidies are distributed periodically based on the Subsidy Distribution Cycle network parameter, which is expected to be daily (or equivalent block periods) at genesis.\\n\\nAs a first step, a tenant asks for a low price and providers that win the bid by offering the lowest price are awarded a bounty. The bounty in the early days may be exponentially high (usually 5x \u2013 6x the cost).\\n\\nFor example, Alice wants to run a machine learning application and it costs her $10 / day today on the cloud. Alice then realizes that she gets 10 times more resources on Akash for the same price and she places a bid for $1 / day on Akash\u2019s marketplace.\\n\\nBob and Charlie are cloud providers on Akash. Bob expects to earn $5 / day for running Alice\u2019s Job and Charlie (with a better fill rate) expects to earn $6 / day.&nbsp; A fill rate is the percent of bids won.\\n\\nLet\u2019s assume the subsidy pool is at $20 / day. This Order is placed on the order book for $1 / day which receives no bids. From there on, the Ask increments every block period by using the subsidy until a provider fulfills the order&nbsp;*or*&nbsp;the subsidy pool is exhausted for that distribution cycle. Any unspent subsidy is carried on to the next cycle.\\n\\nIn our example, let\u2019s say after 4 blocks, the Ask reaches $5. Bob bids for $5 and Charlie bids for $6. Bob wins the Job and earns $5 whereas Alice pays $1. The $4 is paid to Bob from the subsidy pool and $16 is carried to the next cycle.\\n\\nAlice then posts another order for $1. With the subsidy pool at $20 / day, the pool accumulates to $36. Bob is fully utilized and cannot offer any more compute. Charlie realizes he\u2019s the only one that can fulfill the order and waits until the Ask reaches $36. Charlie now bids on the order and earns $36, 6x what he expected to earn.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922312-kawvcvsdg1vdrjavryqdd4xngc7tkhmiqqosq5wge6x9isxirvjhyp65t7molvrdh1pg93-zpmqotocxlixiaa9vuwyii0atjlvn7qwtokuty65weuia4kemgak1zeewvyqx.png)\\n\\nAlice happily posts another order for $1. Since the subsidy pool in the previous bid was won by Charlie, the subsidy pool resets to $20. Bob realizes Charlie made $36 and adds more capacity to the network, expecting to take part in the network prosperity. Bob realizes that he\u2019s the only provider and decides to wait until the Ask reaches $20.\\n\\nBut Alice is so pleased that she can\u2019t help but share her Akash experience with her friends. Now the Ask is at $15. Danny, another provider, hears about this and decides to offer his capacity to Akash and expects to earn $5. He sees an offer for $15 and bids for $15. Danny earns $15. Alice Pays $1.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922320-s6uk4j1nirumr2fcbrmc6grbsfro3ob0c9jtfzv9b1rwtxwbaeycmoacxicrqy4bjwiuunlh95ddrjv5qmbbeknbunho1e1xxbkispg3nscffkactjvwozsmenrrqfa4kh1b.png)\\n\\nAkash\u2019s system design ensures that a provider can be at risk of losing a job (and subsidy along with it) if they\u2019re always trying to win the entire subsidy, and encourages providers to employ incremental strategies.\\n\\n**Attracting Liquidity using Network Dividend**\\n\\nIn addition to a portion of the block rewards, Akash Token (AKT) holders receive a portion of the lease fee by means of a Take Income. A portion of the income from every lease is captured by a Take Pool which is then distributed to AKT holders based on their Stake Weight (tokens locked and unlock time). The Take Rate is a network parameter established by the consensus of the community and expected to be 20% at genesis. The proposed Take Rate of 20% is common with high volume marketplaces (e.g. Uber 23% and Apple 30%).\\n\\nTake Income establishes a clear earning potential of AKT by means of a network dividend instead of relying on speculation. For an industry that is expected to be $210 billion in 2022, a 20% Take Income amounts to $42 billion in income at 100% market penetration.\\n\\nAs the network grows in adoption, the consistent income-generating potential of AKT will attract liquidity, leading to higher subsidies. With a transparent way to measure performance, one may quantify network value.\\n\\n**Summary**\\n\\nAkash\u2019s blockchain provides a shared state for decentralized control planes and the Akash Token bootstraps the market \u2014 this powerful combination unlocks network effects to accelerate adoption in an open ecosystem.\\n\\nBy leveraging the power of a free market and a permissionless, open cloud, Akash Network will unlock 85% of cloud compute capacity in 8.4 million data centers currently underutilized. Significantly more efficient and up to 10x lower in cost, our Supercloud provides the market with a compelling alternative to the cloud infrastructure oligopoly.\\n\\n**\\\\[**&nbsp;[**Download Updated Akash Network Token Economic Model to Learn More**](https://akash.network/static/akash-econ.pdf)&nbsp;**\\\\]**\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;An Evolution of Akash Network Token Economics&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Last fall, we released our Akash Network Token Economic Model, a system that leverages Akash Token (AKT), a native currency, to solve for volatility (one of the biggest challenges for adoption in crypto) while ensuring economic security of our public blockchain. In the paper, we presented various strategies to mitigate inherent adoption challenges that face an early market economy \u2014 lack of sufficient demand from the tenants (consumers of computing), which in turn hurts demand because of lack of supply.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-02-06T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Insights&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Insights&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Greg Osuri&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.DCrhtyx6.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1024],&quot;height&quot;:[0,559],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/an-evolution-of-akash-network-token-economics/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;closer-to-the-future-of-the-cloud-in-2020/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;closer-to-the-future-of-the-cloud-in-2020&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\nIn an industry dominated by three cloud providers, the largest of which was featured in a galvanizing&nbsp;[New York Times article](https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/15/technology/amazon-aws-cloud-competition.html)&nbsp;this past December, we knew that we were taking on much larger incumbents, and a huge challenge, one that could shape the future of the cloud, and thus, the Internet.\\n\\nWhen we set out to build the Akash Supercloud, the world\u2019s first decentralized peer-to-peer marketplace for cloud computing, we knew we\u2019d be tackling technical problems that had never been confronted before to give developers, the builders of the future, more freedom, flexibility, and agency to create.\\n\\nI\u2019m proud to look back at what our team achieved in 2019 to get us much closer to our vision of The Unstoppable Cloud, and I\u2019m excited to share what we have planned at the start of this new year.\\n\\n**Looking Back At 2019**\\n\\nIn the first half of 2019, our team focused on building the first version of our testnet and developing our token economic model, leveraging a framework for bootstrapping marketplaces in any industry challenged with underutilization of resources.\\n\\n**Joining the Cosmos Ecosystem**\\n\\nLast fall, we announced that we were bringing Akash to the&nbsp;[Cosmos](https://cosmos.network/)&nbsp;Ecosystem, giving developers access to an open, permissionless and secure marketplace for cloud computing. We were early believers in Cosmos, and as the Cosmos Hub grew and attracted more developers, we saw an increasing need for simplicity and scalability that comes with serverless computing and a decentralized infrastructure to support that growth. For us, joining Cosmos was ideal because of Tendermint\u2019s iteration speed and community momentum.\\n\\n**Proving It Works**\\n\\nTo gain market proof for our decentralized peer-to-peer marketplace, we launched our&nbsp;[Founding Member Rewards Program](https://akash.network/blog/congratulations-to-founding-member-challenge-contributors-still-time-to-join-for-5500-akash-tokens/), a series of challenges over a one month period designed to show contributors how to become a cloud provider and how to deploy applications in our decentralized Supercloud. The program involved 3 progressively difficult challenges along with bonus challenges, and contributors joined from all over the world, including the U.S., Korea, Japan, China, Europe, India, and South America. We were excited by the incredible community engagement, with 45 providers and nearly 1,700 applications completed on the first Akash testnet.\\n\\nContributors lit up our Twitter with&nbsp;[praise](https://akash.network/l/love)&nbsp;for our documentation and ease of deployment. In user interviews conducted by a top partner network, 40 out of 100 developers shared that Akash had the best developer experience and documentation. We prioritize exceptional&nbsp;[documentation](https://akash.network/docs/), and it was rewarding to get this feedback from the community.\\n\\n**Engaging Top Validators**\\n\\nAkash employs a blockchain secured by a Proof-of-Stake consensus model managed by independent Validators, and Validators perform the vital role of providing economic security to the Akash blockchain. Given how essential validators are to building and scaling Akash Network, we announced that Jack Zampolin of Pylon Validation Services and Director of Product at Cosmos, and Sunny Aggarwal, Research Scientist at Tendermint, had joined as advisors. Jack and Sunny are renowned as top Cosmos validators and key contributors to the Cosmos community. We\u2019re fortunate to have their guidance and insights as we scale Akash Supercloud.\\n\\n**Sharing Our Vision**\\n\\nTo share our distinct vision for the future of the cloud, our team contributed to SF Blockchain Week and Packet\u2019s IFX conference late last year. At SF Blockchain Week, I spoke on the Internet 3.0 Decentralize Everything panel, and our CMO Maly Ly shared branding and marketing best practices on the Blockchain in Marketing Panel. Our team also participated in the 3 day DeFi hackathon. At Packet\u2019s IFX 2019 conference in Las Vegas, I presented a keynote, \u201cThe Unstoppable Stack\u201d on building the world\u2019s first open, permissionless, sovereign, and secure supercloud and marketplace.\\n\\n**Unveiling the Akash Supermini**\\n\\nDuring my keynote at Packet, I unveiled the Akash Supermini, our plug-and-earn portable server and the world\u2019s most powerful in-home supercomputer. The Supermini gives developers full sovereignty over their data and a path to avoiding costly cloud service providers. Users can also plug and earn their favorite cryptocurrencies and offer the device\u2019s unused compute directly on the Akash marketplace. Looking towards the future, the Akash Supermini will also serve as a potential inference layer for new networks leveraging IOT devices like Helium for instance.\\n\\n**Building the Dream Team**\\n\\nGetting closer to the future of the cloud requires a deeply experienced, passionate, and committed team. Last year, Boz Menzalji joined as General Manager and Maly Ly joined as Chief Marketing Officer. A serial entrepreneur and business development leader, Boz has seen two acquisitions and previously was GM at Refereum, a blockchain-based gaming rewards and marketing platform. At Refereum, Boz successfully listed the $RFR token on three new crypto-exchanges with a collective daily volume of $30+ million. As Akash\u2019s GM, Boz orchestrates and scales operational strategy, business development, infrastructure, and processes to enable the successful acceleration of our platform.\\n\\nAn award winning marketing leader, Maly has 18 years of experience accelerating growth and brand awareness across data-driven technology platforms and interactive entertainment companies including Eventbrite, AdRoll, Relativity Space, and Lucasfilm. She has scaled three early stage startups to $150+ million annual recurring revenue, and brought beloved consumer brands including Star Wars, Tomb Raider, and Nintendo to millions of people globally. At Akash, Maly leads acquisition and retention, and works with our team to build a brand that inspires people around the world with the possibilities of the first permissionless and open cloud.\\n\\nJoining Maly on the marketing team is Michael Gushansky, a top sales and customer service performer who comes to us from the events and auto industries. As Marketing and Community Manager, Michael leads our community efforts and scales our marketing functions.\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922312-img4cf96ee494c5-1.jpeg)\\n\\n**Looking Ahead To 2020**\\n\\nIn 2019, we proved that our platform worked \u2013 providers offered their unused compute through our decentralized marketplace, and developers seamlessly deployed applications in our Supercloud. Through many conversations with data centers, and organizations with greatly increasing needs for cloud compute at lower costs, like machine learning companies, we\u2019ve identified specific markets where Akash\u2019s platform could save them up to 90% on their costs.\\n\\n2020 will be the year we launch our market-ready platform to onboard and support customers and services. We\u2019ll be launching our incentivized testnet, unlocking liquidity, and continuing to partner with validators and delegators. We\u2019re excited to continue growing our community of builders as we transition to our Mainnet.\\n\\nAs we expand technical infrastructure and services, we\u2019ve been working with Alex Ellis to bring OpenFaaS to Akash Network. With 20,000+ stars on GitHub,&nbsp;[OpenFaaS](https://www.openfaas.com/)&nbsp;is an open-source alternative to serverless computing that is gaining wide adoption.\\n\\nWe\u2019ll also be focused on expanding our network of in-home cloud compute providers through the development and launch of the Akash Supermini, the world\u2019s most powerful portable plug-and-earn server and in-home supercomputer. Through the Supermini, anyone can become an income generating in-home cloud compute provider on Akash\u2019s Supercloud. If you haven\u2019t already,&nbsp;[**reserve yours now**](https://akash.network/supermini/reserve)&nbsp;as initial quantities are limited.\\n\\nI want to extend a tremendous thanks to our team, partners, validators, and investors, who have continued to believe in our vision and support us on our journey to creating a permissionless, open, and secure future for the cloud. We want to create a future where architects and builders of the internet have greater freedom to innovate, and where people around the world can be ensured sovereignty over their data.\\n\\nIn 2020, we look forward to getting much closer to this future vision of the cloud.\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Closer to the Future of the Cloud in 2020&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;In an industry dominated by three cloud providers, the largest of which was featured in a galvanizing&nbsp;New York Times article&nbsp;this past December, we knew that we were taking on much larger incumbents, and a huge challenge, one that could shape the future of the cloud, and thus, the Internet. When we set out to build the Akash Supercloud, the world\u2019s first decentralized peer-to-peer marketplace for cloud computing, we knew we\u2019d be tackling technical problems that had never been confronted before to give developers, the builders of the future, more freedom, flexibility, and agency to create.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2020-01-24T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Insights&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Insights&quot;],[0,&quot;News&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Greg Osuri&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.DIk_vzdD.jpeg&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1024],&quot;height&quot;:[0,768],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;jpg&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/closer-to-the-future-of-the-cloud-in-2020/banner-image.jpeg&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;six-trends-transforming-cloud-computing-in-2020/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;six-trends-transforming-cloud-computing-in-2020&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\nAt Akash, we\u2019ve been working at the intersection of cloud, blockchain, and the edge, and this coming year it\u2019s exciting to see technologies we\u2019ve long championed achieve broader adoption and transform multiple industries. Overall, there is a movement to sovereignty\u2013of platform, technology, data, privacy, and cost. We\u2019re also seeing new technologies and devices leverage infrastructure, crypto incentives, and the edge in-home.\\n\\nAs we look to 2020, we see six key trends set to transform the future of the cloud.\\n\\n**1.&nbsp; Cost Sovereignty**\\n\\nAccording to RightScale\u2019s 2019 State of the Cloud report, increased cloud usage has made cloud cost optimization the top priority for three consecutive years. For enterprises, the top responsibility of central IT is managing and reducing cloud services costs. By implementing multi-cloud/hybrid cloud strategies, companies can optimize for services and providers best suited to their needs and budget. Additionally, containerization technologies like Kubernetes provide hybrid cloud platforms with more workload portability and the ability to scale those workloads across different development environments, providing even more flexibility to optimize costs.\\n\\n**2\\\\. Containerization**\\n\\nContainerization gained steam with the opensource Docker engine and Kubernetes by enabling developers to build faster and more secure apps. Larger companies are overwhelmingly choosing to utilize containers, with Kubernetes adoption reaching 60% and Docker adoption reaching 66%[1](https://blog.akash.network/2020/01/09/six-trends-transforming-cloud-computing-in-2020/#easy-footnote-bottom-1-520). We\u2019re also seeing many users opting for container-as-a-service products from their cloud service provider. AWS container service reached 44% adoption in 2019 and Microsoft Azure\u2019s container service grew from 20% to 28% adoption in 2019[2](https://blog.akash.network/2020/01/09/six-trends-transforming-cloud-computing-in-2020/#easy-footnote-bottom-2-520). As containerization technologies like Kubernetes matured and commoditized software, companies are becoming more comfortable running their own data centers and serverless is picking up wider adoption.\\n\\n3.&nbsp;**Serverless Computing**\\n\\nYear over year, serverless has been the top growing extended cloud service, with a 50% increase over 2018 (24% to 36% adoption)[3](https://blog.akash.network/2020/01/09/six-trends-transforming-cloud-computing-in-2020/#easy-footnote-bottom-3-520).&nbsp;[OpenFaaS](https://openfaas.com/)&nbsp;is an open-source alternative to serverless computing that is gaining adoption, with well over 20,000 stars on GitHub. With OpenFaaS, you don\u2019t need a major cloud provider to develop and deploy serverless applications. OpenFaaS has even begun supporting machine learning frameworks which have typically only run through major cloud providers. In the coming year, we\u2019re going to see a growing number of machine learning companies bypass major cloud providers to deploy serverless through companies like OpenFaaS.\\n\\n**4\\\\. Machine learning**\\n\\nMachine learning is the fastest growing segment in the serverless space. Machine learning companies are building applications with the potential to solve a wide range of problems from slowing climate change to transforming healthcare. According to Zion Market Research, machine learning spend will grow from $1.58 billion in 2017 to $20.83 billion in 2024. As machine learning requires a lot of data to make the best inferences possible, cloud computing costs will become even more important to manage for machine learning companies. 2020 will see a shift in the way machine learning companies structure their cloud strategies.\\n\\n**5\\\\. Edge Infrastructure**\\n\\nWith an increasing number of IoT devices globally, bringing computation closer to where it\u2019s needed subsequently saves bandwidth and decreases latency. New in-home networks leveraging and supporting the IOT are emerging with increased frequency. Helium, for instance, is a peer-to-peer wireless long range network that allows IoT devices to securely and inexpensively connect and send data to and from the Internet. The&nbsp;[Akash Supermini](https://akash.network/supermini/)&nbsp;is a powerful and portable in-home server that acts as an inference layer for IoT devices. The infrastructure edge will enable a growing number of devices like Helium and the Akash Supermini to be deployed in-home, which will play a critical role in the transition from wired to wireless infrastructure. According to the 2020 State of the Edge report, it\u2019s projected that over $700 billion will be spent on edge infrastructure and data center facilities in the coming decade.\\n\\n**6\\\\. Proof of Stake**\\n\\nWith the current market cap for PoS cryptocurrencies at $10 Billion and over $6 billion locked in staking, and the rapid growth of PoS networks like Tezos and Cosmos, we\u2019re seeing a fundamental shift from Proof of Work to Proof of Stake as a consensus model for blockchain[4](https://blog.akash.network/2020/01/09/six-trends-transforming-cloud-computing-in-2020/#easy-footnote-bottom-4-520). PoS networks like Tezos and Cosmos are decoupling from speculative cryptocurrency fluctuations as the performance of their coins is based on the health of their ecosystem, creating income generating digital asset classes. Proof of Stake crypto incentives enable infrastructure and edge technology innovations like Helium and Akash Supermini to subsidize early supply and market adoption.\\n\\n1.  Rightscale 2019 State of the Cloud Report. The program involved 3 progressively difficult challenges along with bonus challenges, and contributors joined from all over the world, including the U.S., Korea, Japan, China, Europe, India, and South America.  \\n  \\n**Deploying on the World\u2019s First Supercloud for Serverless Computing**  \\n  \\nEach challenge had a corresponding reward, for a total of 3,500 Akash Tokens (AKT), with bonuses of up to 2,000 AKT.&nbsp;&nbsp;\\n\\n*   **1st Challenge, Level 1**: Deploy an end-to-end encrypted chat client on Akash.&nbsp;[Details](https://github.com/ovrclk/ecosystem/blob/master/founders/level1/README.md).\\n    \\n*   **2nd Challenge, Level 2:**&nbsp;Deploy a secure, decentralized, real-time messaging service on Akash.&nbsp;[Details](https://github.com/ovrclk/ecosystem/blob/master/founders/level2/README.md).\\n    \\n*   **3rd Challenge, Level 3:**&nbsp;Sell your spare capacity on Akash.&nbsp;[Details](https://github.com/ovrclk/ecosystem/blob/master/founders/level3/README.md).\\n    \\n\\nThe challenges engaged contributors with Akash Network, the world\u2019s first supercloud for serverless computing, and taught them how to deploy on our open, permissionless, and secure marketplace for compute cycles.&nbsp;  \\n  \\nContributors from around the world worked together to help each other complete challenges. Admittedly, all this collaboration made us warm and fuzzy, and this is the community we envisioned when we set out to build Akash.&nbsp;  \\n  \\n**Wall of Love**  \\n  \\nThe Founding Member Challenges ended last Friday, December 13th, and the warm and fuzzies continued on our Wall of Love:\\n\\n**Congratulations to the Winners of our Founding Member Rewards Challenges!**  \\n  \\nToday, we\u2019re excited to announce the Founder Badge winners of our Founding Member Rewards Program Challenges listed in the top leaderboard below. Contributors who completed all three challenges successfully earned our coveted Founder Badge. We\u2019ve also listed contributors who completed each of the three challenges. We\u2019re impressed by the resourcefulness, patience, collaboration, and grit that was displayed these past four weeks by our winners!  \\n  \\nWe recognize that there are other ways of contributing to Akash\u2019s community, such as helping others navigate through the challenges, or sharing technical guides.&nbsp;&nbsp;  \\n  \\nWe\u2019ve identified the Top 5 Community Prize Winners, and these generous and supportive community members will each receive our limited edition plug-and-earn Akash Supermini portable server!&nbsp;**Below are the Community Winners.**\\n\\nThe Akash Supermini Much respect to those going the distance and completing the difficult 3rd Challenge to achieve the coveted Founding Member badge.  \\n  \\nThree weeks ago, we launched the Akash Founding Member Rewards Program for contributors to Akash\u2019s testnet and as a warm thank you to our community. Since then, we\u2019ve had contributors join from all over the world, including the U.S., Korea, Japan, China, Europe, India, and South America. As a reminder, the program involves 3 challenges and each challenge has a corresponding reward, for a total of 3,500 Akash Tokens (AKT), with bonuses of up to 2,000 AKT.&nbsp;&nbsp;  \\n  \\nThe Founding Member Challenges&nbsp;**end this Friday, December 13th at 5PM PST, and we\u2019ll be announcing the winners next Tuesday, December 17th**.&nbsp;  \\n  \\n**If you haven\u2019t participated Our CEO Greg Osuri will be presenting the Keynote session \u201cThe Unstoppable Stack\u201d at 2pm to 2:30pm in the Great Hall. He\u2019ll be sharing how we\u2019re building the world\u2019s first open, permissionless, sovereign, and secure supercloud and marketplace, and making it unstoppable.\\n\\nWhat does Greg mean by Unstoppable? Find out in the Q&amp;A below, and don\u2019t miss his Keynote on Wednesday to learn more!\\n\\n**Quick Q&amp;A with Greg Osuri, Cofounder &amp; CEO of Akash Network**\\n\\n**What is your principle behind \u201cUnstoppable\u201d?**\\n\\nThe principle behind Unstoppable is fully sovereign cloud infrastructure that cannot be challenged or taken down by adversaries and hackers. It\u2019s a system designed without assuming trust. Today, you assume providers will protect your data and keep your network up, that they have your best interest in mind. How do you plan for the opposite?&nbsp;\\n\\n**How did this shape your development philosophy?**\\n\\nAt Akash, we designed a cloud with a system that does not incorporate the comfort of assumptions, leveraging Peer-to-Peer (P2P). Users are responsible for peer infrastructure deployment. If a node or institution goes down, another node can pick it up. It\u2019s politically and physically decentralized, but logically centralized with single state data.\\n\\n**What can your audience expect to learn at your IFX Keynote?**\\n\\nI\u2019ll be providing context and an understanding of the opportunities, challenges, and different approaches in decentralized cloud, as well as economic incentives. Essentially, how do we create a public cloud today with learnings from past generations, and new tools like containerization, Kubernetes, game theory, and radically different economic models.\\n\\nI\u2019ll also cover how to use old tools in new workflows and new tools in old workflows.&nbsp;\\n\\n**What are you looking forward to at IFX2019?**\\n\\nI\u2019m excited about seeing Bare Metal become a first class cloud deployment option.&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Don\u2019t Miss The Unstoppable Stack at IFX2019&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Our team is excited to be heading to Las Vegas this week for Packet\u2019s IFX2019 conference to connect with and learn from our peers in the cloud infrastructure ecosystem. Our CEO Greg Osuri will be presenting the Keynote session \u201cThe Unstoppable Stack\u201d at 2pm to 2:30pm in the Great Hall.&quot;],&quot;pubDate&quot;:[3,&quot;2019-12-03T00:00:00.000Z&quot;],&quot;draft&quot;:[0,false],&quot;categories&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;News&quot;]]],&quot;tags&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;News&quot;]]],&quot;contributors&quot;:[1,[[0,&quot;Maly Ly&quot;]]],&quot;bannerImage&quot;:[0,{&quot;src&quot;:[0,&quot;/_astro/banner-image.coImd9M2.png&quot;],&quot;width&quot;:[0,1024],&quot;height&quot;:[0,536],&quot;format&quot;:[0,&quot;png&quot;],&quot;fsPath&quot;:[0,&quot;/home/runner/work/website/website/src/content/Blog/dont-miss-the-unstoppable-stack-at-ifx2019/banner-image.png&quot;]}]}],&quot;render&quot;:[0,null]}],[0,{&quot;id&quot;:[0,&quot;1-cosmos-validator-sikka-aka-sunny-aggarwal-of-tendermint-cosmos-joins-akash-as-advisor/index.md&quot;],&quot;slug&quot;:[0,&quot;1-cosmos-validator-sikka-aka-sunny-aggarwal-of-tendermint-cosmos-joins-akash-as-advisor&quot;],&quot;body&quot;:[0,&quot;\\nLast week, we announced that Jack Zampolin of Pylon Validation Services and Tendermint joined Akash as an Advisor, and today, we\u2019re excited to announce that the number one Cosmos validator Sikka aka Sunny Aggarwal of Tendermint/Cosmos has joined Akash as an Advisor. Validators are essential to ensuring the sovereignty and security of Akash\u2019s platform. In recognition of their importance in our ecosystem, we recently&nbsp;[announced a grant of 20% delegation power for the first 10 genesis cohort of validators](https://akash.network/blog/an-invitation-to-akash-validators-genesis-10/)&nbsp;who commit to Akash Network.\\n\\nSunny\u2019s deep commitment to community and to teaching, along with his role as Research Scientist at Tendermint/Cosmos, perfectly positions him as an invaluable advisor and guide as we scale the world\u2019s first open, permissionless, and secure supercloud and marketplace for serverless computing.\\n\\nRead on to learn more about Sunny\u2019s remarkable trajectory from pirate ship to the Cosmos.\\n\\n**Q&amp;A with Sunny**\\n\\n**Is it a pirate\u2019s life for you?**\\n\\nHaha, that profile picture is from back when I was a student at Berkeley, and was running for the student government.&nbsp; Heavily dissatisfied with the existing political parties in UC Berkeley student politics, a few friends and I created a new Pirate Party.&nbsp; While a bunch of the other candidates were taking it very seriously, we were just having fun with it. We had a pirate ship on the main plaza fountain, and we challenged people to sword fights while blasting the soundtrack to \u201cPirates of the Caribbean\u201d.&nbsp; But we also had a serious message too, which people liked, and so come election day, we ended up winning a seat! In today\u2019s political world, we\u2019re in one of the most advanced memetic conflicts, and I think ideas win through not only their merit, but a combination of merit and memetic contagion\u2013something I think segments of the crypto space have understood quite well.\\n\\n**How did you get into blockchain?**\\n\\nAs a freshman at Berkeley in 2015, I was studying Computer Science and Political Economy, and got interested in Bitcoin as a way of exploring the intersection of the two. I\u2019ve learned that when I want to learn something, I sign up to teach it. That way, I better learn it! At Berkeley, there\u2019s this cool program called Decals, where students can teach courses. Two friends and I decided to create a course called the Cryptocurrency Fundamentals Decal, where we taught about the mechanics of blockchains. The same semester, we started the Blockchain at Berkeley organization, bootstrapping a lot of the initial members from the students in the Decal course. The summer after Sophomore year, I got really engrossed with Proof of Stake, which led me to learning about Tendermint. I reached out to them to help out, and come fall, I was so enthralled that I dropped out of school to work on Tendermint and Cosmos full time.\\n\\n**Why did you decide to become a Validator?**\\n\\nWatching the Bitcoin scaling debates a few years ago, I saw there was a definite split between the miners and core developers, and that was a large cleavage where the battle lines were drawn. I wanted to become a validator to be able to wear both hats, such that if conflicts arise, I can have an understanding and appreciation for the viewpoints of both sides. Having the mindset of a validator also helps me make better design and architectural decisions, as I am simultaneously a user of my software and systems.\\n\\n**How did you become the #1 Validator on Cosmos?**\\n\\nI think it is likely a combination of factors. Sikka is a community-oriented validator; we don\u2019t take in delegation from large known funds for example, but rather from completely anonymous individuals throughout the community.&nbsp; Both myself and my partner, Dev Ojha (valardragon), have contributed heavily to the core software of Cosmos, such as Tendermint Core and the Cosmos SDK. We are able to use our specialized knowledge of the core software to provide insight and improve the security and service for our delegators.\\n\\nFor example, prior to the Kava re-launch, we were able to identify a misconfiguration of the genesis file, which would have gotten many validators slashed. We were able to sound the alarm bells in order to halt the launch and fix the issue, allowing launch to go forward smoothly. We also, going along with the community theme, initially charged a 0% commission for a few months after launch, which likely attracted a number of delegators.&nbsp; However, after feedback from the community through discussions and a governance proposal we created, we increased the commission rate, after which we still saw the vast majority of delegators stick with Sikka. We are currently working on a project called the SikkaDAO, in order to give more say on the validator to the Sikka delegators.\\n\\n**As Research Scientist at Tendermint, what projects coming into the Cosmos ecosystem are you excited about?**\\n\\nThere are a bunch of projects building on Cosmos that I\u2019m really excited about. I think there\u2019s a bunch of cool DeFi primitives being built on Cosmos SDK chains right now, such as Kava\u2019s multi-collateral CDP system, Microtick\u2019s short-term options/price discovery platform, and Chorus One\u2019s Quicksilver project. The Cosmos architecture has a very particular mindset when it comes to designing systems. I think maybe the best way to describe it is to take a \u201clocalist\u201d view of interoperating entities. Cosmos chains normally provide their own security, and then users create interaction stories between chains that take into view each chain\u2019s security, instead of the Cosmos Hub trying to provide a single global security set.\\n\\nIt\u2019s interesting to see this system integrated with other mechanisms in Cosmos projects such as the Agoric smart contracting system and the Kira Dex design. Finally, while building defi and smart contracting is awesome, it\u2019s also great to see more practical projects with real world use cases and users. For example, Lino and of course, the Akash Network. A lot of the open source tooling built by the Akash team is super awesome with immediate real-world usage in DevOps workflows, and it\u2019s exciting to see it all come together in a fully decentralized cloud platform like the Akash Network.\\n&quot;],&quot;collection&quot;:[0,&quot;Blog&quot;],&quot;data&quot;:[0,{&quot;title&quot;:[0,&quot;Cosmos Validator Sikka aka Sunny Aggarwal of Tendermint/Cosmos Joins Akash as Advisor&quot;],&quot;description&quot;:[0,&quot;Last week, we announced that Jack Zampolin of Pylon Validation Services and Tendermint joined Akash as an Advisor, and today, we\u2019re excited to announce that the number one Cosmos validator Sikka aka Sunny Aggarwal of Tendermint/Cosmos has joined Akash as an Advisor. The platform achieves these benefits by integrating advanced&nbsp;[containerization](https://techcrunch.com/2017/11/21/overclock-labs-bets-on-kubernetes-to-help-companies-automate-their-cloud-infrastructure/)&nbsp;technology with a unique&nbsp;[staking model](https://akash.network/l/econ-paper)&nbsp;by&nbsp;[bootstrapping supply to accelerate marketplace adoption.](https://akash.network/blog/bootstrapping-a-free-market-by-borrowing-from-the-future/)\\n\\nIn the past year, we\u2019ve rapidly progressed our platform through technical achievements and pilot programs.&nbsp; Now, Akash is enabling our builder community to deploy real-world applications and experience our product first hand.&nbsp; In the week since launching our&nbsp;[Founder Member Program,](https://akash.network/blog/become-and-akash-founding-member-and-earn-token-rewards/)&nbsp; we have seen close to 100 applications on Akash\u2019s testnet, including machine learning, Riot Chat client, and more. We\u2019ll be transitioning to Validator testnet by the end of Q4.\\n\\nWe\u2019ve been fortunate to have overwhelming support from great partners at&nbsp;[Cosmos](https://cosmos.network/),&nbsp;[Packet](https://www.packet.com/), and&nbsp;[Coil](https://coil.com/):\\n\\n*\u201cSince I began working on Blockchain technology in 2017, I\u2019ve been searching for the crossover of existing cloud technologies like Docker and Kubernetes, as those systems and the cloud in general, have been grappling with many of the same distributed systems problems. Akash Network, with its cloud native developer workflow, backed by a decentralized network, is the most exciting project in this space today. Their platform is a tremendous step towards the realization of the world\u2019s first open, permissionless, and secure public cloud.\u201d*&nbsp;**Jack Zampolin, Head of Product, Tendermint and Akash Advisor.**\\n\\n*\u201cA perfect opportunity for Packet. When we have spare capacity, we can sell it through Akash\u2019s blockchain marketplace, ensuring complete utilization of our cloud servers.\u201d*&nbsp;**Jacob Smith, SVP Packet.**\\n\\n*\u201cWe realized early on that a decentralized cloud marketplace enabled by Interledger is going to be disruptive to centralized cloud platforms. By partnering with Akash, we\u2019re able to tap into their many years of experience at the cutting edge of cloud technology to bring this vision to life.\u201d*&nbsp;**Stefan Thomas, CEO, Coil &amp; Co-Creator of Interledger.**\\n\\n### **An Invitation to Join the Akash Validators Genesis 10**\\n\\nIn recognition of the vital role validators play in ensuring Akash\u2019s sovereignty, we\u2019re excited to announce a delegation power reward program.\\n\\nBy Friday, November 29th, the first 10 genesis validators to commit to Akash will be rewarded 20% delegation power.&nbsp; The 20% delegation power will be distributed between the first 10 validators based on the total size of their commitment.\\n\\nIf you\u2019re disqualified, the delegation power will transfer to the 11th candidate and so on. In this effort, we\u2019re excited to announce the Akash Founding Member Rewards Program!\\n\\nOf the 100,000,000 tokens that will ever be pre-mined at genesis, we\u2019re allocating 2% (2,000,000 AKT\u2019s!) to a reward program for early contributors in our community.&nbsp; Our reward program is inspired by projects from the community, such as Solana&nbsp;[Tour de Sol](https://solana.com/tds/), Cosmos&nbsp;[Game of Stakes](https://github.com/cosmos/game-of-stakes), and Kava&nbsp;[Founder Rewards](https://github.com/Kava-Labs/kava/blob/master/docs/REWARDS.md).\\n\\nWe have two genesis rewards programs to share:\\n\\n1)&nbsp;**Akash Founding Member Rewards Program**\\n\\n2)&nbsp;**Akash Incentivized Staking Testnet Program**\\n\\nFor the Akash Incentivized Staking Testnet Program, we\u2019ll share more information at a later date.&nbsp; If you are a validator, please check out&nbsp;[our validator rewards overview](https://blog.akash.network/2019/10/31/akash-network-validator-rewards/), and be sure to&nbsp;[sign up](https://akash.network/validators)&nbsp;for updates.\\n\\n### **Akash Founding Member Rewards Program**\\n\\nOur Founding Member Rewards Program focuses on Akash Testnet participation.&nbsp; The program is limited to only 100 members and involves 3 challenges. Each challenge has a corresponding reward, for a total of&nbsp;_**3,500 AKTs**_:\\n\\n**Wednesday, Nov. 6th:**&nbsp; Akash Founder Level 1, the first challenge is worth&nbsp;_**500 AKTs**_.\\n\\n**Tuesday, Nov. 12th:**&nbsp; Akash Founder Level 2, second challenge is worth&nbsp;_**1,000 AKTs.**_\\n\\n**Tuesday, Nov. 21st:**&nbsp;Akash Founder Level 3, third challenge is worth&nbsp;_**2,000 AKTs.**_\\n\\n**Friday, December 13th:**&nbsp;Deadline to complete our three challenges by 5 PM PST.\\n\\n**Tuesday, Dec 17th:**&nbsp;&nbsp;Winners Announced!\\n\\n### **Top Prize for Top 10 Contributors**\\n\\nWe recognize that there are other ways of contributing to Akash\u2019s community, such as helping others navigate through the challenges, or sharing technical guides.&nbsp;&nbsp;\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922423-photo1.jpg)\\n\\nThe top 10 contributing community members will receive the prototype edition of plug-an-earn Akash Supermini aka slick portable server for your home will be mailed to you!&nbsp;\\n\\nSimply plug it in, become a node for Akash, and earn your favorite currency from offering compute to Akash\u2019s marketplace!\\n\\n### **Akash Founder Level 1, Your First Challenge (500 AKT)**\\n\\n![](https://www.datocms-assets.com/45776/1620922434-crop-0-0-767-996-0-founder1-2x.png)\\n\\n**Reward:**&nbsp;500 AKT\\n\\n**Challenge:**&nbsp;Deploy an end-to-end encrypted chat client on Akash and attach a custom domain.\\n\\n**Winners:**&nbsp;First 100 submissions \u2014 measured by the timestamp of the git commit \u2014 that pass the qualification criteria.&nbsp;\\n\\n**Instructions:**&nbsp;Follow the steps in this&nbsp;[guide](https://github.com/ovrclk/ecosystem#akash-founder-level-1-your-first-challenge).\\n\\n### **Akash Founder Level 1 Bonus (25 AKT)**\\n\\nBonus AKTs will be awarded to the community members that help us spread our vision for creating a truly open-source cloud. Sharing your experience on twitter and tagging us will earn you an additional 25 AKT.
